title: Delicious pizza. I
review: Delicious pizza. I got it as a take way. Because I wanted deep pan, it takes 35 min to make, so I went for a walk. The small pizza is massive and difficult for 1 person to finish.

title: Great pizza
review: We ate dinner here during a business trip. They had wonderful service and great pizza. We tried the deep dish special (a must try), as well as ventured out and tried a thin crust BBQ chicken. Atmosphere was relaxed and conversation was easily had. I would certainly return.

title: Great food but be ready to wait...and wait
review: Giordano's has some of the best pizza I've ever eaten. The only downside is the ordering and being seated. When we came in we pre-ordered food on one side of the counter. Then put our names on a wait list. After waiting about 35 minutes we were seated. I would have guessed that within that amount of time the pizza we ordered would be just about ready and we could eat almost right away. Wrong we waited another 30+ minutes before the pizza was brought out. Again, it was incredibly tasty but I would be sure to get to the restaurant before my stomach starts to growl next time.

title: Awesome Italian meat!!
review: Great Italian Meat sandwich. Fantastic service by Austin.  Nice , clean family atmosphere. Will defined be back before we leave.

title: very very good
review: I wanted to get some deep dish pizza because, you know, I was in Chicago and that's what you do. My wife doesn't like pizza so much, but she humored me. I got a medium deep dish because I was hungry. OMG it was so much food. My wife bites into it "THIS IS SO GOOD!" so yeah, good food. We got it take out so can't comment on the restaurant but it looked nice.

title: Gotta get a Chicago deep dish pizza
review: While in Chicago, you have to get a Chicago style pizza. It takes a while to cook, being so thick, but it was very good. Get a salad or appetizer while you wait for your pizza. It was definitely worth it and I would go here again for sure. Wish I could rate it a 4.5

title: Good but improvements needed
review: 1. Deep dish pizza tastes good! But you might not enjoy the thick crust. I found myself more into thin crust ones. 2. Dry-rubbed wings are too salty and my mouth burns after the meal.

title: Great Italian Beef & Chicago deep dish pizza
review: Getting a deep dish Chicago style pizza is definitely a must when visiting the windy city. Italian beef is also a thing here too so I tried both of them and they were super delicious!!!

title: A Chicago requirement
review: First trip to Chicago and everyone told me I had to try a pizza (pie) here. I certainly wasn’t disappointed. A small fed 2 of us big eaters. This thing was 3 fingers thick and delicious.

title: Very good pizza
review: In from New Jersey so im used to a different style of pizza but the pizza was very good. Had about a 35 minute wait on a Friday night. Me and my two kids split a pie and all of us were pleased. Good cheese and sauce. Had the cookie desert and also very good. All in all happy with the meal.

title: I Guess You Need To Like Deep Dish
review: I guess you need to like deep dish to really like this place.  We had never had deep dish pizza and you know, when in Rome or when in Chicago.  Firstly the service was AWFUL so my average rating isn't based on the fact that...More

title: Deep Dish Delight!
review: You need to pack your patience, this is not just a meal but an experience. You start by signing in and if you're having the deep dish they get your order started right away because it usually takes an good hour to get your deep...More

title: Good as always.
review: Had the personal deep dish, while my wife had the traditional pizza crust. Both were served hot and tasty. Its a franchise restaurant, but still good.

title: Deep pan pizza!
review: So they say that Chicago is famous for deep pan pizza so we tried it last night! Giordanos is a chain pizza restaurant, we chose to go after the football game last Sunday. Fortunately we were able to get a table in this very busy...More

title: Delicious Quick Lunch
review: We enjoyed lunch and dinner here. Both times the food was delicious - their sandwiches at lunch - pasta and pizza for dinner and service was great too

title: Good pizza but disgusting soft drinks
review: Pizza was overall ok, but we were very disappointed about the drinks we were served with. They tasted like bad tap water from toilet. Because of the ice which is made from tap water or because drinks are mixed with tap water

title: very good!!
review: The last time we tried to eat here, the wait was over an hour, so we decided to go somewhere else. This trip, we decided to go for an early dinner which worked out great. We were seated right away. The pizza was fantastic. The...More

title: Extra thin crust pizza was very good
review: Instead of the traditional deep dish I tried the extra thin crust with sausage and mushrooms. The toppings are the same so thick mozzarella slices on top of sausage and thin sliced mushrooms. Crust was crunchy thin so this is s good alternative. I also...More

title: Server and management were awesome but pizza NOT worth the incredibly long wait or BIG price tag.
review: Went to Chicago to try the pizza. It was pretty good but not as amazing as folks hype it up to be. I tried the thin and deep dish crust. Thin crust was hard and cardboard like. Deep dish was served hot and the server...More

title: The real deal
review: Get the deep dish pizza and I highly recommend the dessert cookie with ice cream! The small deep dish is more than enough for 2 people. We got the individual deep dish and it was just right. Great service and worth the wait!

title: Excellent location, good food too
review: This is one of our favorite pizza places in Chicago. Conveniently located, too. They also serve a glutenfree pizza. Friendly and helpful waitresses. A good experience. Delicious salads and pizza.

title: WOW - best pizza ever
review: Our first visit to Chicago and everyone told us to eat at Giordano's.We were not disappointed! As there was a lineup we had to order before we were even seated. No problem.The place itself wasn't too big which may be why there is always a lineup.The deep dish pizza was fantastic. We even tried a different place in Chicago (recommended by a local) but we liked Giordano's the best. Can't wait until the next time I get to eat here!!!

title: Excellent
review: Family enjoyed very much. Pizza was excellent! Service was great! Can't wait to visit again! Prices reasonable.

title: Little Disappointed
review: I am so sorry, Giordanos, of course we had to visit during our first afternoon while in Chicago... the deep dish came to the table, we were ready with camera for that first slice... you know the cheese... and then, Nothing! Even the waitress realized some things are not supposed to change, but unfortunately, they do... we order half meats and half vegetables, after the 45 minute wait, the vegetables were cold Inside the Pizza!!! We know they can do better... hopefully next time, but today, your are lucky with a 3 star...

title: Great Pizza - Good Lunch Offer
review: Great Chicago style pizza. If you're in a hurry (like we we're) go for the express menu offer. Its about $7 and offers a small personal pizza (easily enough for one) and small side. The larger pizzas are still pretty good value and the amount of cheese pull we witness was extraordinary. Michigan av location is pretty large so good for groups. Was relatively quite when we were in at 1:30 midweek.

title: Raw sausage
review: We visit Chicago every summer & our tradition is going out to deep dish pizza on the 1st night. Giordano’s was only 2 blocks away so perfect... so we thought. First bite & it was cold! Also found sausage that was pink. Waiter sent manager over who didn’t apologize, just asked what we would like to do. Giving benefit of the doubt we sent pizza back to get fully cooked. Not even 10 minutes later pizza came back & 1st bite of new “recooked”pizza had sausage so raw you could undeniably see the red of the uncooked meat. Our waiter was shocked & embarrassed & again sent manager over. I showed to the manager, he said OMG, & literally took our pizza away... again no apology, no I’ll get you a new pizza, nothing!! Our poor waiter had to come over & tell us they were taking the pizza off our bill. Whoever runs Giordano’s needs to do some serious customer service classes because that manager didn’t seem to care that we were there or that we got uncooked pizza. Even when we walked in the door he was complaining to another employee about a co-worker (also pretty sad that I could hear the whole conversation as we waited for our table). I’m giving this review 1 star because I have to but we will never return for your pizza.

title: Great stuffed pizza
review: This was the first time I tried stuffed crust pizza, and it was amazing. You should try it! We order the small Chicago style pizza (for two persons) and it was more than enough. We ate 60% of the pizza, the rest came home with us. For sure a great place to eat some amazing pizza!

title: Gotta get one!
review: You have to visit a Giordano’s when you are in Chicago. Their pizzas are hard to beat. The deep dish pizzas are amazing! You also need to try the thin version. Those are good too. They have their system down like a well oiled machine. It does take at least an hour for a deep dish so you will not be in and out. It is worth it.

title: Food was ok, the service was horrible
review: Overall I thought the pizza was ok. I have had Giordano's before and thought the food was better previous times I have eaten there. It could be the location this was my first time at this location, or that we went at lunch, but was really excited to have a pizza and came away disappointed. The service could also be a big part of the reason I was disappointed in the food. Our waitress literally disappeared for 45 minutes. We had to have other waiters get us refills on our drinks and get our bill. We looked around for her and she was nowhere to be found.

title: Our second favorite deep dish
review: We loved the atmosphere here, and the Caesar salad was to die for. But all of us preferred the competitor's butter crust deep dish instead. It was very tasty and definitely not bad if you only get to try one deep dish restaurant.

title: It’s ok. It’s nothing special. It’s overpriced for the hype. But again, it’s ok
review: Long wait to get in on a Saturday afternoon. By the time we left about 230 no wait at all. Coming here from out of the area, of course we ordered the deep dish. Veggie special specifically. Undercooked. Crust was extremely soggy, to the point the serving dish was leaking water on to the table. It tasted fine, but a bit of a disappointment. Wait staff was fine. We didn’t complain but likely will not return.

title: Pizza was awesome
review: We ordered the sampler appetizer which was very good and one of us got a caesar salad which was also tasty. We did this anticipating a 45 minute wait for our pizza. When we got there we only had to wait 10 minutes to be seated but they did advise us to go ahead and order our pizza. We ordered the quintessential deep dish. Service was just okay. We ordered waters to drink which contained very little ice so we did have to request a glass of ice. We discovered little to no ice is a Northern issue. The pizza came out in a timely manner and it was everything we were hoping for. Not at all disappointed. Will be back on our next trip.

title: Chicago Style Pizza
review: We ordered 2 medium Chicago style pizzas and were in heaven! It was way too much food for the 4 of us (which the waitress warned us about) but that just meant we got to bring a bunch home. Can't wait to go there again and eat their pizza. DELICIOUS!

title: chicago style pizza
review: we are from out of town and decided to get a real Chicago style pizza. I think this is the one of these we went to . Wow, a busy,busy place. it was a wednesday night and still this place was PACKED. And there was walk away take out. Lively small bar. Service nice reasonably affable considering how busy these folks are. Kept thinking John Belushi was going to show up --- "Cheeseburger,cheeseburger,pepsi,pepsi. They have an odd way of doing this . you place your order at a counter and they begin the baking process and you sort of hang around where ever you can find a seat. i offered my seat to a lady. Evidently that is rare as i watched fat boy chicago boys phone fiddling while 60+ yo ladies stood. But there is some people watching opportunities Now onto the pizza-- worth the wait ?? you bet. Good salad, really,really good pizza. what a delight. Boy oh boy is this stuff good. reasonably priced. The order and wait is evidently because I was told it takes 35 minutes to bake one of these. chill out have fun. now that i know the drill i would get 2 seats in the bar immediately after placing my order and just watch the ball game on the tube.

title: Pizza was EVERYTHING!!!
review: The pizza is to die for and will forever change where we eat pizza moving forward.  It is definitely worth the wait and you will not be disappointed!!!!  The calamari is delicious too!  If you are in Chicago make the time!!!

title: Worth the wait!
review: Full house on a Sunday evening, but got right in after a few minute wait. Large meat on meat deep dish and the house special salad stuffed five people. Both were to die for! First hesitant experience with Chicago style pizza and my expectations were blown away!Deep dish takes a while to come out but gives you lots of time to catch up with your company! Very diverse crowd of singles, couples, families, twenty-something’s out on the town, business professionals, and retirees. Service was just the right amount of attention with at least three people that interacted with our table. Server was attentive, served the first round of slices and boxed up the leftovers. The pizza deliverer made friendly conversation and the busser unobtrusively cleared the table.

title: Pizza was GREAT!
review: Wait staff was friendly; found the front concierge not so much. People outside asking for money (which we saw EVERYWHERE in downtown Chicago). Pizza was stupendous! Rich, rich, deep dish pizza. We waited a long time for the pizza to arrive. We ate about 2 p.m. on a Sunday; still had to wait for a table, but not too long.

title: Deep Dish Dream!
review: Ordered "The Special" deep dish pizza, salads and the sampler for our family. Wow! So delish!!! Fantastic portions and salads are super fresh! Server was really friendly and overall atmosphere really great. A must try while visiting Chicago! Ps.. try the peach Sangria👌

title: Great Pizza with Long Wait! Tips on optimizing wait time.
review: If you are visiting Chicago, this is definitely the place to try the famous Chicago Style Deep Dish Pizza.We were there with a party of 8. Estimated wait time during lunch was 60 minutes! We could not wait that long. Bummer is that they don't take reservations. However we learned that at the inside reception area they have two lines one for "Wait List" and other is for "Pre Order". We decided to come back for dinner and optimize our wait time.We arrived early by 6:00 PM and the estimated wait time was 90 minutes! We stood in line for "Wait List" and put our name down. We were told we will get a text in 75 to 90 minutes and we must respond to the text in 5 minutes to hold our spot.Then we stood in the "Pre-Order" line and placed order for a Cheese Pizza and Veggie Pizza. We were told the Pizza prep time is 90 minutes.Now we had 90 minutes to walk around and enjoy the Michigan Ave.When we got seated around 7:30, out Pizza was ready. It arrived in 5 minutes. It was worth all the hassle. If you plan well, you can optimize the wait time.

title: Aussie travellers enjoy Chicago deep dish pizza.
review: The warm character of the restaurant put us at ease instantly. The cheery staff seated us and made us feel welcome. The waitress had exceptional knowledge of the food and drinks and was quick to make recommendations. The generous pizza was tasty and filling. Washed down with decent ales and a Chianti.We went back again a few days later!

title: Fun family-friendly place
review: The team and manager greeted us as we walked in and seated us almost immediately. Our server was slow - having been in the food service industry and worked in every possible job at a restaurant, I can say she had zero sense of urgency in providing customer service to us or any of her other tables, though she was helpful in giving us an approximate wait time on our food. That being said, the manager did his best to keep our experience a positive one, which is why I'm giving it such a high rating. The food was delicious!! Highly recommend the deep dish pizza!

title: Best deep dish pizza i've had!
review: Went there with a few friends a few months ago while touring in Chicago and absolutely loved it! We have to wait in line for like 10 minutes cause it was full but definitely worth the wait! Delicious pizza and great size. This restaurant is a must visit if you're visiting Chicago.

title: Order Less than you THINK you can Eat
review: We arrived at 12:30 AM on a Monday afternoon and the place was practically deserted. However, we left at 2:30, the restaurant was full with some folks waiting. There were nine of us and we ordered one large and one medium deep dish pizza. We also ordered two samplers for appetizers to tide us over until the 45 minute pizzas arrived. The bruschetta on the sampler platter was very good. The cheese triangles were nothing special. The pizza was very good and we had enough left over to feed another three people.We’re short five stars here only because the service wasn’t great. I am definitely not a Chicago pizza expert but I would definitely return here for pizza again.

title: HIghly rated?
review: The expected long wait to even get into the doorway and the suggestion that the Take-out would be much faster, we ordered to Take-out. We came back in the 45 minutes predicted and took the pizza back to the hotel. The meat and other goodies were well represented but the inner dough was gooey and unfinished. Will try other Chicago deep dish offerings

title: Fantastic deep dish pizza!!
review: My colleague and I split a medium house salad and a small deep dish pizza (the Chicago Classic with pepperoni, and the holy trinity of mushroom, green bell peppers, and onions) and it was truly divine! I had not had deep-dish pizza before, and it was amazing! The crust is just deliciousness in warm bread form, and the ingredients were fresh and wonderful. We also got peach sangria, which is made in house instead of shipped in like the red sangria is, and it was refreshing and perfectly balanced. The service was incredible. I was made to feel like an old regular customer walking in rather than a first-tuner, and our server guided us to the correct portion sizes (thank goodness we didn’t get a medium pie, we didn’t even finish the small!) our server told us to take the leftovers and give them to a Chicagoan who would appreciate some good food. We did just that, and we were grateful for his kind-hearted advice. Such a lovely meal!

title: Chicago style pizza!
review: This is a must visit for any pizza lover. Every time I get to Chicago, I stop here for at least one meal. Awesome!! And filling! Now you can get this pizza delivered to the continental US, too.

title: My first deep dish pizza!
review: I am not a pizza eater but I was told that in Chicago one had to eat a deep dish pizza from Giordano’s. So we timed our hop on hop off bus tour to leave us near this one at lunch time. It takes 40 minutes to make the pizza (all are individually made to order) so we ordered a Giordano’s Sampler as a starter whilst we waited, accompanied by Blue Moon and Sam Adams beer, all of which were very good.The pizzas are huge; one of us had a small (one person) pizza with artichokes, mushrooms and black olives and could not finish it whilst two of us shared a small Chicago Classic, of which we only managed to eat two thirds. The Classic comprised cheese, tomato and pepperoni with red peppers and onion. It was excellent and looked like a quiche with the deep crust and filling.Service was really attentive. Recommended.

title: Really good deep dish
review: We stopped in pretty late. I know ours was one of the last pizzas out. Staff was very friendly even though they were ready to close.We haven't had deep dish before but it was really good. Just got the pep that we shared and still had leftovers. I'm a guy that thinks pizza lives and dies by the it's crust and this was excellent.

title: Best deep dish pizza I've had
review: Best deep dish pizza I ever tried. The crust was the right firmness so that the pizza didn't turn into a soggy mess.The cheese, sauce and toppings were a great consistency, where it didn't feel too heavy or greasy to eat.The service here is extremely friendly. Bonus points because it was a very busy restaurant but the staff were always checking up on us, attentive and quick.For those with kids, the staff gave colouring activities and crayons to the kids, which was very much appreciated because of the wait for the food.Warning: It takes 45 minutes for them to make your pizza! Patience gives quality.

title: Deep dish heaven
review: You're reading this because you want to know about the deep dish pizza - it's worth it. We waited 30 minutes for a table, but they let you order your pizza (which takes 45mins to cook) at the time you join the waitlist for a table so really, there is no wait time! The pizza was amazing - so much cheese, perfect crust (I think the baked crust is so yum). We ordered a small with no sides and were absolutely stuffed at the end. I just wish we went back!

title: My first time in Chicago and the Deep Dish Pizza her was AMAZING!!
review: The pizza was unlike anything in California. So amazing. One piece and it is like a huge meal. I can see why everyone wants to eat here. It was so awesome and the look of the place and location was really nice. Everyone in our group ate, drank, and were so happy to visit this piece of Chicago.

title: The Best Deep Dish
review: It had been a while-probably 20 years-since I had visited downtown Chicago for an extended period of time. My colleagues and I ate dinner at Giordano's and the pizza was absolutely fantastic. There was a little bit of air for a table-approximately 20 minutes-but it was well worth the wait.

title: Intro to Deep Dish for International Colleagues - Close to McCormick
review: While attending a conference at McCormick I felt I had to introduce some colleagues from Spain to the wonders of Chicago Deep Dish Pizza. Of course, they didn’t recognize the pie as a pizza but enjoyed it as a new experience. Four of us had a family bowl of salad and a medium pizza and were quite satisfied. The pizza was good - but not the best ever. The sauce was tasty but I would have like a bit more. Our server was efficient - until the end of the meal when there was much confusion due to mixed up credit cards. Giordanos is about a mile from the convention center. It felt good to walk back to our AirBnB after dinner ;-)

title: Go Hungry!
review: Recently visited Giordano’s in Chicago for a late lunch. I’m a NJ/NY guy who grew up on good Italian pizza- i.e. the “thin crust “ type baked in a brick oven preferably, so I had to see what all the fuss was about for Chicago “thick crust” pizza. My colleague and I split the smallest “Personal Pizza” with a few added toppings. Wow! The diameter may be small but at 2 1/2 inches thick this tiny pizza was a full meal for two hungry guys. Great taste, fresh ingredients and very different than NY style pizza. I must say service was a bit slow but friendly and apologetic. We apparently hit a late lunch rush. Plenty of choices on this comfort food menu. Check it out.

title: The Best
review: I know their pizza doesn’t look amazing in pictures, but one word... Cheese. The quality and quantity of hot oozing cheese makes this beat out Lou M’s in my book. The cheese holds the toppings down and is soft and light, just an amazing concept. The crust is a little much as I prefer a thin buttery crust. Also, when cold it’s like eating a brick of cold cheese so cold leftovers are to be avoided. You have to try this if you’re in Chicago.

title: Fantastic deep dish
review: Fantastic deep dish! Wonderful service too. Not my favourite place in Chicago but pretty close! A little too much crust with the folded over crust but still mighty fine! Their cook dessert is tasty too!

title: A Classic
review: If you go to Chicago you should try the deep dish pizza. Have to wait 40 minutes. The service is terrible. Pizza crust super crunchy.

title: Oh my God
review: We ate there the other night it was crowded it was worth that way I can eat the The deep dish pizza but let me tell you what their thing crust pizzas also lots of cheese ,The crust of the pizza was thin real butter it tasted like a Ritz cracker Timbo if you’re in the Chicago area there’s like four of them are scattered around Chicago he got to go try it’s worth the wait

title: Best Chicago Deep Dish
review: Maybe I'm jaded by imitators, but these pizzas are the best I've ever had, Nice, thick, buttery crust. Just the right amount of sauce. Toppings piled as hgh as the crust is deep! Oh and don't forget the cheese--lots of it! Love this place!!!

title: Best Chicago Deep Dish
review: We’ve done a tour of a few different highly rated Chicago Deep Dish pizza places and this was our winner.  The others were good but this one stood out with a great crust and excellent sauce. I would definitely recommend.

title: Thats what i'm talking about
review: Second try at a deep dish and they hit the ball out of  the park on this one pizza just the way i like it cheesy lol great atmosphere and staff highly recommended.

title: Poor systems and poor management
review: Delivery never came. I called and talked to a manager. She said the order didn’t print on their end so “it’s not my fault”. Told me I wasn’t the first person that day. Yet they charged my credit card and sent me a confirmation email. Try Lou’s or Gino’s. The pizza is better and the management is much better.

title: Not Disappointed
review: In Chicago for a convention, I had to give “Chicago pizza” a try. We got here early, about 5:30 and got right in. By the time we left there was a wait. My friend and I ordered a house salad to share that was amazing. It was more like a Caesar salad. Then we shared a small pizza which was six slices. We could only eat two each as it was so thick. It was absolutely delicious. The sauce was great, full of cheese and toppings and the feed dish was amazing. Would definitely return.

title: Never Disappoints!
review: The pizza here never disappoints! Always fresh tasting, tons of cheese and toppings. If you want a Chicago Deep Dish Pizza, try this place first. This location is close to the field museum and walking distance from Shedd Aquarium. Nice neighborhood and nice restaurant/bar setting. Good service.

title: GREAT
review: The food was delish and the server wonderful. Plenty of leftovers. Highly recommend. Had a good selection of draft beer.

title: Deep Dish Pizza beyond words
review: I can not describe how delicious the deep dish pizza is.  And I understand that Giordano’s is the best - I would believe this. The 1 plus hour wait was well worth it

title: Come hungry
review: This was a deep dish pizza that deserves praise. It is made fresh when ordered and absolutely delicious. I was there with my mother and niece, ordered the small, we each had a salad and could not finish the pizza. Looking forward to a return visit.

title: Lunch
review: Very good authentic deep dish pizza. Salad was fresh with good shaved Parmesan cheese  Reasonable choice of Draft Beer. Service was good and fast. Had lunch prices which was good.

title: Very very good Deep Dish Pizza
review: I took my two teenage daughters for dinner at Giordano's our first night in Chicago. Our salads were incredible and the pizza was over the top. The restaurant accomodated our request for 1/2 the deep dish version of their Pizza Margherita and 1/2 of the house special. Great experience and the wait was tolerable.

title: Best deep dish puzza
review: If your willing to wait 45 minutes for a Chicago style deep dish it’s definately worth the wait.we ordered the Canadian bacon and mushroom. It is really worth your while to stop for dinner.

title: Lunch
review: What a great find during our trip. We grabbed a late lunch and it was delicious. We ordered a meatball sandwich, soup, bowl of pasta, and salad. With a dairy allergy, our waiter was so attentive. Loved this place!

title: Deep dish pizza place
review: I learn, that I had to try deep dish pizza in Chicago. The deep dish pizza from Giordano's was very good. The only downside that it takes them 40 min to cook it. Being in Chicago just 4 days and spending 40 min to wait for the food it was a little bit too much. I did not know, but I learned, that I could call and order it next time. But it was a very delicious dish.

title: Delicious
review: Deep dish pizza is really awesome. Service is long but Giordano’s is a classic route point for Chicago trip.

title: Had to try the deep dish
review: For our first time in Chicago we ordered a deep dish pizza with mushrooms, sausage, peppers and onions. It was very tasty, and since they take a while to bake, we started with calamari and more, which was really nice but small on the marinara sauce.

title: Be Prepared to Wait...but Worth It!
review: The wait is long, and the waiting area is crowded. BUT the pizza is special! It’s a Chicago staple, so we went in with the “worth it” attitude. A simple pepperoni deep dish pizza from Giordano’s can’t be beat! Just prepare yourself to be a little uncomfortable in the cramped waiting area before being seated.

title: Delicious Pizza
review: We ordered and had the pizza delivered to us at our hotel. It took about 45 minutes but it was worth the wait. The Chicago-style pizza was amazing. I ordered a House Salad, as well, and it was fresh. The lemon vinegarette dressing complimented the salad.

title: Fantastic Waitress
review: Tari was a fantastic waitress!  She was always ready for us when we had a question, needed the table cleared, etc.  The pizza was under-cooked in the center unfortunately,

title: Best Pizza ever
review: My son and I fly into Chicago for the Bears game. Stayed at Best Western grant Park asked them a good pizza place they told us GIORDANO"S . They were dead on great pizza, we order a med pizza and could not finish it. I', 6-7 300 lbs my son is 6-2 220 LBS. Thick crust great service, beer was only 3 dollars a bottle. A must stop if your going to a DA Bears game.

title: Best Pizza
review: This By Far is the absolute Best Pizza I Have ever eaten if you Like Deep Dish Pizza Then you will Love Giordano’s Pizza!

title: Walked in, sat down, and left.
review: It was a Friday night, so we expected it to be busy! We jumped in line, two elderly women skipped the whole line and asked for a table and they sat them anyway. When we got to the front, we were not asked if we wanted inside or outside when there was clearly options for both, we got put at a dirty table in the back corner. All the waiters/waitresses seemed stressed and angry and not happy to serve us at all. They took our order after 15 minutes and then 5 minutes later, with still no water and no offer of a drink, we got up, cancelled our order and left.

title: Very good,
review: love the thick dough. It takes a long time to cook, so get there in time, you will wait a bit. For my personal taste it was too cheesy...but people go for it. I love deep dish pizza, but mostly for the dough. Great place, great pizza. The place is nice, spicy and it has outside sitting. Service was good.

title: Stuffed pizza, cheesy garlic bread
review: So, we wanted to call ahead to pre-order our pie to save some time as we knew what we wanted and were on our way and couldn't.. Disappointing.. Maybe specific to this location..We were seated and ordered right away and got some apps - calamari and cheesy garlic bread..Tasty..Deep dish pizza was as expected.. Pretty good, sauce and crust.Service was good..Downside to this place is that they only serve Pepsi products..

title: Why does this place exist? A bad joke that lingers in the tastebuds
review: Best words to describe this pizza would be a sloppy rancid mess. None of the ingredients tasted fresh, the tomato sauce on top is salty and dried in the oven and taste like its come straight from a can. The crust in the deep pan is actually very thin but very dry underneath whilst also undercooked, must be a special technique! It's also more of a short crust you'd find on a sausage role or meat pasty rather than nice doughy texture. In conclusion this sorry tired joke of a "traditional Chicago pizza" took over an hour to arrive to the bar and wasn't worth a dollar let alone 30!!!

title: Worst waiter, manager and service ever !!!
review: We waited for an hour for a small pizza that NEVER appeared and the stupid waiter told us “ 15 minutes more “ because he forgot to put the order dam I’m so mad the manager never apologized!

title: New way if doing pizza
review: It is a place where you can eat the deep dish pizza and no doubt you will enjoy it   I loved it although it would s heavy meal but you need to try it ..

title: The best
review: We got the meat pizza. It was so good. The crust has cheese baked into it. My husband and I ordered a small, which is about 6 pieces. We could barely finish 2 apiece. Next time I think we could split the individual, that’s how big they are. Preferred this one to Lou Malnatis.

title: FIRST TIMER WITH DEEP DISH
review: I was in town last week for the Pampered Chef National Conference and we stayed out a little bit from the convention center on Higgins Road ($60 or $70 a night cheaper for hotels lol) but I knew from before I left that Giordano's was a MUST. They were already talking about it and dreaming of it on our FB conference page before we got here and it did NOT disappoint this first time visitor to the Windy Cindy. FABULOUS and AMAZING are two words I would use to describe it. If you come to Chicago it's a must!

title: Deep Dish - Check!
review: Visited Giordano's for lunch as trying deep dish pizza is a must when in Chicago. The deep dish pizza was good, I decided to try the gluten free version of a deep dish pizza....lovely that there was the option...however, not so yummy.

title: Pizza worth the wait!
review: Great, classic Chicago deep dish pizza...will definitely return. Would rate "excellent" for food and service", but the wait time made it only a very good experience.

title: Deep-dish heaven
review: Best deep dish in the world although haven't checked in with China (who knows, they probably have a Giordano's knock-off). A bit of a wait but it's well worth it...

title: Great pizza
review: Food was good we had the meat lovers pizza also on the day you are going home they insulted bags to take frozen ones home.

title: Ask for Ricardo!
review: My family and I drove in from Cleveland, Ohio and we were STARVING!!! We ordered wings, fries, and salad...and our waiter Ricardo made two of us the most AMAZING fruity “moctail”! Well there happened to be a mishap with our order and we were unable to get the pizza we drove so far for. We asked the manager comp the food we DID receive and he graciously obliged. We weren’t exactly clear on the circumstances around the mishap but we felt Ricardo AND the manager treated us with respect took very good care of us out-of-towers! Our waiter was amazing as was the rest of the staff at that location. I will be sure to recommend this establishment to everyone I know! We will be back some other time and thank them for such a rewarding experience!

title: Be prepared to wait extremely long
review: We were seated at a table right away. Was told when we ordered it would take 45 minutes for a small deep dish pizza. Which was fine, I was willing to wait that long. But it ended up being an hour & 20 minutes, for a small pizza. It was good, but the wait was wayyyy to long. Also ordered sample plate & 3 drinks. Came to about $80.00

title: Delicious
review: Super cheesy and delicious, but expect to wait a while for your pizza.  The classic is great and taste amazing but get the smallest size because it will always be to much food.

title: Impatient Staff, Cold Pizza
review: Got here at 9pm on sunday July 22, 2018. It took us asking to get a very impatient waiter to take our order. Male with black earrings. He was so impatient, he only took 1 of the 2 orders. We had to request again for the second order to be taken. Then after 1 hour, after again asking, we got 1 very cold pizza and I hot one. Honestly, I don’t think this pizza is worth it. I was with 3 others felt the same way.

title: Tourist pizza??
review: I stayed at the Congress Hotel about .8 of a mile away and the bellhop inside said that this pizza was tourist pizza. I was wondering why the shade because other locals said go here for pizza. So we went anyway and the deep dish was so good. We have the chicken sausage pizza and entree Caesar salad. Glad we stopped here. I’m from New York still love my pizza but when in the Chi I’m eat some deep dish.

title: Best Pizza I ever had!  NO JOKE !
review: How these guys take dough, cheese and veggies and make something this fabulous is beyond me.  We went with another couple and were amazed at the flavor!  I highly recommend this place for the best Pizza in town!

title: Great Chicago Pizza
review: Quick visit to Chicago and of course, you have try to Chicago deep-dish pizza. It is definitely worth the wait to get the pizza; however, if you need a snack, get one of the appetizers, especially the fried cheese. We really liked our experience at Giordano's, it was definitely good pizza and the service was spot-on too. Plus, it is within walking distance to the Museum campus...which can be a good thing after you eat the deep-dish pizza!

title: A franchise, but still delicious deep dish pizza!
review: You cannot visit Chicago and not try deep dish pizza. Giordano's is one of the best. There are multiple locations, so you can try out some of their famous pizza just about anywhere in Chicago. I recommend getting reservations though. There's a good possibility you will be waiting for a bit.

title: Good deep dish and a great staff
review: This is the best pizza that you can walk to from the aquarium and Field Museum. I ordered a to go pizza for the boys and I. By the time we got over there it had started to rain a little. I asked if we could just eat there. We ended up ordering the calamari app, which was a big mistake. It was good, but the pizza alone was enough for an army (and we ordered the medium). The pizza was good, I liked the crust on this pizza the best out of the three places we went on our trip.

title: Deep deep dish!
review: Always an argument, a matter of opinion, or taste preference, as a Chicagoan we can never seem to agree who has the best deep dish pizza in the city. For me it's easy, Giordano's is my favorite! I love the oozing cheese, perfect crust, and complete thickness of the tasty sauce! Don't get me wrong, this is FILLING! I usually eat a piece and a half, but the take home leftovers are part of the goodness. Waking up the next morning and finding a cold piece is sheer joy. There you have it, many may agree or disagree, that's what it's all about! This is my recommendation, I can only say real deep dish from Chicago can't be beat! Now go give it a try! Weekends are crowded, worth the wait!

title: Too long
review: Made the mistake of trying to check this spot off of the bucket list at Navy Pier. The wait was 40 + minutes and they lost our reservation, then we had to wait forever for the deep dish, gotta be a better system. Ordered a beer and waited 20 minutes for that...unfortunately felt like a tourist trap!

title: Dinner with family
review: Husband loved the pizza, just ok for me. Happy for gluten free for our son. Only question is why order your food while waiting 40+min , to have to wait just as long to get it after you get a table ?

title: Great Deep Dish
review: Delicious deep dish pizza!!! Definitely try the bruschetta as an appetizer !!! Great spot to hit up in Chicago!

title: Our First Stop!
review: Giordano's was our first stop in Chicago. We stayed in the South Loop near Soldier Field. The restaurant location was very easy to get to. There was not a lot of traffic and parking was available. My family couldn't decide on which pizza to get. So we ordered a small deep dish and a medium thin crust. This was more than enough. In fact, we had a lot of leftovers. The two pizzas cost about $40. The service was good and the staff was friendly. They were also able to accommodate a guest with a peanut allergy. It does take some time to get your food. We waited about 45 minutes for carry-out, but it was worth the wait!

title: We drowned in glorious pizza!
review: My husband and i were just there yesterday for dinner. First timers, not having any idea how much of their small pizza we could eat, we ordered a small chicago classic deep dish pizza and i was in pizza heaven at first bite. We didn't order anything else aside from their greenline beer and we ended up full well into the next day!I loved the sauce and the cheese and the nice wait staff that we had. We struggled to finish the small one because it was just us 2. I suggest to go there with a small party so nothing goes to waste.I liked their sauce better than lou malnati's but we find lou malnati's crust better. Both are awesone anyway and well worth the cheat day!!

title: Great pizza if you are patient
review: They warned us that it can take 40 minutes to make the pizza. It took more like 50, so we were really hungry by the time it came. It was really good pizza, but I'm not sure if I would wait that long again just to say I had a deep dish pizza from Chicago.

title: Go to do
review: So coming from the northeast and thin crust pizza I was skeptical. Were hear the Giodano was the place to try deep dish pizza. First you need to know that they take between 45-60 minutes to prepare. Not like the 20 minutes for a thin crust. The pizza was very flavorable and the crust was light but I am a thin crust guy. Definitely worth a try.

title: Best pizza EVER!
review: The deep dish pizza is to die for! It is thick and rich - can't eat more than a piece but whoaaaaaa is it delicious with fresh ingredients and crunchy crust. It is a " must order" when in Chicago.

title: Best Pizza ever !!!!
review: The best pizza ever !!!!! Excellent flavor, waiting to go back to Chicago just yo go again to this place !!!!

title: Not The Best
review: I was hoping for so much more with my first Chicago pizza experience. I was very disappointed. The restaurant is very plain - nothing exceptional. The pizza, which was the real reason we came, was not good. We ordered a 1/2 and 1/2 pizza with one half being a specialty of the restaurant that included green peppers and onions; and the other half was ground beef, onions, black olives and mushrooms. I got a pizza that was stuffed almost entirely with green peppers and onions. I had to search to find the beef and mushrooms and the black olives were sprinkled on top (yuck). The crust had no special flavor and the sauce was mediocre, at best. Literally, there is a place in my hometown that does Chicago-style pizza and they have this place beat all day long. I didn't care for the inch of sauce on top of the pizza, either. Dough was moist and wet - didn't seem cooked all the way through. Sorry to all the other "lovers" of this place, but I won't be going back.

title: Great pizza
review: The famous Chicago deep dish pizza! Great pizza's and friendly service. Very central in Chicago (close to the Bean)

title: Best pizza
review: OK, it's Chicago deep dish pizza.  But it's the best.  Also had a family size Caesar salad, which five of us couldn't finish.  Reasonable prices.  Good beer.  What else could you ask for?

title: Great choice for deep-dish pizza by the Park
review: Close to the Park, classic deep-dish, great service, affordable. Good service, good beer selection, good TVs for watching sports

title: Great
review: Very good food. Popular place so prepare to wait. You can also preorder on line (takeaway). Deepdish excellent

title: Also Fantastic Chicago Pizza
review: When I came back to Chicago, I was happy to go to Giordano's for pizza.  Staff are amazing there.  Always helping you when you need it or when they bring food.  Pizza is good, their salads are also good.  Highly recommend.

title: Amazing !
review: So good and cheesy. Got the Chicago special. Really great crust. Would have liked more toppings. Also got the boneless buffalo chicken to start as the pizza takes 45 mins and it was worth it. Friendly service and walkable to hotels

title: Where to get deep dish in Chicago
review: Friendly service. Delicious food. Be prepared to be full. Great pizza. Also enjoyed the house salad...had a little added flavour with fennel. Yummy

title: It was perfection!
review: I could literally eat here every day! Had the large Cesar salad and the 'special' pizza. Both were nothing short of perfect. It was our first meal in town and while I know there are so many places to try in Chicago...it will be my last meal here too. I heard they're adding a location to Vegas..I sure hope this is true!

title: Thin Crust Veggie Pizza.
review: Finally a great thin crust pizza . The best I've ever had. So many times we've ordered a thin crust pizza and the crust was burnt or soggy. Nice selection of beers . Very pleased with our meal. Our hostess / waitress was knowledgeable and courteous.

title: Deep dish is way to go
review: Four guys stopped by for pizza because we were in Chicago. Really good deep dish pizza. We tried a could of different kinds but like the meat and meat the best. It had the most flavor. It does take 40 minutes to cook so plan on staying a while.

title: Spring Break
review: So I came here with my two kids, Sister-in-law, niece, and nephews. It’s was Easter Sunday around 9 pm. I was pleasantly surprised that we were seated right away, however, I became ecstatic when I saw the menu. There was plenty for everyone to choose from even myself because I have Celiac Disease and cant eat anything with gluten in it. They not only had gluten free pizza, but the had deep dish gluten free pizza. I never thought I’d get to eat deep dish pizza again. Our server was awesome as well as the food. Even down to the ranch my niece and daughter claimed it was the best ranch they had ever eaten. Thank you for an amazing dining experience during our short spring break get away

title: Chicago style pizza is a must have
review: Everyone kept telling us that Giordanos was the place to try- especially if wanting to try a Chicago style pizza. Before placing the order the waitress will tell you that it takes about 45 minutes to make the Chicago deep dish. We ordered an appetizer sampler to eat while we were waiting as we were really hungry. The appetizer was really good. The pizza arrived in about 35 minutes and looked really good. We all ate 1 slice and were stuffed! The Chicago Deep Dish is definitely a must!

title: Best Deep Dish in CHICAGO
review: This is the place to go or to order from for Deep Dish Pizza.  You will definitely love their pizza.  Careful, each slice is very thick and filling.

title: Great food, but pricey and cheesy/touristy
review: Went with 6 people, ordered one large deep dish pizza and one large regular crust plus one soda and one coffee and paid about $90 for all of it. Mind you the pizza was delicious and we had some left over at the end as the deep dish especially fills you up pretty quickly. All in all, we enjoyed out meal, the waitress was great and it was close to our hotel, but my biggest complaint was the atmosphere. It was new and nice and clean for sure, but there was nothing "Authentic Chicago" about it. It felt like an overpriced tourist trap and i wish we had done our research and gone somewhere else that would have been a more locals spot.

title: Delicious Chicago Pizza
review: After reading about Giordano's on the internet (the article was something like 10 restaurants to try if you want good food without the crowds) I had high hopes for a deep dish pizza. My expectations were exceeded. The Italian Beef deep dish pizza was the perfect marriage of what I read were two Chicago classics. Though it was spicy, it was the perfect amount of heat to keep things interesting and yet still edible. It was unique, and an experience I would recommend for those who can take a bit of spice. The individual pizza size was a large portion, and definitely a good value for money.For those who can't handle heat though, the deep dish pizza we ordered with pepperoni and mushroom was divine as well. 10/10, would recommend, would eat again. Additionally, my Italian Beef pizza came with a salad (the house salad), which was just big enough for two to share as an appetizer. It was delicious, and just like the Italian beef, had enough character to be an experience but not so much that it felt weird. Our waiter was very nice, very attentive, and professional. All in all, a great time for people who want to try "Chicago Fare."

title: Pizza Pie
review: We were recommended to go for the Deep Pan Chicago Pizza. Well you need at least 10 people to eat one of those. They are huge. They looked absolutely delicious but we couldn't manage one between 2 people! We went for the pasta and this was huge too. The setting is great and the tv screens have the sports playing. The food is good and the staff were attentive.

title: The Best Pizza!
review: We really enjoyed the food at Giordano's. The environment was great! My husband and I celebrated our Anniversary in Chicago and decided to have dinner here. I was impressed that the wait was not long at all but the restaurant was packed. The server was very nice. We joined the email club and received a free appetizer while waiting for our pizza to cook. The location was perfect walking distance from our hotel. All around great dinner. You have to try it I promise you with enjoy it.

title: Awesome stuff crust pizza
review: Best pizza I've ever had.  Very think with a lot of cheese.  Sauce is wonderful.  Pizza selection is great.  You could order drinks or non-alcohol drinks.  Nice sit down place.

title: It's an experience!
review: The organization could be better. We were told the waiting time for the table would be aproximately 30 minutes, ended up to be at least 45 minutes when we were finally seated, and found 4 completely empty, cleaned tables around us. You are asked to pre-order as you walk in and you don't even have a table yet, but to our surprise, the server came to ask us what we ordered when we were seated. Another waiting for the once ordered food. The truth is the waiter who brought us the pizza was really friendly, took milion pictures of us, and the food was very yummy and filling. There is an option of making your own pizza with your own ingredients, so that is a huge plus for picky eaters. Yes, it is a tourist attraction, but that's what you came for anyways. Overall - recommended.

title: Must try their deep dish Pizza
review: I had heard so much about their deep dish pizza, that I just had to try it for myself. I must say i wasn't disappointed. Their quantities were huge and 3 of us couldn't finish off a full Chicago-style deep dish pizza

title: Food Allergy
review: Visited with friends. I have a food allergy so once a restaurant does a great job with it, I'll typically frequent them because I know I'll be treated well. I guess Giordano's is the exception. They basically said they were too busy to even attempt to serve me. After waiting 30 minutes for a table while spending money at the bar - not what we wanted to hear - especially while entertaining guests who were visiting from another city. We left and started from scratch in a totally different restaurant- Q - and they did a beautiful job despite being even busier than Giordano's.

title: Great Chicago-style Deep Dish Pizza
review: Wait staff were great. Told us immediately that if we planned to order deep-dish, it took 45 minutes to prepare, so that we could put in our order immediately. Promptly brought us our drinks and appetizer to hold us over. Restaurant was a little loud, but that is probably to be expected. Would definitely go back!!!

title: Pizza was good. It is a tourist attraction.
review: The pizza and food is great. This pizza place is a tourist attraction and thus the prices are high. The deep is dish is so delicious. This location is near the Willis Tower and Chicago Federal Reserve . The service is decent but the pizza deep dish will take about 45 minutes to make so be prepared to stay for awhile and if not go somewhere else.

title: So filling!
review: Pizza is pizza everywhere but one deep dish pizza is something else! So filling with all the yummy ingredients in between each bite.  How can one miss this one when in Chicago? This is a must!

title: Poor customer service
review: Ordered three pizzas to go. Wanted them delivered, but said they do not deliver to campus. Stated that we have a recreational vehicle and hard to manage downtown, so we had a student pick them up. Upon receiving pizzas, the personal pan was supposed to be a meat/cheese with no sauce. Only presented with cheese. Husband called manager Caesar to discuss. Manager stated that we had to bring pizza back to store so we could receive credit and pick up another. Explained RV and downtown, Caesar stated he needed product in order to credit. We pack up RV and head downtown. When we get there, manager stated that we did not have to bring product back, that he did not recreate me a new pizza. He called my husband a liar. Claiming that he did not say that. I asked for all my money back and was outdone because he did not create me a new pizza. He stated that he was not going to that after he told my husband he would. There is no way we would have driven that RV downtown to a pizza place for nothing! Than he said the charges me for a cheese pizza and he was returning money for a cheese pizza. I ordered a meat/ cheese personal pan. He said they don't make the pizza. I have been ordering the same pizza for three years!! This was a nightmare!! He also stated that they do not deliver to campus after the driver said they do. He is exhibited poorly customer service and he did not fix my issues but made them worse. Not satisfied with service or quality of product!

title: Best Pizza in Chicago
review: Everyone has their "favorite", but for me, the small deep dish cheese pizza here was my favorite pizza in Chicago. We sat at the bar and had a true pizza/beer experience. I highly recommend eating here, you will not be disappointed, guaranteed.

title: Good Introduction to Deep Dish
review: When we went it was PACKED. We ended up waiting outside as we looked at the menu. We had a party of seven and were actually seated amazingly quickly for how many people were in line. We also had our pizzas show up really quickly as we knew exactly what we wanted as we were seated. We all really enjoyed our meal, although our server seemed a bit over run. Its not a inexpensive meal but while on vacation it was a great place for a family stop.

title: Great service, pretty good food!
review: The pizza was super tasty, appetizers were okay.  For our first trip to Chicago, this was a nice intro to the deep dish.  Our server was awesome!

title: Chicago style pizza (deep crust)
review: The pizza is very good, though it is a bit expensive. Since each pizza is prepared upon ordering, it takes a while for your pizza to arrive.

title: Delicious pizza
review: Had the stuffed crust pizza here which turned out to be filling and delicious. Waiting time was longer than usual but it was worth the wait.

title: Chicago's classy
review: This is the place where very delicious chicago's best pizza is made. Be sure that you are really hungry before entering, as this pizza pie is huge and irresistible!

title: Fave pizza but understaffed
review: We went to Giordano's around noon on a Sunday. When we came in, only 30% of the restaurant was full. We were told that we could either sit at the bar or we could be seated, but we would have to wait a long time...More

title: Great Pizza.  Long wait
review: My husband, daughter and I got a spinach stuffed crust pizza    It was excellent.   The young man taking our order said it would be 20 minutes-it was over an hour.  We asked our waitress, as many people who came in after us were served before...More

title: Good food and good deal (at the right time)
review: I went to Giordano's around 2:30pm when there was a bit of a lull between the lunch rush and dinner rush. I was absolutely starving and let my server know that so our food came out very quickly, it seemed we were the odd ones...More

title: Pizza experience
review: We have Uno at home but Giordano's kept the allure during the trip and didn't disappoint. Waiting list for tables is long during the summer but you can order ahead from the kitchen (pizza takes 45 mins) and get the table after. Nice staff too,

title: What's a visit to Chicago without deep dish?
review: This pizza is worth the wait. Interestingly, they allow you to order the pizza ahead of your being called to your table, which shortens the ultimate wait for food considerably.  They had a good selection of Chicago draft beer as well. The waiter was on...More

title: Best stuffed crust pizza
review: We tried another pizza place but came back here for another dinner it was that good. First night we had some classic toppings but second night just ordered cheese. Must try this pizza!!!

title: It is a must if you visit Chicago!
review: This pizza is great.  Totally different spin on traditional pizza.  Worth the cost to at least try it.  There are some personal pan deals for lunch.  One can save a couple bucks that way.

title: Chicago Pizza
review: So I figured if I am in Chicago I have GOT to try a deep-dish pizza.  It was good, but I thought the crust had too much of a Bisquick flavor in the dough.   But the salads were great and the beer assortment was pretty...More

title: Family dinner
review: Not being from Chicago I can't get pizza like this just anywhere. Anytime I'm in Chicago I have to stop at Giordano's. Great pie and fantastic service. You won't be disappointed.

title: Hotel Delivery made this extra nice
review: We arrived in Chicago a bit late, and thought to order delivery. Giordano's was mentioned to us as a great restaurant to try, and they delivered to our hotel. The chicken parm was good. The pizza was great. But the caesar salad? It was outstanding. Our food was delivered fairly close to the promised time, too.

title: Tasty Pizza, Ok service, Long wait time.
review: This place was our first stop here in Chicago after a long trip and many recommendations by local people. The truth is that it surpassed our expectations. The "Chicago style pizza" it is something that people should try at least once. The pizza is stuffed with the ingredients one choose and it's crusts is full of cheese. The "deep-dish" Pizza is truly out of this world. "Deep Dish" style Pizza is known to take a long time, and we expected this... We ended up waiting 45 mins for, over all it was worth the wait. The people were kinda rude, but we had a good time as a family and that is what matter. It's good for large groups, but not for a fancy dinner. It was kinda expensive, but then again the food made up for it. Overall it was an ok experience.

title: Great Family Place for a Real Taste of Chicago Style Deep Dish Pizza
review: Outstanding experience for a family of 5.  Great traditional Chicago Style deep dish pizza for the adults but also had a kids menu for the picky eaters.   Friendly, attentive staff.   Easy walk from  the Hilton Chicago where we were staying.

title: Vacation with girlfriends
review: Deep dish pizza very good. Chaotic waiting area and VERY long wait for a table. They offer ordering your pizza at same time you put your name in for a table, so when you are finally seated, your pizza doesn't take as long to get to your table. A little bit of pressure to rush to decide what you want, but makes sense given the long time the pizza takes to cook.

title: O.M.G. YUM
review: If your looking for a traditional deep dish pizza in chicago, then this is the place to go. Get there early as it gets full very fast. The service was friendly and the deep dish pizza was simlpy delicious. Coming from australia we wanted to take photo's, and the staff were so friendly that they assisted us in doing so "Thank you guys". The restaurant is warm and cosy and while your waiting for your pizza, there are T.V screens to while away the time. The food is well priced and we would definitely go there again

title: A meal in a single slice
review: Great cheesy pizza. Very filling pizza. Was able to sit at bar and order, bartender was working very diligently but always had a smile and very friendly. 2nd time here and great both times

title: The kind of pizza you take picture of!
review: The stuffed crust pizza was so large when it came to the table everyone in my party took out their phones just take a picture! While I am not that crazy about all that cheese on my pizza, I opted for the thin crust which was delicious. The man in my party really enjoyed the stuffed crust but each of them could only eat two pieces at most. The house salads were delicious and we had Great service even on a Saturday night during peak dinner times. This location is very close to millennium Park which is nice to walk around after having dinner.

title: Summer trup
review: This place was amazing. Deep dish pizza was outstanding. We would definitely return if we came back to Chicago!

title: Yummy and Affordable
review: They are everywhere in the city but good enough for us out of towners to eat at twice. We liked that they were easy to find, tasty, and fast.  The pizza was delicious and I am at home craving more now!

title: WOW!
review: We were actually on the over an hour wait list for a restaurant closer to our hotel when we remembered the name of the pizza place recommended by someone at the convention center. We looked up the address and decided to walk there. IT WAS WORTH THE WALK! Not only were we seated, had our orders taken, and an appetizer served by the time the text came through from the other restaurant, but there is NO WAY it could have been better than Giordano's! This was our first time with true Chicago style pizza. My advice? Order a size down from what you think you can eat. Get an appetizer to hold you over (it does take 35-45 minutes to bake), and be prepared for leftovers anyway. We wished we had a way to keep the leftover, and we had ordered the personal pizzas!

title: Lunch
review: Relatives living near Chicago told us this is the best place for lunch.  Very nice, friendly, clean and good.  Very different stuffed crust pizza but good. Not cheap at all but not high for downtown Chicago.  Took 45 minutes though.  Had beer also.

title: First time for Chicago style pizza - not disappointed
review: Ordered a personal 6" pizza since I nowhere to keep leftovers.  It was very different than the thin or thick crusted pizza we get in Pa.  Loved that I could customize my order.  It was delicious.

title: Best. Pizza. Ever.
review: If you are in Chicago and want to try authentic deep pan pizza there is only one place you should go - Giordano's.The restaurant has a great atmosphere and was extremely clean and modern, while the waiting staff were extremely friendly and helpful.As for the food - the pizza was absolutely incredible. Living in the U.K. I'm actually gutted I'm not able to have anther one!If you're in Chicago - go to Giordano's!

title: Don
review: This was my first experience with Chicago deep dish pizza. We ordered a large meat and more meatand the 4 of us could not finish it.But it was so good and still I was thinking about it the next morning. I love cold leftover pizza so I can say this pizza is just as good with coffee in the morning as it was with beer the night before.

title: Iconic
review: Iconic deep dish pizza joint.  Classic menu.  Great service.  Official provider to the Cubs...need I say more?

title: Linch
review: Excellent food and sevice.  Ordered the deep dish meat and more meat.  It was amazing.  Will be coming back next chance i get.

title: Satisfactory
review: After visiting millennium park, we were craving some authentic Chicago style Deep dish pizza and found Giordano's to be only a block away. After previously eating at Lou Malnati's on a prior Chicago visit, it was time to broaden our palette and go for another type.The workers that greeted you at the entrance of Giordano's seemed to treat everyone as if they were on one big assembly line and the personal touch was definitely missing. They could have se some fine tuning in customer service!We decided to preorder our pizza, glad we did it, and were seated shortly thereafter. The waiter was outstanding but the deep dish pizza seemed a little blah. It was very filling and smelled great, but there wasn't anything that made it memorable.....darn.Would choose other places to try before returning.

title: Always a Great Pizza
review: It is hard to pick a "best" pizza place in Chicago, and Giordano's should be on your list of places to check when you make this search! The thin crust pizza is great, the deep dish is amazing! Salads are also delicious and the servers are always helpful and prompt!

title: PIZZA DELIVERY
review: After a day walking the Art Institute, we just couldn't go another step. Ordered online and had delicous Chicago pizza and antipasto (and cannolis) delivered within an hour. PERFECT.

title: Yum!
review: We thoroughly enjoyed bruschetta, deep fried stuffed potatoes and the best deep dish pizza.  They were very busy on a Friday night but the atmosphere was calm and our waiter was very attentive and accommodating.

title: Good pizza
review: Good deep dish pizza but we expected more. We waited to be seated around 30 minutes on a Saturday afternoon. Good service but did not go back, since we liked deep dish pizza more in other place.

title: Excellent deep dish pizza
review: Everyone recommend deep dish pizza from Giordano's. We went one that close to us, It's a franchise but the deep dish is so good. We ordered the meat and more meat, i can smell it when they bought it to us, it's so cheesy and the crust is so good. We would like to bring one home for my son but they only have frozen cheese one. End up ordered another meat and more meat, it's still freaking good after 8 hours drive. I will say money worth.

title: Stuffed Pie is Super Cheesy, great sauce
review: Try the cheesy bread, nice size portion. All salads look good, we tried the Italian and it was delicious. Stuffed pizza is very cheesy, we split our pie with 1/2 mushroom and 1/2 green pepper. The sauce has a nice flavor. The crust was a bit bland, maybe too heavy on the flour as the edge was too thick and chewy to eat.

title: A great pizza place
review: Although Giordano's is a chain, its food has the taste and look of a great neighborhood pizza place.  Their pizza is great, I like think crust but you can get deep dish as well.  They have a good selection of beers and wines.

title: Delicious
review: First ever taste of deep pan pizza. First ever visit to Chicago. Delighted to choose this restaurant , will never forget the taste and aroma of my lunch, all my family had such a gorgeous meal. Service was fantastic and with a smile. Will have lovely memories of my trip to Chicago from Ireland. ☘️

title: WHOA, that's a lotta pie!!
review: I heard from everyone, you gotta try Giordano's if you want great pizza. I have to agree it was great, I got the BBQ Chicken Stuffed Pizza...SMALL. What nobody told me was how LARGE the SMALL was!! lol It was enough for DAYS...too bad I didn't have a fridge. I would suggest the personal pan sized pizza...if you are getting pizza for one or come hungry!

title: Get the deep dish
review: I don't understand why anyone wouldn't love this pizza...the only thing I can think is you got a thin crust in a restaurant that is known for their deep dish pies...The manager was wonderful and the food was excellent! We were there a lo g time but we had the LSD lemonade and the sampler appetizer...both very good! I would definitely go there again and I with take advantage of their shipping of pies to anywhere!

title: Confused
review: Why does this place have decent reviews? I guess being from NY our standards are high. The dough is dry and tasted like frozen pizza. Toppings were mediocre at best. I can't believe people love this pizza. We ordered a thin crust, it was late, a few drinks in. We were very easy to please so to speak. Well, it was terrible, and it cost us $41 for a large pizza.

title: Great pizza!
review: We are here over the weekend. Service was prompt and friendly. The stuffed pizzas were delicious. Definitely lived up to the hype. Recommend!

title: The definitive Chicago Deep Dish
review: Being a native New Yorker, it took some convincing for me to try Chicago Deep Dish. Giordano's was my introduction. Now, before you say "but there are others places" (which is only fair) I did try some others. Lou Malnati's...I gave them a try. Besides arrogant service, the sauce used on the pizza was so acidic I should have bought stock in TUMS. SO, at this point, I returned to Giordano's. Never to stray again.

title: Best authentic deep dish pizza in town
review: This was the first time we were eating a much heard of deep dish pizza and we were not disappointed at all eating it at this restaurant. There is a 40 minute wait time after you order to get your food, but it was definitely worth the wait. We had gone during a non-peak time so we were seated right away. I would definitely recommend eating at this place.

title: Excellent Pizza you MUST try this!
review: Undoubtedly, Chicago-style pizza is one of the best things to try while in Chicago. Giordano's makes some of the best I've tried! The service was a bit slow, but the food made up for it!

title: Excellent deep dish pizza.
review: I have been to the windy city many times over the years, but have never actually gotten a true deep dish pizza until now. So, I have nothing to complare it to, other than regular pizza. That being said, I thought it was excellent. I ordered online, which was easy enough. Staying in a hotel is always a bit tricky. Some let the delivery people come to the room, others not. This one I needed to meet them downstairs when they called. Delivery was pretty much on time for what was estimated. There was many other delivery people there as well, and the drivers do not have much saying where they were from, so it was a bit awkward wandering around the lobby asking each stranger who they were with.What is there to be said about the food, other than it was much heavier than I thought it would be. The site says a small feeds one - two people, but we had 1/3 of it left after stuffing ourselves, so plan accordingly. My main regret was not having a microwave to be able to enjoy it a second time.

title: First taste of Chicago deep dish
review: We ate at the bar and Benjamin kept us in drinks and entertained while we waited for our pizza. I think it was the best pizza I ever had.

title: Delicious Deep Dish
review: We stopped in on a Friday night while spending a long weekend in the city. We were surprised to be seated right away and our server was great. Three of us ordered an order of garlic cheese bread and a small deep dish pizza and it was more than enough food. It was excellent!!! Highly recommend.

title: Chicago style great pizza!!!
review: Ordered 2 pizzas to go. What a treat!!! This is not Kansas pizza!! Had the stuffed pizza!!! WOW, It was hot, great  tasting and high quality toppings!!!!

title: Finally A Must Do
review: Our 3rd night in Chicago allowed us the chance to check out the most recommended deep dish pizza in the city. Service was prompt and courteous. The Moscow mule was refreshing. Love the fresh grated Parmesan on the Caesar salad. No room for dessert.

title: Great Deep Dish!
review: Whenever I come to Chicago I always get Giordano's deep dish and it never disappoints.   You have to wait 45 for them to cook it and it is worth the wait

title: Traditional deep dish excellence
review: We had a great pie at Giordano's.  Known for its stuffed crust deep dish pizza, it did not disappoint.  They also had several microbrews on tap.  If you're in the South Loop area, this is a great place to get your Chicago-style pizza fix.

title: Deep dish!
review: Chicago and deep dish pizza go hand in hand. That is a must have dish if you ever visit Chi town. Giordano's is one of the best places to enjoy the real deal, they have 30-40 mins waiting time if you directly walk but there...More

title: Chicago style pizza experience
review: Great experience for Chicago style deep dish.  I'm from Jersey and as our waiter said, this is not New York pizza.  We ordered Wings, sampler a a customized deep dish.  Way too much food but we had a few hours before our flight and the...More

title: On Michigan Ave
review: We landed from Dallas looking for some good Chicago Pizza and walked upon Giordano's on Michigan Ave.  Pizza was great and very flavorful.  The crust was crunchy and not to hard.  The chopped salad was great as well.  We got there at 11:30 just as...More

title: Amazing food
review: Great staff and even better Pizza!  Must go if your going to be in the Chicago area  Know that you'll have to wait about an hour for you pizza to be ready but it is sure worth it!

title: must eat
review: this is my first time to eat " deep dish pizza". that was great. you must eat. they have some brunches, so you can find near your hotel.

title: A Chicago Favorite!
review: Our first night in Chicago, we ordered Giordano's and had it delivered to the hotel.  It's a bit pricey, but we fed our whole family (with leftovers) on one pie.  If it's not Chicago ordinance, it should be that you have to eat here at...More

title: Tasty Deep Dish
review: Know in advance that you will need to wait for a table and your pizza.  Yes, totally worth the wait.  Select your favorite toppings, a cold beer, and enjoy!

title: Best Deep Dish in the US
review: Giordano's has the best deep dish pizza ever! I love their pepperoni pizza. Hands-down, no one can beat their pizza. We are so addicted that we regularly have their pizza delivered to our home in St. Louis. So, even if you're not in Chicago but...More

title: Amazing!
review: Giordanos was within walking distance of our hotel, which we love!  This was our second time at this restaurant and decided to try the thin crust pizza.  Stuffed crust pizza is what they're known for and it seems that's what everyone was eating.  Our thin...More

title: AMAZING PIZZA! if you are into pizza this is the place to be at!
review: I love pizza! who doesnt right? well this is one of my favorite spots to visit when in Chicago. It is a big slice of pie but definitely WORTH it. not too expensive but you can share this yummylicious pizza with a buddy or two....More

title: Deep-Dish Chicago Pizza
review: Good things take time. Our pizza took over 45 minutes to cook. Be advised you will be told this when you order. This gave us an opportunity to order appetizers and drinks. We enjoyed the pizza and service. It was a nice treat while visiting Chicago.

title: Must do in Chicago!
review: When in Chicago, you must eat at Giordano's and have the deep dish stuffed pizza. It is delicious and unlike pizza anywhere else.

title: Amazing, though super long wait time.
review: Food was excellent, though we waited 55 minutes to receive. Placed our order when the gentleman at the front recommended us to do so and advised us to have a seat/drink at the bar which we did. But after waiting 20 minutes, I noticed the people who came after us were being seated. When I approached the gentleman again, it seemed he had totally forgot about us. When we were finally seated, it took another 30 minutes to finally receive our food.

title: Unexpected average pizza
review: I didn't feel like my usual stuffed pizza on this evening, so I ordered a thin crust pizza. Mistake! The crust was too hard, the toppings slid off the pizza because no cheese was added below the topics. The wings were ok. My advice: stay with the stuffed pizza; thin crust is not their best item.

title: Great Pizza!
review: We ate here on a quiet Thursday night and it was our first experience with true Chicago pizza. The service was great (except the waiter did add mushrooms and we asked that they be taken off), the craft beer was wonderful, and the pizza was delicious.I've come to understand there are a few different types of deep dish in Chicago, I encourage you to try them all. This one wasn't my favorite, but it came in at a close #2!

title: The best stuffed pizza I ever had!
review: Wonderful location,  great taste, reasonable price. The 45 minutes wait is so much worth  for it. I ate the best stuffed pizza and tried it the next day again. Highly recommended!

title: Ok food...service is terrible
review: My friend and I were referred to eat at Giordanos. The wait for the food was an hour or more. The bartender seemed to be annoyed the entire evening. No desire to go back.

title: Better than Lou's
review: Went on Halloween before the Bears game.  Great atmosphere and not too far from Soldier Field.   Crust was better than Lou's and the filling was too!

title: Amazing
review: This place is awesome. The pizza is amazing. The sauce is the best I've had. Even the appetizers are yummy! And you can order their pizza frozen to take home or have delivered to your home!!

title: great chicago pizza
review: I visited Giordano's for lunch with a large group for business. The service was very good. The food was great.

title: Delicious
review: Considering this was my first Chicago deep dish pizza, I must say, it was amazing. Thank you for living up to the hype!

title: Had to try Chicago Pizza
review: Recommended by the hotel concierge as the "best" we were warned that there would be an hours wait. Place was slammed with people, but we preordered and got a table in 45 minutes; it was outside and "our" radiant heater was broken, so a little chilly. Salads were excellent, very crisp and tasty. The pizza arrived and it was tasty, but it was a "deep dish" pizza and had more than one half inch of pure cheese on the crust and then red sauce on top. One piece of that and we were done! took the rest to the hotel, but actually threw it away. I guess we were the only ones that don't like that much cheese, cause when we left there were more waiting.

title: It was worth waiting for
review: Amazing deep dish pizza, a medium one works for three people meal, we went day before to another giordano's and the waiting time was 1hour and the same next day, it is the minimum time to cook a deep dish pizza, so we decided to wait, you should too. Loaded pizza with perfect crust. I highly recommend this place, if you go to Chicago, you cannot leave without trying it!

title: Deep dish Chicago Style pizza at its best.
