review: Words fail to adequately describe the experience of eating this Deep Dish Chicago Style pizza. Be sure to come early they are cooked to order and well worth the wait. I have ordered VIA internet for home delivery and I don't live in Illinois!!! The price for shipping was absolutely worth it. You won't want any other pizza after getting a taste of this master piece!!!

title: Undisputedly the best pizza in town.
review: this place serves the best pizza i've ever had. If this was a tiny bit cheaper I would love to go to this place time and again. for all those who are pizza fans this place is a must to be at. Also if you want to try the famous Chicago deep dish pizza there is no better place than Giordano's for sure.

title: Great Chicago pizza
review: Not much to add to what others have already said: a must in Chicago, Giordano's deep dish pizza is great! it is worth the time you have to wait to be seated and the pizza to be delivered (45 min, although they take your order before you are seated to reduce the time you'll wait on the table). The small size pizza is big enough for two unless you´re really starving.

title: Best Pizza
review: Went to Chicago to visit my brother and he suggested this place to eat and I am so glad he did. There was a 45 minute wait, but we ordered the pizza and then in 45 minutes when our table was ready, we sat down and our pizza was ready within 5 minutes. The pizza is awesome! This is a MUST!

title: BEST pizza ever!
review: This is the best pizza I've ever had! You will not be disappointed if you go here! I will be ordering some to ship to my front door!

title: Best Pizza!!
review: We came here on our first night in chicago after a long day of traveling. Giordano's is very clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful! The food was excellent and the environment was very warm and welcoming! This was our first experience with Chicago Pizza and we were not disappointed!

title: Best pizza ever
review: We looked up this pizza place on trip advisor. It had high ratings and the food and service definitely came through! We had been at the shedd aquarium and the location was close and easy parking. There is a parking lot adjacent to the building which cost $10. We had a table for six in the front window. Our waitress Jennifer was excellent. She was very attentive to all of our needs. We ordered an extra crispy half cheese and sausage which was the best pizza I've ever eaten. My husband ate a deep dish pepperoni mushroom pizza he said it was the best he's ever had. I'm not a fan of deep dish pizza but he loved it. The atmosphere is upbeat. I noticed there were several people coming in for carry out. There's a full bar. Definitely a family place. We will be back. They have seating outside but it was too cold and windy on the day we visited.

title: First pizza pie
review: Never had pizza pie before, in my mind and from pictures I thought it would be a really thick Base withe usual pizza toppings - how wrong was I! This monstrous thing was delicious however we couldn't finish it even though we got the suggested small for 2 people. We visited on a Monday night before the Bears game so the place was busy but we were seated in minutes. Our waiter was good as with the other staff front of house. You do have to wait 45mins for a pie so either reserve ahead or be prepared to wait. All in all great experience.

title: So disappointed. A big waste of money!
review: Thought we'd try deep dish while visiting Chicago. Really disappointed. Saw good reviews but salad and pizza were nothing special. Pizza was undercooked and after we asked for it to be cooked longer (after the waiter mansplained to me that dough should be raw under the toppings), it still tasted not much different than boxed frozen pizza. Waiter was overzealous. And I was very ill after. :(

title: Exceptional Service
review: Went here last night around 7. Sat at the bar . Our server /bartender Zuri was swamped with people . She not only single handedly served us , but also was serving tables and booths behind the bar . She was awesome , we never had to wait for anything nor did anyone else for that matter . I can't say enough about her . She was always smiling and even talking to us between getting drinks and food for everyone . What an outstanding representative on the front line for Giordano's! Thank - You

title: Worlds best pizza
review: Giordano's is simply the best! Never disappointing! It takes 45-60 mins to cook your pizza, so call ahead or order while you are waiting for you table.

title: Good pizza but does not live up to the hype
review: Waited over an hour to eat at this famous place. Hostesses were frazzled but our server was lovely. Neat to watch the pizza dough makers flinging the pizza in the air. The Piizza was good. We ordered one deep dish and one thin crust. Toppings were good but something was lacking with the dough and the sauce. Can't put my finger on it. They had a chicken sausage topping that was marketed as "light". It was quite tasty and I recommend it.

title: first stop for Chicago Pizza
review: Good place  to sample all the styles of Chicago pizza. We tried both the deep dish and thin crust. Toppings were varied, which was nice when you are in a group. Staff were friendly, and service was pretty quick.

title: Great pizza, terrible service
review: The pizza is great but the service was terrible. I was out of water for at least 10 minutes while eating. I finally went to the bar to get more and the bartender's response to me asking for a water refill was 'well you're gonna have to wait a minute', like it was a huge inconvenience so I went back to my table and waited for the waiter to come back. Then he wouldn't split our check, he said it was too long of a process and that we all needed to pay together on one check.

title: Best pizza I've tasted!
review: Loved this place, our waiter was very friendly, gave us recommendations and we tried the meatball pizza with mushrooms which was amazing. The small pizza is for two, but it's really a lot for two people. Also we tried the minestrone soup and was really good. Great taste, great service! You can't miss this place if you're in Chicago.

title: Excellent
review: Excellent deep dish pizza! Good service. They brought out the kids meal soon as it was ready. It was 45 minutes to get the pizza but you can preorder to save time.

title: Good Pizza but Lou Malnati's Deep Dish is Chicago's Fave
review: People will say Uno's or Due's or Giordano's for their faves, but Lou Malnati's Deep Dish Chicago Pizza consistently wins the #1 spot for deep dish in the city.

title: You've got to have some!
review: There's nothing like Giordano's deep dish stuffed pizza.  It takes an hour to cook, but its worth the wait.  I challenge anyone one person to eat a small.  I couldn't.  I had a sausage and mushroom and it was delicious.  There's nothing like it.

title: GREAT Pizza
review: Pizza was amazing. Staff was great.   Remember to plan ahead because it takes 45 mins to cook a deep dish pizza.   Loved it and would definitely go back!

title: Deep dish
review: Ate here on a Friday mid-afternoon (about 6 blocks from Chicago Hilton hotel) and restaurant was mildly crowded.   Ordered calamari (very good), Caesar salad (very good), a beef calzone-type (great), kid's spaghetti (great)  and deep-dish pizza.  Note pizza takes about 45 minutes to cook so...More

title: Different than expected
review: We got to Giordano's around 10pm. They were still pretty busy around this time. As a jersey girl used to tomato pie and sicilian style crust, this was something else. The dough, it's almost like a biscuit style but denser. That's my crazy interpretation of...More

title: probably the best food (not just pizza) i've ever eaten
review: the sauce is perfect, not too sweet and not too sour.  the crust is so delicious.  the the caesar salad and house salad are also delicious!  we ate there 2 times in the 4 days were were in chicago!  sooo good.

title: This is it!
review: 5 Stars, grand slam, died and went to pizza heaven, can hardly wait to eat leftovers the next day , sad that there isn't much leftover to savor!  Ordered harvest salad and stuffed chicken sausage spinach pizza. Nothing more needs to be said or tried...More

title: One of the Beat in Chicago....
review: Been around for decades....one of the best deep-dish pizzas in Chicago.  Old school feel with great service and yummy entrees...the real star here is the deep dish pizza....a must when in Chicago!!

title: Great service and pizza
review: We had a half veggie and half sausage and mushrooms. They did a very good job of keeping the sides separate so we didn't need to order two pizzas and all were happy. The staff was attentive and upbeat

title: Hands down, BEST. PIZZA. EVER!
review: I had heard great things about Giordano's before visiting Chicago. Even with the the great reviews, I was still not expecting the pizza to be THIS GOOD. Seriously, the best pizza I have ever had. If you get the chance to have this delicious pizza...More

title: Great food, crowded and busy, poor service
review: My husband and I went to this Giordano's last night before a soccer game at Soldier Field. We've both been to Giordano's before, so we knew the pizza would be great and we knew the restaurant would be busy.  We got there around 5:15. We...More

title: Best deep dish in Chicago
review: I was recently in Chicago for a week and literally had deep dish pizza for one meal every day I was there. Every time from a different restaurant some of them the super "famous" spots that we waited hours for. Giordano was the best I tried. Great stuff.

title: Amazing - great value and service
review: I want to go back to Chicago simply to back here - it was amazing food, great service and atmosphere - group of 8 of us ordered 3 small pizzas and we had 8 slices left over and everyone was full - the toppings are amazing and the pizzas taste great. Would totally recommend.

title: Not a great place.
review: So this is not my first time here and I try not to write or say anything negative after just one visit . Giordano's pizza is overall good in every location, but if You want to avoid stress and two hours wait . Do not go to this location. You hear servers saying sorry, oh I'm sorry , we are little short on stuff...Yeah my fourth time here and this place is a mess ....by the time pizza is in front of You...You just want to run out this place .

title: classic and great
review: My son wanted the classic deep dish. They warned that it would take 40 minutes, and it did. We were ok waiting and he thought it was worth the wait. The restaurant got busy and our waiter neglected us. But the food was worth it.

title: Chicago Pizza
review: While I personally prefer think crust we entertained out of town guests who wanted to try Chicago style deep dish. Giordanos really filled the need .Good fast service from our server and a tasty Chicago favorite served hot was delicious.

title: BBQ Chicken
review: Our first trip to Chicago and this place was a must. We really enjoyed the deep dish people. Be sure you have time. It takes 45 minutes to cook! You have to have someone from your party there to wait. We LOVED this pizza.

title: MUST have pizza!
review: My husband had eaten here in the past, and it was a must on his list for our vacation. It was worth it. When you get there, be prepared to wait--however, they have a great system where you order your pizza while you're waiting. (Pizzas take an hour to cook). I'm telling you, if you like thick-crust or deep-dish pizza, this is the place for you! (There are also thin-crust options). We had a simple pepperoni pizza. My husband and I split a small pizza and a small antipasto salad--we are eaters, and that was the perfect amount for us! I can't wait to bring my kiddos here! Our server was Gina, and she was EXCELLENT!

title: Yes it is the best pizza!
review: It was worth waiting one hour. And I could wait 2 if needed. Nothing I say will be enough. You should try it!

title: Great pizza!
review: This is a place that you should go if you are a pizza fan. Chicago style, something between a pizza and a pie, it worth the time you wait until it arrives in your table. We were in 7 people (5 adults and 2 children) for dinner so we ordered one small size pizza half veggie half Chicago Classic and another one medium size all cheese pizza. It was perfect and more than enough to satisfy everybody. We were attended by a very communicative and funny waiter, what pleased us. If you come to Chicago, I highly recommend check it out.

title: Husband's favorite thing about Chicago
review: My husband and son loved this place.  They got the deep dish.  I enjoyed the thin crust.  My husband is mad we live so far away from this place.

title: Giordanos
review: We had to stop and try a Chicago style pizza when in the city. Totally different experience than pizza I've had before. A small order is plenty enough for a couple plus left overs to take with you!

title: Deep dish pizza Chicago style
review: First time I had Chicago style deep dish pizza. Not a fan. Took 45 minutes for the pizza. Sauce was good but crust was bland and tasted like saltine crackers. I would try the thin pizza. Not worth the wait in my opinion.

title: Very good!
review: Stopped by here while in Chicago because we wanted to try authentic deep dish pizza. This b place is known for their stuffed deep dish-- we ordered a small (plenty for two people) Chicago Classic. We also ordered buffalo wings for an appetizer. Appetizers here are a necessity because it can take 45 minutes to an hour for deep dish pizza to cook (and we were hungry). The wings were very good, hot and fresh and the pizza was great (even with the sauce on top which is unique where we're from). Lots of cheese, lots of toppings inside! We decided that we would definitely visit here again when we returned to Chi-town.

title: Chicagolicious
review: A trip to Chicago must have a stop at Giordano's for stuffed deep dish pizza.  Worth the 45 minutes to wait for it to bake.  Absolutely delicious.

title: Come hungry!
review: Other words of advice: maybe jog there to offset the calories you will consume, don't think about calories, DO NOT order an appetizer, just wait for the Za. It's worth the wait. Also, the frozen lemonade is very good once you water down the sweetness. A MUST when in Chicago!

title: Come Hungry!
review: You have to try deep dish pizza, and you should try it here. The restaurant is clean, the staff friendly and the service is fast. The pizza though, just cheesy, yummy, deep dish heaven. I recommend the meat pizza, just a classic.

title: Better salada
review: Deep dish pizza is kind of heavy with so much tomado sauce, but Giordano´s have better salads and good service,  With a médium it could work for 4 people

title: While in Chicago, deep dish pizza at it's best!
review: We had a large group on a Saturday during dinner time, so we had to wait an hour after being told to expect 1.5 hours. The wait was well worth it! The outside seating while waiting is comfortable. We received excellent service and the food was incredibly good! We had several first timers to Chicago and they loved the deep dish pizza. Prices are fair and the beer was cold & good! We highly recommend for families to enjoy.

title: Excellent deep dish
review: This review is geared toward those that are in a rush. Know that if you show up to get a pizza to go, you'll be waiting about 45 minutes at a minimum. The same applies if you are eating inside the restaurant as well. This is pretty standard throughout the city, as we discovered. But if you've got the time to wait, you will not be disappointed. Great pizza.

title: Worst pizza ever!!!
review: First we asked for a traditional style pizza and they came with cracker thin crust pizza which is there " traditional style pizza" we made them take it back and we ordered the Chicago style deep dish which was even worse. The crust was just as thin but the sides were tall. The pizza was the worst pizza I have ever ate in my life. I have had frozen pizza that tasted better. Detroit is not know for the pizza but it sure is so much better here then anywhere.

title: Great first meal in Chicago
review: Found Giordano's by accident not knowing that it was so popular. We had to wait over 1 hour but they take your pizza order while you wait so it is just about ready when you sit down. I have food allergies and they were very helpful to make sure I had something to eat and I felt very safe. They have Gluten Free pizza and pasta and also sauce with no cheese and the food was delicious.

title: Delicious!!!
review: This pizza was delicious!!!  We ordered the pan pizza which takes about 45 minutes to make, but it was well worth the wait!  We had salads while we waited and they were delicious also!!  I highly recommend trying this place!!

title: Quintessential Chicago!
review: My husband and I went for an early dinner on a Saturday evening... at around 4:00, we were seated right away. Our server was very friendly and attentive. The Greek starter salad is fantastic, and our deep dish Chicken sausage/mushroom/spinach pizza was very good. The bottom crust was a little soggy though. Be advised, it takes 40-45 minutes for deep dish pizzas. Loved the fun atmosphere.

title: Disappointing
review: I saw the reviews on here and thought this would be a good place to try the deep dish pizza. While they do serve deep dish, it tasted like it was a frozen pizza. The cheese was very rubbery and not warm when it was served to me. Overall I was very disappointed.

title: Not for everyone
review: Tried their deep dish pizza which I wanted to try for a while. Wasn't for me (seemed frozen and preheated). There is other restaurants which my friends recommend for authentic Chicago deep dish pizza close by (Lou Malnati's ) try it out it might be better than this place .

title: Overstuffed Pizza Parlor
review: We had reservations for our group made long in advance, unfortunately they where very unprepared for our group.Understandable but then add in one sever for a table of 20 and service is impaired at best (handling 2 other tables as well).Pizza ordered was ok, but rather than thick crust, it was mostly thick cheese. Sorry to say not up to My Standards for Chicago Pizza. I know our Group size detracted so I am giving 3 stars instead of 2

title: Great Food, and atmosphere!!
review: The food here is amazingly good, and the staff is very helpful and friendly! Nothing like Chicago Deep Dish!! Cannot wait to return!!!

title: A good family dinner with Chicago famous Stuffed Pizza
review: 餐厅坐落在密西根大街南段，是非常出名品尝芝加哥比萨的连锁餐厅。朋友推荐来芝加哥一定要品尝这里的厚披萨。我们周二晚上吃晚饭，无需排队或者定位。餐厅员工很友善，我们四个人点中等大小的披萨也吃不完，实在是够大量！上面有很多️和不同馅料，搭配的不错，不会显得油腻，值得一试！Giodano is a famous chain restaurant for Chicago famous Stuffed Pizza that my friend highly recommended us to try. We went for dinner on a weekday on Michigan avenue and no need to wait or make reservation. Restaurant staff are very friendly and helpful. We ordered medium size classic stuffed pizza with some entree and desert. Four of us can not finish the medium size at all! There are a lot of cheese in the pizza, very good taste in general.

title: It is a Pizza Pie
review: There are many Giordano's in Chicago but this was nearest our hotel and they accommodated our large party. I also had previously signed up with Giordano's email and had a coupon for a free appetizer, we got the bruschetta which saved me almost $10 and gave us something to eat while waiting for the pizza. Due to the size of the pizza it usually takes about 45 minutes to make. Our waiter was helpful but a bit slow on drink refills. Pizza was great but I would have liked it to be a bit hotter. Atmosphere is a new establishment so no old world pizza parlor charm. Because the pizza is so deep, like a pie, if you normally have a medium for two people, you might want to get a small, one piece is easily the thickness of 2 or 3 normal pizza slices.

title: Great Deep Dish Pie in Family-friendly Atmosphere
review: Several friends recommended Giordano's as a "must visit" when in Chicago. We visited the one just south of Grant Park. The pie was outstanding. Prices were very reasonable. The only drawback were the noisy kids the evening we ate there. We're early diners, though, so kids are to be expected. We will definitely return!

title: Tried the Deep Dish
review: Not a deep dish fan but this was pretty tasty. Nothing to complain about, through and through this was a good pizza! Tried the Chicago style and I have to say it wasn't bad! Sorry cant convert but I gave it a good try!

title: ehh
review: Well, to start with, you can take my review with a grain of salt...maybe a big grain, because I'm not a big fan of deep dish pizza. However, my wife is and she didn't like the pizza much either. The pizza crust was too hard. We went to a different deep dish pizza joint the next day and my wife liked it a lot better. On the flip side, the service was excellent. The waiters (man I forgot their names, but one was a skinny black guy and he was training another guy) were really nice and helpful.

title: Best pizza pie I have ever eaten
review: We waited 45 minutes for the pizza to cook but it was well worth the wait. The pizza actually comes out looking like a pie. The real surprise was the crust which was so buttery and crispy. The pizza is built like so, crust, meat and/or vegetables, cheese and then sauce. Very tasty and filling.

title: Good pizza good staff
review: The pizza was amazing and the staff where up to par with making sure we where satisfied with drinks and anything else we needed

title: Stopped by on the way to Soldier Field
review: After all the hype concerning Giordanno's pizza, my party was sorely disappointed. We ordered two pizzas. One came out at a normal expectancy rate, but the other took nearly an hour to prepare and serve! Granted the establishment was very busy the 4th of July weekend, but the pizza was mediocre to boot.

title: Best pie
review: We were so hungry when we got to Giordano's. We walked the city all day long. We got to the restaurant ordered our pizza (it takes 45 minutes for the pie.) Well worth the wait! We were seated about 10 minutes after ordering got some water and an appetizer. Then the pizza was out. Perfect way to end a day of walking the city. It is so worth the wait. My husband was so happy with the service and the food.

title: Pizza
review: The staff was very friendly. I have allergies and they were very understanding. The atmosphere was lovely. The food came out hot and fast. The taste of the pizza is pretty good, but I have had better.

title: I got stuffed in Chicago
review: Amazing Pizza, totally worth trying it! A new Pizza eating experience! Make sure you are hungry. I had deep dish Pizza for lunch and even the next morning I wasn´t hungry,... Enjoy!

title: Long wait terrible service
review: First let me say the pizza is pretty good. If i had to rank the Chicago pizza i would have it would go:1) Pequods2) Lou Malnati3) Giordanos4) GinosEven though i only rated it 3rd on the list it's not to say it wasn't good. The pizza itself was actually quite good, however the service was an absolute disaster.We waited 10 minutes to have our drink order taken, then 20 minutes to get them. Our PIzza took about 1 hour 20 minutes and we saw other tables getting their food and drinks faster than us. Very frustrating as we were dealing with time constraints and had a very non responsive server

title: Had to try Deep Dish Pizza
review: When in Chicago one of the things to do is try a deep dish pizza. We went to Giordano's during March Madness. We got lucky we got a seat fairly quickly.First thing to note, it takes 45 Minutes to make a deep dish pizza so don't go if you want to eat right now. We ordered some Salad and a small deep dish pizza with chicken sausage and spinach. We were four in the group and could barely finish the small pizza. The wait was OK since we were watching the game and drinking beer. Pizza came nice and hot. Can't hold and eat this pizza, definitely a knife and fork affair. Taste was great. Waiter was a little slow to get drinks and the bill at the end but overall a great experience.

title: First Chicago Style Pizza YUM!
review: We are from St. Louis and so my family was very excited to try out this iconic Chicago style pizza.  A friend that travels to Chicago often recommended Giordano's, although no particular location.  We were visiting Shedd aquarium and decided to walk to the restaurant...More

title: Pretty good
review: Pretty good food, some local beers. We ordered a medium stuffed pizza and it was more than enough for our family of 4. We got the Super Veggie, which was a little watery due to all the veggies... it was good but we'd order a...More

title: very good stuffed pizza
review: i had the opportunity to go this place and would highly recommend trying there stuffed pizza.  our server was very nice and polite and made the experiance very pleasant by being very courteous throughout our meal  as for the food it was very good considering...More

title: The best pizza I've ever had!
review: I got there around 2pm on a Wednesday. The place was pretty empty. I sat at the bar  and ordered a beer. Then I ordered the lunch special (personal pizza & side item for about $10). I had the house salad as my side item...More

title: Good Chicago's pizza
review: Pleasant restaurant but very popular Waiting time over 15 minutes without reservation  Stuffed Pizza very good but completely different from any type of Italian Pizza.

title: Delicious!
review: This was the first time that I had pizza in Chicago and many of my friends recommended Giordano's. We had deep dish late one night and we both loved it. Our server was really nice and multiple staff members stopped to check in on us....More

title: Decent but not great
review: This was my first time having Chicago style pizza. It was tasty but give me NY style any day. All our food was OK but nothing I would go out of my way for.

title: Great food, sad service
review: We came in as a party of six....we really liked the pizza, but one of the cooks from the back refilled our drinks twice since our waiter was busy? Sad service for such a yummy place.

title: Decent place to get some grub...
review: If you're looking for a no frills dining joint, this place is a constant restaurant to go to. The location is pretty central, close to some Chicago sites, the food was average, the price was reasonable and the service was good.

title: overpriced and not the best in town IMO
review: I'm NOT a deep-dish girl, so I'm not the one to ask about that... but some very well-versed "eaters" in our group ;) said they like Lou Malnati's more than the deep dish at Giordano's. The chicken Parm, which I am VERY well-versed in, was...More

title: Best fried mozzarella!
review: Had a great experience at Giordano's. The wait for a table was about thirty minutes, but we loved that we could order in advance and that it would be brought to our table when it was ready. We also indulged in some deep-friend mozzarella - I cannot recommend that enough! It was delicious, perfectly crisp on the outside and the mozzarella was so fresh. The pizza, while small, was so incredibly filling. I think we each only ate a piece, and even then the walk back to our car felt incredibly long with such heavy stomachs.

title: Good stuff
review: Looking for good food? Well you found it! You can order ahead so when you get you seat you do not have to wait that long to eat.

title: best pizza!
review: Their stuffed pizza was absolutely amazing!  It's very filling so a small with 6 pieces was enough for both of us and we still had leftovers!

title: Great experience!
review: We went on a Saturday evening around 4p. Approximately an hour wait to be seated. The pizza takes 45 mins or so to cook anyway so we ordered before we sat down. Just hung out at the bar until our table was ready and our food was out 5 mins later. Very delicious pizza and attentive service! Only negative was that one of the bartenders over charged by $4 for every drink. After he left we got a new bartender and he was like "I don't know what he was charging you but that's not the price of your drinks". Good thing the pizza made up for the over charging. Would be back but probably to a different location.

title: Best deep dish pizza ever
review: Heard good things and a 45 minute wait but Chicago classic deep dish was on point. Perfect flavor! Other food good too but pizza was calling our name.

title: Best Chicago pizza I've ever had - worth the wait
review: Wasn't sure we wanted to wait but wow was it amazing. Eating a slice was like having an entire meal. The fries were great while waiting 40 min for the pizza, and we can't wait to go back to Chicago to have some. Best pizza of my life. Worth the price. Yum.

title: OMG!
review: Giordano's Chicago style deep-dish is the benchmark. Fresh, flavorful, delicious! There is no good reason to miss this pizza!

title: One of the best Chicago Style Pizzeria
review: Whenever someone visits me in Chicago, they ask me where they can get a good Chicago Style Pizza, and I either recommend Giordano's or Lou Malnati's. I have a sweet spot for Giordano's because it is the place I first experienced my first Chicago Style pizza. But I nowadays prefer to order their thin crust pizza as it's not as heavy and still tastes great. They also offer some decent salad appetizers. It's a chain with multiple restaurants across the city.

title: Best of the three pizza places I tried in Chi-town
review: Great pizza, salad and service.  2 lunch specials including a soft drink, individual pizza (I could only eat half) and a salad for $9.99.  Yahtzee.  Service was spot on during a slow Tuesday lunch.

title: Deep Dish
review: Among the most well known deep dish pizza in Chicago.  Very good pizza at that.  Maybe not the best in Chicago, but a worthy place to try deep dish.

title: Delicious mouth-watering pizza with great service
review: We were recommended to eat here after explaining how we really wanted to try some traditional Chicago deep-dish pizza and we were not let down.Our host suggested we get the small size as we were only two and that we could take off some toppings for half of the pizza if someone didn't like a topping that it came with. We also got a small entree size salad which was actually a decent size and really tasty.The pizza was to die for. Delicious. Filling. Me and my husband barely managed to eat 2 slices each (the pizza came with 6) and we took the 2 slices home for lunch the next day. The servers and cleaning staff were delightful and we will happily return the next time we are in the windy city!

title: Good Chicago Deep dish pizza
review: We ordered a pepperoni deep dish pizza for take out from this location as it was in walking distance during football halftime. Great pizza and service. They made an extra effort to prep parm cheese and red pepper flakes as they were out at the time. Was delicious. The patrons seated for a meal seemed to be enjoying their food.

title: Good first time deep dish
review: Atmosphere was nice, very clean.  Booth, bar or table seating.  Go in the mid afternoon, its slow and the pizza comes out faster than the 45 minutes on the rest of the reviews.

title: Chose your branch
review: Wwe ordered the house special and it was great! I would love to have it again. The wait time, though, is ridiculous! 1 and a half hour for a small pizza! Not good especially since we had a baby with us. We should have chosen a less busy location.

title: Ok
review: Cool to see strands of cheese when you get your slice that is indeed deep but the wait is at least 45 minutes after you're seated.  Thick crust is doughy and sauce relatively plain.

title: Awesome Food!
review: A Must do! Great food! It is not an in and out place if you want a deep dish pizza. Take 45 min to make the pizza, recommend calling ahead before coming.

title: Fantastic Pizza
review: A great resteraunt, the pizza was amazing! Just a few blocks from the art museum. Tip, if you want Deep Dish Pizza, order ahead, because it takes a minimum of 45 minutes!! Great service with atmosphere!

title: One of those Chicago Institutions to Try at Least Once
review: The pizzas here are the prototype for all major, heavy, thick stuffed "Chicago-Style" crust pizzas. You don't want to guess the calorie count on one of these pies. But, if you do love them, you will be in good company. (I like the thin, crispy crust variety...this is the polar opposite of that). The sauce is zesty & they are nicely made. But they are thick, oozing, cheesy, calorie bombs. But when in Chicago...go for it, at least once in your life.

title: Great pizza
review: Giordano's pizza is always good and this visit was no different. I ordered the sausage and cheese pizza and we enjoyed it throughly. It was hard to stop Eating it. I am so glad that it is across the street from my house.

title: Love Giordano's, just not this one...
review: Every time we come to Chicago, we always stop at Giordano's and like other reviews, this time I must admit I was rather disappointed. Although this is the first time that I have eaten at this location, the other three spots (N Rush St , W Van Buren St and a new one in Schaumburg) that I have been to have always been consistent, but this one was not like the others. We always pre-order our food, so we do not have to wait 45-minutes to one-hour for our pizza. This time we ordered about 40 minutes ahead, by the time we arrived, we waited about 30 more minutes, which is unacceptable, seeing that they said they put it in the oven right after we called it in. I ordered sangria, which is a very common drink, although it was good, it was 90% ice and 10% drink. As someone who bartended for seven years, I would never serve this to a customer. I said something, so our server brought a new one, which was much better.The interior and patio on the sidewalk of this place was nice, the people at the front door were friendly as well as other staff members that I encountered. While trying to find this place, we asked a local. After telling her we were going to Giordano's, she said to go to Lou Malnati's Pizzeria instead. After visiting this Giordano's, I will take her advice next time.

title: Pizza Chicago style
review: Great Pizza by the Navy Pier. Huge slices and arguably the best in Chicago. watch them make it while your mouth is watering. Tops.

title: Amazing Food, but Lacking on Service
review: Let me start by saying that I thought our waitress was very good, but the place was woefully understaffed. The hostess had to come over and take our order because the waitress had too many tables to cover and she couldn't get to us. It also took over an hour to get our pizza, but it was worth the wait. We stayed with a traditional thin crust instead of deep dish and it was one of the best pizzas I've ever had. I will go back here, but I'll try to make it not during the busy hours so I don't have to wait as long.

title: Pre-order if you can!
review: Amazing deep dish pizza, the place is great and attention awesome but call ahead and pre-order if you are on a rush, otherwise the traditional deep dish will take about 25min.

title: Great Deep Dish Pizza
review: When in Chicago one of the culinary obligations is to try the famous deep dish pizza and Giordano's  is one of the best choices.   Good food, great service/

title: Chicago Trip
review: We stopped briefly in Chicago and decided to stop and have some pizza.. This place had a cool atmosphere and great pizza. Buyer beware, although the stuffed crust was amazing, it takes 40min to cook.. Enjoy!

title: Good food, long wait
review: Have been to this restaurant years ago and this time again did not disappoint. Food was good. Ordered a salad to share as our appetizer as it takes 45-60 minutes to receive the pizzas. We got there at 11:30AM knowing there would be a line up plus the 1 hour wait time for our pizza. Recommend planning your visit around this. The pizza was good, but I would say this particular location is very touristy as it's right off of Magnificent Mile. Perhaps the wait times (to get in the door) are less at some of the other locations. This is traditional Chicago deep dish, so it's good to try it just for the sake of trying it. Visited a competitor's location on a trip to Chicago a couple months ago and preferred their pizza.

title: Chicago Style at its best!
review: We dined outdoors on a beautiful evening. Loved that it was within walking distance to the Hyatt Regency McCormick Place.

title: Fabulous Chicago Experience
review: My colleagues and I dined here in search of the famous Chicago deep dish pizza, and we were not disappointed. We sat at the bar to cut down on the wait time, and our bartender was delightful. Don't get in a hurry while dining here. The magnificent deep dish pizzas take about 45 minutes to prepare. This is a must-eat restaurant in Chicago.

title: Good, little expensive
review: Nice deep pizza. Its a very thick pizza like a lasagna, you taste all the ingredients meticulously. Very expensive, $30 for a medium pizza but its worth it.

title: Very Yummy Itailian, Chicago Style
review: Very Yummy Italian Chicago style! I was by myself so I ordered the meatball sub and fries. It was cooked to perfection! But a word to the wise, if you order a deep dish pizza, be prepared to wait 45 min to an hour. Another patron sitting next to me, ordered at the same time as me and by the time I had left he was just getting his pizza.

title: Deep Dish Delicious
review: About ninety minutes after we gave our name to the hostess we finished a pizza that ranks among the very best. Very enjoyable!

title: Quality ingredients
review: I'm not a huge Chicago style pizza fan, but I went along with a group of friends and was blown away. 5 of us split a house salad and medium Chicago Classic stuffed pizza and it was the perfect amount of food. The flavor of the pizza was amazing, and not greasy at all. The only negative experience was that our service was incredibly slow - and we were there at 5:30pm for dinner, so definitely before the rush!

title: Delicious Deep Dish
review: Stopped with my son after his college orientation at his recommendation. The waitress was friendly and attentive. We went during the late afternoon before the evening dinner crowd, so we were seated immediately, and we didn't have to wait the normal 45 minutes for our pizza to be prepared. The signature deep dish stuffed pizza was very good. I would come here again.

title: Best pizza ever!
review: If you like deep dish pizza, this is the place for you.  The staff was friendly, and the pizza/salad were great.  We met some friends there and had a blast.

title: NOW THAT'S PIZZA
review: Stuffed veggie pizza with added home made meatballs and beer. Life couldn't get any better after a day of touring Chicago on a warm sunny day. Know it does take 45 mins. We arrived on a Sunday about 5:30, sat almost immediately and by 7:00p the place was packed and waiting outside to get in. Service spotty with young disinterested staff but pizza great. Never had a pizza like it and probably won't have it for awhile but worth a splurge. We split a salad as well.

title: Simply heaven...
review: Giordano's stuffed pizza, fried ravioli, salads and pastas are simply the best. This is a first stop when we visit Chicago, pictures I've sent my friends have inspired replies of "torture!" and "how can you do this to me?"...my friends are always jealous when I tell them I'm eating at Giordano's.

title: Great tasting pizza
review: It's a bit of a wait (45 minutes for the fully stuffed pizza) but it's worth it. We all enjoyed our pizza and still and plenty left over. The sauce was flavorful as were the baked in toppings. Their craft beer wasn't too bad either.

title: Eat like a local!
review: Got the scoop about best times to go. Went after 10 pm as we were trying to take in all during the day. The pizza did not disappoint. Stay away from the meatball sandwich at that time. During the day, meatballs okay. Lines can be really long after 2pm.

title: Stuffed Crust Pizza--Go Hungry!
review: this is Not the place to go if you are in hurry and just want a quick slice.Had the Stuffed Crest Super Veggie Pizza.Each pie is made to order, but the Super had everything we wanted (they were out of green peppers--so no need to ask for them to be excluded).

title: Super thick stuffed pizza will fill you up quickly!
review: Thickest Chicago style stuffed pizza you will ever find. If thick is for you, then Giordano's won't disappoint! Takes about 45 minutes to get your stuffed pizza, but it is worth the wait. Nice atmosphere, clean environment. Large stuffed pepperoni pizza with four drinks cost around $40.

title: Came highly recommended
review: No less than 3 people told me that this was a must for Chicago.I went on a Friday night. There were no slices available and a "small" pizza was ~$22. I was warned that the wait time was approximately an hour. It ended up closer to 90 minutes. When the pizza finally came it was very heavy and 2 slices was plenty.I don't regret trying this, but definitely didn't think it was as good as I was expecting.

title: YUM!
review: This by far is the best deep dish pizza I've had, it a tradition my husband and I have everytime we visit Chicago that we eat here on our visit. This pizza is best when fresh, I don't think it reheats very well. We did find out that Lou Manati's pizza does heat up better so we will be eating Giordano's when in town and taking Lou's home... ENJOY!

title: OK...I Don't Get It
review: First...the staff and management could not have been nicer to us. It was very busy and they got us in and out according to our time table.Maybe it's because we couldn't stay the 45 (WHAT????) minutes it says on the menu it takes to cook one of their specialties so we opted for the express lunch of a BEAUTIFUL FRESH salad and a personal deep dish pizza. The pizza was NOT what I was expecting...it had a grossly undercooked base to it so it tasted like I was eating a bowl of uncooked dough. The sauce was really good though. Did I miss the experience by not getting the real thing? Perhaps. ADVICE: leave plenty of time to grab the big one and I bet you'll like the experience better. This was the Giordano's at Navy Pier

title: here for the pizza
review: stopped in for pizza in the windy city.  was not disappointed.  pizza was excellent.  sauce was good.  waitress was wonderful and helped a lot when ordering.  also had bruschetta which was prepared well

title: ¡Best Gluten-free Pizza Ever!
review: From house red, to salads, to Chicago stuffed pizza and, yes, GF pizza--it was all TERRIFIC!  But PLEASE explain to me why all Chicago pizza restaurants mutilate their pizzas!!!!???!!  Pizza should be cut into "pizza slice" shapes, not greasy squares, folks!

title: Chicago Pizza
review: Great atmosphere and one of the best pizzas I have had. The deep dish is a must...warning it does take about 45 minutes for a large deep dish, worth the wait!!!

title: Great Deep Dish Pizza
review: My wife and I dined at Giordano's recently when we visited Chicago. We had read online that they had really good deep dish pizza and that it takes about 30 mins for them to prepare the pie for you. More time to enjoy a few beers right? They have tables out front on the sidewalk and we had planned to sit there but as it turned out, it was a little chilly so we decided to sit inside. We ordered the sampler appetizer along with some brews to enjoy while our pie cooked. The sampler platter was pretty decent. Be careful that you don't order too much of a pie if you go the deep dish route. A small will easily feed two reasonable people. The pizza came to our table right at 30 mins. It was really, really good. I would eat here again... service was good and the food was very good.

title: cheesy
review: We were told to go here for deep dish pizza,so glad we did.the pizza was delicious.we had the stuffed pizza,it was so good,plenty of cheese oozing from the pizza.my husband and ordered the small for 2 people and took some home,we also had the boneless buffalo tenders.the service great,but expect to wait for 45 minutes for the pizza.it is worth it.prices are good .lots of seating but as as we as we were leaving around 7 it was packed and people were waiting to be seated.

title: Great Pizza
review: Usually I can eat a pizza myself, high metabolism, but I couldn't eat more than 2 pieces in a sitting. even their small is about 5 pounds. I had the meat lovers stuffed pizza and it was packed full of meat and cheese.

title: Best pizza ever
review: If I had the option to travel to a place just to select a meal, it would be worth the flight to go get Giordano's pizza.  They have the best pizza ever and you wouldn't regret it!!  Hard to beat!

title: Excellent Chicago Pizza
review: This stop was a must for our daughter to experience a lil bit of Chicago food. Apparently, this location is newer to the Giordano's franchise...our taxi driver wasn't even aware of it, so keep the address handy. The restaurant was new, clean and not too far from the museum campus. Located right on Michigan Ave, the people watching out of the front window was awesome. The menu indicates a 45 minute wait for the deep filled pizza but ours didn't take nearly that long and we filled our tummies with some yummy garlic bread during our wait. The pizza was excellent, we ordered a medium size and had plenty left over. The service was extremely slow but otherwise we'd highly recommend trying this place for some excellent Chicago pizza.

title: Good Pizza Close to McCormick
review: You either like Chicago stuffed pizza or your don't - this is a pan pizza, with the toppings in between pieces of dough, then covered with cheese and sauce. Very thick and filling. This has nothing in common with a thin crust pizza! But - if you like thick pan type pizza's, Giordano's is a good as any. This location is handy if you want to take a (somewhat long) walk from McCormick place or it is a very short cab ride. Large restaurant so wait times are short. The service is at best OK. Large draft beer selection and served very cold.

title: Great Classic Food...a Must for Chicago Travelers
review: The weekend before St. Patrick's Day is probably not the best time to just wander into Chicago for the day, but we did. We ran across this Giordano's on our way out of town. We planned to go to the one up by the "Bean" but it was much too crowded with a long wait. The service was so-so, but the food was definitely worth it and the table we had by the front window was awesome. We were able to watch all of the party-goers stumbling back from the festivities up by the river. It was entertaining! Deep dish pizza, Greek salad and a happy family = great experience!

title: Best Chicago pizza - take it home!
review: I love Chicago-style, deep dish pizza, and Giordano's stuffed pizza is the best! For anyone leaving Chicago from the north side of town, travel south on Lakeshore Dr instead of using the I-90/I-94 highway. The view is beautiful driving between the city and the shoreline. Exit at Roosevelt to get to Giordano's Michigan Ave restaurant. It is in a perfect location to grab a take-out pizza as you leave Chicago. Call 45 minutes ahead so you won't have to wait. It is super easy to get out to I-90/I-94 from there. You'll be so glad to have that pizza for dinner the next night!

title: Chicago style pizza
review: Bet sure to get the stuffed crust pizza- go all in. Life is short! Only downside was time it took to get the pizza- suggest ordering right when you get there while waiting for a table- then when they seat you there's less time you have to wait!

title: Great food OKAY service
review: The deep dish pizza, garlic parmesan fries, and Caesar salad were all fantastic. The service was okay. The waiter was a little abrasive when asked about dietary accommodations. BUT Giordano's is a must go if you want to experience great pizza! They have a great lunch special where you can get an app/salad, entree, and a drink for $10 bucks!

title: Great service at a busy time
review: This is the place to go for deep dish pizza!  We had a wonderful waitress and even though they were very busy, our pizza came quickly.  It was delicious!  A must when you are in Chicago.

title: Good pizza, great chopped salad!
review: My teen sons and I ate here for a weekend lunch. Go early to avoid a wait!! The pizza itself takes about 45 minutes to make, so I was glad we walked right in. Good food and decent service.

title: Delicious Pizza and Fun Atmosphere
review: You are definitely going to wait for a table here but the waiting was half the fun. The appetizers were great and the pizza was fantastic. Put this place on your Chicago itinerary.

title: It couldn't be more Chicago
review: It's very touristy and a must see if you have out-of-towners.  The brick walls and deep dish pizza are perfect.    The food is great.  I highly recommend the cheesy bread as a starter.

title: Great place to try deep dish
review: Beware it takes about 45 min for your pizza to cook. We barely ate half the one we got because of how big and deep the pizza is. It's more like a lasagna with all the layers and lots of sauce. I saw someone order thin crust which was more like hand toss and it looked great. I gave it a shot and it tasted great, just not a fan if deep dish

title: Dissapointed
review: One of the things to do on our list when we visited Chicago was to try a pizza. None of us cared for all the bread in a deep dish, so we opted for thin crust. It was tough, rather soggy, toppings of cheese and pepperoni could have come from Dominos.

title: Still the Best
review: After many trips to Chicago and taste tests with competitors, I still come back to Giordanno's spinach stuffed pizza. This time, we had it delivered to our hotel room. The delivery was timely and the pizza hot and fresh. Still our favorite! We are three adults and a small with a side salad was plenty.

title: Unbelievable wait time!
review: We ended up having our order delivered so our kids could swim.  It took over 2 hours to get our pizza!  I had to call twice to find out where it was and threaten to cancel our $80 order!

title: Best pizza in the world
review: For centuries people have argued over what is the best pizza in the world is, well Giordano's is the clear winner in my opinion. The pizza is so thick you have no option but to eat it with a fork and knife, the crust is delectable, with toppings galore. Sorry East Coasters, but Giordano's has your thin crust beat hands down.

title: Great pizza and atmosphere
review: I ate here in October 2014. The atmosphere was great as was the food. Starters are large so they may be best shared. I would eat here again.

title: Yuck and a Waste of Time Too
review: Had to go here, of course, since it seems everyone does. To be fair, could just be that we hated Chicago style pizza and maybe Giordano's doesn't make it any better or worse than anyone else there. Or maybe I am too East Coast. I have never seen pizza like this in the NorthEast nor even in Italy and don't have any interest to see it again. Waited almost 2 hours to have the pizza put in front of us. At that point was starving. Don't see the point of putting in the order when you arrive since you don't get it for 2 hours anyway. Drinks had hardly any ice in them and the lemonade was clearly powdered crap. Just what you want on a 90 degree day, yum- warm powdered lemonade. Service was terrible; waitress was surly but not in a fun cute way like diner waitresses. Don't waste your time. Go to NYC and get "real" pizza.

title: worth the wait!
review: of course, I am a pizza lover and wanted to try deep dish while in Chicago. while walking the magnificient mile, we found this one, it was 2:30pm and we decided that it would be the perfect time as it wasnt lunch or dinner time. Well, when you enter, there is a 45 minute wait and you have to place your pizza order in right away. I ordered a small sausage pizza. after 45 minutes minutes, we did not receive a text or call as promised that our table was ready but when we saw those after us get a seat, we checked and they seated us right away. From the time seated, another HOUR before we got our pizza. it was delicious and small for us, was still alot for 2 people. The server was very friendly and we did not have to wait long to get our bill, pay up and be on our way. Upon departure, once again, many people waiting for a seat. It was an experience that was worth it. the pizza was crispy on the outside, it had alot of stuff including cheese, but it was not overwhelming and of course, the tomato sauce was on top and delish...I would highly recommend the experience to all pizza lovers.

title: Great pizza and beer!
review: This Giordano's like the rest I've tried didn't let us down. Pizza was fabulous! We got the deep dish, (is there any other way in Chicago) Chicago Classic and what a great choice. I would describe it much like lasagna with crispy thick crust. I had the chopped salad which was great although it says the dressing is honey mustard, it didn't taste like it. It was good whatever it was and the salad helped with the 45 minute wait it takes to cook a deep dish. You just have to deal with the wait because it can't be helped and it is worth it!Beer selection is very good with beers from all over the US including my home state of Louisiana. The atmosphere was ok, not as good as some of the other Giordano's but maybe it because the Bears had just lost to the Bills and everyone was a little subdued. Check the place out, you won't regret it!

title: Very Good Chicago Pizza
review: Went to the relatively new Giordano's on Michigan Avenue. We were lucky enough to find seats at the bar or it would have been a 45 minute wait for a table. One bit of advice, be prepared to wait 45 minutes for your pizza to arrive after you place your order. It takes that long to cook it properly. Order an appetizer or a few beers while waiting. The pizza was pretty good, not NY pizza but good. Definitely recommended.

title: Pizza to die for
review: Super service and just fantastic pizza. We got 2 small deep pan between 3 of us. Too much. Don't be tempted to giant sizes. I so wish I had a bigger appetite.

title: Best pizza in Chicago
review: Good classic 'stuffed pizza'.  Long wait at peak times, but can put name and list and shop while waiting at nearby Michigan Ave.  more variety than Lou Malnati's.

title: Really great stuffed pizza.
review: This was the first place we went to eat. Open late on a weekday, my family was hungry after a late flight. Food was awesome. We went back the last night before we went home. Staff was great, food was awesome. The second night we ate outside, it was busy but the staff handled it well. Great place to eat.

title: Big pizza
review: It is not a real pizza but it is The Best that i ever had in the USA. The only weak Point is the waiting time, up to 40 minute, but this issue worth for me

title: New Giordano's Location with Sadly Inattentive Owner
review: I've avoided the Giordano's chain in Chicago since their bankruptcy a few years ago. The restaurants had declined in quality and service, and with so much to choose from . . .We decided to give the new location in our neighborhood a try over the weekend. The owners did a spectacular job building this new restaurant in an older historic building on South Michigan Avenue. Sadly, they've apparently forgotten the food.Who ever heard of an Italian restaurant running out of meatballs? Well that's what they told us when we tried to order, and this caused two in my party to quickly scramble to find something else. Instead of the four-cheese ravioli, I picked the veal parmigiana. This turned out to be a mistake. The veal was pedestrian, and it was plopped on a bowl of lukewarm spaghetti. No "real" parmesan cheese was available and I was stuck with grocery store ground cheese.Others in the party were equally dissatisfied with their meals. The sauce had all the makings of quality dishes, but they failed to deliver. Asked for a manager when we were leaving but were told none was available. Meh.

title: Ugh! Cold, soggy pizza
review: We ordered a deep dish pizza for take out and the pizza was soggy, cold and gross. I have a feeling it had been sitting for quite a while before we picked it up. There's a huge difference between takeout and eating in so maybe we would have enjoyed it more if we had eaten on premises? Not sure. The pizza sauce was way too sweet.

title: Flavorful!!
review: Their pizza is excellent!! The way they bring it to you makes it easy to serve. Slices are square, not triangles. Lots of flavor, crispy. Price is decent for the area.

title: Delicious
review: We tried the deep dish stuffed pizza and hot wings. The pizza looked very different compared to the style I usually see but the taste was awesome and the wings were some of the best wings I’ve ever tasted. Great spot to dine and we had a nice view as well! 5 stars wings 4 stars pizza 5 stars service

title: Great takeout!
review: I can't speak to the service of this restaurant because we got takeout, but we thought the food was very good. The pepperoni pizza had just the perfect amount of spice and sauce. The pizza was cut into squares, so it was perfect for sharing with our crowd. We also got a ceasar salad, which was delicious. If you're looking for a quick, easy and delicious meal, this is a great choice.

title: Poor service
review: Went in on a Friday night but it was fairly quiet. Despite that the waitress was shockingly poor. It took her at least 40 mins to take our food order instead spending most of her time chatting to her mates, we had actually finished our first round of drinks before she came back so had to order another round. Almost walked out without paying......I doubt anyone would have noticed. The food however was great and partly rescued what was rapidly turning in to be a frustrating night. Could have been great!

title: Really good food.
review: I got take out from here twice during my stay in Chicago as it was very easy walking distance from my Grant Park hotel. This pizza, as many have already described, is some of the best thin crust deep dish I’ve ever had. My style is sausage, Canadian bacon, and black olives and it was fantastic both times. A size small pizza can really give you two meals here so if you are not looking to take any home and you are flying solo then go for the mini size. Next time I’m in the city I will be back.

title: Lovely Food
review: We ordered a Calabrese if memory serves right. Delicious. Very unique take on traditional pizza which was new for us. The waiter was new but very attentive and helpful. He recommended this local beer on tap to pair with the calabrese and it was phenomenal. Recommended.

title: Great Pizza
review: Ate here after the Bears game. We were pretty hungry and wanted something easy so we decided on pizza, most of the restaurants were on pretty long waits, we were able to sit on the patio and were served immediately. The thin crust pizza was just the right amount of crunch and seasoning. the sauce was on point as well.

title: very good food
review: They call the Calzone-Pizza "Calabrese". All dishes (Burger, Ravioli, Pizza) was very good.I really can recommend this!

title: Delicious!
review: We picked this place because it had thin, deep dish, and gluten-free.  Nine of us, from aged 57 to 9, four different types of pizza, and it was wonderful! The service was good, and the food was GREAT!  We highly recommend this pizzeria.

title: Great Pizza
review: We eat there twice. First time we went Sunday at noon and eat at the restaurant and then we order to go. Good service, very good pizza and the price is affordable.

title: Absolutely delicious, family owned
review: We had pizza and beer one evening. Thin crust, taco pizza!! Best pizza I have ever had!! Super friendly staff and interesting ambience. You must try this place, they have a large menu and all food made with love. I wish I could remember our servers name. She is a tiny little blonde with a huge smile! Thank you for making us feel so welcome!

title: Skip the deep dish and try this!
review: This pizza is amazing. I think it's the sauce! Went after the Cubbies lost to the Mets (boo) and had a medium Hawaiian pizza and a beer. Took the rest to the hotel for midnight snacks. Totally walkable from Wrigley Field. There's even a Cubs merch store across the street. Seriously, great pizza. My friend ordered a gluten-free pizza and she couldn't say enough great things about it!

title: I couldn't eat it all
review: My wife and I ordered a 18" pizza. I shouldn't, it was too big. It was one of the really nicest pizza's I have had and I am a big pizza eater. I just couldn't eat it all. , and I would like to thank all the staff. They are very friendly and courtyess.

title: Cheesy goodness!
review: We ordered the stuffed pizza with sausage. It was delicious and cheese oozed our everywhere; seriously, there was a fist-sized amount of cheese that leaked out of the pie onto the tray. We ate in the bar and arrived an hour before close. The bartender was exceptionally friendly and attentive; he gave no indication he wanted to rush us out. Our only complaint is the sauce is really sweet. We added jalapeños and red pepper flakes to spice it up. We selected this instead of the other pizza places because it was a block from our hotel. Oh, and we only were able to eat 1.5 of the 8 slices on a medium pie. If you are just a couple, you might be better off ordering a small. The bartender talked us out of a large to a medium but it was still too large.

title: Pizza was good, my son loved the sandwich
review: We shared a large veggie pizza and had a beer and all was good. My son had a sandwich stuffed with meat etc and he's still talking about it. convenient for a snack before/after the museums.

title: Chicago's premier pizza chain
review: My wife and I grew up in Blue Island, one of Chicago's south suburbs, so it figures that we're very familiar with Aurelio's Pizza. Founded in 1959 in Homewood, the chain has grown to include locations throughout the Chicago area, northwest Indiana and Florida, Georgia, Minnesota, even Las Vegas. In 1976, Aurelio's opened the world's largest pizza parlor, a 16,000-square-foot flagship at 18162 Harwood Avenue in Homewood. And, fortunately for city dwellers like us, there is a location at 1212 South Michigan Avenue in the South Loop. Aurelio's signature item is the 18-inch thin crust pizza with Italian sausage, mozzarella cheese and marinara sauce. In a town known for pizza, Aurelio's is as good as it gets. But what we like most about Aurelio's is the extensive menu of pasta, sandwiches and other Italian staples. On our visits to the South Loop or Frankfort or Homewood or Palos Heights locations, we love to sample the Italian beef sandwich or mostaccioli or beef ravioli (my wife's favorite) or meatball sandwich. And how about the deep dish cookie dessert? It's a half-pound chocolate chip cookie baked in a deep dish pizza pan and smothered with vanilla ice cream. Love the calories.

title: PIZZA JUST LIKE CHICAGO MAKES IT
review: I am from Chicago and have had many types of pizzas.  Aurelio's matches all of the best pizza I have ever had in Chicago!

title: Ordered Pizza and it was amazing!
review: I recently visited the city and my brother told me that we HAD to get pizza from Aurelio's. He told me that is was the best pizza he has ever had, and I have to agree with him. We ordered the Chicago deep dish (just cheese) and a large pepperoni-sausage on thin crust. Hands down, this was the best pizza that I have ever had in the city. Aurelios is now on my "must go" list the next time I find myself in Chicago.

title: Not Chicago deep dish, but the best "other" pizza around
review: We used to live in the Twin Cities. There is one Aurelio's there. We frequented it. So, when I saw this one on the map, we headed there immediately. Usually in Chicago, we head to Gino's for deep dish, but this pizza is just amazing. The sauce is what makes it awesome. I also had the Batch 59 beer which was a great amber ale. We'll be back.

title: Where have you been all my life
review: My daughter and I had this place on our summer bucket list of restaurants to checkout. We couldn’t wait for the summer to arrive.This pizza was beyond delicious and our wonder waitress customer service was superb. We have found our new pizza place to order from.

title: THE BEST PIZZA IVE EVER HAD
review: By far the best pizza i've ever had. Recommended by a friend - sadly i'm from the UK  and cannot get anything like this at home. I am actually debating flying back over just to have this pizza again. Service was great, waitress attentive.

title: Kid Friendly Chicago Style Pizza Place
review: We went there with our 16 month Old Grand Son in a stroller. The place had a bar too. We sat on a corner table with enough space to park the stroller close to us. Welcoming and helpful staff. We also noticed large group of school teens coming in with chaperon and this place was big enough to accommodate them in a very orderly manner. We chose large half veggie and half works. Pizza was cheese heavy but still delicious. I would go there again because of cheery staff and being a kid friendly place.

title: It carry’s out well also!
review: My wife has been a fan for decades but it’s 15 miles from our home..... friends picked it up, and after a brief reheat in our oven, it was bubbly hot and Delicious! Chicago pizza aficionados tend to be loyal and here the novelty is the sweet red sauce.....We chose the sausage and cheese pizza and it was loaded with tasty sausage bits, nicely spaced and in virtually each bite. The crust was also evenly hot, no soggy middle area and nearly as good as the edge pieces. The other was plain cheese and also delicious.The salad was pretty standard fare but dressing tasty.Would we return? Absolutely!

title: Chicago in a restaurant
review: Chicago is the friendliest city I have ever been in. Strangers nod to you and say hi, everywhere one goes.Aurelios is a friendly place. One is made to feel very very welcome. It faces stiff competition as Chicago is the Mecca of the Pizza. Aurelios is certainly in the running. Lots of offerings for all tastes in pizza. We spiced ours up and itwas excellent. Good selection of salads. Light on desserts but probably a good thing given the high calories on consumes in the pizzas.However the service is the true winner here. Really very friendly and personal.Will go there again next time I'm in town

title: Friendly atmosphere. Delicious pizza.
review: What a warm welcome and a fantastic meal! We had a hankering for authentic Chicago pizza and this was the place that was recommended to us. It has quite a history and there are plenty of photos on the wall of Aurelio and various notorious people. Loved it. The staff and the manager could not have been more welcoming. The food was excellent and in very generous portions. I would not hesitate to go back.

title: Best Pizza in Town
review: Ok, so I am not from Chicago, but my husband is, and I know everyone feels very strongly about pizza. I grew up Italian, my parents owned an Imported Italian food store with all types of homemade food, and my first husband owned a successful Italian restaurant/pizzeria in Cleveland, Ohio. I bring this all up to say that I know pizza, and Aurelio’s makes the best! My Chicago husband, after all is said and done, and I agree that this is the tastiest, most consistent pizza in the city. Nice restaurant, pretty good service.

title: Best pizza in town
review: Had to wait as it was so busy but it was worth it.  Good and friendly service, very reasonably priced.

title: Named After My Dad. lol.
review: The reason my sister and I came here for lunch is because Aurelio is our dad's name. We wanted to buy him a shirt, so we decided to eat here and afterwards order him a shirt.I'm not much into thin crust pizza, but for thin crust, the pizza was quite good. I had two slices of pepperoni and my sister had two slices of cheese. Both of us were nice and full. Personally, as far as thin slice pizza is concerned, I still prefer Costco Pizza, but Aurelio's was pretty good.

title: So good!
review: The best pizza ever! I absolutely love Aurelio’s! We had the baked ravioli for an app and it was unreal. The pizza is filling and flavourful. I am definitely returning to Aurelio’s the next time we’re in a Chicago!

title: Nice place
review: Giordano’s was too crowded so we went for Aurelio’s. And we didn’t regret. Nice, quiet place. Delicious pizza! Small pizza is really big, more than enough for two of us. Angie was very helpful and kind. We were nervous when we came, but left with a smile, thanks to her.

title: Pizza in Chicago
review: This restaurant was recommended by the front desk at our hotel- of course we were looking for deep dish pizza. When we arrived we were told that their thin crust was the best. I fore went that recommendation ordered a deep dish and my grandmother ordered a thin crust. We were both very happy.

title: Very good.
review: Ordered on a Friday night, quoted an hour and a half. The pizza arrived in forty minutes. Sweet tasty sauce and great crust.

title: Best Pizza we could imagine!
review: We were hoping to eat deep dish pizza in Chicago but didn’t know where to go. A tour guide said Aurelio’s was the best, so we decided to go. Boy, are we glad we did! We had their stuffed pizza as well as thin crust and both were delicious! The stuffed pizza was amazing. It was well worth the cab ride from Navy pier - we are so glad we went. Prices were good ($35 for 3 of us) and good was delicious!

title: Good Pizza
review: Better pizza than expected.  Juicier than your average thin crust, but it works.  Very good service, too.

title: Excellent Food Good Service
review: I went in as I was walking on S Michigan Avenue and exploring options for dinner. I was seated at the bar and was quickly greeted by the server I asked for healthy recommendations and ordered a house salad with grilled chicken It was served promptly and presented nicely The salad and grilled chicken was very fresh and tasty Unfortunately I found the bartender/server to be focused on other duties other than waiting on his single customers who were eating instead of drinking I found the prices to be reasonable

title: good eats and nice place to hang out
review: love the pizza but I do always ask them to go easy on the sauce.  Otherwise it could be a bit sweet for some people.

title: Great pizza.
review: I visited with my 8 and 10 year old.  My kids ordered pizzas, a salad for myself, and an appetizer for bosco sticks. The food was great.  The pizza was great.  Excellent crust. We shared a cookie shot at the end.

title: Amazing sauce
review: We were visiting our son and he said that he goes here all the time for pizza and it is really good. We had the large dinner salad with raspberry vinaigrette and house dressing. Both were very good as I had two servings of salad and tried them both. We did the thin crust pizza with pepperoni and they cut it in squares which I loved. I'm not much of crust eater so I love getting the middle pieces. We sat in the bar and both bar tenders were our servers and they were both great. Can't wait to visit and go again.

title: Great pizza
review: First visit while in Chicago. Selection great. Pizza was mouth watering. Service was excellent. Will definitely visit again.

title: I would go back to Chicago just to taste their spinach Calabrese again
review: Aurelio's was a 2 minute walk from my hotel, and even though it wasn't one of the must try pizza places I'd been told to go to, I decided to try it out, and I'm so happy I did. It is definately in my top 3, if not favorite pizzas I've ever had. That spinach calabrese was amazing. I will definately visit again when in Chicago.

title: Great pizza and service
review: Arrived Saturday night from London, knackered but hungry.  Stumbled across this place and was immediately made to feel welcome. The service was superb, beer cold and pizza tasty.  Couldn’t fault - thank you

title: Love the pizza
review: Love their pizza. Been eating it for over 50 years since their beginning in Homewood. Our server Andrew made it a fun night.

title: Dynamite Thin Crust Pizza
review: Recently, I needed to drive my daughter up and back to Chicago for a conference and we were looking for a good pizza place for a pit stop. Trip Advisor came through big time helping me to find this smaller chain which really knows its stuff. Aurelio’s makes some fantastic pizza and has a nice beer selection too! *Hint if you’re lucky, you can find free parking in a shopping center lot just a couple blocks to the west. ￼

title: Amazing, life changing pizza!
review: Discovered this pizza about seven years ago and it instantly became my favorite Chicago thin crust pizza. The sauce, cheese, crust and toppings are so good. The cheese caramelizes on top and they cut into squares. I think it’s better than any other pizza in the city. Try it!

title: Best pizza we had in the US.
review: Great food and drinks. Fantastic pizza. Good service. Would definitely go there again when in Chicago. Mouth waters just thinking about it......

title: Pasta Party
review: Attended a Pasta Party with a charity prior to the marathon. The pasta was good and the sauce was better. I enjoyed the family style dishes, but wish the wait staff had given us proper utensils to serve.

title: Tasteful!
review: Great pizzas. Thin and crispy. A little bit fatty, but pizzas usually are... staff were great, polite and nice :) we felt welcomed with two small kids.

title: I would eat here again and again
review: Thank you to our Uber driver who recommended Aurelio's. I am not the biggest fan of Chicago deep dish and we needed a break. The thin crust, cut in squares was awesome! Our group of 4 adults loved it. The crust was not to thin, somewhere between thin and regular at other places. The spices built in were great and the services was good. It was slow around 8 on a Monday night, but filled in others that know good pizza. I can only imagine what a great place this would be to watch a game on the weekend. I wish we had an Aurelio's in Texas.

title: Not my slice of pizza
review: being a native new yorker, their pie was too cheesy and sagged in the middle, the crust, bleh. not a fan of the deep dish

title: Great pizza
review: The pizza is so good here. They have a ton of seating inside as well as some outdoor seating. The food is always good, the service is always great.

title: Good food, good service, good sports venue
review: After all these years in Chicago, decided to check out this pizza place. In a town with great pizza places, it is hard to try something new. The food was good, not great, and the service was good. The location at Michigan and Roosevelt is good if you are visiting the museums or going to a concert or Bears game at Soldier Field. Nothing bad to say about this place, just too many better pizza places, in my opinion.

title: Ok food. Bad service.
review: Our family stopped here after going to the Shedd Aquarium. We ordered an appetizer, a gluten free pizza, a large pizza and fettuccine Alfredo. The appetizer was good and came out quickly. The gluten pizza came out next and then 10 minutes later came the fettuccine . This was very good per my daughter. The large pizza came out last, 5 minutes after the fettuccine and we didn't really care for the taste of the sauce. It's a preference thing. The server brought our drinks out soon after we ordered but that was the last time that he thought of that until after we were all done eating. I start with the idea of giving a 20% tip. If you take care of us and our drinks, the tip stays at 20%. We were not taken care of. He came to the table several times and never offered refills. When we did ask for a refill he forgot to bring back a cup and he needed to be reminded once he came back around. All in all, ok food, bad service. We will not return.

title: Get the thin crust!
review: Don't waste your time with anything other than the thin crust italian sausage pizza. Get a big one because it tastes even better cold the next day. I don't know the exact ingredients they put in their tangy sauce, but it is unbelievable! I've been all over the world, and no one makes a sauce like that!

title: Great pizza music and service
review: The restaurant was recommended by friends and lived up to expectations. We caught the redline train from downtown and got off at Roosevelt and it was a shortcut to the restaurant near millennial park. A great place to carbohydrate load for the walk back through the park to downtown.

title: If they had pizza this good in Tampa, I'd need bigger pants.
review: This is hand-tossed thinner (not thin thin) crust pizza with amazing quality toppings and sauce. I though I'd want deep dish in Chicago, but I was wrong. We got the supreme, fried mushrooms, and some local beer, and could not have been happier. Super filling -- you will get all the bang for your buck.

title: Great Pizza!
review: We prefer thin crust pizza, and this was the best we've had! Had their late afternoon special, $10 for a personal pizza with 3 toppings of your choice, soup or salad, and spumoni or cannoli. Loved the crust - crisp enough to pick up without losing the generous toppings of sausage, Canadian bacon and green pepper. The mozzarella was very flavorful and not greasy. The chicken dumpling soup was also excellent. The dinner salad was large, and included a surprising array of ingredients - pimento, cucumber, tomatoes, red pepper, croutons and red onions with a house made italian dressing. The lettuce could have been fresher, however. The chocolate spumoni was delicious, but I would not recommend the cannoli. I'd go back any day!

title: Good, but not as good as deep dish
review: I don't know if there is a more traditional spot, but this location is contemporary. I guess I was expecting something more "old-school". We had the hot wings which were nicely seasoned to be spicy but not too hot. We had an enormous fiesta sausage and pepperoni pizza that was more than we could eat. Four of us including two teenage boys, and we still brought some home. The flavor was unique, but wee bit on the salty side. I'm glad to have had it, but when I am in Chicago, I would prefer deep dish. Still, I recommend you go and taste for yourself.

title: Very tasty!
review: I went to Aurelio's Pizza with my friend and colleague during a science conference. We had a great experience and delicious pizza. The restaurant has a good location in proximity to the Roosevelt train station and the Southern Loop. The home-made pizza sauce was very good and their Chicago style pizza was super tasty! I highly recommend this place!

title: Awesome experience
review: Move over, heavy Chicago deep dish!  This pizza was so full of flavor and little grease.  Worth every calorie.  Service was fantastic.  8 kids, 5 mamas, all seated quickly.  Will definitely go back after our next museum trip.

title: Great Pizza!!
review: Fantastic pizza!!  Amazing cheese bread!  Great atmosphere!  Different than typical Chicago style pizza...thinner crust but we prefer it over the deep dish. Worth trying for sure!!

title: Delicious every slice
