The sangria was very good. In all, good place for quick bites.

title: Exellent!
review: Very nice place, friendly and exellent food. I'll recommend it to all my friends & family, different from the usual Tapas. Will go back again soon!!!

title: Good food
review: Went here for Tapas with a couple of girlfriends. It's in the South Loop so a little out of the way from the action but the restaurant itself is a nice place. We ate outdoors which was nice but was close to the road so that wasn't so great. I've been to all the standard Chicago Tapas places (Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba, Iberico and Emilio's) and this place is way better. The food is solid and the service very good. Would go back.

title: Not bad, slightly confusing
review: This was my first experience with tapas. I found a lot of interesting things on the menu, very few that didn't include seafood. If you're not into seafood, don't bother going here. Also, know that when it says spicy, it really isn't. Also, there was a live music/dancing performance. It was WAY too loud and interfered with our conversation.

title: first visit
review: The food was very good but a bit on the expensive side. Four of us ordered a variety of tapas and the final tab was as much as if we had ordered dinner. The décor is festive and the service was good.

title: Excepcional!
review: Our first visit to Tapas Valencia was outstanding! Margarita, our server, provided a wonderful experience, sharing her knowledge of wine and food. We had the pre-fix menu with wine paring--delicious! I tend to prefer California wines, but was not disappointed with the selections paired with our 4 courses. We will definitely return!

title: Tapas Valencia NEVER Disappoints!!!
review: I've been going to Tapas Valencia for several years now and it is my fave Spanish restaurant! The service is always excellent, the management and staff are so welcoming! The drinks are exceptional - their bar is one of the best in the city, and the food is the highest quality and always seasoned to perfection! And you do not want to miss the live music and Flamenco dancing (see schedule)! I absolutely love this place because I always leave feeling better than I arrived!

title: Bar Menu=Best Menu
review: You must hit up the bar menu!! How can you pass up $3.00 small plates!?!? All you need to do is purchase a glass of wine or cocktail. Each dish on the bar menu is actually cooked to order, so everything is delicious and fresh!

title: Excellent place to celebrate with family.
review: Had a great time here celebrating a birthday. They have prix-fix menu (min 2 ppl) as well as a regular menu. We had 5 ppl, 2 ordered the prix-fix menu ($35 each) and the rest ordered 7 items to share. That's plenty of good for everyone. It was hard to stuff in dessert. Place - nicely decorated with Valencia tiles on the wall - imagine yourself in Parc Guell. Drinks - tried the mango margarita and cava sangria. Have to say I have had better ones else where. Food - excellent. The beef tenderloin were tender, scallops were fresh, crepes were thin and crispy. Very tasty all around. Dessert was good too! Not the usual super sweet type. Bonus - I told the server we were celebrating a birthday and he came out with a ice cream puff with a candle on top!Highly recommended and will return.

title: GREAT TAPAS
review: We went Saturday night, our waitress, Margarita was WONDERFUL. We had 4 course tapas with wine pairings all for $53.00 a person. Margarita explained every dish and wine and was very attentive. We would have never ordered the tapas on this menu but decided to do something different and BOY were we happy.... The food and wine were GREAT. We will go there again when in Chicago.

title: Would not come back
review: I came here with a larger group after a graduation. The service was fine, although our waiter was not particularly concerned about my food allergies, I could register the annoyance on his face when I asked the ingredients in particular items. My allergies are life threatening, you'd think it'd be preferable to go to the kitchen to find out if a dish contains pine nuts then to send a customer to the hospital. He did recover a bit by bringing out a surprise dessert for the graduate in the group.The atmosphere is fun, great for big groups and colorfully decorated. Patio would be great on a warm evening, but could not accommodate a group of our size (9).The real letdown was the food. It just simply was not as good as other tapas restaurants. The portions were also very small, making items difficult to share, which is usually the idea with tapas. The raw salmon dish we ordered was also turning grey and smelled so fishy several members of the group could not eat it. Probably the only dishes I would call good were the skirt steak with mashed potatoes and bacon wrapped dates. Sangria was okay, not the best I have had but fine.

title: Excellent tapas restaurant
review: We like tapas restaurants -- good way to sample many different dishes without running up an unreasonable tab. Tapas Valencia offers a wide range of interesting and quite delicious dishes. The small plates are not so small -- compared with many tapas restaurants, Tapas Valencia offers fairly generous servings. We thoroughly enjoyed the 7 or 8 plates we chose. Wait staff was both attentive and knowledgeable regarding the dishes on offer. Prices were reasonable. The evening we went there was a flamenco show, as well: not memorable but still enjoyable.

title: Excellent variety, presentation and atmosphere
review: We took friends there who'd never eaten Spanish food, and we've been to Spain several times. The menu was a good spread of hot and cold, vegetables and meat, seafood and fish. Our waiter Margerita had good knowledge of the products and was helpful and friendly. Good selection of Spanish wines, but I had their mango margarita with smoked paprika on the rim - and it was so good. Everything we had was superb, but my highest recommendation is for sea scallops over couscous. Or just the Spanish ham and cheese. Or just order a basket of bread and a gallon of alioli!

title: Fabulous Variety of Food - Tapas Style!
review: Girlfriend outing - someplace where you can taste a lot of different things and "share" plates. We decided on Tapas Valencia - for the variety and the location to our hotel.We certainly were not disappointed! The service was great - our waitress was timely without being on top of us. She made some great recommendations - based on how we liked previous plates. And the staff was very good at clearing dirty dishes without intruding on our conversation. The Manager even stopped at the table to check on how we were enjoying our food.We sampled several plates from the Hot and Cold dishes - nothing was disappointing. And each plate was plenty for 2, or 3 people to sample from. We only wished that were could sample more – but we were too full.The location is near McCormick Place, and the inside was a bit industrial – but the colors and paintings made the space look lively. There’s a good size bar – plenty of room for intimate tables as well as larger parties. This place has made our "go to" list of restaurants in the Chicago! We will definitely be back.

title: Best Tapas Ever
review: We went on our son's recommendation. What a delight! The sign said "Valet Parking" and the manager (Jose) came out to park our car! He welcomed us with a big smile. It was in the morning, so some of our group ate their wonderful, creative Spanish omelets. Yummy! I had grilled squid and artichoke hearts. The squid was better than I had in Madrid. The portions were large; the service was fast and friendly. The atmosphere was light and fun. We'll go out of our way to return on our next Chicago trip.

title: Tasty tapas and great service
review: We visited the restaurant years ago, and  we're pleased to say the food is just as good and the service is even better. Ambiance is fun, and they keep the food coming. Didn't have time for dessert, but they had great options.

title: A hidden Gem!
review: I toured the South Loop with a Chicago Greeter last summer. She told me that she loved this restaurant and I've been wanting to try it ever since. Last night I took a friend for her birthday and it was fantastic! I loved everything about it! Friendly service, decor, menu items, peach sangria and the food was outstanding! Everything!! Can't wait to go back!

title: Fun time out
review: What a fun place to eat with fantastic food and great service. Almost went back the next night we liked it so much! They offered a wide variety including basics and new fun things. They handled our allergies and gluten free with ease.

title: Amazingly tasting tapas! (what else?)
review: This place's location may not be glamorous, but it's worth getting to. Their 4 courses (each included 2-3 tapas) prix-fix menu is what we had (2 are needed to order it): a wide array of succulent tapas sure to please all tastes! The waiter warned us: "you won't leave hungry!", and he was right: even though the tapas are by definition small plates, they kept coming and coming, one better than the previous, so it was a feast of flavors. All of them are highly recommended, from the patatas bravas to the lamb with caramelized onions, to the roasted garlic mashed potatoes, to the crispy, tasty tilapia. All fantastic! The Tempranillo by the glass was a perfect match. Only 2 small caveats: 1) the octopus (spicy and yummy) was fridge-cold, so beware of this; 2) one of the 2 included desserts, the cheesecake, was too heavy and compact: best avoided. But overall a great dinner, appropriately priced, in a vibrant atmosphere and with an attentive, friendly service.

title: Not Perfect, But Very Good!
review: The lady and I visited last night for the 5th or 6th time, on a bitterly cold evening. Some dishes are better than others, but the staff are warm, friendly, not at all intrusive, and they try very hard. The Montaditas tapa (pork tenderloin cutlets on small slices of bread with a delicious sauce and carmelized thin-sliced onions, are delicious, it's a struggle not to order two portions of those, it's the best tapa they have. The black bean soup with chorizo is delicious also. The lady finds the paella a bit salty, but I've never had bad paella, tasted great to me.We ordered gambas, shrimps in a lemon/butter/garlic sauce, and were disappointed, too much butter, tiny shrimp and only 6 of them for $9.50. We never complain, but I had to. Even though we ate 4 of the 6 shrimp, the house took the shrimp off the bill and apologized. We weren't spending a fortune, only one glass of wine, total, but the manager earned my respect right then and there.I tried the onion soup tapa, and it was disappointing, it was just onion broth with croutons, and the menu said it had Manchego cheese, but I couldn't find any. No problemo, I'll go back to black bean soup.In short, it's possible, I suppose, to have a meal that isn't terrific, if you're unlucky, but we will return often, we're treated with utmost courtesy, by the hostess, manager, and valet parkers, which only charge a reasonable $6. Our visit is always enjoyable, and by the way, the profiterole dessert tapa is wonderful, and a steal at $5.95. Tapas at the bar on certain days are discounted, a wonderful bargain. This cafe tries hard to please, it's a good place for a casual meal.

title: Excellent food and atmosphere
review: This is a friendly,colorfully decorated spot for tapas on State St. We actually ate here two different times and the first night, the service was impeccable and the food delicious. I ordered Gambo con Expinacas , tiger shrimp atop spinach with white wine and it ws delectable. My friends had Pato Confitado, duck confit with mushrooms nad pipirrana de Buey, skirt steak with bleu cheese and we were all pleased. The seccnd night the food was equally delicious, but the server forgot one of the orders and by the time it came we were ready to leave. Mistakes happen. I would still return.

title: Enjoyed a relaxing evening at south loop neighborhood restaurant
review: If you enjoy tapas, this is the place for you...the staff is very congenial and welcoming...located on south state street, it's a bit off the beaten path from Loop and River North restaurants but an easy cab ride...cost for both food and drinks is moderate and it's fun to try a variety of Spanish dishes without overindulging...the wait staff is pleasant and knowledgeable in answering questions about the menu and portions...a fun, enjoyable, affordable evening...will go back!

title: Tapas Valencia A La Chicago
review: Inviting and brightly decorated, Tapas Valencia has an extensive tapas menu to choose from. The menu is almost too long but if you like options, pick this tapas establishment. The unusual Tostadas de Centollo presented us with toast points topped with Alaskan king crab, avocado and balsamic--what turned out to be a winning mix. The Croquetas de Jamon y Pollo had a delicate texture and a complimentary tomato sauce. The roasted dates wrapped in bacon are a MUST-DO. You cannot go wrong with smoky and sweet. The Patatas Bravas were okay. The baked eggplant with tomato, wild mushrooms and Tetilla cheese with a Madiera wine sauce had an interesting flavor but the texture was slimy and unappealing. Could be a personal thing but all three of us had same assessment.Server was sweet and knew his tapas. Complimentary marinated green olives and bread were nice touches.Flamenco was beginning as we were leaving. A great experience in an interesting neighborhood. Have a go.

title: Perfect girls' night destination
review: First time visit and loved it! Large variety of choices and many were exceptional. Faves were meat and cheese platter and skirt steak. Potato and egg omelet was unique and really good. Everything had appropriate flavor and presentation was beautiful. Bonus of live music and dancer was a surprise. Fun atmosphere. Will come back, undoubtedly.

title: Great
review: Ate there for the first time. Food was great staff very friendly. Nice size portions. Would definitely recommend.

title: Great food, great service, great atmosphere!!
review: We went in with a party of 12. We were seated at the time of our reservation and were taken care of from the time we sat down until we left. Everyone enjoyed the live performance ! We loved the food and the Sangria! We highly recommend this place!

title: Consistently Great!
review: Great food.  Great drinks.  Wonderful, friendly staff.  We have  a weekend home in Chicago and find ourselves going back to Tapas Valencia again, and again.  Without question, a South Loop gem!

title: Ole !!
review: Wonderful ambiance in a hip new part of Chicago thats expanding fast. Great rate for valet too. Food offered a good range of tapas hot and cold and service was quick and with a smile. Plus was the delightful live music they featured. Made the evening extra special. Definitely would return.

title: Decent Spanish tapas, but not the best place in Chicago
review: This near south side restaurant used to be in the western suburb of Bloomingdale several years ago - we liked the food then, but the service was just okay. Wondered if by changing locations things had improved. Atmosphere: We ate outside since the weather was perfect. Road noise was high, but otherwise we had a nice experience. It looked like the inside was decorated nicely - I was surprised they weren't busier on a Sat. night. There aren't many other places around this restaurant, other than condos, so it feels a little isolated. We were told that it's busy with nightlife one block over. Drinks: I had a glass of the red wine sangria, which was good. Food: we ordered goat cheese marinara, spicy potatoes, tiger shrimp with honey sauce, beef empanada, and salmon and cheese rollups. The goat cheese marinara was by far the winner of the bunch, always my favorite. The potatoes were okay, nothing special. I liked the beef empanada, but it was more of a croissant pastry dough rather than the type of dough we're used to. The salmon was good, as was the shrimp. Service: While our waiter was pleasant, we had to ask for him a few times for food, water refills, and our check. They weren't busy at all, so I'm not sure why the service was so slow and inattentive. We had plans after dinner, and since service was slow we had to run out of there to our next destination, which was a bit stressful. Overall, we liked the food, but the service was just too slow for us. Would I go back? Sure, but if given the choice I'd probably pick another tapas place in the city, as there are many.

title: Amazing food!
review: My wife, daughter and myself stumbled on this place. We had never been to a Tapas restaurant. IT WAS AMAZING! It is pricy but the fod is excellent. Staff was great. They gave us some awesome recommendations since we have never eaten there or had Tapas style food. Worth the visit. I will go back.

title: Best Spanish Restaurant in Chicago
review: Very flavorful Spanish food with excellent sangria and wonderful customer service. Large selection of tapas and paellas. This restaurant is as close to true Spanish food as I have ever tried outside of Spain. Have tried pretty much every item on the menu and every single one has been fabulous. One of my favorite places to eat in the city. Highly recommended.

title: Best Tapas in Chicago
review: This is my "go to" place when I have visitor in Chicago. It has a varied menu, excellent wines, and a very pleasant dining room. (There are very nice discounts beverages and Tapas in the afternoons.) We held a wedding rehearsal dinner there and everyone was satisfied with the selection and quantity of food.

title: Fun time out
review: What a fun place to eat with fantastic food and great service. Almost went back the next night we liked it so much! They offered a wide variety including basics and new fun things. They handled our allergies and gluten free with ease.

title: Great
review: Ate there for the first time. Food was great staff very friendly. Nice size portions. Would definitely recommend.

title: Great food, great service, great atmosphere!!
review: We went in with a party of 12. We were seated at the time of our reservation and were taken care of from the time we sat down until we left. Everyone enjoyed the live performance ! We loved the food and the Sangria! We highly recommend this place!

title: Amazing food!
review: My wife, daughter and myself stumbled on this place. We had never been to a Tapas restaurant. IT WAS AMAZING! It is pricy but the fod is excellent. Staff was great. They gave us some awesome recommendations since we have never eaten there or had Tapas style food. Worth the visit. I will go back.

title: Best Spanish Restaurant in Chicago
review: Very flavorful Spanish food with excellent sangria and wonderful customer service. Large selection of tapas and paellas. This restaurant is as close to true Spanish food as I have ever tried outside of Spain. Have tried pretty much every item on the menu and every single one has been fabulous. One of my favorite places to eat in the city. Highly recommended.

title: Best Tapas in Chicago
review: This is my "go to" place when I have visitor in Chicago. It has a varied menu, excellent wines, and a very pleasant dining room. (There are very nice discounts beverages and Tapas in the afternoons.) We held a wedding rehearsal dinner there and everyone was satisfied with the selection and quantity of food.

title: Pricey but tasty fine food, drinks, non-welcoming environment
review: I think the recommendations from the staff were well made. I had tried tapas in a past trip in Seattle. They were well prepared at this establishment. The drinks were ok. The Sangria was slightly bitter. This may have been from the fruit added. The espresso was served tepid where I prefer it warmer. The chocolate dessert was miniature similar to the tapas. My biggest complaint was the limited amount of food for what resulted in a larger than expected check. The service was perfunctory but not cordial unlike others that I have visited.

title: A Better Than Average Experience
review: The lady and I visited Tapas Valencia a few months ago. Everything wasn't perfect, the veggie paella was bland, but some of the tapas were quite good. I phoned last Saturday afternoon and the girl on the telephone was courteous, said that they were booked for the night, but there are quite a few tables in the bar area, and we could always eat at the bar.We took a chance, and were pleased. They have valet parking for $6, a nice touch, and the tables in the bar were plenty big enough. I'm tall with long arms, and didn't feel cramped, moreover, I was pleased to be seated promptly at 7 pm with no reservation.The cafe is noisy, very, and they had live music, but the food was good. The grilled calamari was tasty, not at all rubbery, and the pork loin medallions served with carmelized onions and a delicious sauce, similar to a demi-glace, were delicious. So were the profiteroles we shared for dessert, and none of the tapas we chose were disappointing.This was a nice experience, Tapas Valencia is a nice cafe, it's easy to get out without a burdensome tab, and the service was attentive and courteous. Everything was very satisfactory.

title: Found this place on Open Table at the last minute
review: I'm always worried about getting a reservation easily in a big city like Chicago on a Friday night at the last minute, however this place didn't disappoint. Comfortable place, nice decor, easy walk from the Hilton Chicago where I was staying. The mixed drinks were good and the selection of tapas was extensive. Wish the paella could be made faster than 45 minutes - because of the time I didn't try that. However all of the steak and fish tapas we tried were excellent. There are a lot of tables in this place and it doesn't get too crowded so it is a good option if you are in a last-minute pinch.

title: Have grown to love Tapas Valencia
review: We had a couple negative experiences with Tapas Valencia years ago (charged full price for martini special, inedible lamb dish was not removed from the bill) but we moved to a condo in the same building and have tried them again. We now love the place. Jose the manager is fabulous and makes everyone feel special. We initially over-ordered but now have our favorites and know to order fewer dishes. Some of our favorites are the cheese stuffed peppers with black bean sauce which we order every time; the very generous portion of talapia with artichokes; and the gabriella salad. Their salmon dishes change regularly but are always great. There are drink specials daily such as 1/2 price bottles of wine on Wednesdays. The bar menu is very reasonably priced and is a great way to try new dishes, but you must sit at the bar. Overall excellent food, great staff, lovely setting. Highly recommend!

title: Among Best Spanish Restaurants in Chicago
review: Discovered by chance in 4/14 issue of "Chicago Where" magazine and decided to give it a try. Bet decision ever!! I knew we arrived at the right place when treated to an unsolicited cup of Spanish olives within a minute of sitting at our table. My wife and I were pleasantly surprised by the overall selection, quality/taste of the food and its friendly service. Perfect for a Saturday night date, place accepts reservations and has bar, tables & booths. The Saturday we went it had live (guitar) Spanish music and flamenco dancers. The music was not loud allowing a conversation without shouting. The staff took care of us promptly by removing empty plates as soon as they saw us finish each course of tapas. If you are not familiar with tapas, the best eating experience is the pre-fixed "Taste of Spain" menu: 3 courses of at least 2 different tapas each plus 2 desserts, i.e. a total of 10 tapas for $37 per person (2 people minimum) - come hungry though!!!. You can also choose from regular menu. Not many parking structures in the area but restaurant does offer valet parking. Easy access in/out of I-90/94 nearby. Will definitely come again. Check online at http://tapasvalencia.com/

title: Great tapas menu
review: Great price to try out everything on the tapas menu if you have room. The portions were just right, and my Cilantro Mojito was absolutely amazing. My barmaid, Stephanie, definitely knows how to make a killer mojito!! Must try the potato dish and the egg with smoked salmon dish, superb!! The only complaint would be that you must buy an alcoholic drink to dine off the tapas menu, which was not stated on the menus nor on the website.

title: Excellent Tapa in the South Loop
review: From the Sangria to the desserts, the food here is excellent. The bacon wrapped dates are the best.The service friendly, not rushed. The restaurant is spacious, never feelinig crowded. We went there as part of restaurant week. We did not know at the time that Tapas Valencia was a Meson Sabika restaurant, which in our opinion is one of the best tapas restaurants in the midwest.

title: This was definitely a winner!
review: Love the $5 margaritas, and the friendly wait staff who didn't even mind when I had to plug my dying iphone in. I also love that this restaurant really doesn't have much around it, makes it clear that it is worth going to as well as much-needed in the neighborhood. The food is good too: my favorite (unsurprisingly-- it's always my favorite at tapas places) was the Queso de Cabra. We also tried the Pimientos del Piquillo which were super tasty. I think we also had a rolled-up eggplant sort of thing, but it's hard to remember now... those $5 margaritas hit hard!I appreciate the number of vegetarian items on the menu, and the prices are fair. This was definitely a winner!

title: Nice - Friendly
review: Nice restaurant - friendly staff that greet and serve you - definitely made me feel welcome. I had three tapas which were good - nice selection of some beers as well. Would definitely recommend a visit if your in the area.

title: Family friendly, delicious tapas experience
review: We were a group of 7 with 1 young child and had a great experience at dinner. We put ourselves in the hands of our waiter's recommendations and he brought an array of cold then hot tapas and a medley of desserts. The food was consistently good - a few items were delicious - especially the cold crab and the almond flavored cake. The service was excellent and they handled the presence of the little girl in our party beautifully. We all had a great time!

title: Poor plate presentation POOR tasting tapas
review: Had a business dinner there last night and was embarrassed by my selection of location. The plates were plain white and presentation fell flat, but not as flat as the taste. We ordered the warm goat cheese with tom/roasted pepper and garlic bread and it was if a can of tomato sauce poured right over top with store bought HARD garlic bread.Also, we did not get the veg paella ordered. The manager sent a complimentary desert over as an apology, but still the overall experience was not good. I will not recommend or return.

title: Money I will never get back !
review: We were meetings some friends for cocktails and wanted to grab a quick bite! This was the closest place that we could get 7 30 PM reservations an hour before on saturday night the big Halloween weekend. I suppose that should have been a red flag. We were greeted warmly, the decor is colorful and the staff friendly and attentive. This is where the positives end. We ordered a good mix of Tapas around 6 of them and neither one of the dishes were good. The Patatas Bravas were bland but perhaps the only saving grace ( but its hard not to do potatoes well ). The Beef tenderloin empanadas was Ok but nothing I would ever crave and come back for. The toast tips with seafood was like someone opened a can of tuna and lathered it on top of the bread which was soggy. We got garlic shrimps which were over done chewy and tasteless. I have yet to find a good tapas place in Chicago. We tried Meson sabika which is definitely a better than Tapas Valencia but not by much. The search continues. I will not be back.

title: cool restaurant
review: I went here with friends it's located on State Street in the South Loop. The food was pretty good, the drinks were great, I had the passion margarita delicious. The desert was great too it was an almond pound cake drizzled with caramel and with pears.

title: Great food, fun atmosphere
review: First time here and loved it. We had a reservation and were seated right away. Two of us decided to do the tasting menu and it was absolutely delicious. Particularly liked the toast points with crab and avocado and the scallops with couscous . But the almond cake with pear and caramel was the best non-chocolate dessert I've ever had. Fun place!

title: Great food!
review: Took some clients here for dinner... Wanted a relaxing and fun environment. The good was fantastic! Our favorite was the beef medallions with the sweet potatoes. We also liked the spicy potatoes as well as the garlic shrimp.Definitely ask the waitstaff for recommendations. The desserts were great too... Loved the flourless chocolate cake.I think the restaurant should consider dimmer lighting in the restaurant... Would create a better ambience in the evenings (it was a bit too bright).All in all... Great place!

title: Fantastic Spanish restaurant
review: My family and friends love dining at this wonderful Chicago restaurant. Delicious, creative menu and attentive, professional service makes this the best Spanish restaurant in Chicago. Street parking is free and easy nearby, so for anyone who lives further from the south loop, make this a destination spot and you will absolutely love it.

title: Great for gluten free
review: Great atmosphere and service. There are many options for gluten free. The prices are very reasonable. I love the dates and eggplant with goat cheese.

title: You know it is good when everything is written in Spanish !
review: Nothing like going to an authentic Spanish Tapas restaurant. Don't worry all the wait staff speak English and are wonderful at explaining all the dishes. Our favorites were the Chicken & vegetable casserole (very spicy) beef empada and grilled shrimp in a lemon garlic sauce. Great drinks too! The whole experience was wonderful! :)

title: Great spot for lunch!
review: I had a business lunch...3 people and it was a little noisy but a fun place to share dishes.  The food is excellent and the service was great.

title: Delicious!
review: It's wonderful to find such nice places to eat in the South Loop. Attending a conference at McCormick Place used to mean going to the Loop foMcCormickr dinner. With its option of sidewalk seating, and such delicious food, I now have a nearby dinner choice to recommend.

title: Excellent choice for Tapas in Chicago's south loop
review: We have been to Meson Sabika and decided to try Tapas Valencia after a server at the Pirate's House in Savannah GA, (Brad) guaranteed we would enjoy Valencia more than Meson. Well wewould have to agree...this place is wonderful. As beautiful as Meson Sabika is, Tapas is beautiful in a modern way. We liked the room between tables..such a spacious set up. The service is outstanding. Everyone is very attentive...from the server to the busy service to the manager. We never had to ask..someone was always there to attend to our every need. The food is excellent. There were four in our party, so we decided to sample several cold tapas and then several hot.The cold plates included the garlic potato salad...oh so good, we had to order a second. The chilled shrimp in horseradish tomato sauce, the shrimp were a good size. The beef tenderloin with the mushroom and date was mouth-watering. For hot tapas we had a lobster dish that was to die for, the stuffed mushrooms were tasty, the puffed pastry with beef tenderloin will be a repeat dish and the scallops were tender. We had dessert, we had the banana in caramel sauce with chopped pistachio nuts served with ice cream, we had the flan, and we had the bitter sweet chocolate tart..All the desserts were good. We did have drinks before dinner, we had mojitos and Absolut on the rocks...Imagine our surprise when we received our check the drinks were only $5..a special. What a deal. For $6 they have valet parking. For sure we will be returning to Tapas Valencia real soon.

title: Meson Sabika in Chicago's South Loop area
review: This South Loop restaurant has a more modern, brightly-colored atmosphere than Meson Sabika in Naperville although they share the same owners. This was our first visit to any place south of Roosevelt Street and luckily they had valet parking since we did not know the area. Service by a really sweet waitress was attentive but not overwhelming. The 5 tapas and 2 desserts that we ate were all tasty and not that expensive - the total bill with drinks and tip came to less than $75.

title: Wed. 1/2 Price Wine
review: Had a great dinner and half price on bottle of wine on Wed. Loved the wine selection. The portions were just the right size.

title: Wonderful!
review: My friends & I visited Chicago for spring break, and we were looking for some place different to eat. We found this restaurant listed on Trip Advisor, & we loved it! If we are ever in Chicago again, we will be back. The food was great, perfect atmosphere, good prices & friendly staff. I highly recommend it!

title: Wonderful tapas
review: Our first visit and we were very pleased! We had the 4 course intro menu that included deserts..we included the sine flight specifically paired to the fantastic menu. It was great!

title: Great tapas without pretensiousness
review: This has become our default dining out restaurant; partly because it's within walking distance, partly because it's a good value, but mostly because the food is great!Some tapas restaurants are intimidating; the dish names don't always convey what you get and their "specials" often disappoint. Not Tapas Valencia! The menu is large, but organized so you can get things you like, such as beef empanadas, and explore things you haven't tried. Portions are oddly perfect. We especially like the paella valencia. And all dishes with Serrano ham, of course. The black bean soup is great! Nice Spanish wines by the glass. Not having been to Spain, I'm supposing Tapas Valencia isn't "authentic" but so what? It looks like a duck, quacks like a duck, and most importantly, tastes like a duck (yes, they have a duck confit tapas).Desserts aren't overwhelming, but again, so what? I'm biased; don't like chocolate. They've got a great Plátano con Helado (sauteed banana). If you like chocolate, maybe try some of Tapas Valencia's...It seems they're actually getting better, if possible, every time we dine there.

title: Excellent Tapas in South Loop!
review: Been to this place twice! Excellent food! Competitive prices! Great atmosphere! Valet parking available, but street parking also available.

title: Fun, great service, good food
review: Michael, our server, was awesome through dinner, quick to refill cocktails, recommend tapas. D even charged my low battery phone. We will be back for more fun tapas.

title: Tapas in Chicago
review: Sunday brunch with friends from out of town turned into a brief visit to Spain. The waiter suggested 5-7 plates for the 4 of us (older adults), which was adequate and not too pricey. The Spanish tortilla was very good, and we enjoyed the greens that accompanied it. We also ordered mussels, olives, artichoke, serrano ham and chorizo. The artichoke was the least of these, the tortilla the best. Service was good, atmosphere very European. The room would probably get very loud with more people in it.

title: Nice atmosphere
review: Enjoyed the atmosphere.  The tapas were good, but not great.  Little pricey for the quality.

title: Fantastic Spanish restaurant
review: My family and friends love dining at this wonderful Chicago restaurant. Delicious, creative menu and attentive, professional service makes this the best Spanish restaurant in Chicago. Street parking is free and easy nearby, so for anyone who lives further from the south loop, make this a destination spot and you will absolutely love it.

title: Great for gluten free
review: Great atmosphere and service. There are many options for gluten free. The prices are very reasonable. I love the dates and eggplant with goat cheese.

review: Nothing like going to an authentic Spanish Tapas restaurant. Don't worry all the wait staff speak English and are wonderful at explaining all the dishes. Our favorites were the Chicken & vegetable casserole (very spicy) beef empada and grilled shrimp in a lemon garlic sauce. Great drinks too! The whole experience was wonderful! :)

title: Great spot for lunch!
review: I had a business lunch...3 people and it was a little noisy but a fun place to share dishes.  The food is excellent and the service was great.

review: It's wonderful to find such nice places to eat in the South Loop. Attending a conference at McCormick Place used to mean going to the Loop foMcCormickr dinner. With its option of sidewalk seating, and such delicious food, I now have a nearby dinner choice to recommend.

title: Wed. 1/2 Price Wine
review: Had a great dinner and half price on bottle of wine on Wed. Loved the wine selection. The portions were just the right size.

review: My friends & I visited Chicago for spring break, and we were looking for some place different to eat. We found this restaurant listed on Trip Advisor, & we loved it! If we are ever in Chicago again, we will be back. The food was great, perfect atmosphere, good prices & friendly staff. I highly recommend it!

review: Our first visit and we were very pleased! We had the 4 course intro menu that included deserts..we included the sine flight specifically paired to the fantastic menu. It was great!

If you like chocolate, maybe try some of Tapas Valencia's...It seems they're actually getting better, if possible, every time we dine there.

title: Excellent Tapas in South Loop!
review: Been to this place twice! Excellent food! Competitive prices! Great atmosphere! Valet parking available, but street parking also available.

title: Fun, great service, good food
review: Michael, our server, was awesome through dinner, quick to refill cocktails, recommend tapas. D even charged my low battery phone. We will be back for more fun tapas.

title: Tapas in Chicago
review: Sunday brunch with friends from out of town turned into a brief visit to Spain. The waiter suggested 5-7 plates for the 4 of us (older adults), which was adequate and not too pricey. The Spanish tortilla was very good, and we enjoyed the greens that accompanied it. We also ordered mussels, olives, artichoke, serrano ham and chorizo. The artichoke was the least of these, the tortilla the best. Service was good, atmosphere very European. The room would probably get very loud with more people in it.

title: Nice atmosphere
review: Enjoyed the atmosphere.  The tapas were good, but not great.  Little pricey for the quality.

title: First Official Tapas Experience
review: We were visiting in Chicago recently & experienced Tapas Valencia. We went on a rainy Sunday and sampled some very tasty dishes! It is amazing how a small amount of tastefully prepared food can satisfy you while pacing yourself and visiting with your party. We were a party of 3 and did not have the opportunity to sample nearly as many things as we would have liked this time. Everything we had was very tasty and fresh! And they offered us some alcoholic drink specials also, but we did not indulge, although they sounded delicious as well! Would definitely recommend this place!

title: Tapas
review: We walked in off the street to this restaurant, and as two women thought Tapas would be great. Be warned, the portions are very large. Our waiter suggested 5 to 6 items for two people. We ordered 5 and it was far more than we could eat. The quality of some plates were excellent, others were not so good. We felt our service to be lacking. Then we noticed that the women next to us were in an argument with their service about a dessert that should have included a scoop of ice cream. The server did not give in until another server came by the table and said that in fact the customers were right. The atmosphere was very pleasant and the selection of plates was good. One should just be cautious about how much to order, perhaps starting small and adding plates as you go.

title: Love this place
review: My wife and I have been here a couple of times and went again last night. The menu hasn't changed a bit but why change what isn't broken? It is great place to go with friends. It is busy, but not too loud and super reasonable. $120 for four people including desserts and a pitcher of sangria is pretty great. I will be back.

title: Another good experience
review: Went back to Tapas Valencia this weekend and left again with a favorable impression. Have been here a few times and I've always walked away satisfied. Parking has never been a problem and waitstaff was excellent. There are some places that may have better tapas in the city but everything our party tried was very good, with some excellent dishes. This place is a reliable, good standby that I will certainly return to.

title: Yum!
review: I especially loved the scallops and couscous. The service is excellent and for the quality, it is very reasonably priced.

title: Awesome Tapas on the South Side
review: We love Meson Sabika in Naperville and were disappointed when we couldn't make a reservation for New Year's Day. But then we discovered that Meson Sabika has a cousin on the south side of Chicago and since we were headed into the city for a show, we decided to check out Tapas Valencia. Raphael was our amazing and incredibly attentive waiter. He suggested we start with Tostados de Centollo and helped us choose a delicious Rioja to accompany our meal. Tapas Valencia's menu has all the wonderful tapas we enjoy at Meson Sabika including our favorite Solomillo con Jamon. We went with several family members and shared a great assortment of cold and hot tapas and topped it all off sharing desserts including our favorite Platano con Helado. Though the food is the same, the atmosphere at Tapas Valencia is very different from Meson Sabika. Tapas Valencia is open and airy with vibrantly colored tile mosaics on the walls - modern and fun. Valet parking is offered but we had no difficulty finding street parking on our own. We highly recommend Tapas Valencia - makes heading to the south side of the city worth it!

title: Love the tapas
review: It's perfect size serving of food for not so hUngry days and their service is always with a smile;  Good variety of wines and cocktails

title: Awesome Experience
review: Very authentic. Quick service and friendly staff.  Good variety in tapas and delicious food in general.

title: Tapas here is always great.
review: I like this restaurant because they have great service, drinks and food.  It worth a try for sure!!

title: Very disappointed...
review: service was terrible. We arrived early when few guests were there and we still managed to leave 40minutes after a few couples that got their 10minutes before us! We felt abondoned... The food was average as far as taste nothing spectacular but after spending over $100 on the Valentines day 3 course special we left still feeling hungry!!!

title: great food,
review: Three of us went after a long day. We were able to sample several different small plates, and we found plenty to choose from, even with a very picky eater. Our waitress was very friendly and helpful. When we wanted a wine suggestion, she grabbed the knowledgable bar tender who was able to suggest a fine Spanish wine that wasn't too expensive. We managed to get a table without a reservation on a Saturday night. We felt lucky that we just happened to drive by and see this place.

title: Delicious
review: Good food, good drinks, great menu, lots of choices, nice atmosphere, good wait staff, nice prices.

title: The $30 fix prixe tapas menu is great!
review: You get six courses including desert. Within walking distance of the Field Museum (15 min) and Art Institute (20 minutes). Service very good. Wine reasonably priced.  Decor very attractive.

title: Zagat rated best Spanish tapas in the midwest. Excellent in every way.
review: If you live in Chicagoland and haven't been here, it's worth the easy drive just south of downtown on State Street. Tapas Valencia is the snazzy urban cousin of Naperville's Meson Sabika. Same owner, same amazing food. The atmosphere is full of energy. Contemporary decor - beautiful mosaic tile walls, high ceiling and open floor plan. The service is everything you'd expect from Meson Sabika, professional, attentive, knowledgeable, just in an urban-chic setting. Jose, the manager, is an expert on Spanish wine as well as food pairings, and he just might be the nicest, most generous restaurant manager in Chicago on top of it! He aims to please at every level and it's clear his staff is trained in the same way. This is a fun place, a happy night out, and I'd be amazed if you weren't blown away by some of the gourmet -yet affordable- tapas that come out of their kitchen. We love it and will go again and again.

title: Excellent Food and Service
review: Friends and I went out for dinner on a very busy Saturday night. We were fortunate enough to get a table as the place was very busy.We sampled approximately 8 different dishes including the fillet mignon marinated in olive oil and ground peppercorns, the brochette of chicken tenderloin, marinated artichoke, stuffed peppers with black bean sauce, grilled pork medallions, and brochette of beef tenderloin. We shared the puffed pastry with ice cream and chocolate sauce for dessert. Terri was our server and she was attentive and had a delightful personality. When asked about several items due to allergies of members of our group, she checked with the chef to make sure there would be no allergic reaction to specific dishes.The only area that we would like better addressed is the noise level. The entire decor is a non-carpeted floor and wood room dividers with an open ceiling. It made it so that at times we had to repeat ourselves as the noise level made it difficult to hear each other.It was an overall excellent experience with delicious food.

title: 5 stars
review: We visited the Shedd Aquarium in the morning and was looking for a lunch spot before hitting the Field museum. This hot dog stand is conveniently located right outside the Field museum. They claim they have the best hot dogs in Chicago. And I don't doubt them. Price is also very reasonable considering there is very little food options around (the cafes inside the museum were all closed due to covid). If you're visiting either the aquarium or the museum, definitely stop by here and decide for yourself if this place has the best hot dogs in Chicago.

title: Worth the Wait
review: Yummy authentic Chicago dogs at a good price!  Worth the wait!  They also have vegetarian and turkey dogs.

title: Great Hot Dogs
review: Excellent hot dogs at a friendly hot dog stand. Definitely recommend if you are in the area. The Chicago Dog I had was excellent

title: Music!
review: I was so hungry, then I found this! It tasted so good! All of the toppings worked in a musical unison of tasty perfection. Please try this place out. It’s by many great things to do, and they are excellent!

title: Great place for a quick bite
review: Perfect hot dog. This is a simple place, just a little cart. We were going to the aquarium from the Field museum and needed some lunch. $8.50 got you a hot dog, chips, and a drink. The hot dog was on a steamed poppy seed bun and it was great. The menu says you have to dance if you want ketchup, but I was given ketchup with no issues at all. Ha!

title: Just a hotdog
review: Convenient location when you’re riding or walking along the lake or at the museum but the hotdogs were mediocre.

title: DELICIOUS AND DELIGHTFUL!
review: While taking a walk along the lake shore, I came across this little kiosk and decided to try a Chicago style hot dog. My trips to Chicago usually include a trip to Portillo’s, but I have to say this hotdog was every bit as good. Thanks

title: Cart outside Shedd Aquarium
review: Good and quick bit to eat before going into the aquarium. $8/9 gets you a hotdog, chips and a soda.  There were alot of bees around there so that was annoying but the food was amazing

title: Great dogs
review: Wife and I ordered a dog and drinks. The ladies working were very friendly with us. We just got the regular chicago dogs and enjoyed. Definitely worth the stop to get one from here while in the museum area.

title: Great Chicago Dog
review: The warm bun and toppings are excellent. Price is right. The only con would be the size of the hot dog/weiner itself. It was very thin. I am not sure if this is the traditional way to eat them or not. Great location!

title: Try the Chicago Dog
review: It was good. Not much more to say. Gotta be 100 characters . . . um . . . the service was fast and the cart was clean. 140 characters. Nice.

title: Chicago Dog...Gotta Do It!
review: This was a mid tour pit stop location while on our Segway tour. A great way to take a break and experience something truly a part of the Chicago culture!  We went for the gusto and let them put everything on it. What a delight!...More

title: It’s all in the toppings
review: Dog is standard, but the combination of the warm soft bun with the spicy toppings makes the difference. One is not enough to satisfy a hungry person

title: Excellent Hot Dogs
review: One of the things Chicago is known for is hot dogs.  I wanted to try one but being a vegetarian I suspected my chances were slim.  That was until my wife and I happened upon Kim and Carlo's hot dog stand and their vegetarian hot...More

title: Best hot dog ever!
review: We had just finished walking around the field museum and were hungry. Wasn't sure about a "Chicago" hot dog but is was amazing. The people running the stand were super nice too! We still talk about the best hot dog we've had

title: Even vegetarians can enjoy a Chicago style dog
review: We stopped here for a quick bite between attractions. The cart was a very short distance from the entrance of Shedd aquarium. Service was a little slow, but the food was really good. My boyfriend had a Chicago style hot dog. I wasn't planning on...More

title: Convenient and a taste of Chicago.
review: We had our first Chicago Dog at this hot dog cart. It was fresh, and had great quality ingredients. It had a decent price point for what it was.

title: In between museums
review: Head for a snack in between the aquarium and the field museum. Hot dogs, including veggie vegetarian hot dog which was good. Chips and pop also available. No where to sit, stand and eat.

title: Quick bite
review: On our weekend to Chicago the Mr wanted a Chicago style hot dog... and this was his pick. Little bit of a line as it’s a outdoor stand but it certainly met his expectations. P.s. they make you dance for ketchup 😆

title: Quick bite on the run.
review: This is a small hot-dog stand located outside of the field museums west exit. I went here in search of a delicious vegetarian hot-dog...  So the veggie dog isn’t very good. Polish dog was excellent as well as the all beef Chicago style dog. Potato...More

title: My first Chicago style hot dog
review: After visiting the nearby museum, my husband and I came here for a quick lunch. I had the Chicago style hot dog with everything on it, but onions and peppers. My husband had the same, except on a veggie dog and onions added to it. I typically only put ketchup and mustard on my dogs (putting ketchup on it is a crime in Chicago), so it was interesting to have different flavors on my hot dog than what I'm used to. It was a good hot dog that tasted more like the ingredients that flavored it than the actual hot dog. The price was a bit high, but it was a good lunch.

title: Best Vegetarian Hot Dog Ever
review: I came to Kim and Carlo's on a warm September weekday lunchtime for a vegetarian hot dog which was recommended. The hot dog was the best I've had and was a good price. If you're vegetarian this place is a must visit in Chicago, however avoid buying the drinks as they are very expensive.

title: Excellent must eat
review: Great Chicago style dogs. Fries were crisp. Not greasy. Excellent experience. Will definitely eat here again.

title: Chicago-style hot dogs with a view
review: My wife and I were strolling around the Museum Campus, going from the Adler Planetarium to the Shedd Aquarium to the Field Museum to Grant Park when...would you believe it?...we walked into Kim & Carlo's Hot Dog Stand. Located at 499 East McFetridge Drive or 1400 South Lake Shore Drive, whichever address you care to choose, between McFedridge and Waldron, between the Shedd Aquarium and the Field Museum, only 1/2 block from Soldier Field, Kim & Carlo's is a family-owned business that corners the hot dog market in this neighborhood. They only offer two dogs, Chicago-style and Polish, and they do an awfully good job of it. The Chicago-style hot dog with a Vienna Beef hot dog, soft poppy seed bun, mustard, onions, tomato, hot peppers, pickle, relish and celery salt is a classic. Sit down and eat a couple with a backdrop of Grant Park, Lake Michigan and the Chicago skyline on a hot summer day and you feel you've just won the Mega Millions. Are they tuning up for the Bears' games?

title: ChiTownDawgDoneGood
review: Delicious. Need we eat more? Good variety and value...best and only hotdog of this day!! Do it dawg.

title: Great Chicago Dog
review: After walking around Field Museum decided to grab a dog on way to car.  Glad we did.  Great, speedy service.  Great Chicago dog.  Will remember for future visits.

title: Chicago Dog Cart
review: The only place to eat around the museums that isn't inside the museum. Besides, you gotta get a Chicago dog while in Chicago!

title: After Museum hot dogs
review: I read about Kim and Carlos tofu dogs before we arrived in Chicago. After a long day touring the Field Museum, my son had a regular Chicago dog and I had a Chicago tofu dog, and they were delicious! So nice to not get left out on the Chicago dog experience, just because I don't eat meat! Thanks to Kim who was so nice, we love Chicago!

title: Yum!
review: Searched for a vegan Chicago dog, this place had great reviews. Walked a long way for it and was not disappointed! The meat eaters in my family loved theirs too! We sat on the grass & ate then ordered a second round! So delicious, a great authentic Chicago dog lunch!

title: Good dogs!
review: Stopped for a bite after a long museum visit.  Had our first Chicago-style hot dog, so I can't really compare, but we enjoyed them.  Didn't hear any complaints from our young kids about the ketchup-only dogs either.

title: Yummy dogs !!
review: Needed something to hold of for a while, they were parked outside the field museum. Yummy hotdogs Chicago style with everything!!

title: Did in a pinch
review: Just outside of the Field Museum is an oasis- a food cart that sells Chicago style hotdogs, chips, assorted ice cream drinks and canned sodas/bottled water. They advertise Vienna style dogs. Well...it just clicked- a Vienna style dog is smaller. Not like a Vienna sausage, but smaller than the dogs we had at Max's. They were good, we all devoured them, but the bun did not feel so challenged with the smaller dog. It beat the offerings of the field museum, which are expensive and run of the mill. The service was swift and friendly! I would go back for sure!!

title: Chicago style dogs
review: Cheap good food outside the Field Museum. We got four Chicago style dogs (two without hot peppers), two chips, and two sodas. Perfect lunch for our family of four. The best part was that was a great hot dog. We really enjoyed it!

title: An extra stop on the Museum Campus Chicago!
review: So you are visiting the Field Museum or the Shedd Aquarium, and you have heard about, but never tried, a Chicago Style Hot Dog! Well, make a stop outside at Kim and Carlo's!! They offer the freshest ingredients, and Vienna Beef Dogs, of all varieties. Including Vegetarian, Turkey, and Polish! Whatever your taste! This is your chance to find out for yourself, why Chicago is known for these unique delights!  Two locations available, with amazing views of Chicago's Skyline for the tastiest dogs, Kim and Carlo's is the best around! A must have!

title: Bucket list food
review: Everyone says you have to have a Chicago hot dog while here. So, we tried Kim and Carlo's. It was a great hot dog and we found ourselves wanting another one.

title: Read the sign if Asking for Ketchup
review: Great crew at this hot dog stand we discovered while waiting for the hop on-hop off bus, just outside the Field Museum. I am Canadian and like nothing but ketchup on my dog...and that’s how I ordered it. Lol the young lady asked me to reread the sign and I realized it said Must dance for Ketchup. Believe me they enforce the rule

title: Chicago Dogs!
review: Just outside the She'd Aquarium is a great hotdog stand called Kim and Carlo's. Get the Chicago Dogs with everything. They're great! Perfect for a quick bite after wandering through the aquarium.

title: Fun bucket list stop
review: We stopped at this stand located between the Field Museum and Shedd’s Aquarium after reading about it. It’s a fun stop after a long day of seeing the sights and a nice option from overpriced museum food. My son wanted to experience a true Chicago-style hot dog on his visit. This stand did not disappoint! Loaded polish sausage (recommended by the server) was a hit with the boys. Lots of sunny places to sit and enjoy the sunshine and view while you eat. Two drinks and 3 hot dogs were $18. I’ve seen other reviews where people complain of price, but I felt it was reasonable for the area and experience.

title: Arguably the best Chicago hot dog in town
review: I went to this place based on a tour guides recommendation and i must say I was not disappointed. Eating a Chicago hot dog, in Chicago was one of the things on my to-do list and I ended up having 2

title: Not bad, but very pricey for what it is
review: It is right outside of the museum, so very convenient.  The hot dog and sausage is not too salty , which is unusual but good.  The price though, is pretty steep for a dog, with  a drink, its about $10 per person.

title: Nice to have outside the museum
review: You can have an authentic hot dog after visiting to aquarium. That's great for visitors who is tired and hungry. Its price is fair.

title: Best Hot Dog I've Ever Had
review: My wife and I grabbed a hot dog at Kim and Carlo's stand after leaving the Shedd Aquarium. It was recommended that we do not miss. It was great advice.We ordered the big hot dog fully loaded. Don't get the small one ... you will be hungry later. The Vienna Beef Chicago Style hot dog is a meal.The peppers and pickle were excellent. I would have eaten two if I had not been full from the first one.There are plenty of places to sit near the stand. Well worth waiting to eat here.

title: Best Authentic Chicago Dog
review: Go walk around the museum district when in Chicago and as you do, make sure you stop and get a Chicago dog here. Personally I think they're high for the full meal deal, i.e. chips, but get a Chicago dog and a drink, sit on a park bench and enjoy.

title: Great experience
review: I have heard a lot about this food cart and was happy it was so easy to find!  Would definitely make a trip to have another!

title: Great Chicago Dogs, friendly service
review: We visited the location near the Field Museum and had a very good lunch. The basic dogs were good quality, hot, etc. The Chicago dog was exactly right. The staff were efficient without rushing us. The range of soda and chip choices might not be like your local supermarket, but they covered our opinionated crew just fine. Their "dining room" was hard to beat: a grassy slope on a gently warm summer day.

title: First Chicago dog
review: First there are 2 locations, we stopped at the stand by the museum. We ordered 2 Chicago dogs, chips, and a drink. For the first experience and with nothing to compare it to the 'dog' was ok. I did have higher hopes going in based on the reviews but maybe a hot dog with everything but the kitchen sink is not my thing. I'll give it another go just not here.

title: Tasty but didn't live up to expectations
review: I had the polish dog with ketchup, mustard, pickles and celery salt. I prefer grilled hot dogs but it was still nice to have the novelty of a street vendor. I don't care for the toppings of the Chicago dog so that's why I went with my own.

title: Ok Hotdog
review: Nice and friendly service from a hotdog stand in front of the aquarium.  I had the loaded hotdog -- it was ok but the dog was. it too flavorful. Two hotdogs and one water = $11

title: A must
review: Visiting Chicago for the first time? Part of the experience is a Chicago-style hotdog. Comes w/sport peppers, onions, relish, tomato & pickle spear. Tasty. Price was reasonable to a little high. Hotdog was a bit chewy. Service was quick.

title: Chicago dogs
review: This stand is right outside the Field Museum and super convenient to grab a bite after your visit. The hot dogs are delicious albeit a little pricey when you add chips and a drink.

title: Vegetarian Hot Dogs
review: There is truly something for everyone at this cart. As a vegetarian I always envied my husband partaking in Chicago Dogs, but because of this cart I could finally partake. I'm beyond grateful and had about 4 dogs in 2 days. I found them to be that good.

title: Good Chicago-style Hot Dogs
review: After a great day at the Field Museum, naturally I was pretty hungry. Sure I could have eaten at the cafe inside, but I luckily found something even better outside: Kim and Carlo's stand. If you're looking at the Field Museum steps (the McFretridge Drive entrance), it's down on the left side of the building outside. Prices are reasonable, and the hot dogs themselves taste great. It was my first time trying a Chicago-style hot dog, and I must say it was good first impression. Just a solid food option after a day at the Field Museum or Shedd Aquarium!

title: It was ok!
review: We thought they were the best since they were suggested by the tour bus people.  They were a but expensive as well. $8 soda can and chips.

title: Great lunch cart to enjoy a Chicago dog
review: Great lunch cart to enjoy a Chicago dog. Two carts on the museum campus. Love their Chicago dogs....

title: Delicious Chicago style hot dogs
review: Before traveling to Chicago last weekend, I got on this site and looked for a good place to get a Chicago dog. I saw that this place was near The Field Museum, so we ate here after visiting the museum. It was delicious and reasonably priced. I would definitely recommend eating here!!!

title: My First Taste of a "Chicago Dog Lite"
review: This is the first time I've put more than ketchup on a hot dog. I know, I know... according to Kim & Carlo's, it doesn't even belong there. :) It was excellent!

title: Chicago Hot Dogs
review: Had to give it a try.  Was hot but not so plump.  Had to keep pickle in roll while adding mustard.  Difficult to find soda instead of water.

title: Get the polish sausage with all the fixings
review: I've tried both the Chicago style hot dog and the polish sausage. I prefer the polish sausage. It's larger and in my opinion a bit tastier as well. Get the polish sausage with all the toppings for the Chicago dog. It's a bit messy but well worth it. The hot peppers and the onions with the mustard help to substantially enhance the flavor and provide some crunch. If you're in the mood for a Chicago style dog fix, this place delivers.

title: Good Chicago hot dog!
review: After spending some time at the Shedd Aquarium, we were ready for a bite to eat. Great location!  My daughter had to dance to get ketchup on her hot dog, lol! If you are in the area, gotta get a Chicago dog!

title: Good Chicago Dog
review: We decided to grab a quick snack before going into the field museum and this dog cart was in the perfect place. We had the Chicago style dogs as well as a polish and were happy with the food. A bit messy but good. You can get just a dog or you can get a combo with chips & a drink so they have several choices in case you're hungry.

title: Best Chicago Dog ever!
review: Must stop at Kim and Carlo's for their Chicago dog! Affordable and so good tasting! The perfect, quick lunch between sites we visited.

title: The reviews are right
review: Like others, we were on our way to the Field Museum and spotted the truck. My wife and I had never had a real Chicago dog, so we tried one, plus a Polish dog. Wow! We got everything - no ketchup, of course. Again, wow! I warn those who are first timers that they can be a little messy, but so worth it.

title: Great Dog Stand in the Park.
review: I work in the park so I could be a little bias to this stand. Every time I get a hot dog for lunch it's from this stand only. They have great dogs, brats, and at good prices. The staff are always super nice.

title: Perfection on a Bun!
review: My husband went to the Field Museum while I was at a conference in the Chicago suburbs. Before he went, he tweeted @thebrainscoop (Emily, the Chief Curiosity Corespondent from the museum) to find out where to get a good lunch when he visited the museum, & she made this suggestion. He was dubious of the combination of toppings when he was told to get one with 'everything', but he says, 'trust the ladies!'. He was blown away by the yumminess of these hotdogs with 'everything'. He said that they were the best sandwiches he ever had!

title: Well worth the jump off tour bus to get a taste
review: My husband and I were on a hop on-hop off bus tour traveling around the lake at the Shedd Aquarium and Field Museum when the bus driver told us that he would stop at the stand if anyone wanted to buy a hot dog. He said they were the best in the city. Now I'm not sure if he gets a piece of the action, but I did want to try an authentic Chicago style hot dog and this was my opportunity; I'm GLAD I did. I live on the East coast of USA and it was unlike anything I could get at home. I split the hot dog with my husband, but he saw how much I was enjoying it and let me eat most of it. It was little messy (get more napkins), hot dog a bit small, a fair price for Chicago. I highly recommend, enjoy!

title: Great Stop
review: We stopped by for a chicago dog on our way to the Field Museum. Great place and solid food for a good price.

title: Kim and Carlos have to be millionaires!
review: This venue is literally a hot dog stand on steroids! Standing right between Shedd Aquarium and the Field Museum not to mention half a block from Soldier Field, it beckons anyone who needs a substantial snack with a low price tag. There are many toppings to choose from, but underneath it all is either a great Chicago hot dog or an authentic polish sausage. Many people choose to give their dogs " the works" to avoid limiting their choices. There is usually a line and customers appeared to be steady. Seven dollars will get you a doggie, a beverage, and chips. Can't beat that for a bargain. We do hope their delicious product and caring attitude will truly make them millionaires!

title: One of life's simple pleasures
review: Standing outside of Shedd Aquarium, this hot dog stand is a real treat. They serve real Chicago-style hot dogs, and they are delicious and inexpensive to boot. Nothing better than having one of these bad boys in the sunshine while looking at the Chicago skyline. Make sure you have one with the works. Fantastic.

title: Chicago style hot dog cart
review: We were planning on seeing the Shedd Aqarium and looked up where we could have lunch nearby. This hot dog stand is extremely close to the general admission ticket line for the aquarium. We tried the hot dog, sausage and chips. Our total was $12 for the two of us. I tried my hot dog with mustard, sport peppers, celery salt and a pickle spear. They are small, so maybe getting two would be a good idea if it's your meal.

title: 1st Chicago Dog.  . . Loved it!
review: Reasonable prices, quick and tasty lunch.   Would have never put this combo on a hot dog, but it was great. Great stop when your visiting the museums.

title: BEST HOT DOG IN CHICAGO
review: This stand sits beside the Field museum and it is a must stop while in Chicago. If you don't have a Chicago Hot Dog Here then you have never had a Chicago Hot Dog. They are the best, BEST. I don't know what they do to them but they are the best and they are normally pretty crowded. But worth the wait.

title: Perfect for lunch
review: The half day tour made an impromptu stop here for lunch.  We wanted to try a hot dog during our visit and we had the Polish Dog (ketchup not allowed).... tasty !

title: Excellent hot dog
review: If you go to the Fields Museum or Shedd Aquarium, you must stop here. Okay, $4 for a dog is a little much, but c'mon. You're in Chicago. You gotta have a Chicago dog. This place has them. And they're good! Can't wait for my next one.

title: Delicious
review: This was my first Chicago dog I've ever had and it was delicious. I was very skeptical about how Chicagoans make their hot dogs, but I was so glad I tried it. Super convenient location as we were heading from the Field Museum to the Shedd Aquarium. $7 for a dog, chips, and a drink. Cheaper than what you will pay inside the museum/aquarium/planetarium and if you're a tourist, you need to try it because you can eat the overpriced food inside those places in your hometown any day. :)

title: Good price, good dog
review: 5 dollar loaded polish dog. My first Chicago style hot dog and I loved it. Fast service, nice simple menu, solid service.

title: A bargain yum!
review: We were ravenous and stopped by after a long visit to the Adler Planetarium (the cafe closes at 3). My expectations weren't high given it's such a touristy area, but the dogs were delicious. A Chicago style dog, chips and a drink for $7. We plopped down on one the nearby benches and enjoyed our late lunch while taking in the view and people watching. Fun!

title: Best hotdog ever
review: I had an amazing hot dog here, I've been told they have the best hot dogs of the city and only 4$! Go!

title: Perfect stop for museum visitors
review: We took a break from exploring the Field Museum for a Chicago style hot dog, chips, and a can of soda. Price was $7. There is a small service charge to use a credit card. There was a line each time we passed the truck but it moved quite quickly. There are plenty places to sit in the area and people watch while eating. We enjoyed the woman in front of us in line who was willing to follow the "rules" and dance for some ketchup.

title: Good hot dogs at an affordable price
review: We stopped here at least 3 times while visiting the museums on museum campus. Very tasty & good prices. We got the Chicago style hot dog & were not disappointed. They take cash or cards & you can get a combo (hot dog, chips, & canned drink) for about $7

title: Good Hot dog
review: I got a combo meal with chips and a coke. It costs me 7 dollars.  This Hot dog is great. I ll recomend for anyone. Good deal;  good meal

title: Best Chicago Style Dogs
review: Just outside the Field Museum is an excellent hot dog stand. The Chicago style dog is amazing; full of pickles, onions, and peppers, all on a steamed poppy seed bun. It's the perfect dog!There is almost always a line, but it moves quickly. If traveling to the Museum Campus, be sure to stop by for a treat!

title: Delicious pizza
review: We ordered the Margherita Pizza and the Italian Beef Pizza.  Their thin crust  was very good -they were very thin and crispy.  Both pizza was very tasty.  We had good service and the staff was attentive.  The place is very clean.

title: Nice Local Neighborhood Pizza Place
review: Very good service, food was fine, good menu choice.  Outside is next to the El which can be charming as well as noisy when going by.

title: #1 Pizza We ate here on a Pizza Food Tour. Out of 4 pizza shops the Tavern style Polish sausage saurekraut was the tastiest of t
review: #1 Pizza#1 Pizza We ate here on a Pizza Food Tour. Out of 4 pizza shops the Tavern style Polish sausage saurekraut was the tastiest of them all.

title: An Italian and Polish Lunch with Friends
review: I had gone to Flo and Santos as part of a Chicago Pizza Tour a couple years ago. During the tour, we had two of the speciality pizzas, and I meant to return for a more traditional topped pizza. My friends and I went for lunch to belatedly celebrate one friend's birthday. We shared the delicious pierogi appetizer and had a tavern style pizza.Overall, the food was very tasty. A few minor things prevent the restaurant from getting five stars. The pierogi appetizer is six to an order, and you have to have the three set flavors. We would have liked to go all meatless. We shared the paczki dessert, and I like my paczki filled -- not plain.We went on a Sunday, and everyone was able to find parking or get there easily on CTA. I would go again, but I would skip dessert.

title: Holiday Get Together
review: Service and food is awesome!! I have been here a few times and everyone is so friendly. The food is amazing. The specialty pizzas=buffalo chicken and sausage with Sauerkraut are our favorites. The Pierogies and chicken parmigiana are very good too! Definitely worth a visit if in Chicago.

title: Awesome Gem!
review: Service was iffy, but the food was amazing. I'm so sick of the usual Chicago style pizza and this hits the spot. Don't even get me started on the perogies, I can't wait to go back!

title: Great South Loop Local Place
review: Met family and friends prior to the Saints/Bears game. What a treat! The place was packed with fans from both teams, and it made for a great experience. We had the Onion ring tower, Italian Beef special pizza with ghost pepper cheese and the Ravioli. All in all, a great experience. Nice job Flo and Santo's!

title: love
review: Local spot....love everything on the menu! This is centrally located in the South Loop with lots of options; Great for singles, couples, families, and events.

title: Good service Food okay
review: We stopped here for dinner on a Sunday night. We were seated very quickly in the front part of the restaurant by the bar. The menu has a mixture of Italian and Polish items. We ordered the cheesy garlic bread and the pierogi sampler. They both came quickly. The bread was very dry. The cheese was very over baked and the bread hard as a rock. The pierogis were very good. The sampler included a mix of six pierogis on a bed of sauerkraut. They were very good. For dinner we ordered a pizza(selected the toppings ourselves) , a chopped salad and a beef sandwich. We also had soup. The soup was piping hot but rather tasteless . The chopped salad was huge and it was fine, The Italian beef came on a toasted roll and but had to ask for the aujus to put on the sandwich. The beef itself was very tasty but without the actual aujus it would have been dry as dust. The pizza here is always good. Unfortunately we had peppercinnis on our pizza and they were too hot to eat. So we spent a lot of time taking them off. We did have a nice visit and we were served quickly so it wasn’t a total loss. We might go back again if in the area. Flo and Santos is very close to Soldier Field. If the Bears are in town the place is probably packed

title: Warm night out with family and grandchild.
review: Pizza was great along with pierogis, but, italian beef sandwich that was not at all a signature Italian beef sandwich. Made Italian Beef Sandwiches not a signature Chicago sandwich. The thin beef was tough and it was as it was heated in microwave. Should have ordered a pizza or polish sausage sandwich.We are originally from Chicago and was happy it was on the menu. Buyer beware,

title: Could not get out
review: Sat at front bar.  Ordered beer and pizza.  Got 0 service.  Waited more than 30 minutes for check to cash out.     Came here a lot for the past seasons but interest fading.

title: Pizza Tour in Chicago
review: We had the chance to taste a couple of different pizzas at Flo and Santos. Our favourite was the thin crust with polish sausage, sauerkraut and bacon. It was delicious. I also enjoyed the Italian beef pizza and if you like a little heat with your pizza toppings this will definitely fit the bill. All and all a great pizza place and well worth the visit.

title: Average
review: I live close to Flos and love the food and atmosphere. However, the service has been lacking recently. Its in a great south loop location that locals want to visit and feel comfortable in. Lately the employees being hired are rude and disrespectful. Its sad because its always been pleasant and warming.

title: Great food. Good location. Variety
review: Great food. The kids meals were devoured. I had a polish platter that was delish!My husband had a meatball sandwich and enjoyed it.We finished it off by sharing a big slice of chocolate cake.Service was friendly. It was a great location and a reasonable walk from our hotel. We would go back.

title: Neighborhood Favorite
review: This is a great places for a casual, good meal. I've been here countless times as I live right here. This is the almost the only place in the neighborhood my aunt will eat at when she comes to visit. The BEST is Thursday night patio nights with live music and drink specials … if it's not too crowded to get a table! We love the huge selection of beers that is always changing as well, especially on warm summer days.Pizza is great (I like ordering the farmer's market special pizzas and getting to try different pizzas all the time.) The pork wings and the loaded fries and MUST haves -- the cheese on the fries is not gross fake cheese, it thick and tasty. Also … the ketchup they have here is great. Try the spicy version (With a black label) if you like spicy. Our whole family has started purchasing only this ketchup brand after eating here so many times. Thanks Flo&Santos, see you soon for patio Thursdays !

title: Crazy pizza combos....
review: There are definitely some pizza combinations that might have been dared based here. I sampled four different pies. I guess I’m still old school as I preferred Sausage and onion to some of the crazy specialty pies. However in general they were all pretty tasty with crisp crust.

title: Excellent pre-game location
review: Great place to get together before a Bears game. We sat outside and loved the heat lamps. Very good pizza, good service and bathrooms were pretty clean considering the rush

title: Outstanding
review: Outstanding food and service at very reasonable prices. Everything our family ordered was so good. My son’s burger was perfectly cooked and generously portioned. My wife’s pasta was delicious. I had s sampler platter which was a great combination of a variety of things. Drink specials were awesome. Service was so quick and friendly. The atmosphere was really cool. Our only regret was not having pizza as it looked incredible!Cannot wait to return.

title: Chicago Bears Pre-game
review: Great place to attend before a Chicago Bears game. Reasonable prices, great pizza and some Polish food on the menu. On game day the restaurant opens at 9am…should be able to get a table until about 10am, then after that time it can be challenging.
