title: Really good burgers with Gluten Free options
review: We were in downtown Chicago and needed to get some lunch.  Needed a Gluten Free option for my son,  and found The Burger Point on "Find Me Gluten Free".    You can get Beef, Turkey,  Chicken or Veggie burgers.  All made fresh from natural and organic...More

title: Great no-frills burger bar
review: Whether you order a burger from the menu or choose to build your own, there's something for everyone. A great spot for informal dining.

title: Great Portions & Great Service
review: We order from and visit Burger Point often.  They have some of the juiciest and amazing burgers in Chicago.  Never a let down.  Their service is always on point.  We will continue going to them as well as sending guests their way.

title: Care & High Quality Ingredients
review: It's amazing how sourcing high-quality ingredients to create simple but flavorful burgers goes a long way.  Burger Point is great for lunches, hangover cures, or a munchie craving fix at any time they're open.  The owner explained the menu, the vision and values to us...More

title: Family lunch
review: Very good burgers , I came with family to try different styles of burger and I think they are delicious I really recommend this place and it's not expensive

title: Great burgers! Friendly staff
review: I went with my family while we were in Chicago, we had randomly picked it off Trip Advisor. While the parking wasn't the greatest and the prices are a pretty expensive the burgers were great. The employees were really friendly. We had a large group...More

title: Juicy Burgers and Crispy Fries
review: Wonderful food and nice burgers on gluten-free buns.  Service was quick and food was spectacular and huge portions.  The handmade veggie burger was one of the best I have had.

title: Better than 5 guys
review: This place serves a pricy burger. For three of us, with fries and drinks, it is $45. But it is worth it. They have a large menu of sophisticated burgers using various spices, vegetables, breads, and eggs. The sweet potato fries are great. I usually...More

title: Hot, Fresh and Organic
review: I have been visiting Burger Point for two years. My co-workers and I love it. The food is worth the money spent. The staff is friendly and courteous! Food is made to order and they have a large selection to choose from. 6 oz or...More

title: Hit the spot burger!!!
review: I'm always on the never ending search for best burger ever. First off. A very impressive menu. It was a tough decision. So tough that my friend and I decided to split 2 bugers. Best of both worlds! I like all the options you have...More

title: Delicious, fun choices, quick, affordable
review: It's just a little place on a corner but they have about 15 or 20 burgers to choose from. All sound great. For like $3 more you get fries and drink. The burgers are big and wonderful. It's high quality. The food is served quick....More

title: Great find for an out of towner
review: Great burger, awesome fries, killer sound track. Everything is made fresh to order, so don't call this fast food...worth the short wait

title: Wow!  Super impressed!
review: Visited from the UK found this place after some googling while visiting Chicago.   Bit of a walk outside of the "loop" but well worth it!  Wasn't busy at all and the food is amazing!  Great variety of burgers to choose from and presented to you...More

title: Best burger I have ever had
review: Small place but the best burgers ever. Fries could have been more crispy but a great place to eat. Was just a few blocks from the hotel so it was a nice walk. I got the mushroom burger. Maybe it taste better because the meat...More

title: Everyone can find a burger here
review: We found this place trying to find a place to lock up a divvy bike. They have a great variety of burgers here and hand cut fries. I got a standard bacon cheeseburger and it was pretty good.The fries are small but fresh. I wish...More

title: Amazing burgers.
review: We stopped here after our first full day working the booth at Sweets and Snacks Expo. We had some awesome food during the week, but the meal here was probably the most memorable. Burgers arrived exactly as ordered. The fries were awesome as well. We look forward to going back. It isn't necessarily cheap--but worth the cash.

title: Yum yum tum tum
review: Very delicious burgers. Definitely worth the money and the portions are big. Lots of variety to include veggie burgers.

title: Excellent Burgers!!!!!!
review: I really enjoyed the wide and diverse range of burgers. I had never had a stuffed burger before, but they were excellent.First time I went I had the All-American Classic, AMAZING!Second time I had them deliver (Yes, they deliver!) a Drunken Granny, also AMAZING!Spiral potato is really good, prefer that over their regular friesNext time I'm in chicago I have to go again.

title: A surprise find, and I'm glad I found it!
review: Found this place whilst trying to find the L station.  Looks like a standard, decent quality independent wee burger place. Comprehensive menu, provenance & quality shown through. Great chicken wings and great value (the upmarket burger places nearer the centre would certainly charge more)

title: Fresh ingredients, inventive burgers
review: We stopped here for lunch at the recommendation of a friend who lives nearby. They use all organic, fresh ingredients, which I like.I had the mushroom burger (with Brie!) and my husband had the standard American burger. We also split an order of sweet potato fries.We both enjoyed our burgers very much, but the fries could have been crispier.If you're looking for a good farm to table place (and are willing to pay for it), it's a good place.Don't go if you are in a rush, because food is made to order.

title: Great Hamburgers!
review: Not sure if this is actually a restaurant, but they do take-out with some of the best hamburgers ever. Meatlovers,vegan,etc. We were visiting friends and ordered dinner from them. I had the Blue Harvest, wonderful! So I did not actually go to their establishment. But it was one of the best hamburgerts I have ever eaten. The rest of our group concurred. A little pricey, but definitely worth it.

title: Drunken Granny!!!
review: We had an on-the-fly meal here after a very long day. Wow! What a happy mistake. My DD age 14 had the blue cheese burger and it was massive. She skipped the fries and ate every bite. DD age 8 had the kids burger and it was very generous and the slices of bacon were crispy and sliced thick. Speaking of the fries, if you like them thin and golden brown, this is the place to be. Our family of 4 had more than enough with two orders. The organic and corn syrup-free ketchup is amazing. Very hearty and full of tomato flavor. My DH had the special Cali burger with massive slices of avocado and raved the whole time. The winner of the night was the drunken granny on a pretzel roll. I am dreaming of it now. Slices of bourbon soaked granny smith apples on top of a brie and walnut stuffed 1/2 pound burger topped with fig butter. OMG! I ate half and the other half was breakfast. Best burger I ever ate. (and I am over 40!)

title: Delicious burger and fries
review: I got the late night hunger pangs and found this place on Google. It was only 3 blocks away from where I was staying so I decided to give them a try. The place was pretty small, but given how late it was it had more than enough space to sit.I got The Burger Point 6 oz (I probably would have burned my mouth with refluxed acid if I went for the 12 ouncer) with cheese fries and a coke. It took a surprisingly long time. I was happy that in the end the long wait was worth it. The patty was cooked very well and was tender and juicy. There was a sunny side up egg on top and complemented the taste well. The fries were very slim and crunchy. Over all it was a very tasty meal, much better than something like Five Guys.Would definitely go back again.

title: Very Good Burgers
review: I had a delicious burger and great fries.  Did try a wing and it was good too.  Service was quick.  There special ketchup was good also.  It was a Saturday and it was busy.  Portions are very generous.

title: Good burger place
review: Went here with the family on vacation. Found it on Urbanspoon and based on the rating we went. It was really great. Lots of options and everything was really fresh. Highly recommend it.

title: Awesome burgers!
review: Great favor and you can have them made anyway you want. Have beef , chicken, turkey and veggie burgers. I had the sweet potatoes fries, made perfect. Very interesting aspect is that they have a organic ketchup that is amazing. Great tasting, bought three bottle to take home.All food is made to order, so there is a 15 min wait or so, but well worth it.

title: Burgers, wings, and fries, oh my...
review: My husband and son had burgers which they both raved about. My husband is a burger connoisseur and is very picky about his burgers. He likes classic burgers not all the fancy stuff or fancy buns and he really liked their "classic" burger. I had their wings, buffalo style, which I thought were good. They have good fries too. They do take a little longer than most fast food places but everything is cooked to order. I can't wait to try the veggie burger next time:)

title: One of the BEST, no doubt!
review: I consider myself a burger expert. Wow, was I happy to find The Burger Point. A little under a mile from the Hyatt at McCormick Place. I walked there one night for what i consider one of the best burgers I have EVER HAD, and I do not say this lightly. It was so good I walked back for lunch the next day.Great for the belly, not so for the waistline!!!! A MUST if in the area!

title: Burger Point
review: Great Burgers, organic burger, more lean than your fast food burger.  I like their take on sweet potatoes fries.  topping are only limited by your imagination

title: It's still terrible!
review: I decided to give this place one last chance because I live right across the street. My girlfriend won't eat the burger after her gristly experience with them in the past, so she ordered wings, which were just alright.I ordered the shroom burger and requested a pretzel bun instead of the one it came with and cooked to medium rare. I ordered carry-out and was told it would be 20 minutes. I arrived right on time and was greeted by the person at the register. He was not very friendly and collected my money. He never said anything like it would be ready soon. About 12 minutes later when someone who arrived after me picked up their order, I asked when mine would be ready since it should have been done 15 minutes ago. I was finally told it would be ready soon. The person preparing the orders after they were cooked looked completely overwhelmed. Nobody there seems to be able to do more than one thing at a time. That's why they are notorious for taking forever even though it wasn't crowded.So here's the results: Wrong bun and cooked to medium well. Completely tasteless along with being way over-priced. Thank God my girlfriend didn't order a burger. It was full of gristle from my first bite to my last. And they brag about grinding fresh everyday and the quality of meat they use?I don't eat White Castle, but I'm willing to bet their burgers are better. This has to be one of the worst burgers in the city. Actually, I can't imagine anyplace being worse.In conclusion, if you want to eat a horrible, overpriced, tasteless burger that is over-cooked along with messing up the order and waiting forever for it--this is your place.As for anyone giving this place great reviews, they are either friends and family of the owners, or their taste is as bad as the burgers.

title: Amazing burgers.
review: We stopped here after our first full day working the booth at Sweets and Snacks Expo. We had some awesome food during the week, but the meal here was probably the most memorable. Burgers arrived exactly as ordered. The fries were awesome as well. We...More

title: Good burger place
review: Went here with the family on vacation. Found it on Urbanspoon and based on the rating we went. It was really great. Lots of options and everything was really fresh. Highly recommend it.

title: It's still terrible!
review: I decided to give this place one last chance because I live right across the street. My girlfriend won't eat the burger after her gristly experience with them in the past, so she ordered wings, which were just alright.  I ordered the shroom burger and...More

title: Everything but the Fries
review: This place has good to great burgers.  The chilli is great.  Their fries are awful.  Both the regular and sweet potato fries taste bland and are always soggy.  I will never order french fries from Burger Point again (unless they improve).

title: Does it taste good-no!
review: I can 't believe I have been reading these positive reviews. I live right across the street from it and don't even want to visit again. The burgers all have gristle, and they don't taste good. I have seen people say the Ashman is better than In and Out. I would rather have one In and Out over a hundred from Burger Point.They are overpriced and bad. I don't mind spending money on a good burger. Too bad this place doesn't serve one. I ate at The Butcher and the burger today and it's so much better than this place. For anyone who likes this place, go there and eat a real burger.

title: Best burger I've had
review: Definitely best burger in chicago. Just went yesterday had the ashman burger and it was delicious. If you love "animal - style" burgers at In and Out on the west coast you will love this one cause it's so much better. Meat and toppings were fresh, they are very generous with the cheese, bread was fresh. Overall much,much better than Five Guys, Epic, and M burger. And the selection beats all those other places hands down!

title: FOOD
review: The food from this Burger Point Chicago was the worst food i have ever had in my life, it was extremely Greasy and made me ill very fast. not only was is over priced they messed up my order so i paid 16.61 for burger roll and a Pepsi.

title: Premium burger made to order.
review: I went here for lunch about 11am beating the lunch crowd and was very impressed. Having recently just opened they are doing ever thing right out of the gate. I customized my burger blue cheese and all on a pretzel bun and it was superb. Toppings are fresh

title: Best Burger I Ever Ate!
review: My girlfriend found this place online and wanted to try it. I had expected a decent burger. What I got was hands down the best burger I have ever had. I ordered the dirty south burger doubled, with aged cheddar, smoked bacon, and bbq sauce on a pretzel roll. It was juicy and delicious from the first bite to the last. Plus there were numerous ways to have your burger prepared including vegetarian and turkey burgers with just about any topping. The staff was very friendly and eager to please. I will definitely be visiting The Burger Point again.

title: Price is good, food is good, fries are good
review: I really enjoyed this place. There is also a very reasonable Thai food restaurant next door.I had the veggie burger which was really soft and kind of fell apart as you ate it. My dad had a burger that you pretty much build on your own with the different toppings they have and he enjoyed it.They say that their meat is cage free, hormone free, grass fed which is nice.

title: Awesome Burger
review: My sister and I had lunch here because she had a coupon. We ate there again three days later because the food was so good. The Ashman was amazing and so were the sweet potato fries. I didn't like the bacon burger with blus cheese and bacon jam but loved everything else. Free parking in the small lot in the back.

title: Valentine's day
review: Place had awesome entertainment staff really played there parts good and was great with the audience they'll even randomly call someone out the audience up on stage to participate in the act.The hold atmosphere was great you get to take pictures with a atomic gun...by a 1920s car they have dress up hats u can buy to take the pictures in. Food was average great alcohol drink menuMore

title: Must do!!!
review: We had such a great time here!  The atmosphere really immursed you into the 1920s.  The food was delicious and the portions were huge.  The staff was great - friendly and funny.  The show had us laughing until we cried!  Fun for all ages -...18-118!!!  We would definitely do this again.More

title: Fun Entertainment
review: Cool setting, fun entertainment. The service was good. The food was exceptable, drinks were good. we had a good time!

title: We LOVED IT
review: My husband and I LOVED IT!!!  Our prime rib was excellent!! Our server, Bubbles, was so sweet and attentive!! We really recommend this to everyone, and remember you are transported back in time and having dinner with gangsters!! So don’t get offended by loud and...gruff!!! Have fun!!!More

title: Birthday at Tommy Guns
review: All I can say is if you love the roaring 20's you will LOVE Tommy Guns!! From the moment you arrive your transported back to a secret speak easy. Our waitress was Bubbles and she was amazing! Aside from a fun filled show (that the...audience participates in) the food was some of THE BEST eats Ive had! My husband ordered the prime rib (said it was the best prime rib hes ever eaten) and I got the lemon chicken...WOW it was out of this world! Absolute amazing experience!!!More

title: Fun!
review: Went here with my husband on a Friday night and we had a blast! The entertainers worked their butts off the entire evening but never broke character. Our food was great, the portions were huge. (We had the pork chops and prime rib) We’ll definitely...come back next time we visit and would recommend this to anyone. Not entirely appropriate for children but I think the jokes would go over their heads.More

title: Good food and entertainment
review: Here for a business dinner with customers.  Staff were attentive and entertaining and the food was good.  We enjoyed the evening.

title: Value for Money
review: Great choice of food which is served on mass to the whole audience but still hot and very tasty, the rib eye steaks were huge, for me, but melt in the mouth gorgeous.

title: Loved it
review: I am not a dinner theatre person, I have been to a few and hoped they would be the last.  My mother loves them so I booked this for her, after reading reviews on here that most people enjoyed it.  I have to say, I...LOVED it. It was hightly entertaining, the staff were great.  I laughed and enjoyed the show.  It was amazing to see the old dances and her the old music.  The food was as described, huge portions and yummy.  Based on the reviews about potion size we did not order appertizers and we still could not finish.   Just a tip, pre order a cab or uber, it was really hard to catch one at the end.   All in all I would say this is a great way to spend the night, I would go back.More

title: What a Hoot!
review: We were at a convention at the McCormick Center and thought we had made a straightforward dinner reservation. We had no idea what was in store. I hope I'm not giving anything away when I say that there is no sign on the door and...the only way to find the entrance is for a man to approach you on the street and ask you if you are looking for Tommy Guns. You will be led back in time to a speakeasy.Everyone is in period dress and the place is hopping. This is not gourmet food but the prime rib is a solid choice. And where else can you get Capone minestrone? The waitstaff is awesome. Our waitress was Velma and she looked like one. The show is full of familiar tunes with singing and dancing and a little bit of plot. Great fun for the evening at a reasonable priceMore

title: A good night out
review: My wife and I visited from Australia. We did dinner and a show at this establishment last night. It costs $77 US per person for the show, 1 soup and 1 main meal. I chose the steak and it was massive. It comes with potatoe...More

title: Fun birthday
review: This was a great way to end our first trip to Chicago!  Everyone was wonderful and we were thoroughly entertained!  The food was good, too.  So glad we did this!

title: 60th Birthday celebration
review: My birthday canoli!  Opportunities to have photos with players, and become part of the show.  Want to really make your trip fun?  Dress like you lived it!  A must do if you are going to Chicago!

title: take a trip back to the roaring 20's
review: Hadn't been here in at least 20 years. Forgot how much fun it was. We went there to celebrate my daughter's 19th birthday. It's a dinner-show restaurant. Your waitresses are also part of the floor show. All the cast are dressed in 1920's era clothing,...More

title: A Must!!
review: My daughter and I went to Tommy Guns Sunday March 19, 2017 and this was one of my favorite stops during our visit to Chicago. For $67 per person you get a great meal and a one-of-a-kind experience.  Upon arrival you will be expected to...More

title: Must watch!
review: This is a show that takes you back to the time of prohibition. The show starts as you enter the venue just like the real thing so be ready with your password. The performers are very talented and the entire restaurant is the stage.

title: Great place for a special fun occasion
review: This place is great!  Good food and awesome entertainment.  We visited for my girlfriend's birthday, and i wanted to shy away from the "traditional" dinner option Chicago has to offer.  SHE LOVED IT!  Food and drinks are excellent.  Thank you for a great time at...More

title: A Great Evening of Food & Entertainment !
review: The 'garage ' is a dinner theatre.We were there with a group of 12 couples (a 5 day Chicago tour [DenureTours] from Lindsay Ontario) The setting was actually a garage,the interior was early garage and mobster design. The meal was a prime rib with baked...More

title: So much fun!!!
review: We were in Chicago for a week, and did all of the touristy things, including Medevil Times, and a boat tour.  Tommy Guns Garage was our absolute favorite!  The cast works really hard, they go out of their way to make you feel welcome, and...More

title: Good show plus good food
review: The show was entertaining and well presented.  The cast was clearly focused on giving the audience a great time.  The food was much better than expected - not fine dining but much better than I would normally expect from a dinner theatre.

title: Fun Chicago-style show- good dinner!
review: Took the teenagers here during our Chicago visit - good value dinner and show - was able to grab a Groupon so even better. All the servers were a hoot -dressed to the nines in spats and flapper dresses - prime rib was very tasty...More

title: Great Entertainment
review: From start to finish the evening was a lot of fun, from meeting "Fingers" at the door & giving him the password, to being escorted to our seats in front of the stage. Lola our server/dancer/singer really looked after us. We visited for our 25th...More

title: Dinner Show
review: Fabulous experience! This speakeasy has so much to offer, great food, great talent, great staff. Thank you!

title: threater was good food not so good
review: The show was pretty good (very small budget), they pushed drinks and the food was not very good, also had problems with the reservation and still trying to clear up with my credit card people.

title: Group get together
review: It was fantastic. We had great food, the musicals were great, the drama was great and the ambience is awesome. A must go for people in love. Went there with my colleagues.

title: Great night for school group
review: We attended with 70 people from a high school band. We pulled up to the back door and a gangster boarded our bus.   Service was decent, food was very good and the entertainment was excellent. The staff works so hard.

title: Great Fun

review: Would recommend this to anyone visiting Chicago.  It is a really fun night and the staff are all without exception fantastic. Our waitress Mona was great and Roco was a great host with his banter. Audience interaction is hysterical and light hearted fun.  A great...More

title: Silly fun
review: This place is a lot of fun and great for groups. Some people dress up in costumes or you can buy hats there to take pics with. It's a fun interactive show and the food is actually descent. I go here every time I'm in...More

title: A light fun night out
review: Was looking for something fun and different... and that's what this place is. As a "Dinner and a Show" it's a light hearted fun night out. Staff are fun and engaging. The food is decent. The show is fun. We went as a couple and...More

title: Gangsta Era ...
review: A 20/30's type show . Great time and atmosphere.  Highly enjoyed the show and food. Recommend the prime rib . Rye and ginger pretty good also. Lol Go see you'll be happy you did.

title: Fun Place For Celerations
review: Good food with the servers doing a Prohibition Era show. Great for special occasions with friends or family.

title: So much fun and great food as well!
review: This was a fun evening!  Nothing like a Broadway show or anything, just having a good time and eating good food!  They really involved the audience in the show!

title: Ladies night out
review: We decided to have a ladies night out at Tommy guns.  I'm glad we did. From the time you drive into the parking lot until you leave you are brought back to the 20's. All the actors were great. everyone had a good time. We...More

review: Food, service and real time 1920's atmosphere was great.  Every person was in character.  Loved it.    I would lose the shooting of the tommy gun and the pistol carrying on the outside of the costumes.  With all the real shootings in movie theaters, schools, colleges,...More

title: Great show and prime rib
review: OMG!! The prime rib was fabulous. Our server was Twinkles and she was fabulous. I came with a group of 16 high school students and wasn't sure if they would be engaged. Since I was pulled on stage, they really were roped in. It was...More

review: I took a group of 50 adults, ages 55 and older. Tommy's promises a step back in time & they deliver. Stepping into the "joint" you are immediately transported back to the time of prohibition & the Speak Easy!  The food was great! Large portions....More

review: Excellent opportunity for our high school music group of 144 to experience a private show!  Great interaction with entertainment!  Meal choices & all delicious with no one leaving hungry.  We will be back!

title: Disappointed
review: April 26, 2015 I was very disappointed when I took my family to Tommy Guns to celebrate my mother’s birthday and all the food they served was cold and nasty. The Prime Rib was rated very high, but it was nasty.  When I called to...More

title: Easy Street all the way!
review: Great show, great food! Lots of entertainment, Sadie is an awesome server and entertainer. We Love Gloves- Gem of Chicago history  Must see!!

title: "A HOOT "
review: This is where you want o park yourself for lots of laughs and a real good time. The overall experience is what makes this place worth going to. The food was good maybe not the best BUT what6 can you expect when the chef has...More

title: Fun Dining
review: Dinner and a show! From the moment you pull up to the parking gate and speak to the attendant to the time you pull out of the same gate that evening the change in atmosphere takes you back! My husband surprised me for my birthday...More

title: Great time for adults & parents
review: Visited with family for relatives 80th bday.. Had a couple teens in the group that had fun but I would recommend this show to the 30-85 year old crowd. Food was good, show was highly entertaining. Great singing and dancing. Price was pretty steep ($70...More

title: Amazing experience.
review: Loved, it. I dressed the part and was picked to participate.  The food was good.  The staff was off the charts amazing.

title: Lotta laugh's
review: 20 ladies went to Chicago for a "deer widow's shopping weekend".  Ended Saturday night at Tommy Guns.  The gals were dressed like flappers of the 20's, the guys like gangsters.  The waiter and waitresses were the performers.  Prime rib was delicious as were the drinks.(...More

title: Working actors do it best
review: Fun and ridiculousness ensue from the moment you arrive. Password and secret knocks admit you into the speakeasy.   Dames are escorted by gun toting Fedora wearing gangstas who warn the men "not to make me shoot ja"   The show was really good and interactive with...More

title: Dinner and a Show
review: The restaurant looks like a warehouse full of the roaring 20's gangster paraphernalia. From the time you walk in the door you are greeted gangster -style. Guests dine at lonngg tables - about 20 to a table. It's a great place for groups. I enjoyed...More

title: Fun evening good food
review: We were with a large group for a fun night. This is a venue for very large groups or families. You sit at large tables and are met at the doors by gangsters already in their character which was fun!  There is alot of audiance...More

title: So Much Fun!!!
review: Ok, the food is just ok, nothing to really write home about BUT the entertainment and atmosphere is so much fun!  When our taxi pulled up, we were like where is it?  There is nothing on the outside to identify it.  Then two gangsters came...More

title: Disappointing
review: Had been there 20 years ago and bragged about it to our friends but was very disappointed when we brought them.  Immediately upon seating they try to sell their merchandise.  The salmon was very fishy tasting and nothing special.  The prime rib was acceptable.  The...More

title: Unique out of the way place.
review: Not exactly what I expected with the view from the outside but the whole experience was so fun.  The dining room tables weren't impressive but that is part of the whole experience.  A little Al Capone type of gem. Step back in time.

title: Perfect Prime Rib!
review: Step into the fascinating world of the Roaring Twenties, as you enter Tommy Gun's Garage, the ultimate destination for an interactive audience spectacular in Chicago.   The theme begins before you even walk into the building at this amazing dinner theater, where a secret password will...More

title: I was disappointed...
review: We had done the "Gangster Tour" of Chicago and then went to Tommy Guns for a meal and a show. I had heard some really good things about this place, so I was really looking forward to it.   First, the good things: the prime rib...More

title: This Dame Loved It
review: The night we went was my husband's birthday and boy did he have fun.  They put us at a table right up front and the got him on stage and a flapper sang to him.  When you book your tickets you are given a pass...More

title: What a hoot
review: Fun time for our group of 24, dinner was excellent, large portions, many of my clients took home leftovers.  Entertainment was corny but fun and very energetic.  Had a blast...keep it up guys and gals.

title: Great time
review: Went for our 25th anniversary while in Chicago. Had a great time. The whole cast was totally into it and made the experience great. Mona was out waitress as well as a performer and took great care if us. The prime rub is great. I...More

title: Just all around terrific
review: Terrific venue, terrific show, terrific prime rib, terrific salmon (wife couldn't finish it) terrific time.  Rat-A-Tat-Tat

title: Entertaining!
review: Great gangster dinner show. Didn't realize the servers were the entertainers. Prime rib was cooked great. Fun place!

title: Little Jake sent us
review: So much fun!! The dinner (we had primae rib) was wonderful and the show afterward was sooooo funny - my sides still hurts!  Definitely worth seeing!

title: Family oriented
review: Family oriented restaurant with delivery available try it out and see if you like it! Great for special date night or family night

title: Yes, Harold's fried chicken is different--and better
review: In our quest to discover the best fried chicken in Chicago, my wife and I did a lot of eating and a lot of research. One thing we learned is Harold's Chicken Shack is a Chicago original. Harold Pierce, an African-American entrepreneur, and his wife...Hilda founded the restaurant in 1950 as a small operation on 39th Street on Chicago's South Side. It was called H&H in those early days and specialized in dumplings and chicken feet, both common soul food. Eventually, it became one of the few examples of a thriving fast food chain that was owned by and principally served the black community. Today, Harold's has more than 40 locations in Chicago and vicinity, including the flagship at 124 East 35th Street. We sampled the chicken and takeout service at 612 South Wabash and 1501 West Madison in the West Loop, near United Center. In case you haven't compared Harold's chicken to KFC or Popeye's or Brown's Chicken, Harold's is different in two ways--(1) it is cooked in a mix of half beef tallow and half vegetable oil, which provides taste closer to the traditional fried chicken of the American South, while most chains use only vegetable oil and (2) Harold's chicken isn't fried until it is ordered while some chains fry their chicken in large batches and store it on warming racks until it is purchased. I ordered a 1/2 white chicken dinner, two wings and two breasts with fries, cole slaw and bread. My wife opted for an eight-piece chicken tender dinner with fries, cole slaw and bread.More

title: Delicious Old-Fashioned Fried Chicken
review: Fantastic chicken at a great price. I would only go for the chicken and fries though, not the desserts at all. Hot wing sauce is on point too!!

title: My absolute favorite chicken
review: Harold’s does not disappoint!!  I ate there everyday while in Chicago & almost cried when I realized I didn’t grab my mild sauce to go. I first tried Harold’s in ATL, but heard chicago was were it originated. I had the wings covered in mild...sauce with some Obama tea. I tried my first pizza puff here too. I am so excited that AZ will be opening one this month.More

title: Maybe I got a bad batch but I was not impressed
review: I have heard many great reviews of Harolds Chicken for some time and finally found myself near one. The chicken was dry and with little taste. I had the hot sauce on the side and it seemed to be simply a bottled hot sauce. The...cole slaw included with the chicken dinner was a container of an ounce or two. The fries were good.More

title: Pretty good food.
review: This restaurant has pretty good food and the service was great. We had the Catfish nuggets and they were pretty tasty.  My son had the chicken wings and said they were also quite good. The fries and coleslaw that came with the nuggets dinner were...also pretty good. We got the cheesecake for dessert and it left something to be desired but overall the food and the service were on par.More

title: Good chicken
review: Nothing fancy. Great chicken, fish and grub. College or working student style. Fresh hot and tasty. A must try when visiting Chicago!

title: great fried chicken
review: My wife and I were in chicago and walked over to Harolds for lunch.  I got the lunch special of fried chicken wings, slaw, and drink and she got fried chicken breast.  The chicken was excellent, crisp skin and moist meat.  Highly recommend

title: Harold's Chicken Shack
review: The food was very good, however, the menu online is not the same as what is available at the restaurant, we did an office order based of the online menu but had to reorganize once we arrived.  The quality of the food was very good.

title: The one. The only. One of the all-time fried chicken greats.
review: I went to #71 near McCormick Place (the convention center). A small, VERY unassuming walk-up store. Take out only at this location. Be prepared to wait a while  as the chicken is essentially fried to order. Always has been; always will be. So, just the...OPPOSITE of fast food chicken. WELL worth the wait. Be prepared to be elbow to elbow with all manner of customer, especially hard working folks before or after their shifts. This, in my opinion, is a good thing. The basic meal comes with chicken on a slice of white bread, fries, and a very small portion cup of cole slaw. I get mine with Harold's hot sauce; it's not too hot and it's very tasty. And the fried chicken is just like older guys like me remember it. Small pieces (no chicken on steroids!); tender; tasty. Very inexpensive. Years ago fried chicken stopped tasting like fried chicken to me. But not at Harold's. Fried chicken like I remember it. That's a good thing.More

title: Good fresh chicken
review: Don't let the modest looks of this little place fool you.  The fried chicken here is excellent!  Be a little patient as they make it fresh for you when you order.  It's worth the wait.

title: Amazing fried chicken.
review: I didn't eat here but my wife did.  She said it was the best fried chicken she has ever had.  Generous portions and very affordably priced.  It's in a great location and it's open late on the weekends.  The service was stellar - very friendly...More

title: Harold's Chicken Shack - TASTY fried chicken!!
review: Suitable for take-out or dine-in, Harold's Chicken Shack serves hot, crisp, tasty fried chicken. I greatly enjoyed a recent lunch -- it's fast food that tasted made-to-order. Really good fried chicken pieces, wings, or fried chicken sandwich. Tasty french fries too. Bottom Line: You'll enjoy....More

title: Good, superhot fried chicken
review: This is the real deal if you want super hot, fresh, chicken and fixins fresh out of the fryer.  Not a diet place and not fancy, but fingerlicking good.

title: Get the Catfish
review: I went to the taste fest and the line for Harold’s Chicken was wrapped around the corner. I waited and went to the restaurant. The chicken was good, not like expected with the amount of traffic. The fried catfish is something I would recommend. That...More

title: Good whole wings
review: The wings were hot and taste and the fries real. Opted for the sauce which came over the wings and fries and I'm glad I did. Definitely good for that late night fried chicken fix. I will be back the next time I visit Chicago.

title: Satisfies a wing nees
review: Okay, I’d heard good things about this place and the food definitely didn’t disappoint!   The venue itself is a little rough around the edges; however, the lady behind the counter was lovely, and the chicken is good!  I opted for the chicken tenders with mild...More

review: I went here while visiting Chicago two years ago and fell in love with the chicken.  I tried going again this past weekend and it was awful.  I don't know if I got a bad night or placed a poor order or what, but yuck....More

title: great fast food chicken!!1
review: if your looking for a quick dinner then please stop by this place...casual and fast food like restaurant...fried chicken to perfection...all kinds of people stop by this place...I had chicken and fries but next time I'll try the fish...

title: Price, decent chicken

title: Just OK

title: Good Eats

title: Great Fried Chicken

title: Not much to look at, but great food

title: Great catfish
review: Kind of a dive looking place but the food was good. We had the chicken and catfish combo. That catfish was the best I have had in the north.

title: Good Ole Fried Chicken
review: My wife and I were visiting some friends one weekend and decided to stop by Harold's for some fish and chicken. They been around a least 25 years and know how to fry it up.

title: Great fried chicken!
review: We stopped here for an early dinner before a summer walk  to explore Hyde Park:). Chicken was fresh, piping hot and was an amazing meal.  We did take out...and then drove so was a good option for us us we found a nice spot to...More

title: Smells Great, but ends up Tasting Average
review: Went here on local Chicogan recommendation, ended up being disappointed. Basic fried chicken place, with some fried shrimp and fish as well. Flavor is ok, but nothing that you would need to make a special trip for. I hear they have multiple locations so perhaps...More

title: Good
review: Really close to the Hilton.  Great chicken.  Worth it if you want good cheap eats one night if you are on a budget or want convenience.

title: Great catfish and hush puppies!
review: My Husband and I were in town on business from Nashville and knew this place was famous. Our luncheon wasn't appetizing and we headed from the Hilton across the street to this little chicken place. He said it was some of the best fried fish...More

title: Yum!
review: I've heard about Harold's Fried Chicken from Chicagoans that claim it's the best fried chicken you'll ever eat.  I wouldn't go that far but the chicken is pretty tasty and I'm glad to have tried it.

title: Great Fried Chicken
review: Terrific place for lunch.  Nothing fancy but it is all about the food, so who cares if it isn't the prettiest place I have ever seen.  the desserts look amazing but I was too full form my half chicken to indulge.  Next time for sure!

title: healthy sized portions
review: juicy, tender, well seasoned. Happy to see this spot was right around the corner from our hotel. There was a crowd however the service was quick and food fresh.

title: Great take out for a good price!
review: We were stuck in our hotel room downtown in the South Loop because of an impending severe thunderstorm warning, so we decided to try take out from Harold's after seeing positive reviews.  We had the chicken tenders (with mild sauce), fried mushrooms and onion rings....More

title: Good chicken but great catfish!
review: The chicken was good, juicey and had great flavor. They also do fish and the catfish was flavorful and flakey!

title: Fried chicken
review: The popcorn chicken is a little spicy but was the favorite among our group. After drinking this greasy food hit the spot. We got our food to-go since we were staying close by and the restaurant atmosphere is not the greatest.

title: Nice little surprise on South Wabash
review: First night in Chicago, I see Harold's Chicken Shack (aka Harold's Fried Chicken) from my hotel.  It looks like a dive, sketchy place to eat.  But for some reason, I see lots of folks eating there.  Moral of this story is don't let appearances deceive...More

title: Good but change out the grease
review: We love Harolds and the price and chicken is to die for. Kind of funky when when you walk in, crappy seating but the food more than makes up for it. The last couple of times we went the chicken was good but you could...More

title: Very homey food for very little money.
review: The catfish is a treat if they have it. The chicken is classic. Friendly staff. Get a chance to mix with the locals!

title: WE ATE THERE FIRST DAY IN CHICAGO
review: My husband and I use to live in Chicago and we had several dates @ Harold's but ever since we moved to San Antonio we have not found chicken like it is made in Harold's. When we found out they won best fried chicken restaurant...More

title: Awesome Chicago tradition
review: Harold's has great fired chicken for a reasonable price. Be ready to wait or to call ahead, and expect bare-bones dining areas of there are any at all. Just savor the flavor of a longstanding Chicago tradition.

title: Good Fried Chicken
review: We are from Alabama and enjoy good fried chicken. Harold's does it well. With cooking it to order, we expected a long wait but took only about 15 minutes.

title: Royalty For The Night
review: From The Time I Walked In To The Time I Left,  I Felt Like A QUEEN!!! The Staff was beyond AMAZING.  The Entertainers had me gagged from beginning to end.  It was high energy and glamor the entire night.  My eyes were blinded by the...Glitz and Glam.  Food Was to die for. You have to try the steak, and girlllllll get extra butter on that steak. THANK ME LATER.  This is certainly a birthday I wont forget Ok HUNNNEYYYY Shout Out To Mr.Billings And Mrs. Henry For Extra Special Attention!! See You All SoonMore

title: Don’t waste your time. Go elsewhere
review: I am a huge fan of drag shows & this was NOT it. The queens may have huge talent although there was no show. They must have danced for about 10 seconds before just walking around for the remainder of the song asking for cash...tips.  It feels like it is more about the money than providing the audience an actual show. I truly felt taken advantage of as there was no performance  Also, they tell you it’s $45.99 per person and it was very disappointing because they continuously keep trying to get you to buy “special shots” during the show while asking for cash tips. Then they provide themselves a 20% gratuity once you get your receipt at the end of the night.  There also was a lack of professionalism from the staff, I had another reservation with friends for another day so I called to cancel and they asked how I enjoyed the previous performance as they saw my name on the reservation from the night before. I told them how I honestly felt about the performance and in no rude way. They hung up on me.  This all bothered me way more than the poor quality food provided as my expectations for food were not high, so I was not disappointed there. It met my expectations of mediocre dry food. Which I didn’t even mention to them.  I’d go to another drag show elsewhere to enjoy an actual performance. This does not allow them to show their talents which is very unfortunate because I’m sure they have a lot of it.More

title: Lips need to get better food
review: Selection is very small, my chicken was bland and they did not have all the sides they advertised. It was over priced. The performers were ok, they had the tables way too close. The waiters couldn’t even fit thru the isles. I’ve been to other...shows and I liked their setup way betterMore

title: Best Drag Brunch in Chicago
review: LIPS Chicago is hands down the best drag brunch in Chicago. The energy in the room was lit from beginning to end.   The service was outstanding, the food and drinks were great and the performances were amazing.  Ruff n Stuff, the host of the LIPS...Chicago Gospel Brunch was simply, hilarious. Her gospel drag performances had people on their feet.  I can’t wait to return.More

title: Lovable moments to feel
review: The energy n connection w other guest n the creativity that's shown. The divas being them n living.  The best part

title: Fabulosity at its Finest
review: Probably not the first place that comes to most people’s minds when looking for a place to celebrate a sweet 16 birthday, but this was our choice and we’re so glad!  The food is delicious (try the steak frittes), the service is top notch, and...the decor and lighting make for some great photos.  The Queens work hard serving up food and drinks to the tables and then serving up amazing entertainment - you won’t be disappointed!  My daughter was thrilled to be honored for her birthday by the lovely ladies at Lips - truly a birthday to remember.  Two things to note: 1. The jokes/language can be a little raw, but nothing you haven’t heard in a million movies.  2. Be sure to have a wallet full of singles to tip the ladies as they perform.More

title: Excellent Experience
review: We came to Chicago for the weekend to just get away from the office for a few days.  I talked my husband into coming here since we didn't go for my birthday this year (We started a tradition last year that he'll take me for...my birthday to a drag show of my choice.)   Food was fantastic, and the show was excellent, even with the Covid Protocols in place.  We felt everything was cleaned well and people were spaced in a way that no one came in close contact.   I've already recommended to 3 of my friends who are visiting Chicago later this year.  Can't wait to come back!More

title: Show was Awesome and Food was too!
review: We came here for the show and was expecting the food to be wedding/hotel quality. I figured it would fill my belly, but be tough and flavorless - BOY WAS I WRONG, but I get ahead of myself.  We took the Green Line to the...show (too cheap to Uber); just a short walk to the theater. Yes I did it in heels . . . not easy but accomplished.  We had booked the late seating. Lovely Tori greeted us  (party of two) and sat us right next to the stage. We were going to have a view!   A lovely queen came to take our drink order and explain how to find the digital menu. It was very hard to hear her with the background music playing and her clear chin face mask. Those drink were delivered. We opted for the Frozen Cosmo and were not disappointed - they were pleasantly strong. My partner was a bit chilled and inquired about a warm drink. Coffee was available and they added a shot of Bailey's. It did the trick.  We watched as others arrived. A very large bachelorette party was in the center of the room, and then a smattering of other tables due to COVID restrictions. All of the servers were masked. The showplace was beautifully appointed. It was over the top but not garish. Funky yet classy. A perfect setting for the queens to do their thing.  Our permanent waitress then came to take our order. She wanted to get it in prior to the large party. We appreciated her thoughtfulness. A food runner brought out our caesar salads which were dressed perfectly and not swimming in dressing. And then the meals arrived. I had the rigatoni in vodka sauce and my partner the grilled chicken breast. I was truly blown away by the flavor and presentation of the food. But the tenderness of the chicken both in my pasta and that of my parter's meal was astounding. The only slight disappointment was that the menu said we would get a dessert but one never arrived.   The show was everything I had hoped for and more. This was my first drag show. I had seen Trixie Mattel in a solo show and I have seen Les Ballets Trockadero, but not a traditional show. I appreciated the stage hostess saying something about tipping the performers because I was not aware that was a thing and did not come prepared. Our food runner graciously broke some $20s for us. The 'singing' was spot on. The dancing shook all the right things. The energy remained high for the night. $5 shots with a sparkly ring were offered midway and of course we needed those!  After the show Tori spoke to my partner and I for about 15 minutes about her experience and answering the questions my partner and I had. We really appreciated the time she took with us. Before leaving we checked out the restrooms - which were upstairs . . . ugh - drunk test. I told you the drinks were good!! The upstairs had high top tables for when they were at full capacity. The bathrooms were lovely.   I can't wait to return. I look forward to attending the Gospel Brunch.More

title: A wonderful experience
review: My friend and I had such an amazing time at LIPS Chicago. The performers were wonderful and the food was excellent. We will be back!

title: My Bae's Birthday Celebration
review: Great service the food was good the Mimosas where bottomless and the show was amazing valet parking was convenient and timely over all it was a  Exceptional

title: Thank you for a great event!!!!
review: Lips is everything! From costumer service to food. You have to visit soon. I was blessed by the drag brunch.

title: Litty drinks, horrible food.
review: I enjoyed the show but the food was horrible. It was the nastiest pasta I’ve ever eaten. Drinks were $5 if you ordered off a special menu but it’s not even worth it.

title: Such a wonderful experience!
review: The show was perfect! So fun and lively. The girls were amazing! The service was also too notch and the host was hilarious! Go, GO, Go!

title: Great brunch
review: Great brunch and so entertaining, the concept is unique and it’s a fun place to have a good meal and be entertained with a high quality drag show. Don’t forget to bring your wiggles to top the girls, they really work hard serving and performing

title: celebrating 3 birthdays
review: The place is awesome. Beautiful decorations. The show was great!  Very entertaining I know there is limited time. They serve the food at the same time as the show so some of it is a little distracting but it was still awesome!

title: Love #LipsChicago
review: Soft Opening Was #Amazing Family And Friends Day #Amazing  Glitz And Glam Show #Perfect but need to update music and not do same shows back to back in same night or next day   Gospel Brunch with ruffnstuff is my all time favorite.   Not really a...More

title: Fun, great entertainment, best show
review: We went there with a large group, 71 people!  We all had the very best of times.  Food is delicious, drinks are good, the girls are fabulous! cannot go wrong for a great time out.

title: Awesome Experience!!!
review: It was my first time and I was there for my birthday!!! It was such an amazing experience that I would encourage everyone to go and have a “Lips” experience!

title: Lips Chicago
review: The decor is so pretty. The staff very friendly amd accommodating.  We had a great time will definitely be back. My pasta dish was very good too

title: Ari Gato was amazing
review: Went last night, and every single queen was royalty, especially Ari who served us, and was so talented and charming, and her performances were insanely good. I loved her so much. Please make sure she gets to see this message!

title: Great
review: Amazing everyone was so nice. Clean food great unlimited drinks and a great show they made my grandma happy on her birthday even took pictures with her. She really enjooyed herself and im happy she did

title: Such a fun time
review: I went for a friend sweet 16 party, and I had an absolute blast! I expect you to have fun, but it blew me away!

title: Amazing show! Great addition to SLoop!
review: Went for the first time on Saturday for a moms night out and had a blast! Top quality show, great service and the interiors elevate the entire experience. Planning a return visit, soon!

title: Girls night out
review: My group had an awesome time it was definitely worth it can’t wait to return the food and drinks were awesome and wonderful customer service

title: Not to be missed while visiting Chi
review: The best of shows. Elegant and classy with a midst of flirtatious energy. The girls are FANTASTIC. Great dinner or Gospel show. Incredible bargain. And let’s not forget the food. Super yummy and a great variety of options. Only negative..... they should charge more!!!.... Don’t be stingy and make sure you leave extra gratuity. Well deserved. Has become a staple visit for my visitors. LOVE LOVE Lips!!

title: Fun evening of drag
review: Had a great time.  Fun drag show, great food and drinks.  Wish our waitress was in a better mood.  Had no sense of humor.  All others were great and we had a wonderful evening.   Be cool to see some group numbers.

title: You’re missing out!
review: Amazing! Great time great package deal great ambiance! Would go back again! It’s great for birthdays& bachelorette parties or just plain anything. Loved the girls and had so many laughs!

title: Excellent!!!
review: It was my first time at lips but this is a go to place for sure... the scenery is just fabulous and the atmosphere is perfect... the girls and mcee are very entertaining.. I will be returning for sure.

title: Great show and food, service needs work
review: My sister took me out for my big 50th birthday! As soon as we entered we were excited because the decor and all the ladies were fabulous. The service at the bar was great as were the drinks. When we were seated I noticed my sister whispering about something turns out she was confirming the birthday package. As soon as our server approached the table she said do you know what you want to eat. It was a bit abrupt since we had about 30 seconds to review the menu. We asked for suggestions and she replied that she had only tried two of the options. My sister once again started whispering. The salads arrived quickly and they were large but just okay. The entrees were DELICIOUS. A gentleman checked on us and my sister asked about the birthday package for a 3rd time. He quickly brought over my crown that it seemed like everyone else had since they were seated. As a 50 yr old woman this was not a big deal to me but it was to my sister because she planned for this to be part of our evening. Our sever came halfway through our entrees to offer water for the first time. My sister pointed out that someone else had to bring the hat and her response was “well she has it now”. We also had to request our dessert which our neighboring table had already received and finished. The show was fun and entertaining and we will be back but I hope service improves otherwise I would skip dinner and watch from the bar.

title: Fabulous!!
review: Excellent show!  Very professionally done.  The Queens are beautiful and hard to believe!!  Food great too!! Thanks for a great night!!
Very neat.  I'm from a small town and dont see much of this.  The decorations were beautiful.  Staff very fun and would go again.

title: “Great Atmosphere, Great Food, Better Drag!”
review: Right off the back you walk into a fantasy land of Glitter and cheetah print where you’re welcomed by smiles and great hospitality. Food is amazing and the drinks will have you coming back for seconds(if you can handle it) but nothing compares to the amazing shows the queens put on they’ll have you on your feet and ignite your hearts i would recommend this place to all my friends and family!

title: Great time!
review: I enjoyed Lips. The food was amazing. Our server was extremely nice and their service was outstanding. The show was amazing and the host made the night. Her jokes was so funny and me and my party enjoyed her the most.

title: Such FUN!
review: We had a wonderful time!!  The staff was incredibly kind, the show was really fun and the food was delicious!!!  We could not have had a better time!!

title: Birthday
review: Enjoyed the show and the birthday acknowledgment and reduced drinks   I will come back again and bring more make friends as I think they would find the shows entertaining and the well dressed guys as truly exotic

title: GREAT TIME! GREAT FOOD! GREAT PLACE
review: My friends/family surprised me with a bachelorette party. The place was beautiful. I was in awe of the detail in the decorating. Everyone was friendly. Customer service is some of the best. Performances were great!! The food was soooo good! Seasoned perfect! I’d go back alone for that. The chicken Parmesan was what I had and I’m hooked. The host was hilarious and so warming. She takes shots at everyone but it’s all in good fun. Please don’t be sensitive because it’s not meant to hurt you. PLEASE VISIT!!!! Almost forgot the drinks were good too! Try the kick that b*tch to the curb lol

title: Everything and More!
review: Visited Lips for the first time in Chicago and I have to say it was the best drag experience I’ve had to date. I went to Gospel Brunch. Top notch performers, not to mention hilarious. Lots of brunch options. I loved the crab cake benedict. The environment was super camp, in a good way. Will definitely visit again when in town.

title: Heaven on Earth
review: If I Could so would die here, and the queen that answers the phone gives me the life I need to keep going!!

title: BEST TIME EVER
review: Love love this place the food and shows are absolutely fabulous. I’ll be back again and again. The atmosphere is something to behold.

title: Lips Is Heaven On Earth
review: I have now been to 3 out of 5 locations Lips has to offer. The soft opening for the Chicago location did not cease to amaze me. Inside the venue is absolutely jaw dropping, I felt like royalty the moment I walked through the threshold, and the food is to die for, actually finger licking good. Lets not forget about the Queens, who gave a show to remember. The energy, the lights, the glamour. I will definitely be back again and again.

title: Good atmosphere and great food
review: I had the 12 hr pot roast dish which taste so amazing it literally melted in my mouth and my husband ordered fish and chips and he also enjoyed it very much. Our server Savanna was awesome and the atmosphere in general is great. It...also has a little band in the corner who’s great. I hope if your in town you get a chance to unwind and taste the amazing food.  Bar/Dining restaurant.More

title: Disappointed
review: I was in town visiting friends.  I stopped here myself my first night. It was a little busy, and I sat at the bar.  Took about 5 minutes to get a beer.  The bartenders seemed more interested in the service bar and the wait staff...than the customers.  I had one beer and left.  It seems like a place to go with a large group rather than by yourself.More

title: Cool South Loop Bar with Good Food
review: We stopped in for a quick bite to eat.  Got chili and short rib tacos.  They were both very good.  The service was good and the noise level was quite low at lunch.  Great stop before or after a bears game.

title: Chicago visit
review: First impression isn’t so great. Appears worn down place, ready for re beatification. Outdoor chairs almost all with broken seats. Service is OK. Server forgot to bring silverware. Selection of beers was good and we enjoyed it. Food was good. We liked turkey burger. Overall...mediocre place, not bad but not to crave to come back.More

title: It's bar food, people, but friendly
review: The turkey burgers were average, the noise level high, and service was uneven. That said, lots of TVs, good beer list and good sweet potato fries. Just be patient and thirsty.

title: Not coming back
review: Food was average, wine was overpriced and the menu quite limited. Only good thing was the service. Average.

title: Fun Place
review: We absolutely loved the atmosphere in this sports bar. We devoured flat breads after  long day in the city, they were definitely delicious. Chicken wings and nachos were ok. Jalapeno Martini, Moscow mule are a must!

title: Just another sports bar
review: Been there a couple of times now, mainly because I live a couple of blocks away. Being new to the neighborhood, was told this was a hot spot. First visit was rather disappointed as its just another sports bar. Burgers, wings, etc. Their claim to...fame is their assorted foot long grilled cheese sandwiches. OK, unique but nothing to write home about. Service is ok, not bad but not stellar. On the upside, the second time I went, had the fish and chips (I like mine crispy) and it was really good. 3 huge pieces of tender flaky white fish, nice crispy batter, and good chips. (Can't stand if they are soggy and they were not.More

title: Yummy food, decent service
review: We both enjoyed our meals (one grilled cheese and the other mac and cheese). This place was a random choice because it was near our hotel, but it is worth considering if you’re in the area.

title: Yum
review: The Faroe and Quinoa salad is my absolute favorite. The atmosphere is great and can’t go wrong with anything on the menu.

title: Best kept secret for Brunch
review: Friends took me to The Scout Waterhouse + Kitchen for brunch.  At first, I was hesitant, since we were walking into a bar for Sunday breakfast.  I wondered how a bar could possibly serve a decent weekend brunch?  To my surprise, the menu was very...More

title: Things changed
review: Came here Sunday to have my mom try my favorite Turkey burger.  I have bragged about it for years.  Not sure what’s changed but it tasted like rubber and with zero flavor.  The service was so great and the beer list amazing which is why...More

title: Food, Fun and Fellowship with Great Service
review: I was in town for a training. We all came to The Scout for dinner. We had an absolutely delightful time. We were able to socialize over dinner (the food was great)while enjoying top notch service. A great Place for Food, Fun & Fellowship

title: Great food and lots of TVs
review: Pleasantly surprised by the amazing food here. Very comfortable local spot a mile from Wintrust Arena

title: decent 'reliable' food
review: More or less a standard array of comfort food choices, maybe a bit tweaked for a Chicago theme.  Not far from my hotel and a great place to watch the world series (loads of TVs and the place is very big).  Good quinoa bowl, good...More

title: Top ten bar with killer food??? Yeeeessssss.
review: So we show up right after the Chicago marathon. We are a large group with people coming and going. The place is jam packed for NFL Sunday plus tired marathoners. A recipe for disaster,right? Wrong! Drinks were promptly supplied, the food was delivered, let the...More

title: Nothing special
review: Service was very fast, the food was average. The quality of the food was just okay.  There are much better options in Chicago.

title: Service confused and slow, food average.  Skip this one....
review: Went here end of July before a concert at Meigs Field (Oops!  Northerly Island)…  the service person forgot to take everyone's order and had to be run down to finish, the food delivered after a 45 min wait did not match what was ordered for...More

title: Ok drinks, awful service
review: Dropped in for a late night drink after dinner. Drinks were ok, but not worth the price. Service was terrible, we will not return!

title: Beware: check your credit card statement
review: Cliff note version:This Scout lacks attention to detail in billing and follow up on customer complaints.   The details: Stopped in for a beer before a concert at Soldier Field on 8/11/18.  Beer was $7.  Imagine my surprise when the charge posted to my credit card...More

title: After game stop
review: My friends and I stopped here after a baseball game for drinks and appetizers. It was nice so we sat outside.......The drinks were good and very reasonable for Chicago. Could have been happy hour prices...not sure. We got wings and nachos and both were plentiful...More

title: Late evening dinner
review: Arrived in Chicago after 8:30 pm and The Scout was right around the corner.   The food was very good.  Got the Cuban footling grilled cheese.  It was great.   Only problem was the loud music inside.  Outside was full.   Service was good but the server could...More

title: consistently very good
review: went for late night dining and late afternoon lunch. Both visits were very good with attentive service and above average food

title: Nice Place to End the Day
review: In town for business and I was looking for a nice place to kick back and have a couple drinks after a long conference day.  Met a local and asked where to go and she actually offered to take me there.  Convenient location with street...More

title: Great drinks and atmosphere, Ok Food
review: The margarita was tasty.  I got the fish tacos and they were pretty good.  I tried my friend's short rib grill cheese and it was tasty too.  I was not wowed by the food, but it was not bad either.  I would go again and...More

title: The place for sports fans to go in Chicago
review: I stopped here out of curiosity for a late lunch during a recent business trip. It's located near Soldier Field and caters to sports fans. I came mid-Sunday afternoon, and the place was packed. Despite that, I didn't have to wait to be seated at...More

title: Quite unpleasant
review: I live about 2 blocks from The Scout and need to remind myself to limit my visits to nice summer days.  Went to dinner early Saturday night.  They were pretty busy with a few parties and football playoff game.  As usual, the artificial sound blasted...More

title: Amazing food!
review: I was recommended to this restaurant by one of the record at my hotel and was not disappointed.  It was only 2 blocks away and so easy to get to. I had the 12hr pot roast which was to die for and very filling as...More

title: Noisy venue but great to watch sport.
review: Counted 17 TVs that I could see from my table, great for watching sport. Food ok, beers were cold, service good. Would eat there again.

title: If it’s on, they’ve got it!
review: The first thing you’ll notice about The Scout is there isn’t a spot on any wall that’s not filled with screens. Everything worth watching is on multiple screens and seating is positioned to provide great viewing angles. It reminds me of the sports rooms in...More

title: OK bar in Chicago
review: My drinking buddy and I ended up here by accident, when our green line train was halted at nearby Roosevelt station due to an 'incident' - it seemed churlish to not have another drink before ordering a car to get back home. There is rather...More

title: Great Food
review: Love , love ,love  A must!  Great food, everything we had was delicious . Comfortable seating and music was good. Waitress was ready good. Friendly staff and very clean. This was our first time here. And cant wait to come back

title: Nice restaurant near Roosevelt
review: Large portions, great bar with tons of televisions with Sports coverage. Went over for lunch with friends on a weekend. Ample seating, decent staffing. Food was delicious. We went with footlong grilled cheese, footlong caprese sandwich with tomato bisque, tater tots and bread pudding. Would...More

title: Retirement Celebration
review: Retirement celebration for a long time Loyola Medical Center employee. The service was absolutely some of the best I've seen and it was a very busy, hectic and noisy time for about 4 hours. My hats off to our sever Shab and the manager (whose...More

title: Good Burger, but not worth it
review: Quick burger run, mid-afternoon, found a usual sports bar atmosphere.  The positive, good burgers with efficient, friendly service.  The asparagous as a side was novel and welcomed.  The negative, was a stereo set to 11, a very loud group at the bar (what was their...More

title: Good pub food...
review: We enjoyed the food and the atmosphere.  We had the copy cat burger and the monster midway- two really good burgers.

title: Incredible...
review: Gastro pub-food. We were looking for a BBQ joint on Sunday morning and thought one was within reach, but when we arrived it wasn't going to open for another 5 hours. A Chicago local (typical friendly!) recommended The Scout. When he said foot long short...More

title: Very good food, good location for Soldier Field Event
review: Although it was extremely crowded, we enjoyed the food and drink before heading to the U2 concert at Soldier Field.  Fun atmosphere too.

title: Expensive because of location
review: Its pricey because its a typical hangout pre-game or concernt given its proximity to Soldier Field. Service is good. Can barely hear music. Food is average.

title: Neat restaurant with al fresco dining
review: Just stumbled across this place and stopped in because I have a dog named Scout. Food was a bit on the spicy for me, but I'm a lightweight in that arena.

title: Sunday late lunch
review: We visited this establishment with my son his wife and their 3 year old and 7 month old children.   We were quickly seated. Our server was very good with the young kids and paid special attention to them. This made the entire experience great!  At...More

title: Great spot for lunch or to watch a game
review: We stopped for lunch with our son and his girlfriend. The food was very good and service was fast for being fairly busy. The place itself was a little loud and hard to hear the music or the games. We would go here again.

title: The Scout is worthy of its many awards
review: Whether you drop in to The Scout at 1301 South Wabash Avenue for "Happy Hour" or brunch or lunch or dinner or a late-night snack or just for drinks, you're in for a treat. This rustic watering hole with a long beer list, a huge...More

title: Great spot for drinks and snacks
review: We went here for 'happy hour' after our friend got off of work. We basically just picked somewhere close that had good reviews on whatever forum she looked at. We got a nice spot and the drinks and food were really great. We ended up...More

title: Good spot
review: Good food, good venue with outdoor seating available. Nice staff offering good service. My second time was just as good as the first.

title: Love the burgers and nachos
review: Stopped in for dinner after our trade show.  Had the chicken nachos and burger.  Both were excellent as well as our server.  Would definitely go back!

title: Great neighborhood feel bar for everyone
review: Not sure why, but I tried this place in the evening on St. Patrick's Day and day 2 of NCAA tournament. Very happy I did. Crazy packed and deafening loud. But, the staff was terrific! I was drinking Black & Tans. It seemed as if...More

title: Great service, decent food, but LOUD
review: My wife and I had dinner at The Scout last Friday.  Our server, Hailey, was super friendly and took good care of us.  They also had other staff checking on us, clearing empty plates & glasses, etc. so the service was great.  My wife had...More

title: Amazing Place
review: While on a girls weekend and shopping at Chicago we were trying to decide where to eat dinner.  There were four of us, two adults and two teens.  A young woman overheard us talking a suggested a place that she works part time.  The Scout....More

title: Great Pub atmosphere in the south loop
review: Enjoyed great hearty food at the Scout in the south loop...I had the 12 hour pot roast and it was so good and sooo comforting... definite reminded of Grandma's pot roast.  The 12 hour pot roast is a generous helping of roasted pot roast over...More

title: Great Food, Very Loud
review: First the good... our server was great and the food was excellent. We started with the chicken nachos, they were delicious. I had a burger (very good) and the other two had a prime rib sandwich and fish and chips. They also liked theirs. Huge...More

title: College football championship
review: Great sports bar in downtown Chicago. Good bar food with cold drinks. Bar wasn't terribly busy and the service was good.

title: Good Sports Bar
review: This is your typical sports bar, with a million televisions.  You can't miss them from any angle in the restaurant.  The staff here is great and the food is top-notch.  If there was a drawback, it was that it was stifling hot, but the place...More

title: Food and a beer
review: Stopped after a recommendation from a local.  Had great service and got our food quick even though they were very busy.  Had the Copy Cat burger., which is a bacon cheeseburger with egg on it. It was fabulous.  Other person In our party had the...More

title: Lunch at Scout
review: Best bar in the south loop, my wife and I take all of our out of town guests to visit this fantastic bar/restaurant

title: Another One for the South Loop
review: Rather than eat in, we ordered take out from The Scout.  Our order was ready at the appointed time and the take out service was good.  Of course I can't say much about the ambiance or service for a sit down meal.  But we thought...More

title: Local place in South Loop
review: Small enough to be the local sports bar with the perfect blend of bar food (burger, wings etc) and TVs. But big and unique enough to be on any tourist must do for the foot long grill cheese with tomato soup dipping sauce

title: Awesome foot long grilled cheese
review: First time visiting and we were extremely pleased with all of our choices.  Three of us shared the foot long grilled cheese and an order of nachos, plus my son ordered the burger.  I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting the downtown area...More

title: Great bar
review: Good food; good beer list; excellent service. fun place for really good pub food and some pretty good draft beer

title: Great sandwiches, friendly neighbor hood pub
review: Great service and tasty upscale bar food.  Chicken sandwich with fried green tomato was delicious.    Would go back again!

title: A Sport/Foodie/beer geeks dream location!
review: Took a break to get out of our meetings & stopped at The Scout this week. A recommendation from a complete stranger we encountered walking on South Michigan. THANK YOU again sir! The wide open yet not loud atmosphere with televisions in every direction, a wonderful pub like menu and darn near every beer ever brewed on their menu made this a must try location while in Chicago! I had the rock shrimp and calamari and two IPA's that I had personally never tried. My friend went with the clam chowder that had chorizo in it, I didn't get his opinion mainly because after his first spoonful it was then devoured at a very rapid pace! Granted the basketball game hadn't started while we were there, but the service was some of the best that I've personally ever had been afforded the pleasure of having in many other cities.Great location, great atmosphere, good food and a spectacular beer list.

title: Not great, treated poorly by staff
review: We went to Chicago for an NFL game to see our team and the Bears play. Yes, we wore our team gear inside and were polite and got on the wait list, they said 30 minutes, the place was packed at 10 am with the game starting at 2. One of the guys taking names told us there was some space at the back bar and walked us back there only to find there was no space, in the meantime, they never put our name on the list so several other parties were put on the list while we were being dragged to the back. Seemed like it was on purpose. Then there was no place to go except get shuffled around the front area. Bartenders were rude and ignored us. Greeters again said 30 min, but nothing was moving and we started seeing other parties behind us get seated. Food looked good, but we never got the chance to find out. Bottom line, maybe check this place out on a non game day but since Chicago is full of great places, you can skip it for the poor treatment. If you go on game day, my advise is to reserve a table, wear Bears gear over your team gear and then take it off after you are seated :). Funny thing is, we are lovers of football history and players, so we took all kinds of pictures of the Bears greats stuff on the walls at the stadium and my cat is named Payton, after Walter, not Manning. Sure hope opposing fans coming to my town get treated better than we did.

title: Nachos nachos nachos
review: They are one of the best!! I love going to scout during sports season! The nachos are my go to fave! Always a good crowd and I always meet cool people.

title: Amazing.
review: Quick service.  Great Food. Awesome environment. There isn't much more to say. 10 stars. COME HERE! Great selection of alcohol and great food. Family friendly as well!

title: Great grilled cheese Sandwich.
review: Picked this place as was recommended in a chicago guide. One block from Roosevelt train station really easy to get to. Sports bar feel and nice wooden tables and bar. Sports on tv's. Good selection of beers craft and IPA. I had the famous triple cheese grilled cheese sandwich this was served with tomato and basil dip. (Pretty much tomato soup) $12. The bread was brioche style so a little sweet but very tasty. Would've like it a bit more toasted but was yummy worth going for. A nice white bear for 7 bucks. Will be back.

title: Great dinner!
review: By far the best black bean burger in Chicago! The restaurant was busy but, we still had great service. We would definitely go back again!

title: great burger and beer
