review: This is a great bar with great food and drinks. We ordered a burger each and they did not disappoint us. They have a good beer selection and other drinks as well. It's a kid friendly place...

title: Great bar and grill
review: Tons of televisions at this place and the food is great. Can't go without trying the chicken nachos. Great place to watch Saturday and Sunday football or cruise in for weekday beer with awesome short rib grilled cheese sando.

title: Loud sport bar atmosphere, so good with children
review: We were there recently with family, including children aged 2, 6, and 10. They had a kid friendly menu with a wide variety of selections for adults. Their grilled cheese sandwiches are varied and unique. The Alaska halibut was excellent and had a very nice presentation.

title: Busy but good
review: Our group of 5 went in after running the Ditka Dash at Soldiers field. The place was packed with other runners so we expected to wait. There was a lot of standing room and we were even able to get a drink while waiting. The wait was about 45 minutes, which wasn't bad since we needed a booth, not a table. The prices were very reasonable, and the food was great. The prime rib dip was delicious and the foot long grilled cheese was amazing! Portions were huge -- we all took home leftovers. Good place to go to watch a game since there are TV's everywhere. I'll definitely go back!

title: Great food and 823,426 televisions.
review: Surprisingly good food for a sports bar. If you like sports, you'll find a TV at each table that you can switch to whatever game you'd like to watch. If you DON'T like sports (like me), I recommend going at an off time when it's quieter.

title: Not Just a Sports Bar
review: We headed to The Scout for a fundraiser on a Saturday night. The décor was stone/brick walls with huge windows overlooking the street and TV's in every open spot. It was a much more casual atmosphere than I expected. A great place to watch games for sure. There is a large bar and restaurant area in the front. We were in the back area, smaller, with another large bar, and lots of hi-top tables. Our server was great, quick at refreshing our drinks and pleasant. The food was really the highlight here that sets this place well above the average sports bar. Interesting selections and standard fare - done very very well. We will be back for sure!

title: Gameday morning shenanigans
review: We met up with some friends here about 10am two hours before the Bears kickoff. This place was rockin' and looked like it had been for a while. A wait for a table for 4 was pushing an hour, so we fought through the crowd at the bar and not only scored some drinks, but a menu where we ordered the greatest foot long fried egg, ham, & grilled cheese sandwich I've ever had. By the time our table was ready, we were well fed and ready for the hike to Soldier Field. Everyone at Scout was friendly and the service looked like a well oiled machine for a gameday brunch. We walked by post game and the place was still packed. Above average bar food.

title: The Scout for Sunday Brunch
review: Me, my wife, daughter, grandson, and son-in-law just returned from the Scout. The day was sunny and a bit humid. We were cool inside with a nice breeze. My grandson has some allergies so my daughter was concerned. The waitress worked with us and we ordered a hamburger with out a bun, as my daughter had a bun with her so my grandson was happy. Food was prepared quickly and was plated properly. We will return.

title: Great food and drinks and great service.
review: Went there to watch some pre-season football with co-workers and had a great time. Several of the people in my group got the grilled cheese, which was real good and I got the prime rib dip. My sandwich was delicious and the service was top notch.

title: Great menu
review: Went with family after a show at northerly island. We had drinks a Moscow mule and strawberry cucumber press each delicious. I had fish and chips which were crunchy and delicious, not greasy at all. Hubby had short rib grilled cheese with the tomato soup dip. So good. One son had short rib tacos with a salad. Both were delicious and fresh. Another son had the chicken parmesan sandwich which was very large portion and good not dry at all. Wish it was closer. It was late on a Thursday and a lot of patrons. A very loud place.

title: Very good pub grub
review: Our group of 5 plus infant tried a little of everything: short rib sliders, fish tacos, chicken/fried green tomato sandwich, flatbread pizza, BBQ Chicken wings, spicy string beans. Everything was delicious. Service was attentive and friendly. Prices were reasonable. We'd definitely go back.

title: The Scout was a pleasant surprise with good food, friendly staff, and nice atmosphere!
review: We walking along the street and came across The Scout. From the outside, with opening seating facing the street, the place was lively with people and the food smelled good, so we decided to have dinner here. It so happened the food was really good, better than thought and yes we will come back. Loved sitting near the open street area with the sights of Chicago in the background.

title: Go Ahead and get the Grilled Cheese
review: The Triple Cheese Foot Long Grilled Cheese with tomato sauce for dipping was classic and yummy. I wish I would have gotten the Rib or Wolff Version, but I was scared of the size. It's not that big, just take home half.

title: Best of the South Loop
review: Awesome classy sports bar with televisions in every nook and cranny and even individual televisions in select booths. Better than that was the incredible burger and sweet potato fries. Although we just moved into the neighborhood yesterday, we were treated like regulars from the management to the servers. A south side gem.. even if it wasn't a game day! I am sure it rocks when the Bears are in town because of it's location and friendliness!

title: Very good and not so good.
review: My daughter and I went here for dinner in December. It was on a weekend and it was quite busy. A couple of locals had told us it was a decent place to get food. Well, we agreed and disagreed. My daughter had the Cranberry Waldorf Salad and said it was the best salad she had ever eaten. I had the Foot Long Short Rib Grilled Cheese, and was very disappointed. I had expected more than what I consider to be a "sprinkling" of short rib and minimal cheese on the sandwich which came with a $15.00 price tag. Maybe they would have been better off making it a normal size sandwich, and maybe it was just a fluke. I like to give places the benefit of the doubt, so I won't say that I wouldn't go back. Seemed like a great sports bar.

title: Not a bar for chatting
review: This is a great bar in the south loop, but only if you want to drink with the guys and watch the game. I went on a Monday night for dinner with some friends, and at 8pm (sharp) the DJ turned up the music so loud that I couldn't even yell to the person across the table from me. I could only talk to the person beside me. I noticed several tables around us frustrated with this and having to lean in and yell. Very hard to have a conversation and we left shortly after. The server seemed to be frustrated as well as she couldn't communicate with us.

title: Fun sports bar
review: This place is fairly large, with multiple TV's and big bar area. The food is on a "gourmet bar" menu and is worth trying if you are watching a game. During summer they have a great patio area as well.

title: Count the televisions
review: Ate here tonight. I suppose that it would be classified as a sports bar, judging by the number of TV's.However the sound level was reasonable, the food was certainly very quick to arrive, and the service was good.The food was very good, I would certainly recommendthis place for a quick, fast meal.

title: Game day or any day
review: There is no better place in the Chicago for both before and after a football game. The food is fabulous and the service even better. We enjoyed game day so much we went back during the week and it was just as great. A true neighborhood gem.

title: Sports bar with tasty food
review: Was parked in the south loop for a visit to the aquarium. Found this nice sports bar with tons of TV's. Had the fish tacos which were blackened and just the right amount of spice. Server was attentive. A relaxing end to a day touring the city.

title: Great Sports Bar
review: Really trendy sports bars with tons of TV's. Service was spot on and the food was really good. Highly recommend if you want to watch a game.

title: New untrained server and salty food this; not the normal product
review: The fish and chips were great and well prepared. The Duck sandwich was salty beyond ability to eat. The server was new or untrained and only asked if everything was 'ok' a number of times which I dislike. She didn't get the right type of fries noted with the order but a manager fixed that quickly. I have been before when it was better.

title: Pulled Chicken Nachos are aal you need!
review: A group of three ... We started with the Pulled Chicken Nachos to share ... We could have quit there ... But we didn't. I also enjoyed a serving of the Fish Tacos. Great beer selection, too. Kinda noisy outside ... it was a nice evening so we enjoyed the outdoor seating on busy Wabash. The waitresses brief outfits are worth the visit ... regardless of the food quality.

title: Fun "Upscale" Bar!!
review: I met up a friend from college here when i was in Chicago, based on his recommendation. I had never heard of it but figured he picked it for a reason.It is a pretty big bar/restaurant and overall is pretty cool feel, almost like a more upscale bar without the feeling of being snooty. They had a pretty good drink menu/selection and a really cool dinner menu. It seemed like they had all the favorites (burgers, pasta, etc) but with a fun twist. Everything sounded delicious and i think at one point i wanted at least 6 different items.I settled for their Mac & Cheese as i haven't had mac & cheese in years and their version just seemed totally worth it. And it definitely was! There was chicken, bacon, asparagus, mushrooms, etc. It was definitely delicious and totally worth it! The best part is, it was reasonably priced!I had coworkers heading into Chicago for a different tradeshow a few weeks later and recommended this place. I would easily come back here again.

title: Best sports bar in the south loop
review: A waitress recommended this place on our 2nd night and it soon became our favourite place. We never ate here and always sat at the bar. The beer selection is vast and the servers are friendly and attentive. There is plenty of TV's showing every type of sport you can imagine. The servers are also good for recommending shots and chasers which we sampled...first time I've ever had a Jamesons followed by pickle juice.

title: Great Spot
review: Have never been a fan of the south loop area but of all surrounding establishments this place is king. Great crowd, good music, good service and good food.

title: FUN TIMES
review: My fave hangout spot n the South Loop!! Nachos are a must order!!! Good food, service and always a good time. Game days get there EARLY!

title: Great amosphere  ... Sports bar like
review: Dropped in to have lunch and watch Olympic Hockey competition  ... Really enjoyed the Fish Tacos and the side of Brussel Sprout Salad was a pleasant suprise!  The draft beer selection is quite good also.

title: Best turkey burger ever
review: Split it with my wife, both satisfied with the amount for lunch. The burger was fresh made awesome toppings, going along with the great selection of beers...

title: Perfect Spot
review: Have been here several times and have always enjoyed!  Great service, atmosphere, & food.  Would recommend to anyone.

title: Good Sports Bar
review: Great bar for watching a game. Good bar food and good selection of drinks. Servers and bartenders were all very friendly!

title: Best sports bar
review: Great atmosphere...Food was great..banana bread cake with ice cream to die for. If your in the south loop area and in mood to watch a game or hang out with friends ,this is it.

title: TVs for every football fan
review: I was staying in Chicago through the weekend and was trying to find the Patriots game. I couldn't find any "Patriots" bars online near Grant Park, but luckily I found The Scout. Along with many TVs for the Bears, they had at least one TV with every other game.I didn't get any food, though what I saw servers carrying by looked good. I'd definitely try eating here my next time in Chicago.The bar was packed (it was during a Bears home game), but the bartenders were good about getting out drinks. They had a pretty good beer selection and Goose Island 312 was on tap for only $4.50.

title: Very enjoyable outside dining
review: Stopped here on a whim..looked perfect for al fresco dining. The inside was loud but outside was really nice..lots of activity on the busy street. Three meals at our table were all really good..veggie spaghetti, upscale mac and cheese and pot roast. Would definitely go back. I can see where it would be fun to watch a game here.

title: Best place to watch the game in the South Loop.
review: This is a large sports bar with pretty good food. Try one of the foot long grilled cheese sandwiches, you won't be disappointed. Get here early on game day because it fills up fast. The beers on tap are pretty good. I can't complain at all about the service, never have had a problem getting my food and/or drink in a timely manner. Best to take the El and get off at Roosevelt because parking is limited in this area.

title: Bar Food Taken to Another Level
review: Very good food for a sports bar, and great selection of beers and drinks. Have eaten here and taken out numerous times and have never been disappointed.

title: 2 different visits
review: First time went with wife. Great atmosphere, waitress helpful. Had decent wings and good beer.Second visit wasn't much busier, and atmosphere still buzzing, but service very patchy. Like the varied beer menu, and visibility of multiple screens with a variety of sports sated my appetite for multisensory inputs.

title: Lots & Lots of TV Screens
review: Loads of big flat screen TVs everywhere. Go to watch the game.  The sevice is nice.  The food is very average. The noise level can be high. Difficult finding parking on a Wednesday evening.  No valet service.

title: Delicious & good sports viewing
review: I had a delicious burger topped with bacon and a fried egg.  A great place to watch the college football championship, lots of tv screens.

title: Playing the black keys!!!
review: Figure the slow hours and go then.I live in the hood and have a love-hate relationship with the Scout, although I am not sure the Scout is aware of this. I so looked forward to their opening followed by so much disappointment….loud, hard surfaces, too many TVs, untrained staff, and I could go on and on, and often have, but I do admit that their food is good, actually very good. We have settled on weekend brunch (non-game-days) as our best time, the negatives I mentioned are down, and the menu is up, Sausage Gravy and Biscuits (better than 3 Aces), Pot Roast Benny (better than Mom). The bar selection is good, the Blood Mary looks like a meal in its self, and my my doesn’t that 20oz Guinness (liquid bread) go with all those hearty breakfast choices.

title: Quality Sports Bar
review: The Scout is very impressive, with too many TVs to count and always has the best games on, including all NFL games. The staff is made up of lots of beautiful people, but most are not very friendly. It is rare to get a greeting if you sit at the bar, but the atmosphere has all the best the South Loop has to offer.

title: Excellent Sports Bar in South Loop Chicago
review: Went there twice in a short amount of time.Was was excellent!Great atmosphere!The first time the waitress was not very punctual: she made a couple of small mistakes on my order, and we also had to wait for some time to get her attention.But the second time was great, and so were all other waitresses even the first time.Maybe we were unlucky or she had a bad day...No big deal, we were overall very pleased with the experience!Highly recommended!

title: Avoid brunch at The Scout
review: First, we weren't impressed by the the brunch menu options. OK, you might say "this is not a place where you'll go have brunch", point taken! but since they did have a brunch a menu, we thought "how bad can it be" and well, we were actually disappointed. Friend had a breakfast burrito, couldn't finish it because he didn't like it. Boyfriend had a chicken sandwich that didn't really like, other friend had the chicken salad and that was OK and I had a grilled cheese sandwich that was mediocre. So, I wouldn't really recommend it.

title: Nice sports bar in South Loop
review: Great selection of beers, a fairly varied food menu, attentive staff and a good value. We had barbecued duck sandwich, coleslaw, grilled gruyere cheese with bacon and onion jam served with tomato-basil dip and cold beer. Good prices for all items. There were burgers to choose from, but my brother had recommended the grilled cheese. Plenty of fine draft beers from which to choose. Good, quaint location. Service was quick. Lots of tvs. We'd go again. Would be good for kids but not on crazy Bears game day, maybe.

title: Fun spot with great food!
review: Have been here several times and enjoyed everything I've eaten. I've had  NY strip (not on menu anymore :(, foot long grilled cheese and burgers.  Fun bar to watch sports and great when they open the sliding doors.

title: South Loop sports bar
review: This is a great sports bar in my area. Close walk for me since i'm a block away. This is definitely a south loop fave amongst the residents in the area. Food is actually good and there are tons of tv's to watch all the games.

title: Is that all there was?
review: The Scout has a great location in the South Loop. It has great decor and atmosphere, and the waitstaff are very nice. But the menu is limited (that's being generous). My friend ordered the Black Angus Pot Roast and I ordered the Glazed Roasted Chicken Breast. But two minutes later our waitress came back and said they were out of Chicken Breast and if I'd like to order something else. I decided to go with the Pot Roast also (like I had any other choice). But here's the kicker. As soon as the waitress walks away the server from the kitchen shows up with our Pot Roasts. Instantly. My friend and I sat there looking at each other because the food came out so fast that we were afraid to eat it. Was it sitting around? Was it someone's else order that didn't want it? How did he know I would go for the Pot Roast? Anyways we rationalized it away as "there's nothing else on the menu I could have ordered" and "pot roast takes a long time to cook so they must have had it ready to go". The Pot Roast was decent but worth the money? Absolutely not. I was expecting more from The Scout and they didn't deliver.

title: Nothing to write home about.
review: In the trendy South Loop area. A sports bar with average food. Will admit that the atmosphere was upbeat and fun. Not really for old fogies like me, but if I were much younger it would be number one on my list.

title: Fun atmosphere
review: If you like upscale bar food and lots of tvs to watch the big game...this is the place you want to be. Try the grilled cheese!

title: Had a good time Friday after work.
review: Went to The Scout for the first time on a Friday evening about 6:30. This must have been the sweet spot between the 5 o'clock after work drinks crowd and the rowdy later Friday night crowd, because the place was just barely buzzing inside. Then again the outside patio was packed, no tables available. The weather was great so that's where everyone was sitting. Inside it was still nice because there are huge doors flung wide open so the sun and breeze can come in. I thought it was a great atmosphere. Tables were open for immediate seating. There are TV's absolutely everywhere. The inside has the traditional brick walls and wood beams.They had a pretty good beer list. Lots of wheat beers for me and some ciders for the wife. Between us we had a foot long grilled cheese (with bacon!) and the southern salad (it has buffalo chicken, black beans, etc). Both were fine. The grilled cheese was over the top. Lots of cheese, grilled in butter. All told we couldn't eat the whole sandwich. First of all, it was huge, second of all, it was just too rich. The place started to fill up with other people having dinner while we were there, and it was pretty full by the time we left. I believe they take reservations. I recommend The Scout as being one little step up from your average bar food. They do have goat cheese and duck on the menu, you won't find that in most bars. There were other things I would like to try next time. Cannot vouch for the late night atmosphere or the brunch, which I would like to try.Spent $44 total for two people with the food listed above, one beer each, including tax and tip.

title: At least Once
review: If your a visitor from the UK or Europe and your staying on South Michigan Avenue, and want to get a fell for local life in a sports Bar then this is a must, if only the Once. One a quiet, not game evening its tolerable for the more mature visitor, with a good feel to it and some good food as well, although its never going to be classed top eatery is good plain indulgent food. Be aware though, when its busy, it can get a little noisy and you can be left hanging around for a table, even if you can see a free table. If there is a game on then don't even bother, because unless you are at the doors as it opens you ain't getting in. My advice is tourists who want to see Chicago from a local perspective, then visit once on a quiet non game evening, and enjoy it for what it is.

title: A lot of hype--disappointing.
review: We had looked forward to the opening of SCOUT. We were disappointed by the food and atmosphere. It definitely appeals to a young, boisterous crowd.

title: Beautiful restaurant, loud obnoxious people
review: I personally LOVED my salad, but the atmosphere was crazy. We were seated in the back along with drunk, obnoxious fans from the Sox Game (I had also come from the game). At one point there was even a bar scuffle. They screamed from the moment we walked in to the moment we walked out. I was with a fun group of friends and we are by no means fuddy duddies. My advice is to sit in the front.

title: Horrendous customer service, practically racist
review: Last night at The Scout, I noticed that they were making a group of African-American women wait unnecessarily for a table, seating others in front of them. (By the way, I am white). I asked the women if they noticed the same thing and they said that they did- I confronted the host and hostess about it and they blew me off-the host going so far as to turn away from me mid-sentence and talk to someone else. Amazingly, that party was seated immediately and the women waved to me. One went so far as to come over to my table, give me her card, and shake my hand and say thank you.Amazingly, a few minutes later the manager and host came over and confronted me about the fact that I had said something, denying vociferously that they had done anything wrong. They got so agitated that their own bouncer had to tell one of THEM to chill out- remember I was just eating food at my table with my girlfriend at this point.Suffice it to say I let them know I wanted my check and would never come back. On the way out, the host called after us to say "thanks for spending your money here." I returned to tell them I will never spend money there again. I suggest everyone else should avoid this place as well.

title: Not easy to respect people that don't respect you!
review: No matter what you may believe or how you may think you have arrived, not all establishments respect our dollar. Last night (4/4/12) at about 7pm (CST.), I decided to meet my friends at “The Scout” sports bar at 1301 S. Wabash here in Chicago to view the Miami HEAT vs. OKC game. To my dismay, there were no flat screens in the entire venue broadcasting the game. If you ever been to “The Scout” then you know they have over 20 flat screens in the venue. After ordering my food, I politely asked my server if she could change one of the many screens in the back of the establishment to the game. She replied: “sure let me get someone to change it for me”. I waited about 10 minutes but the game was never displayed on any monitors. I proceeded to ask a gentleman that I’ve seen working in a management capacity the same aforementioned question , and of course his reply was in sync with my server: “sure let me get someone to change it for me”. After an additional 10 more minutes of waiting, once my server arrived to serve my 2 friends, I asked if she could have the manager or the manager’s supervisor come to our table. [Side note: let me also say that while I was dressed down with a baseball cap and a fitted white v-neck shirt, I was never rude or belligerent. My friends and I are all 40 and professional. At this stage of our lives we know how to conduct ourselves in a public setting. (NOT THAT ANY OF THAT SHOULD MATTER !!!) ] After waiting 15 more minutes for the “non arrival” of the manager, I decided to go and ask for the manager myself. Yes, I’m fuming at this point because if nothing else he or she should have the common courtesy to at least respond to a customer request for his or her presence. I finally find this gentleman at the front podium and I politely ask if he’s the manger and his reply was “ yes”, so I asked him if he could change one of the many flat screens to the game and his response was ”we’re not turning our monitors to that game tonight”. I asked why and his response was like I said: ” we’re not turning our monitors to that game tonight”. I proceeded to say to him “So let me get this straight--- when venues are begging for customer support in the bar business, for no rhyme or reason, you’re not going to accommodate my request?” No response. With no further explanation offered, my friends and I paid our tab, tipped the server and left immediately. Yes, I had some very choice words that I wanted to impart to that guy but I bit my tongue. I couldn’t believe the treatment! In today’s economy, you make a conscious decision to treat people like dirt! I wanted to believe that we have surpassed so many of the color barrier issues! I was alarmed to discover that there are service providers still functioning in that traditional/primitive way of thinking! What was amazing to me is how we walked directly across the street to a packed FLOS & Santos and asked the gentleman behind the bar if he could turn 1 of only 5 TV’s to the game and he accommodated our request by turning the main screen on and was happy to have our business. We went on to spend $200.00 collectively. While this may not seem like much to you, as a small business owner in today’s economy, this is huge on a Wednesday night. Let me just conclude by saying you have a choice where you spend your dollar so make it a conscious one. I am making a conscious effort to NO LONGER support “The Scout” or any of its related functions!!.

title: I'm done with this place!
review: I live across the street from this place and when it first opened, my wife and I were very excited. It's a sports bar with really good food. Having been there at least 15 times, we have seen a DRAMATTIC change in the clientele, and not for the better. We had dinner there last night at 6pm and we kept waiting for a fight to break out. The crowd was rude and there were multiple drunks at the bar who couldn't stand without bracing themselves on the bar. I felt like I was in a college bar with 18 year old boys drinking (to excess) for the first time. The food is good, but not worth the trouble any longer. Sorry Scout, but unless things change, your neighborhood sports bar theme is done!

title: Exactly what the south loop needed or anywhere.. awesome
review: I one love the scout, i live a couple blocks away and go there semi- frequently. Before after bears games its packed but the place to be win or lose. away from that it is popular and busy all the time every night.A great place to go with friends, meet other people, men, woman etc... the waitress's and bartenders are good looking. the food menu is extensive and so good. foot long grilled cheese.. come on its the best. Also the best bar in the south loop, a must stop at some point. It was disappointing but even this last friday i went to go and they were at capacity.. thats crazy for the south loop. The service from the staff is good, but it feels like the owners dont put that same care into it or passion.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: What a rip off! Terrible food - the $15 fries were frozen - manager was very argumentative. Terrible experience
review: Disgusting food - manager argumentative/ after bad food we see a sign that says - even if the food is bad you pay 50%! Save your money

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Worth every penny!
review: Very welcoming!  Staff accommodated my family of six!  Food was delicious!  Be prepared to spend but it was worth it!  Also... the kids meals have very large portions.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: If you like oysters, this is the place
review: At first, my wife and I were hesitant about dining at Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks. Why? Because we aren't into oysters or sushi or raw fish of any kind, which is the restaurant's specialty. But the website indicated we might be overlooking a good thing. So we made a reservation. And we're glad we did. Located at 1933 South Indiana Avenue in Chicago's McCormick Square, in the South Loop, next to the McCormick Convention Center, it has been specializing in raw fish, oysters, sushi, sashimi and other seafood since 2013. It has earned a reputation for "best grilled oysters in Chicago" and "one of the top 21 oyster houses in the United States" while serving customers in a bright and airy space with a modern flair. The oyster bar showcases more than 60 oyster selections from the East and West coasts. And if you are very thirsty, you can purchase a red wine by the bottle, Meritage, 1/6 Opus One, from Napa, California, for $595. We aren't wine drinkers, either. But there were plenty of tasty options to satisfy our tastebuds--and in our price range, too. We started with a plate of jumbo chilled shrimp, two bowls of New England clam chowder with fresh clams, potato, onion, carrots and celery and Caesar salad with romaine, croutons and parmesan cheese. For an entree, my wife chose grilled Scottish salmon topped with mint and basil sauce with steamed white rice and sauteed broccoli with garlic. I opted for a 10-ounce center cut filet with Wasabi mashed potatoes and sauteed baby spinach with garlic. For dessert, we shared a large slice of key lime pie and white chocolate blueberry cobbler. Chicago Oyster House is open from 5 to 9 Sunday, Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday and 5 to 10 on Friday and Saturday. Next time, I might be encouraged to discover if southern fried oysters are as good as they sound.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Chicago Restaurant Week last Night with Roc
review: Chicago Oyster HouseSome place close....Sunday night and we were out for dining....The location was familiar and the restaurant has changed.The door was still hard to open, the warm of the restaurant was new.... The greeting was very friendly and neighborly.The menu was See (Sea) food and it was on point.This was Chicago Restaurant Week last day. This was a great choice by my cousin.Roc has clam chowder (it was in the bowl-the clam Himself), sea weed salad, and was able to extend her meal by have bites for the four course meal across the table.The four course meal included a Caesar Salad with the anchovies (room to upscale) have great favor and the green were fresh with shaved Parmesan, and four croutons (who’s counting). The 2nd course was Shrimp Shumai (steamed shrimp dumplings). This did not sit well with Rochelle.The 3rd course were 3 well plated lamb chop prepared medium temperature was Thai sauce reduction that was very tasty.The last (4th course) course was just to little yet great taste. The crust was very pleasing and the filling with the whipped cream on top on the pie allow the palate to be pleased.Yes we did get the ala carte spinach. Carmen coached us well on making sure the spinach would have dripping with water. This meal takes Ala Carte service to Highest level. This is a place to return after Chicago Restaurant Week.Carmen was the great....Shalom

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Mandatory 20% Service Charge
review: Calamari and soft shell crab appetizers were served warm - not hot.    Service was mediocre and to demand a 20% service regardless of party size infers that service should be at the least very good.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Good restaurant close to McCormick Place
review: This is a smaller restaurant with fresh fish, sushi, and fish appetizers. The menu is not extensive. There is a fish of the day as well as shrimp and other shellfish. There is beef on the menu, but the portions are very large. The fish was cooked perfectly and the service was excellent. All sides are al a cart, so a bit pricey. It is within walking distance of the Hyatt and Marriott Marquis that are connected to McCormick Place.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Very good seafood and service
review: Dined on a Friday night. Place was quiet with few patrons. Probably due to location. Not much else nearby. Dined here due to proximity to hotel where we were staying. Ambiance is nice; small venue and intimate. Front area has large tv and bar. Service is very good and so was food. Had fried oysters and ceviche for starters. Both fresh and very good, particularly ceviche. Sea bass and crab legs were very tasty. Cocktails also good. Desserts were also good; key lime pie small and tasty. Chocolate cake very rich. They missed that we were celebrating a birthday and didn’t ask. Noted in reservation. Overall an enjoyable meal and experience.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Solid seafood options; all fresh.
review: We had a private party, the drinks were free flowing and the food was good. We really didn't have any other seafood outside of oysters. The oysters were, however, fresh, briny, and tasty.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Restaurant
review: Absolutely wonderful. Staff super nice and attentive. Food was excellent too. They take reservations also.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Superb oysters
review: The fresh oysters were very good. The food was excellent. Service beyond excellent. I can't explain how much i love this plce. You must try fresh oysters, southern fried oysters, clam chowder, grilled prawns. No dissapointment.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: What a Gem
review: We were going to a little experimental theater just a couple blocks away and found this gem. Quiet, white tablecloths, small but interesting menu. Every item we had was delicious, and very reasonable for the city. Save room for dessert!

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Worst meal we had
review: Crab legs were cold, friends calamari inedible, very noisy, more attentive to large parties around us

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Thoroughly enjoyed the food and ambiance!
review: Ate here with some co-workers recently. Saddled up to the bar, and had some drinks. Decided on the ny strip steak (excellent) and we had some truffle fries, sushi rolls, and some other apps. All were wonderful. Helpful, fun staff, and a modern (but comfortable) design throughout the restaurant add to the score here. Definitely recommend this place if you are in the area.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Very good, but not quite memorable.
review: its very comfortable, stylish but not snooty.  The food was good, well presented.   We started with oysters Rockefeller, shared the grilled shrimp and salad.  The side of wasabi mashed potatoes was excellent.  Beer, wine.......no breads. Best part:  not noisy!

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Chicago visit for
review: The Chicago Oyster House was a perfect night out.  Great oysters and cocktails.  Stayed in the bar area all night, got great service.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Delicious!!
review: Really great food and service!  The restaurant is small so make a reservation before you go.  I had the scallops which were really tasty.  The others in my party had the sushi which they really enjoyed.  Would recommend to anyone who wants good seafood

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Blue Point, Plymouth Champagne and...
review: Blue Point, Plymouth Champagne, fanny bay and kumamoto oyesters were the best of the buch in my humble opinion...  the clam chowder is delicious!  Go, you will like this place alot.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Nice place out of the way
review: We were staying at the hotel near the convention centeer and found this wonderful resturant. It does have all three - seafood, Steaks & chicken. It is a very nice place not to large and there is good lighing. The staff was good as was the food. It is not cheep but I thoguth the prices were fair.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Worst ever dining experience!
review: From the second we sat down the waiter was badgering us to order our dinners We just wanted to relax with a cocktail for a minute but waiter was relentless about ordering Our appetizers arrived with our hot food and the waiter was pushing us out Food was mediochre at best and very pricey Service was just awful Waited to speak to a manager for 10 minutes No-one showed up NEVER patronize this horrible place!!!

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Interesting Menu
review: In had oysters and they were excellent, but was not too please with the surf and turf sushi, sounded good, but I'll go for the real stuff next time I go, will definitely be returning.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Solid seafood meal, good service, big city prices
review: My colleagues and I had a good meal at the Chicago Oyster House. We chose the restaurant as it was easy walking distance from our AirBnB near the McCormick Center. I’m always a bit suspicious of restaurants that add sushi to an already complicated menu - so we didn’t order any ;-). It seems this place prides itself on access to fresh high quality fish. All of us tried the grilled options and were pleased with the outcome. Our server was friendly, informative and efficient. Some will find the prices high for what you get.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Great seafood
review: We had a great meal here. The oysters were tasty. Entrees were delicious. Fish was cooked perfectly. The only downside was that the server mixed up our ticket with another party and so we were initially charged too much. Luckily we noticed it. We think it was corrected in the end but will keep an eye out on the charges to the credit card. Pleasant evening otherwise. Within walking distance of McCormick Place. Nice place for a birthday meal.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: A Fun Friday Night
review: I ended up at the Chicago Oyster House on a Friday night after a day at a convention. We sat in the bar, which I really enjoyed. There were a few televisions showing local sports, but the environment was not that of a bar and grill. I had dinner and drinks with some friends and we hung out there for a couple of hours.The drink menu has something for everyone from beer, wine, and hard spirits. The menu has a nice variety of seafood that includes sushi, oysters, and other things you would expect a nicer seafood restaurant. It isn't cheap to eat here, but the food is worth it. I had a soft shell crab, some of my friends oysters, and a sushi roll. I was full and content.The service was great. The wait staff was attentive without being intrusive. They wouldn't let us dream of doing anything for ourselves, and they made us feel welcome.It is a fairly convenient walk from the McCormick Convention Center. That said, if the weather is cool, you might consider an Uber or cab ride there.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Food was marginal
review: First, the waiter (who was nice) never asked if we wanted drinks. Not a huge deal but at a nice restaurant this is the 1st thing the waiter should offer. The calamari was overly breaded and not that good. The broccolini has way too much garlic making it uneatable. My teriyaki salmon was good but I did not appreciate everything being ala carte. I was expecting a better experience for the money.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Great service but average seafood
review: Nice venue, great attentive service, but my magi magi was over cooked and dry.  Miso soup looked promising, with nice seafood in it, but was not very tasty.   Calamari was not crispy.  Everything is ala carte.  Not a 4/5.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: birthday dinner
review: This was the best birthday dinner I've had in a long time. Oysters were the best. Service was the best. Atmosphere was the best. We had blue point oysters-oysters rocafeller-clam chowder and 2 entrees. Food was excellent.I had not eaten oysters in 15 years(I got sick) These were so good we ordered more. Our server Becky was the best. Love this place!!

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Good Seafood, Chicago Price
review: As a New Englander I was hesitant to go with a large group to a seafood place in Chicago. However, the selections and quality were better than expected, but cameat a price since it all had to be flown in. We tried some oysters on the half shell and they were good. I had seafood pasta which included mussells and clams in the shell along with a scallop not in the shell, and some calamari. Overall good, but not really the food you travel to Chicago to eat.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Excellent oysters and seafood
review: Sat at the bar and service was excellent. Oysters were fresh and delicious. Miso soup with seafood was a creative take on my favourite soup when eating sushi. Lobster tail was phenomenal.   Highly recommend!

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Great meal in a warm and cozy, sleek environment
review: We were here for a pre-theatre dinner with another couple. Good was great - sushi amazing! Bar menu plentiful. Service was great and we didn't feel rushed to get to the theatre in time.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Great food but heavy on soy sauce
review: This restaurant is into Japanese style food prep. I have a soy allergy and found that nearly everything, including grilled veggies has soy sauce as an ingredient or addition. The staff were very accommodating but if I had known that there was a strong Japanese influence (translate lots of soy), I would not have gone there because I don't like to make a fuss or create a hardship on the chef. But it was good food, had the fried oysters, plain grilled asparagus and the chocolate cake. Friendly staff and very clean establishment.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Excellent Experience
review: Excellent atmosphere, bar, oysters and sushi. Safe and clean area of town that you can walk after dark. Wait staff accommodating and friendly.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Lovely place, great service and great food.
review: We came here for dinner and had a lot of oysters and they were great.  The waitress was very attentive and the restaurant looks nice. I also tried tuna and outstanding.  Highly recommend this place if your are looking for an oyster place.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Horrible Service
review: Waited for service for 20 minutes after being seated and only getting water.  Expected better service and was hoping to, at least, try the food. Good luck to anyone trying to have a meal while visiting Chicago!

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Oyster issue | Sick all Night
review: We were a group of 4 people and had a variety of oysters (25 total decided by 4) as well as sushi rolls. One of us was sick all night due to a (or a few) bad oyster(s). The waitress also lacked obvious edicate as she would barge into our conversations without any finess to ask us random questions. The bill suggests you pay 25% tip... Decent but over rated and make sure to first smell every oyster you eat if you go!

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Great food and nice atmosphere but overly expensive
review: We had a business dinner here and enjoyed seafood and steak. All the food was tasty and nicely and friendly served. Oysters were fresh but very small. Uni was very good and tasty, but again a very small portion for the price. Steak was absolutely as expected and a nice big portion. The shrimp main course were 6 shrimps, the same as for the much cheaper starter, which was not enough. The sides were good and the wine was excellent. So in summary a good experience at a steep price.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Decent if not busy
review: I came to this place for two nights in a row so this is a fair sampling. First night I came as part of a large group after the dinner rush. The service was fine and the food was average to above average. Tonight I went on my own during dinner which is probably more what people care about. I ordered a spicy appetizer and a more bland sushi (surf and turf) to counter that afterwards. The sushi came first (lobster and filet both cold) and the appetizer never came even after I paused multiple times to wait for it. When I finally asked the waiter told me the chef should be making it. The chef proceeded to make other sushis and I was about to say don’t worry about it when it came. Of course, my mouth was burning and I had no bland sushi to calm down my palate. I asked for the check and the waiter didn’t even offer to take the appetizer off or something else to make up for the wrong serving order. Overall, the restaurant didn’t have that many customers but just the dinner rush was too much for the wait staff. Given the fact that when I walked back to the hotel there were people just sitting in their cars with music blasting on Indiana, I won’t be coming back here again.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Best restaurant yet - especially as it was compliments of Google Maps
review: Sumptuous food, excellent staff, amazingly they put up with us. We were noisy, happy and not even drunk! Really delicious food, thank you 😊

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Outstanding Dinner and Outstanding Service
review: We had a wonderful dining experience at Chicago Oyster House on 7/21. First, the oysters are amazing. We had 1/2 dozen raw (Connecticut) and 1/2 dozen of the baked oysters with all 4 preparations. We also had the scallops which were fantastic. Secondly, for dinner we had the fresh fish mahi-mahi, rack of lamb and surf and turf. They were all excellent. Most importantly, we had TREMENDOUS service not only from the waiter, but his partner sure we never had a dirty dish on the table or an empty glass of water. He went above and beyond and I hope the manager recognizes his service.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Great dinner for a couple
review: Loved the location and the atmosphere was terrific..very nice . Started with selection of oysters and they were fresh tasting and delicious. Good bottle of wine (Sauvignon Blanc) for our meal. Went with the Chilean Sea Bass grilled and my date had the Tuna. Both were excellently prepared and so delicious. Loved this restaurant and would love to live in this neighborhood so I could visit it often. Great job to all.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Beautiful restaurant, food was ok.
review: I had dinner with some colleagues here recently while in Chicago. The food was ok and IMO overpriced. I’d give it a try once more to see if my first impression was correct.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Lovely place for lunch and dinner
review: Came here for a quick lunch, love it so much, we decided to come back for dinner- Tasty food- Super friendly service- Reasonable priceLover everything from fresh oyster, fish taco, steak, fresh lobster claw, good wine list too!Highly recommend if you are in the area

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Excellent oysters and seafood
review: Had six raw oysters and the sushi "special." Both were top notch. Oysters were briny and tasty, big and fresh, all from New England. They have a large selection from which to choose. The deluxe sushi included tuna, salmon, yellowtail, shrimp, scallop, unagi and super white tuna sushi, along with a California roll. Haven't had better of either. Highly recommended.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Solid food
review: Close to Hyatt and convention center.  Small restaurant with good service and good food.  Had seafood and sushi.  We didn’t have any oysters or steAk. Portions are standard size (which may seem a little small these days) but food is good and reasonably priced.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Restaurant Week Selection
review: Every year i pick a restaurant for restaurant week. Chicago Oyster House was this year's selection. The ambience of the restaurant was great. Highly recommend for a date night. The school was very good. I had the lamb chops that were exceptional. The fried oysters (not apart of the restaurant week menu) and clam chowder were also outstanding. The wait staff was extremely nice. The only downfall was that we had to wait a long time for food courses.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Nice place to walk from Marriott Marquis
review: Walked over one night from our nearby hotel to try this out. One of the few other restaurants in this area of the Hyatt/Marriiott/McCormick Place. It is s small place with a small bar area and dining room. We tried several of the baked oyster options and they were all very good. One of our guys had the raw ones too and he like them a lot. The main courses were good as well and portion size was large. This is a cozy, neighborhood type place that has great but not superb food in a intimate environment. I would gladly go back.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Seafood
review: nice small restaurant but great service and food. Great calamari and fresh seafood. We had a very friendly server.  Great from begining to end. I recommend this place if your in Chicago.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Don’t let the name fool you...
review: This restaurant has a great menu and it’s not just oysters. The have great fish entrees, steak, sushi, etc. I️ got fried calamari and sesame crusted ahi tuna with wasabi mashed potatoes. Everything was fresh and tasty. The service was fast and friendly.I️ highly recommend this place if you are in the area.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Cool Spot in the South Loop
review: We wandered in after taking a walk to check it out and found the food to be great, atmosphere in the bar area to be inviting and the staff to be very friendly. Its great to have a solid seafood option in the neighborhood. We will definitely be back.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Oyster are on Point
review: We went here for dinner one night and all the food was very good. Good selection of seafood and Oysters. I would go back here if I get back in town.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: It's Not All Oysters!
review: I almost passed on the restaurant because of the name. I'm not a fan of oysters. However, they had a number of other seafood options. They also had sushi and sashimi. We were here for business. Had the teriyaki salmon and it tasted great. Service was really good also.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Wonderful
review: If there weren't so many people in the restaurant, I would've licked the plate clean.  Great service, blues on the sound system, $8 app and $26 entree.  Very easy walk from McCormick convention center.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Too slow
review: Was there with a party of 8. Apps took 45 mins, food took 45 mins. It was wierd having one persons food come out at a time and waiting for the next. We all sat together but didnt eat together. This is my second time there and it was identical visit. Same complaints. I will not go there again. Wasnt very impressed with the waitress. We had to order when it was convenient for her.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Tasty oysters and sushi
review: I wandered down to the Oyster House from the nearby convention center for a bit of a change from hotel restaurant fare. The oysters were delicious as was the sushi. They had a good beer selection and a small but reasonable enough wine selection.I thought it was a little expensive, but I only sat in the bar area, comfortable and casual. The main dining room seemed very nice and might have made for an experience more suited to the prices.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Chicago Treasure
review: If you have a hard time deciding between the Oysters and the Sushi, have both!  Life is short.  Both to die for.  The Ahi Tuni and the fish of the day, Mahi-Mahi were both delicious, and the service faultless.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Birthday Dinner
review: This place is a little off the beaten path but it's worth it! We were staying at the Silversmith and wanted a place that had seafood but wasn't the downtown, over-priced run-of-the-mill so we found this place on Yelp. The lobster was huge! I would definitely reccomend it as a low-key option for a date night or special occasion. We started off with the snow crab legs, I got the lobster, he got the surf n turf -- we both ordered asparagus but could have shared, the portions are big. The steak melted in my mouth when I tried it! Service was good too!

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Great Bar
review: We sat at the bar and had dinner.  The bartender was fantastic.  The food was phenomenal.  We started with fried oysters (best) and had three sushi rolls and the seafood boil.  Nothing disappointed.  Would highly recommend.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Seafood is excellent!
review: This restaurant has seafood and sushi, as one would expect from the name.  However, one in our group had the Angus Beef and it was perfectly cooked.  To top off the evening, try the Sochi Ice Cream!!

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Amazing
review: The food was amazing!  Nice selection of oysters.  Great service and staff was very friendly. Food was fresh and seasoned very nicely. Casual atmosphere and walking distance from the McCormick Place.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Good if you like Garlic :)
review: I'm not complaining, it's a great place to eat just a little garlic heavy. Nice atmosphere and beautiful dining room. The oysters were first class.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Food was ok
review: I went there with my friend. We had grilled oyster that was okay. I had there sushi Deluxet. I'm not really sure if it was a fresh meat. I wouldn't go back there.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Oyster heaven
review: Ordered four appetizers instead of regular entrees.  The calamari fritti edible but far from unforgettable but the oysters were simply sublime.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Good service, tasty food and nice modern ambiance
review: We've arrived late to our reservation but the staff made sure we have time to order before kitchen closed.  We loved the scallops, seaweed salad, spice edamame, hot sake, spicy tuna tolls and their green tea. Sorry we did not order oysters.  The place was...More

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: comfort food
review: had a quiet early dinner on a weekday. The food was simple, flavourful and comforting. ceviche had a good portion and balanced flavours. oysters were good but nothing worth remembering. The staff was great and very helpful.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Out of the way - but great food
review: On a corner away from the main areas of Millennium Park this place is a real find. Excellent food and reasonably priced. Go for the fresh fish which they'll prepare pretty much any way you want.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Amazing!
review: We wanted seafood and we hit the motherload here. Prices are very reasonable. Great ambiance and friendly service .

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Good Food, Interesting Ambiance
review: Promoted as high end, but not so much when you get there. The place was busy when we went (Wednesday evening) so maybe they were understaffed, but we were told we would only get food service if we sat at the bar. The lounge tables...More

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Oysters Galore! No matter how you like them, they have them
review: Oysters from the east coast, west coast prepared for anyone's taste. Great service - go during happy hour and oysters are only $1 each instead of $17 for 6.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Excellent Seafood Boil Close to McCormick Place.
review: If you're staying near McCormick Place and have a hankering for seafood, head on over to the Chicago Oyster House to fulfill your craving.  Just a five minute walk from the Hyatt McCormick Place, the Chicago Oyster House seems a newish eatery on Indiana Avenue....More

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Food better than the atmosphere.
review: Don't get me wrong there was nothing terribly wrong with the atmosphere, but not what you'd expect in Chicago.  It's a neighborhood restaurant.  However, the food was outstanding. The oysters are fresh and shucked well.  Lobster was very good. My friend got the lamb chops...More

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Seafood Delights
review: This place has some of the best seafood and the prices were reasonable. The grilled calamari was delicious! The atmosphere was really nice. If you're in Chicago, you must visit here.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: A pleasant surprise
review: With everything else being overpriced in and around the McCormick Place, what a surprise to get this quality of food at adequate prices. My wife and I shared 5 appetizers and 2 entrees and each were excellent.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Just before a show
review: Stopped in for a quick dinner before a show at Soldier Field.   Great little upscale place before the madness.  Staff was friendly the service was quick and the food was great.  I'll definitely go back when I have a little more time.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Delicious dinner
review: Group dinner - delicious food, prompt service. I personally ordered the fried calamari and Salmon Teriyaki Entrée and I totally enjoyed it.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Slow, not very tasty
review: A group of us visited this restaurant on a weekday evening.  When we were there it was not very busy.  The restaurant is a little upscale and has seafood entrees in the high teens to upper $20 range.  It also offers sushi.   It is very...More

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Hidden Gem!
review: A group of girlfriends and I came in before we went and saw Beyonce at Soldier Field. We were looking for a good restaurant that wasn't too far away from the stadium. We are BEYOND happy we chose Chicago Oyster House.  We love Oysters, so...More

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Cardboard shrimp sashimi
review: Nice staff, at least when it concerns the waitress and the guy taking care of the water and such. Second time around in 12 days but this time both the shrimp sushi as well as the shrimp sashimi tasted like the cardboard blanket of a...More

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Loved the oysters
review: Wow. I had the best southern fried oysters. The service was on point. Food quality was the best. Very clean and comfortable atmosphere. Would gladly go back.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: LOVED the oysters and everything I had
review: I had the best oysters that I have had in a long time!  They were on special for $2/each the night we were there and I have a dozen oysters that were from the greatest oyster spots in the US (also one from Canada).  We...More

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Food was good but the service was amazaing!
review: We were looking for a place fairly close to our hotel and something interesting while we were in Chicago.  We found this place and decided to try it.  The food was okay nothing was bad (the shrimp in the mix grill was a tad bit...More

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: WOW!
review: My daughter and I started with oyster shots. They were the finest start to a magnificent meal. My son ordered the Tuna Sashimi -- TWICE! We tried surf & turf sushi. It will blow your mind. Great service and fine oysters.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Good Eats
review: As an Oyster house in Chicago I say it was pretty good. There was a good selection to choose from and good variety of flavors. I personally had the sushi platter and it was very good. Will return

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Small, Quiet and Intimate
review: Excellent restaurant with great food! They specialize in Sushi but have a very well rounded Menus allowing for a variety of sea foods , steaks or chicken dishes! We wanted a quiet table for 5 so we could catch up with friends! It was perfect!...More

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Good experience in dining
review: On a business trip, we tried this place.  Raw oyster were delicious, a little pricy. Selection was good.  Had the yellow fish cheeks, they were excellent.  The service was excellent.  The menu had a very interesting variety.  Our group had different items, we were all...More

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: A great find in the south loop
review: We came because of the oysters. The best oysters in Chicago. Great menu, good food, good service. Loved it.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Great oyster experience
review: Cozy ambiance. Great sushi and fish, but definitely go if you want to try a variety of oysters. I loved that the waitress gave us suggestions & gave a little background education on the different types of oysters. We tried several for appetizers.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Living Social rip off
review: The stars are for the wonderful service of the staff and the variety of oysters they offer. Had such high hopes for this place. The Living Social voucher I purchased was a waste of money. Their happy hour specials were a much better deal. I...More

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Great place
review: We arrived a little later than our reservation because you know Chicago traffic. They were cool about it though. The food was amazing I recommend the Cajun boil! It made me feel like I was back in New Orleans. Our server was super friendly and...More

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Casual business dining
review: Quiet neighborhood. Was astonishingly surprised at the great flavor of appetizers as well as entrees. Had Cajun Seafood Boil. Oysters, mussels, lobster claw and crab legs.  Cajun spice was delicious. Service was first class. Would return when in the area.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Good Location for Business with Good Food
review: I was invited to dinner at this quaint restaurant and was pleasantly surprised with both menu and quality.   Oysters are the specialty with variety from both west and east coast. The grill oysters were excellent and again good choices. Each day has a unique appetizer...More

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Small restaurant, nice menu, quiet neighborhood.
review: This restaurant is outside of downtown in an up and coming neighborhood.  This makes it easy to part or walk, which we did from our hotel.  They offer a variety of oysters which are fresh and served very cold, as should be.  Their appetizer menu...More

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Good food!
review: I visited this place in Dec 2012 on my trip to Chicago for the RSNA conference. Walk able distance from the Mc Cormick Place, one can just stroll along the Lake Michigan and land here just to get amazing food. Excellent service.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Food was excellent, very convenient to McCormick Place
review: Walking distance from McCormick Place.  The food was absolutely delicious, service was great.  Great menu choices and the oysters were amazing and fresh.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Great spot - not too crowded
review: My husband and I stumbled on this spot while he was at a conference.   Loved all suggestions by bartender (we ate at the bar) and really enjoyed the raw oysters.  Have never had grilled oysters - worth trying for sure.  The service was very good...More

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: The place to go for oysters
review: Really enjoyed the fresh catch. Side dishes were exceptional. Friendly staff and very attentive service. Within walking distance of Hyatt Regency McCormick Place.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Fresh Seafood
review: Went to the oyster bar on the South Side of Chicago. Food and service was great. I love a place where you can get wonderful fresh oysters in any shape or variety that you may like.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: BOOOOOO
review: We arrived about 15 mins early and the restaurant hadn't opened, although the door was open. We walked in and the hostess informed us that they weren't open. We explained that we just completed a lengthy walk to their restaurant and that we were in...More

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Interesting
review: This place changed it's name in the last year but the menu and everything has stayed the same as it was when the place was named Triad Sushi.  Not sure how they stay in business because there is never more than 1-3 tables of people....More

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Nice dining for convention attendees
review: If you want to get away from the McCormick Center without having to go downtown, this restaurant is a short walk. You won't find many other restaurant options, although it appears the area is developing. We ordered several appetizers as our meal. The grilled oysters...More

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Skip this place altogether
review: My husband and I purchased a Groupon for two lobster dinners entrees.  We order the fried crab appetizer and it was overdone and burnt tasting in our mouths.  The lobsters were both overdone and were tasteless and rubbery.  I will never return to this place.

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: IN CHICAGO NOT CHICAGO RIDGE
review: This is another in a long line of new trendy restaurants in Chicago’s South Loop. It was Okay, but at close to $300 for a dinner for two, I think there are much better dining options in this great culinary city.  Dinner reservation for 7:45PM,...More

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Cold, Soulless and Expensive
review: The atmosphere is black and white, bright light, sterile and cold. We went there because of a Groupon deal for lobster. Smallest lobsters I've ever seen, They could've been crayfish. The rest of the menu was very expensive for unexceptional food. The sashimi was good,...More

restaurant_name: Chicago Oyster House Prime Seafood & Steaks
title: Restaurant close to McCormick Place
review: This restaurant was on the list of suggested establishments from the Hyatt Regency McCormick Place.  I wanted a light meal, so went for the oysters on the half shell.  They offer both raw and grilled and from many locations!  While waiting for my meal, I...More

title: Sick of horrible delivery and abysmal customer service.
review: I’ve eaten at this restaurant and ordered delivery dozens of times. Delivery service is horrible, with drivers refusing to come to my apartment and demanding I meet them where they are. I called to complain to the manager. He said, “too bad, we outsource delivery...so it’s not our responsibility.” I told him then I was not going to order from them again. He said “who cares.”  I’m sick of it. They charge a full delivery fee, then outsource to a horrible service to boost their profit. I’ll never eat there again.More

title: Delicious Thai Food - Perfect To Warm Up on a Cold Chicago Day!
review: We got takeout from Opart at the end of November.  Everyone in our group LOVED the food.  Even the leftovers were devoured the following day.  Our recommendations on food selections, beginning with the best was: a13 Tiger Cry (charbroiled steak), d35 Peanut Sauce Lover with...Chicken, a16 Crab Ragoons, d35 Shrimp Pad Thai and c33 Papaya Salad. - I wish we lived closer to Chicago.  We would be getting Opart once a week! LOL!More

title: Favourite
review: This is my favourite Thai restaurant in Chicago. I absolutely crave the spicy fried tofu. I love spicy green curry and sometimes have a hard time convincing the wait staff that I want more than "white girl spicy".

title: So good
review: Great food at a reasonable price.  The Tiger Cry was delicious and so was the Gaeng Dang!  Highly recommend.

title: Authentic
review: Very good food  served in a pleasant atmosphere. All the dishes sounded so good but alas as a solo traveler I could only choose a few. None disappointed.

title: Delicious & Authentic
review: My daughter and I had a delicious dinner here - service is quick; portions are ample and interior/ambiance are very inviting; would definitely return.  Opart does not serve alcohol - am uncertain whether BYOB is allowed but that aside, this is a very good spot...indeed.More

title: Just wow
review: Went there yesterday, and even though I visit Thailand often, this is where I ate the best Tom Yam ever.

title: Best Thai food
review: Good for taking a large group of friends. The many has many reasonable choices for all tastes. Good for take out to eat alone or with few friends.

title: Great Thai food, and good service.
review: If your looking for a great place to eat, this is the place! It's my first time in Chicago, and I was looking for a place to eat supper, and i fell over this place. Glad I did. Great service and good food. - Thank...you for dinner!More

title: BYOB!  Seriously.
review: We took two business colleagues, and was met by a third one at this restaurant.  And it was my fault for forgetting, because someone had been to the restaurant the day before, and I had already been warned that there was no alcohol served there....I don't drink, so completely forgot about it, but it was a serious oversight according to the others with us.  On the bright side, it appears that the restaurant had a liquor license at one time, and presumably lost it.  So the wine glasses are still there, and you can bring your own bottle of wine and not worry about the corkage fee.  The food was generally very good.  The spring rolls with the peanut sauce was a little sweet for our taste and from the menu, we had not realized that it really was just filled with tofu, which was unpopular with the others (though they might have already been in a dismal mood owing to the absence of alcohol).  The duck with red curry sauce was excellent, as was the green papaya salad.  The fried spring rolls were also very good.  And the Tiger Cry beef was one of the highlights of the meal.  I will say that the restaurant is set up for mostly smaller groups.  We were seated as a group of four, and another colleague walked in and was sitting by himself, so we invited him to join us.  The restaurant seemed very displeased with our request to move to a different table so that we would be able to pull his table to join us.  So I guess the moral is that if you expect to have a larger group, better to advise the restaurant ahead of time, because they don't like last minute surprises.More

title: american thai
review: Had dinner at this place with Thai colleagues and their verdict was “not authentic”. The tom yum soup was sweet rather than spicy — but which i thought was a good twist because I’m Filipino. The pad thai was good and so were the rest...More

title: Awesome Thai Food!
review: Went here for dinner with some colleagues while traveling for work, we stayed at the Hyatt at McCormick Place at walked to this location for dinner. For appetizers we shared an order of the chicken satay and spring rolls. For my entrée, I had the...More

title: Good Thai restaurant
review: I had lunch at Opart Thai House. The food was quite OK, spiciness varied widely between the dishes. My friend ordered medium hot and it was very hot (and he is used to chilli from childhood!), while my pad thai was very weakly spices. All...More

title: Good food at fast food prices
review: We eat at Opart probably once a month. The servers are welcoming, menu is severed and the servers can help you make any modification. For our usual three meals, we don’t pay for than $35 and we usually have leftovers for next day.

title: Best Thai I've Ever Had
review: Any time I visit a new city--Dallas, Orlando, L.A., Washington D.C, New Orleans, Phoenix etc.--I make it a priority to eat Thai food.   Opart Thai House has the best Tom Yum soup ever. From the hot jasmine tea to the tofo to the Tom Yum---everything...More

title: Fat moment
review: I was having a very fat moment and stopped here for chicken pad thai and Shu mai, then went next door to the Burger Point for my fiance'. The food was great. Nice size portion, friendly staff. I will definitely be back.

title: The BEST!
review: This is the only place I eat Thai! Fast and amazing flavor.  The employees are nice and the portions are great.  Our family loves this place go now!!

title: Filled with Asians, delicious Thai off the beaten track
review: I was happy to see how close this was to McCormick Place as I was taken there by friends on the way to my hotel near the convention center. I rarely find yellow curry so happy to see this delicious treat. Serving size was adequate.I...More

title: It was good just not great.
review: I love Thai and try it everywhere I travel. The food was ok but not overly favorable and the service was less than pleasant. Next time I travel to Chicago I'll try somewhere else.

title: Delicious and nutritious.
review: Great food, big portions, interesting decor. Paintings full of exotic details, nice collection of impressive exhibits.

title: Great Thai tasty food
review: Staying in Thailand for work yearly several weeks, I think I have an good understanding of good Thai food. Me and my wife tried out the Opart and we were delighted. I can recommend it. Taste is more than great and service is very friendly.

title: Excellent--and SPICY
review: Looking for something a little different than our usual in Chicago.  Found this walking distance from the hotel we were staying at.  Attentive staff.  Good suggestions.  All of us tried something new that we've never had and none of us were disappointed.  We all had...More

title: Great Thai Food!
review: My son & I were touring Chicago area colleges. He loves Thai food & Opart will become a regular spot on our return visits to Chicago! We loved it! I had the Eggplant in Oyster Sauce! So good! My son had the Green Curry &...More

title: Thai out of mind
review: A restaurant that sits in that vast landscape of inexpensive Thai food with familiar, unpronounceable names, comforty noodle and rice goodness, rich sauces, and lots of heat (if you wish). I had spring rolls, thai green curry (chicken) and a couple of bottled “fancy” beers...More

title: Amazing
review: First time having Thai food and it was one of the best meals of my life. I couldn't believe how fresh the chicken and beef was. Definitely will be back!

title: The Real Deal
review: Simply decorated.  Not overly fancy. Very pleasant service. My wife had Basil Chicken... medium spicy. She said tasted like it should. She loved it.  I had  Pla Dook Pad King. Lots of veggies with the perfect amount of ginger. Both of us left full but...More

title: Great Thai food, but I like the West Town location.
review: My wife and I stopped for lunch on our way out of the city.   We had been to the Opart Thai in West Town before and we're familiar with the menu.  We really like the Tiger Cry appetizer - it's terrific.  We've had that many...More

title: One of the Best Curry Dishes I've Had
review: Went here with a friend and we ordered a couple of dishes to split.  We ordered the pad Thai with pork, which we thought was okay, but nothing extraordinary.  But the dish that really stole the night was the Gaeng Panang Curry with chicken.  Oh...More

title: Very good Thai
