review: There is plenty of seating in this restaurant so the wait time is minimal. Parking is more of an issue. The staff wasn't very friendly but not rude or anything and they were attentive. Three of us went and each had a different meal with...More

title: The BEST Pad Thai I've ever had!
review: This restaurant was great! Pad thai is my go-to dish at any Thai restaurant so I ordered it here and I was blown away with how delicious it was.  My friend who generally doesn't enjoy Thai food much even loved the Pad-Thai here.  The other...More

title: Traditional Thai Food
review: I have dine at this restaurant for a long time, the food is made of fresh ingredients and always taste the same, my favorites dishes are: Shu-Mai or steamed shrimp dumplings served with Thai soy the Yum Neau or sliced charbroiled tender beef in Thai...More

title: Favorite Thai Place
review: This is my favorite place to get Thai food in Chicago. I enjoy the basil chicken (spicy) and the Morgan Taylor martini.

title: Good enough
review: I was here last year, and the food brought me back. This time, based on another reviewer 's assessment, I ordered Pad Thai. It was good not great. I've certainly had better. Portion wasn't large, but for the price, who can argue? Should've had an...More

title: Yum Yum!
review: This Thai food is delicious. I highly reccomend it. My favorite dish is  Pad Thai, which is good here. They get the spice just right. The environment is also nice.

title: Best Pad Thai I've Ever Had
review: Visited on a Friday night for dinner with my colleagues. We were in town for a trade show at McCormick Place. The restaurant was packed with locals. Looked at the food on everyone's plates as I was walking to the table and everything looked so...More

title: Excellent dinner
review: A friend and I dropped in here for a quick dinner this last weekend and had a great meal. Perfect amount of spice and Soporo!

title: Amazing Thai!
review: I ordered delivery for my coworkers craving Thai and it was right on the money.  Food came hot and everything tasted as expected.  The notable dish was the fried bananas which was so good even cold.  The bits of coconut really added to the sweet...More

title: Good south loop Thai.  Reliable.
review: Nothing to write home about but a great location if in the South Loop.  Busy at lunch.  Service a bit spotty.  Food uneven - for example the rice was dry and the dishes did not have the aromatic spicy burst Thai food should have.

title: Meh
review: I found this place online and wanted to go because of all the reviews.  I thought it was good-ish overall.  The service was a little slow when we first got there, but they were really busy.  The food was good-ish.  We got the Crab Rangoons...More

title: loved this place...!
review: Great little place in South Loop. Had variety of appetizers and entrees.  All were excellent....loved the Pad Thai, pad prow waan, gang keow wan...so good, some spice. Parking on the street was no problem.  Service efficient.  Very busy, many locals... Would definitely go back..or try...More

title: Really good when it's good, but inconsistent
review: I have ordered from Opart 3-4 times (so please bear in mind that my experience is for ordering only, I have not dined in).  So far, I have found a pretty wide variance of the quality of the food. It has never been bad, per...More

title: Delicious meal and great service
review: Love their food.  Prices are very reasonable and they really take care of you.  The curry is delicious and you must have the Tiger Cry!!

title: Pretty good Thai food
review: Good Thai option for the local neighborhood. Crying tiger was awesome. Great Thai iced tea too. Not the best Thai food, but really good for what it is.

title: Best Vegan Option Within Walking-Distance of McCormick Place
review: So, not the prettiest Thai restaurant in town....and not the friendliest service....but the food was pretty solid. We started with the Tofu Satay, which I thought was great, though I wish the peanut sauce would have had a little more zing to it. The tofu...More

title: Good food
review: The food was good, not great. Service ok... It was busy at lunch time. The place is very loud. If you want a quiet place for a meal this might not be the place for you.

title: Loved the Food & Ambience!!
review: Found this nugget via TripAdvisor... A risk well spent!!! Food was amazing and the portions were even better. Would definitely recommend to others! 🍜🍴

title: Good price, great food!
review: Everything was about $10 on the menu and we got seated immediately.   Service was wonderful and I especially liked how they always kept our water glasses full.!

title: Delicious food, nice space!
review: The server was great. The atmosphere was calm and nice. The food (chicken satay and tofu pad thai) were delicious, worth the decent pricing, and we had plenty to eat! I would highly recommend this restaurant, especially if you already know you like thai food....More

title: Over half the tables were Asian patrons, tell you something?
review: I was at McCormick Place, and wanted Thai, so ended up here. As I arrived, a guy cam out with to-go food. I asked if the food was good here, and he said, "absolutely, it's the best in Chicago." Not having eaten at any other...More

title: Good thai in nice neighboorhood
review: We were here on memorial day 2015. Much restaurants were closed; Oparth was open. It was reasonably crowded. We were seated immediatly.  We had the veggie egg roll and sample plate as starter and the yellow curry with duck and yellow curry with medium done...More

title: Subpar Thai w/ precooked prefab food
review: One of the worst Thai restaurants in Chicago. One of my fave cuisines, I was looking forward to this place after googling up best of Thai joints in Chicago. Service- horrible. I wanted to dine and they rushed me through every part of my meal...More

title: Nothing special
review: The noodle dish was over sweet, papaya salad was flavorful, but a touch too hot.  Yellow curries were both nice.  Tea was poor.

title: Excellent food, great value
review: We order from here and stop in to eat frequently. Great, flavorful dishes and very reasonably priced.

title: Great Satay
review: I do not really like Thai food but the food here is really tasty and enjoyable. I really liked the Chicken Satay enough to eat the whole portion myself. I also tried the online delivery system which is a breeze and includes a tip system...More

title: My fav Thai food place
review: This is my go to Thai food place.  Parking is easy and food is very good.  Tiger cry appetizer is a must try. I get it every time I go.

title: Pleasing to the palette
review: What can I say, this place rocks!  I found out about it several years ago and have been bringing friends since then.  I've even taken some of the pickiest eaters that I know - they've loved it!!! I have enjoyed everything that I've eaten here....More

title: Loved it!
review: After working all day at a convention at McCormick Place, we couldn't get a taxi because the lines were so long. SO we decided to start walking, originally planning to find a cab, but instead found this restaurant, which came highly rated on UrbanSpoon. So...More

title: Pretty good
review: Thai basil chicken was quite hot and tasty. Would have liked a few more vegetables with the ground chicken. Waitress was pleasant and smiling through the whole meal which made for a pleasant time. However had to spend a lot of time in Fonzi's office...More

title: One of the better Thai restaurants in Chicago
review: Nice selection of traditonal Thai entrees that can be "spiced" to your taste.  It does a thriving carry-out business in addition to a very pleasant dining room service.

title: Great food
review: The food is very authentic and sufficiently spicy.  But everything was fresh and well prepared and completely reasonably priced.  I would definitely recommend that you try it.

title: Weird pad thai
review: I got some pad thai for dinner one of the nights that I was in Chicago. I got the chicken pad thai and frankly it was somewhat bizarre.  In addition to the usual pad thai noodles, the semi-sweet sauce, and the peanuts and lime, there...More

title: Great value, good flavors, could be better
review: We recently ate here during a weekend trip to Chicago.  The flavors of the food were excellent.  The noodle dishes can be ordered hot and spicy beyond the "hot and spicy" section of the menu.  I requested "very hot" on an order of wide noodles,...More

title: Almost Homestyle Thai
review: We got delivery at Hyatt McCormick and ordered, spring roll, Tiger Cry, a curry with duck, tomato and pineapple, and peanut lover's chicken, fresh noodles.  All very delicious, the tiger cry was great and something different.  It seemed more homemade/authentic than the Thai I've had...More

title: Excellent Food, So-So Service
review: This Thai restaurant on the near Southside offers very good food but some shaky service took a little bit away from our experience. We were on our final day, usually a wind-down day, at a conference at McCormick and decided to go outside for lunch....More

title: Good Thai on the South Side
review: Went here for dinner with my friends. The food was good (I had a green curry dish) and came out pretty quickly. The place was getting busy for a Sunday. I would come back again to try out some of the other meals on the...More

title: Amazing Beef Appitizer
review: Arrived at 9:45, they close at 10, kitchen closes at 9:50.  They took our order, had our food within 10 minutes and they didn't rush us out the door.

title: Good food, a bit noisy.
review: Many delicious typical Thai dishes. Many could be made from mild to very hot. Everyone's taste preferences were met.  A couple of large groups, made this a noisy experience until they left about 9:00pm. Nice ambience and moderate prices.

title: Poor service, average food, reasonable prices
review: Went here for lunch while at a conference at McCormick place. Had to wait a while to have our order taken....  I ordered a fried rice with seafood combo.  It was fine, but the rice was in excess..  I made it into 3 meals all...More

title: Good to have good Thai at a great price
review: Lovely food in a family friendly atmosphere, especially the Tom Yum soup was outstanding - hot and spicy but not crazy hot.

title: Excellent, Fast, and Friendly
review: It was a nice atmosphere as well as pretty friendly staff. They were fast but I never once felt rushed to leave. They even packaged up our leftovers and brought them with the check.

title: Thai yes
review: Let me just say that every other week at my office we order from them. They are alittle slow but the food is worth the wait. Gaeng Daeng w/Shrimp extra hot, Thai Ice Tea or Coffee, and Thai Custard are to die for at this restuarant.

title: Great Food and Service
review: Found this gem while in Chicago for a conference.  Food was fresh, hot and very tasty!    Worth visiting for sure!!!  Reasonably priced too!

title: Excellent
review: While I was staying in Chicago I was lucky to find this wonderful restaurant very near my hotel. I was very pleased at the quality and highly recommend it. I especially liked their shrimp dishes which had large perfectly cooked shrimp. Check it out!

title: Service lacking - didn't get a chance to order!
review: Visitors to Chicago. We stopped by on Sunday mid-day in late December. We were quickly seated. The waitperson came over with water. We ordered coffee. And 10 minutes later, with no reappearance of her with the coffee or to take our order, we left.  No...hostess or any other staff at the entrance so we couldn't even tell them we were leaving.  I can't rate the food or the prices since we never had the chance.More

title: Volleyball group meal
review: This was our 2nd visit in as many years to Kroll's and once again we were not disappointed. They did an outstanding job accommodating our group of 20+. The food is good and aleays always plenty of TVs to watch sports.

title: ok restaurant
review: We were seated pretty quickly which was great.  Service was a bit slow.  Food was ok.  It was loud but good sports coverage on the tvs.

title: Butter burgers and cheesecurds
review: I love to go to the krolls by lambeau when I'm in Green Bay, so definitely wanted to try this Branch out when in Chicago. Not as good as the original, in my opinion, but still a good butter burger and cheesecurds :)

title: Butter Burger
review: Read the history of their butter burger and had to try one, get the double, single too small for me, and it did not disappoint. If your a WI Badger fan, you'll fit right in, I am not LOL!

title: Volleyball group
review: We made reservations for 26 recently at Kroll's on a football Sunday and they did not disappoint! They had our tables reserved when we arrived and seated us right away. Our waiter did an excellent job keeping track of 9 different checks without skipping a...beat. And did I mention the food? Excellent! I highly recommend Kroll's when visiting Chicago.More

title: USA Winter Boys Volleyball Championships
review: Having 11 hungry 17 year old guys wanting food immediately, all we had to do was pick up the phone and make a reservation. When we arrived, our tables were ready, the waitress had a plan to get our orders taken and the food came...out without missing a beat. They even took the time to tell all the parents how well behaved and polite our boys were to the staff. We will definitely be returning the next time we come to visit. The food, staff and atmosphere were top notch. A credit to the city.More

title: Cold beer good food...what else ya need?
review: Went here twice over the last weekend. Walking distance from hotel. Staff was great. Beer selection was nice. And tons of places to watch the games. We ate pizza which was thin cracker crust with a real sweet sauce. We loved it.   Go here. Enjoy...a cold one. We did!More

title: Good Food, Drinks, Atmosphere
review: Ended up finding this place while walking from our hotel to grab a bite to eat and enjoy some beverages. As we walked in to the bar area, they were having trivia night which everyone seemed to enjoy. We opted to sit in the dining...area though. The vibe is one of a neighborhood sports bar. Waitress was very friendly and recommended good things off the menu. The food was delicious, the drinks were good and cold and the tab was quite reasonable. Not much more you can ask for!More

title: Large neighborhood sports bar
review: Stopped by for a late lunch during one of the World Cup games. Very spacious restaurant with decent "bar" food (wings, burgers, beer) and attentive service. Reasonable prices. Given the limited options in the area, Kroll's is a good choice.

title: Sports Bar with Huge Screens and a Neighborhood Feel
review: I am not a sports fan but met a friend who is a local and loves going to this bar. The food was good and the service was great. There was plenty of seating when I was there, but I hear it gets super crowded...More

title: Great Atmosphere, Great Burgers
review: We stumbled into Kroll’s famished at 3 pm. I wish I could say that we explored the menu but we went with burgers and they were excellent. We were afraid a butter burger would be a grease bomb but it was pleasantly juicy. I had...More

title: Great food with fountain style soda
review: Kroll's is a Chicago institution. Great food and bar. Specialty is a "Kroll's Burger" which has butter on top. Delicious!  Large menu with lots of different choices. Their Pepsi was a fountain style soda which was really good, not full of carbonation. Staff is relaxed...More

title: Very nice upscale sports bar
review: Great menu, and great place to watch all the sports action.  TVs every where including wall-sized screens.  Place is bigger than it looks, and we all enjoyed all meals.  Service was also very good.

title: Awesome pizza
review: We had a group of 15/ not a problem! The burgers,loaded grilled cheese and pizza was great! Dont forget the tater tots!!! Our waiter was awesome!

title: Ehh, maybe we missed something?
review: Admittingly, the atmosphere is great for a bar.  Huge TVs and lots of beer!   Food, not so much.  Ordered the wings, which were frozen wings that had a heavy bread coating, fried and dipped.  The house burger had a very thin patty with so much...More

title: Consistently good food drink & dessert
review: Dined here for lunch with a girlfriend.  Have been here many times and it never disappoints.  The drinks, food and desserts although limited are very good.  Great bar/restaurant for appetizers and drinks also!!

title: Fun Times with Fun Friends
review: Had the opportunity to watch a Monday Night Football game with some friends I hadn't seen for a while at Kroll's.  The Monday night beer special was great and a great price. We ordered a bunch of appetizers like wings and finger foods that were...More

title: wish it were better
review: My hat is off to them for being one of the early eateries in the South Loop expansion that really started over ten years ago. They benefited from being one of the only places in the area and remain without a great deal of competition....More

title: Always are food and service
review: Great place to watch sports and eat in the South loop. Staff is polite and professional. The menu is updated with options for anyone.

title: Fresh and tasty pub/sports bar
review: My wife and I walked in looking for fresh sandwiches for lunch. Just what we wanted - she got a burger (their specialty) and I had perch sandwich. Sides included. All was served fresh, by a kitchen staffer. Still steaming upon arrival. We would definitely...More

title: Good food and times
review: I went here with a group of friends for dinner. This place is set up for larger groups. They have larger tables and booths and that was awesome. The food was good and fairly priced. My drink was really good. The service was a little...More

title: Meh
review: We were part of a party of thirteen, so the automatic service fee must have kicked in. Food was ok to plus good (meat was a tad over done), drinks had a lot beers not available due to an impending menu change.  Service was indifferent...More

title: Dog friendly!
review: Sat outside in one of the 4 tables. Wait staff extremely nice. Went twice - bfast first time excellent service and great bfast pizza. Had a water bowl for the dogs. Second time for dinner- food was just ok and service took a little long....More

title: Great food, great service, great beer
review: OK - this is a sports bar but it has much better food than the average sports bar.  We didn't know it was a Wisconsin bar which apparently is quite well known near Lambeau field in Packer's country.  However, we didn't know any of this...More

title: Fun bar/restaurant with great TV access and good food
review: This is a casual place where you can be very comfortable eating dinner or having drinks. You are surrounded by numerous large TV screens where you can watch a variety of entertaining shows. The booths are very comfortable. The menu includes a broad range of...More

title: What's a Packer bar doing in the Bears' town?
review: Can a Green Bay Packers sports bar survive in Chicago? In the Bears' town? Near Soldier Field? Yes. Kroll's, a Green Bay institution since 1931, located across from Lambeau Field, is a longtime destination for burger-loving Cheeseheads. Now the youngest generation of the family has...More

title: Nicer than it looks from the outside
review: My wife and I visited Kroll's for an afternoon happy hour.  We had driven by it a number of times and decided to have a drink there, but judging by the exterior we didn't expect it to be very nice inside.  We were pleasantly surprised...More

title: Nostalgia trip
review: Went here because my friend used to come here in his college days. Our lunch was a little more upscale than his old sports-and-beer evenings, but it was tasty and a good value. I can easily imagine his friends hanging out here enjoying a sports...More

title: Great Local Bar and Restaurant
review: Kroll's is a South Loop gem.  Try the Prime Rib Sandwich.  it is excellent.  The restaurant is set back from the bar area so it is possible to hear a conversation yet still watch a game on one of the many, many TVs.  I also...More

title: As great as Last time
review: We appreciated the excellent service, wide selection on the menu, and the quality of the food last time and certainly were not disappointed this time. Not one person in our group of 8 had but great comments

title: Great place to watch Football!
review: In Chicago on vacation. Went here to watch the Packer playoff game. Excellent atmosphere, friendly and fun staff, one of the best bars I have watched a Packer game in, including bars from Wisconsin. Recommend to anyone want a fun great place to watch sports.

title: Good Place to Go
review: Great selection of craft beers, lots of TVs and food was awesome!  Staff even arranged it so that we could watch the Buckeyes on the big screen.

title: Food very mediocre. Service awful.
review: In Chicago on business looking for a local place for dinner. Service was terrible. Waitress even got the cocktails wrong. Sent martini back..ordered with olives, came with lemon. Same drink came back  - they removed lemon and added olives.  Did not bring fresh drink.  Had...More

title: Great food and service
review: Hit this place after and IMTS Show day and it was perfect. Good food. Quick service and seated immediately! Was a little skeptical being a bar, but the food was top notch. Pork chop. Get it. It doesn't get much better anywhere else.

title: Beware... It's a Packer bar in disguise.
review: Even though its within an earshot of Soldier Field, this is definitely not a Bears bar. It is on game days by default though.  For those of you who don't know, the original Kroll's was right outside of Lambeau (not sure if it's still around)....More

title: Just wow!
review: Stopped in for lunch with a co-worker.  I ordered the prime rib sandwich.  He ordered the turkey burger. These guys NAILED IT! If I'm in the area I will DEFINITELY be back.

title: Good Sports Bar
review: visited twice as the atmosphere is good and there's plenty of beer on offer. I had the chicago burger one night - excellent. The next I had the steak dinner which arrived massively over cooked. I ordered it rare but it was cooked medium. I...More

title: Comfort food that pleases
review: A friend and I were not that hungry, looking at the menu enlarged our eyes! I ended up ordering the tuna steak sandwich...medium rare, of course...and he did the quesadillas with french fries and i took the tator tots. Both meals were delicious, and my...More

title: Good Sandwiches, fast delivery
review: My husband and I both really enjoyed our food we ordered from Kroll's. I got the prime rib sandwich, which was great. I just wished they would have not forgotten the side of au-jus. My husband ordered the lobster roll and was not disappointed.

title: Excellent local restaurant...if you're nearby...well worth it
review: Great beers (local/craft) on tap...lots of comfort food.  The grilled cheese and tater tots was to die for!  Would definitely go back!

title: Great hang for small groups
review: Their bar food is pretty average yet tasty. The burgers are the shining highlight on the menu. Generous sides and appetizers keep tables of nibblers sated while beers and conversations are flowing. The quality of service is a bit inconsistent. For a local watering hole,...More

title: Nice neighborhood spot
review: Stopped in on a Sunday morning. We had brunch - ordered the mimosa bucket!  Loved it!  Our food was ok - the stand out was the tater tots!  I gave this place four stars because the service was great. It's everything you expect from a...More

title: Awesome!
review: Very nice local bar/grill. Stopped in for a late lunch on a Sunday all staff were very friendly. Food was excellent and service was quick. Multiple tv's with a variety of games so something for everyone to watch. Prices were very reasonable. Definitely recommend if...More

title: Good local bar
review: This place has good quick bar food and is very reasonably priced. I enjoyed a quesadilla and my friend had a burger, both of which were good. The atmosphere is casual.

title: Great thin crust pizza
review: Krolls is a nice place for friends to watch a game and enjoy a fun meal.  I have eaten there several times and we always end up with their thin crust pizza.  Never disappointed.  The wait staff was great and tuned in the Pittsburgh Pirates...More

title: Nice Neighborhood Place
review: While nothing struck me as superior, I enjoyed the experience of dining there and thought it deserved a good review.  The food, service, atmosphere and amenities were good, the overall visit just felt right.  I went by myself, on a day I felt a bit...More

title: Chicago burger rocks!
review: We were able to sneak right in ( there were two of us) , friendly staff Chicago burger was awesome! Very juicy and tasty

title: Super job in accommodating our group
review: called at 6:00 on a Friday for a group of 10..they went beyond expectations to accommodate us, an outstanding young lady took care of us flawlessly, food was excellent, hot well prepared and presented. could not have asked for more

title: Pre football game stop
review: We picked this place because it's an easy walk from Soldier Field's south end. It has a modern sports bar vibe. The food was fine, more like a diner, nothing special. However the pizza looked good, but we didn't have any. We had a K...More

title: Usual American sports/bar restaurant
review: Had wings and beef enchilladas which were both decent, although buffalo coating was a little overpowering, was given lots of blue cheese though which was a bonus

title: Great for large groups
review: We came to Kroll's with a group of 14 around 4pm on a Saturday afternoon after being told we'd have to wait at least 45 minutes at other restaurants. I had never been there before being the only out of towner. Our group had been volunteering all day and were starving and probably a little slap happy too. The prices were very fair, there were several items on the menu that I had a hard choice deciding on, finally landed on the Lobster Roll. The roll itself was excellent, the lobster mix was average. I ordered the cheese curds as a sub for fries (being from WI). They were ok, not the best ever but pretty good for outside of WI. Friends at my table had onion rings, loaded nachos, soup, pizza, all of it everyone said was really good. The staff took really good care of us, food arrived in time, everyone's order was right, they were good on drink refills. I would definitely go there again.

title: Great pub grub
review: Our group of 8 plus baby had a great meal at Krolls. We had the loaded nachos and fried cheese curds for starters. Entrees at our table included the butter burger, turkey club wrap, buffalo chicken sandwich, chili, grilled chicken sandwich. Fries were crisp on the outside and tender on the inside, even the sweet potato fries, which some other places just can't get right. Portions were large but not obscene, and food was very good. Service was warm and attentive. Looking forward to going back.

title: Very good!
review: This was walking distance from the McCormick Center so a few friends and I decided to go for lunch while in town for the Younique convention. Service was good, atmosphere was great, and food was delicious! I tried Wisconsin Cheese Curds for the first time and got the Original Kroll's Burger. Both were delicious!

title: Better than average sports bar.
review: I like that its a sports bar, but doesn't have that stereotypical feel. More adult. Not a bunch of frat boys.

title: Nice neighborhood pub
review: The flatbread and Chicago burger are great , and the spinach salad was amazing, as I tried the house special vanilla vinaigrette for my dressing . Good beer selection and some daily specials also.

title: Great Burger
review: Waiting to pick up my wife and daughter from a concert at Soldier Field, I happened upon Krolls. Open late (12am Sunday's thank you) read their menu and decided on the original Kroll Burger , a staple since the 1930's. Did not disappoint! Great tots as a side and a nice stout from Chicago made for a terrific meal. Recommended!

title: Fair Price & Good Food
review: Stopped by before the Greatful Dead show and they had the Dead music playing so I already liked the place. We were seated right away and our server was very attentive. They had an extensive menu, and good food.

title: Great Value and Service
review: Stopped by after the Dead show and sat outside. Was notified we could only stay for about an hour and a half as they needed to close the outdoor area per regulation. He GM got us a drink for our troubles. Nice people make dining enjoyable. I would recommend the steak salad, very tasty and filing.

title: Great burgers
review: Great hamburgers that originated in Green Bay WI. We go to the Green Bay location often and the famous burgers are the same here.

title: Great tater tots and burger
review: Friendly and welcoming environment where we were able to sit enjoy a good burger and milkshakes after touring the Glessner and Clarke houses.

title: Good food in a sports bar setting
review: The food and service is good, but be aware that this is a sports bar that has a very lively and noisy atmosphere. Don't plan to go here for a quiet conversation when a game is on.

title: Good pub food and service
review: We had the special chicken dumpling soup and it was hot in temperature and full of meat and filling. Very nice. The butter burger was juicy, lean and good quality meat and bun. The 3 cheese grill cheese is pretty good. The fish sandwich was pretty good.Definitely worth the price if you are in the area.

title: Great Food and good Service
review: This is my favorite downtown sports bar in Chicago, despite being owned by a Packer fan. They have good bar food and burgers ( Kroll burger is awesome and the recognize returning patrons. Plenty off parking despite being near the stadium

title: Great meal - just like home
review: I am from Green Bay originally - so when I saw the restaurant - Krolls - I had to try it out with my family - and we found out the owners are related to the Krolls in Green Bay - food was excellent - like a bit of home!

title: Just average pub fare
review: I was craving real, authentic cheese curds,so I searched on yelp for my nearest chance at finding them. Sadly, I was disappointed at Krolls. Not only were they not authentic, they were frozen balls of cheddar cheese that were served almost room temp cold and not tasty at all. W also ordered the loaded tater tots with all of the fixings, which turned out to be pretty decent because we were both starving. We wanted to try our luck with their dinners, but they ran out of the chicken that comes with two sides. So, it was steak sandwich for us. Hard to chew. But everything there literally was hard to chew because of lack of flavor. Oh. And Pepsi products.

title: Ok sports bar
review: Lots of beers, lots of TVs, ok food. A good vibe and atmosphere so a fun place to watch a game. Pub fare was solid but nothing memorable. Service was irregular at best.  I wouldn't avoid this place but I assume there are better choices

title: If you like beer and sports
review: Can't speak about the food, I just stopped in for a beer or 2 and was very pleased. Their daily happy hour specials are reasonable ($4 for featured local draft) and the bartenders were very friendly. They even let me take my beer outside to people watch and enjoy. Close-ish to Soldier Field but they have plenty of room and tv's if you aren't going to the game. Good neighborhood sports bar.

title: Nice South Loop Pub
review: This is a pleasant restaurant/bar that is frequented by locals and those heading to the Bears' games in the fall.  The burgers are great, and they have a nice beer selection.

title: Great burgers in great atmosphere
review: Had lunch at Kroll's in the South Loop of Chicago Sunday. I had the Kroll's Original Burger. This was the best burger I have ever had. My Wife had the Pulled Port BBQ sandwich and she loved it -no after taste that often occurs with BBQ meals. My son had a BBQ pizza and his wife went for soup. The 14 month old grandson tried to pick up a few young women and snacked on tasty Tator Tots with Cheese and Fries.

title: Nice bar
review: Liked this place, a little pricey, but worth it for the goat cheese on my burger. Drinks were average priced. There was no one really there when we went so I enjoyed the quiet for our lunch. Will go again for sure.

title: Neighborhood bar with a ridiculous amount of TVs
review: Kroll's provides it's customers with a very diverse menu and an even wider array of viewing options.

title: Disappointing
review: We wanted to grab a bite to eat before a movie without breaking the bank or greasy-spooning it. Kroll's was conveniently located, clean, and comfortable, but we came away with the feeling that we could have done better. If you're looking for a sports bar, this place has more than enough TV sets and framed jerseys. But the menu was limited, the food was decidedly generic, the soft drinks borderline flat, and the waitress was nonchalant. It wasn't a greasy spoon, nor did we break the bank, but there was nothing that made us want to come back.

title: Huge screens and comfy seats
review: Great place to watch Fall football comfortably. Just be aware if a Chicago Blackhawks hockey game is playing, it takes precedence on the big screens over college football. Other TVs are like 32 or 36in. The food was really good. Mild hot wings are almost-make -you-cry hot. The local walleye fish plate was phenomenal and came with good fries and marble rye bread. Had a good time at a place convenient to our hotel, the Hyatt Regency McCormick Place.

title: High Quality Bar Food
review: Krolls is a great place to watch a game.  Comfortable seats, lots of TVs and great service.  The food will surprise you, it is well prepared and really tasty.  Great south side stop.

title: Thin crust pizza, like we have in Jersey
review: Kroll's is a great sports bar, period, but if you are looking for thin-crust pizza in Chicago, Kroll's will make you will think you are in heaven (or back in Jersey). Great food, great service, reasonable prices.

title: Nice little burger place
review: We walked here from the Hyatt at McCormick, it is a short walk. Has a sports bar feel to it, lots of burgers and sandwiches on the menu. There are a lot of tvs hanging up so you can see the game pretty much anywhere you sit. My husband loved his burger, our appetizer was good too (hummus) but my buffalo chicken salad was NOT good. The sauce did not blend well with the blue cheese, I don't reccomend it.

title: Like Sports Bars? This is OK
review: Well the South Loop in Chicago is continuing to be developed, with new bars and restaurants seeming to come on line monthly. Kroll's has been there a while, but as it sits alone near the south end of the burgeoning neighborhood, I just made my way there for a Hawks playoff game. I will definitely be back for two reasons: 1) It wasn't as crowded or loud as most sports bars; and 2) It was family friendly which meant no obnoxious drunks. Food: Average; Drinks: Average; Prices: Average; Ambience: Average. A nice “average” neighborhood sports bar!

title: Great burger!
review: Our first meal in Chicago was not a disappointment! They make a great burger! Definitely worth checking out if you're in the area. Cool atmosphere too!

title: Good place for a burger!
review: I had the Chicago Angus burger and it was well cooked and yummy on a pretzel bun. Fries were crisp and service was good! They have great happy hours if you can get there between 5 and 7 pm and lots of TVs to watch the game.

title: Tasty food and great craft beer
review: Ive had a few different things on the menu but my favorite has to be the Chicago burger very tasty and you can pair it with many different craft beers. They also have trivia night on Wednesday and bingo on Thursday the prices are comparable to other bars in downtown

title: very good
review: wonderful meal.  I like the menu, liked the food and great value. Our waitress was excellent. There was another waiter there who gave us a little hassle when asked to clean a table for us., but otherwise a fantasic experience.

title: Nice Spot
review: I walked here for lunch during an event I was attending at McCormick. The atmosphere is one of a typical bar and grill; certainly pleasant enough with plenty of TVs showing sports coverage. I ordered a large salad which worked very well for lunch. The service was efficient and the waitress was friendly and responsive. The prices were quite reasonable for the type of place it is. This is a nice alternative compared to the food court at McCormick if one has the time to spare.

title: Nice drinks and varied menu
review: Lots of good greasy apps but not the healthiest! Good drink menu too. Wish they would add a weekend breakfast buffet like Stanley's does and then this place would be rocking'!!

title: Outstanding Comfort Food in a Sports Bar
review: After a morning of sightseeing, I stumbled in Kroll's South Loop tired and dehydrated on a Thursday at 1:30 P.M. The large restaurant was largely deserted and I was immediately seated and plied with ice water, which was refilled about six times by the attentive staff.Needing fuel for the tank, I ordered the Classic Reuben, Corned beef, swiss, sauerkraut and 1000 island dressing on marble rye ($9.50). Interestingly I was asked whether I wanted it "open" or "closed"; I chose "closed." To double my comfort, I also ordered "Kroll's Best" Chocolate Milkshake ($4.50), with whipped cream.The Milkshake came first. So thick I really had to suck to get it started, it was everything a milkshake should be: creamy, rich, chocolatety, and huge. One of the best I've ever had in a long career of shakes.The Reuben was similarly excellent. Toasted, but not greasy. Piled high with tender corned beef with just enough melted Swiss cheese, sauerkraut and 1000 Island Dressing to make a blissful meld of flavors in every bite. The Reuben came with hot, crisp home-made fries. Comfort food to the max.Service was attentive, but not obtrusive. That water kept a coming.Having sated my hunger, stoked my engines, and rehydrated, I felt 200% better. Who could ask for more?Kroll's, while a sports bar was not loud and aggressively so; you could "sports" or not. For tourists, It is very conveniently close to the Prairie Avenue Historic District, H.H. Richardson's Glessner House and the Tiffany Windows at the 2d Presbyterian Church. CTA Buses #3 & #4 stop right at Kroll's corner of State & 18th.

title: SPORTS BAR-Plain and simple
review: Went here since I was limited on time. They said they could accommodate me and get me food quickly. They did. BUUUUUTTT..I ordered chicken sandwich which was mainly all bread. My son ordered grilled cheese and had same problem. Service was very good, and the waiter who also hosted us was very nice. Place had alot of tv's for sports, and that was great. But for food, I m sure there are better sports bars.

title: Great food
review: The food was fabulous !  A great  place to watch sports.  A unique place - we were seated in a U shaped booth - the kids loved it.

title: Almost as good as Green Bay!
review: As a native of green bay, the burgers are just like the original krolls. The chili is pretty good. They allowed a salad substitution instead of fries. Great salad dressings! The booths are also similar to green bay. The art work reflects green bay history and Chicago sports. Fun place!

title: Neighborhood place!
review: Good place to enjoy some food while watching the sports that are shown.

title: Great drinks, good food.
review: Great local spot in Chicago. Fun place to be. Good service, food is adequate, great beer selection.

title: What a Disappointment
review: This place is in my neighborhood so Ive tried to find something good about it but I can't. The menu is lame and the service is less than stellar. The crowd on the weekend evenings is SCARY. The only positive is this place is a grat meeting place before Bears games.

title: Love the coffee cake!
review: We had breakfast here on a recent trip to Chicago. The coffee cake is great and of course we took one home. The breakfast menu is varied and the service is quick. Food is made fresh and it is hot and worth the price.

title: Loved this fabulous little spot for a quick breakfast!
review: We were visiting Chicago and found this place totally by accident. Menu is great. Has a variety for everyone and serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. We were there for breakfast. The food was fresh and delicious. The kids were happy because they had choices they...loved. we were served quickly and in a friendly way. The restaurant was clean and there was plenty of tables available at 1030am on a Tuesday.More

title: You can always find something here
review: Not a local eatery by any means, but it's good and you can be sure to find something good that you like here. Great for when you're at a loss or need a quick, predictable bite to eat.

title: Not a good breakfast
review: We needed a quick breakfast and decided the Corner Bakery Cafe was always full so in we went.   The first thing that we saw was table full of dirty plates and uneaten breakfasts.  Well it was just after Thanksgiving so we went with it.  Not...a good choice.  The eggs were rubbery and cold.  The bacon was hard and the coffee had a tang.  I visited the washrooms as we were leaving and they were disgusting.  The floor was wet.  The toilets didnt flust and there was no toilet tissue or hand soap.  We will not be visiting this establishment again.More

title: On Almost Every Corner
review: I love the Corner Bakeries.  They are a great place to grab a sandwich or breakfast without breaking the bank.  The service has been quick.  Food is tasty.  Save this place as they are scattered through town.

title: Love the Brownies and Muffins
review: Don't care too much for the bagels but love their blueberry muffins, cookies and brownies. A good place to have a delicious, filling breakfast/snacks.

title: Yummy Food
review: We visited this cafe for lunch although they also serve breakfast foods. We ordered the chicken bacon avocado sandwich. Both of us loved it! It was full of yummy fresh thinly sliced chicken meat, bacon was cooked just right, and avocado was fresh. Even the....Read it came on was tasty, fresh, and soft. Will definitely visit there again!More

title: I think I was addicted
review: Incredible lattes and french toast. It's half fast food/half restaurant and a million times better fare than Panera or Starbucks.

title: Excellent food
review: It was an excellent little cozy place with excellent food at the center of Chicago. I would recommend anyone to go.

title: Not so great.
review: Bakery items are generic.  They probably make nothing themselves.  Love the locations and the decor. They over pack the tables and battled the 3 degree weather unsuccessfully.  This has all the setup to be a great coffee shop but the execution leaves room for improvement.

title: Good Breakfast
review: We stopped here for breakfast. Great options. Good food. Fast service. Couple of locations seen throughout the city.

title: Great for breakfast
review: We used to have this restaurant in Glendale, AZ but they left!! I always eat here when I visit Chicago. They have a large breakfast selection and then offer soups, sandwiches, pasta for lunch and dinner. And they're located all over Chicago!

title: Many things to choose from!!
review: If you need a quick breakfast, this was a great find for us!  Fruit, smoothies, teas, coffees, pastries, muffins, breakfast sandwiches, meals...just a lot of different choices to pick from was almost hard to pick! lol   They are very, very busy but kept the line...moving very quickly.  We were impressed with the service as well as the food.  They also have lunch items too.More

title: Great quick breakfast at a good price
review: I got the California breakfast sandwich which has cheese, eggs, bacon, tomato and avocado on sour dough. It was really good! Really good prices too. I couldn't get the wifi to work there though.

title: Free drink with Hop-on Hop-off Big Bus Tour
review: Nice stop for a refreshing drink and a bathroom break. Nice environment and great view of Trump Tower.

title: Love the coffee cake!
review: We had breakfast here on a recent trip to Chicago. The coffee cake is great and of course we took one home. The breakfast menu is varied and the service is quick. Food is made fresh and it is hot and worth the price.

title: Loved this fabulous little spot for a quick breakfast!
review: We were visiting Chicago and found this place totally by accident. Menu is great. Has a variety for everyone and serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. We were there for breakfast. The food was fresh and delicious. The kids were happy because they had choices they...loved. we were served quickly and in a friendly way. The restaurant was clean and there was plenty of tables available at 1030am on a Tuesday.More

title: You can always find something here
review: Not a local eatery by any means, but it's good and you can be sure to find something good that you like here. Great for when you're at a loss or need a quick, predictable bite to eat.

title: Not a good breakfast
review: We needed a quick breakfast and decided the Corner Bakery Cafe was always full so in we went.   The first thing that we saw was table full of dirty plates and uneaten breakfasts.  Well it was just after Thanksgiving so we went with it.  Not...a good choice.  The eggs were rubbery and cold.  The bacon was hard and the coffee had a tang.  I visited the washrooms as we were leaving and they were disgusting.  The floor was wet.  The toilets didnt flust and there was no toilet tissue or hand soap.  We will not be visiting this establishment again.More

title: On Almost Every Corner
review: I love the Corner Bakeries.  They are a great place to grab a sandwich or breakfast without breaking the bank.  The service has been quick.  Food is tasty.  Save this place as they are scattered through town.

title: Love the Brownies and Muffins
review: Don't care too much for the bagels but love their blueberry muffins, cookies and brownies. A good place to have a delicious, filling breakfast/snacks.

title: Yummy Food
review: We visited this cafe for lunch although they also serve breakfast foods. We ordered the chicken bacon avocado sandwich. Both of us loved it! It was full of yummy fresh thinly sliced chicken meat, bacon was cooked just right, and avocado was fresh. Even the....Read it came on was tasty, fresh, and soft. Will definitely visit there again!More

title: I think I was addicted
review: Incredible lattes and french toast. It's half fast food/half restaurant and a million times better fare than Panera or Starbucks.

title: Excellent food
review: It was an excellent little cozy place with excellent food at the center of Chicago. I would recommend anyone to go.

title: Not so great.
review: Bakery items are generic.  They probably make nothing themselves.  Love the locations and the decor. They over pack the tables and battled the 3 degree weather unsuccessfully.  This has all the setup to be a great coffee shop but the execution leaves room for improvement.

title: Good Breakfast
review: We stopped here for breakfast. Great options. Good food. Fast service. Couple of locations seen throughout the city.

title: Great for breakfast
review: We used to have this restaurant in Glendale, AZ but they left!! I always eat here when I visit Chicago. They have a large breakfast selection and then offer soups, sandwiches, pasta for lunch and dinner. And they're located all over Chicago!

title: Many things to choose from!!
review: If you need a quick breakfast, this was a great find for us!  Fruit, smoothies, teas, coffees, pastries, muffins, breakfast sandwiches, meals...just a lot of different choices to pick from was almost hard to pick! lol   They are very, very busy but kept the line...moving very quickly.  We were impressed with the service as well as the food.  They also have lunch items too.More

title: Great quick breakfast at a good price
review: I got the California breakfast sandwich which has cheese, eggs, bacon, tomato and avocado on sour dough. It was really good! Really good prices too. I couldn't get the wifi to work there though.

title: Free drink with Hop-on Hop-off Big Bus Tour
review: Nice stop for a refreshing drink and a bathroom break. Nice environment and great view of Trump Tower.

title: Perfect for Breakfast!
review: Their coffee and muffins are so good, especially their banana one.   Perfect for breakfast and lunch.  Staff are polite and friendly. Quick service and nice atmosphere

title: Food for the Soul
review: Corner Bakery is a great place for a quick breakfast or lunch - grab a coffee and pastry or sit down for a meal - the food is very good.  Friendly atmosphere for conversation or to just rest and recharge!

title: pricy but good.
review: Good food. Very good pastries! Good coffee! Nice staff. Located inside the Field Museum, so it's the only real food option there, unless you bring your own or go outside of the museum.

title: On alot of corners
review: It's a small corner cafe with different sandwiches and  soups.  Weekends get pretty busy.  Prices are reasonable and the friendly staff was great.  Would eat there again.

title: Amazing cakes
review: Love their cakes and Pastries, they are simply delicious. I always get something from the corner bakery cafe before getting on the metra.

title: Great chocolate chip cookies
review: We enjoyed two delicious sandwiches, a tuna salad and chicken sandwich.  There were many choices on the menu including a breakfast menu.  I bought a bag of chocolate chip cookies to go and enjoyed them for the next few days.  It was a good place...More

title: Lots of choice
review: We ate at one of these bakeries close by our hotel.  Though not really a bakery, the food was fresh and wholesome.  The soup choices were great.  Look out for the soup and sandwich deals. We order and and were able to sis it at...More

title: Great food
review: Went several times during my families stay in chicago,great place food and price for my family.dont hesitate to go.

title: Not a bad place for lite lunch
review: We had a quick snack here it was close to our hotel.  I was thinking it would be a bakery but much to my shock it is not really a bakery but more a little sandwich shop with some breakfast items and coffees etc..  Food...More

title: Best meal and deal for the money!
review: Any time we travel to Downtown Chicago we look for the Corner Bakery Cafes.  They are no longer hard to find as they truly seem to be on almost every "corner."  You cannot beat their prices.  Very, very reasonable.  And, the breakfast and sandwiches are...More

title: Great little eatery
review: We ate at the Corner Bakery between tours we did with the trolleys. They had an excellent variety of food items, the price was reasonable and it is a place we would visit again.

title: Tastes as Good as it Smells
review: This is a wonderful stop for a treat and a cup of coffee.  Fast service, good variety of tasty treats.

title: best cafe chain in Chicago
review: We stayed five days in Chicago and it was a pleasure to go there for breakfast or lunch. My favourite: Anaheim scrambler, Big Al's chilli and oatmeal.

title: Good and fast
review: This is a great little chain with locations scattered through the Loop. The best time to go is breakfast, the French toast is awesome.

title: Good food, good price
review: We went there for breakfast. They were quick, the food was good, the people were nice, and it was a reasonable price. Very accessible location too.

title: Great food
review: I travel to Chicago at least once a year and this is where my family and I eat breakfast every time. It is a nice little place that serves real food not powdered. They have something for everyone and it is always good and hot....More

title: Great Lunch
review: For a chain restaurant I was surprised how good their lunch was.  Had just checked into our room and wanted to have a light lunch, and with the Corner Bakery right across the street we went...and glad that we did.  Our lunch was really good...More

title: The place for breakfast
review: We found many restaurants were not open when we were up and ready to go. We found many that were over priced but once we found the Corner Cafe we were regulars. Nothing particularly fancy but a good hot breakfast for a decent price.

title: Good food!
review: Soups were superb!  Coffee was good.  Just crowded with minimal available seating.  Convenient to the symphony!

title: great sandwiches
review: Sandwiches were great, a bit pricier than expected but would absolutely go again. There are a couple of locations, we visited the one on Wacker

title: Great City Bakery
review: Great little treats for a cold and windy morning in Chicago.  Not a lot of seating.  fun to people watch.

title: Chain store food
review: Lots of them in the city, and yes, they are on corner sites. Clean, prompt service. Adequate food Ate a turkey sandwich, cost around $7

title: Confort food that doesn't break the bank
review: Good soup and sandwiches, plus scrumptious deserts, at a reasonable price (which can be hard to find in Chicago).  Otherwise, try the food courts at Navy Pier and Watertower Place.

title: Appalling service, food and amenities
review: Already reviewed at the Field Museum - the choice of this eatery on the ground floor was a waste of time and money and the most inefficient line system I have encountered. The food choice was poor and the rolls soggy and almost inedible. It...More

title: No better than cafeteria food
review: Coffee, meh...  Food, meh...  Was trapped in the Field Museum with little choice, so we went there and were underwhelmed...  wished there were better options!  Maybe a trek out to Michigan or Wabash Aves. would've been better...

title: Very ordinary food
review: The food and pastries are very ordinary--nothing special here.  The pastries especially are very ordinary, a bit disappointing for a "bakery."  Your neighborhood grocery store probably has tastier choices.  Save your money.

title: Sit Outside!
review: It's an upscale sandwich shop with good food, kind people, a great view all with fabulous ice tea and lemonade. It's a perfect stop for lunch while shopping and seeing the sites.

title: Great Service
review: Everything freshly made great coffee and lovely bread just baked very reasonable and great service despite being packed, .

title: Nice "Corner Bakery"
review: They offer actual breakfast and lunch food. The food is good. Service could be a bit better... but It's fine for what it is.

title: Another good option!
review: After 2 days of the hilton breakfast we walked a few blocks and tried the Corner Bakery. It was the same meal as the hilton at less than 1/2 the price. Even though it was early I ordered lunch and there was no problem. All...More

title: Great food
review: I travel to Chicago at least once a year and this is where my family and I eat breakfast every time. It is a nice little place that serves real food not powdered. They have something for everyone and it is always good and hot....More

title: Great Lunch
review: For a chain restaurant I was surprised how good their lunch was.  Had just checked into our room and wanted to have a light lunch, and with the Corner Bakery right across the street we went...and glad that we did.  Our lunch was really good...More

title: The place for breakfast
review: We found many restaurants were not open when we were up and ready to go. We found many that were over priced but once we found the Corner Cafe we were regulars. Nothing particularly fancy but a good hot breakfast for a decent price.

title: Good food!
review: Soups were superb!  Coffee was good.  Just crowded with minimal available seating.  Convenient to the symphony!

title: great sandwiches
review: Sandwiches were great, a bit pricier than expected but would absolutely go again. There are a couple of locations, we visited the one on Wacker

title: Great City Bakery
review: Great little treats for a cold and windy morning in Chicago.  Not a lot of seating.  fun to people watch.

review: Lots of them in the city, and yes, they are on corner sites. Clean, prompt service. Adequate food Ate a turkey sandwich, cost around $7
