review: It's an upscale sandwich shop with good food, kind people, a great view all with fabulous ice tea and lemonade. It's a perfect stop for lunch while shopping and seeing the sites.

title: Great Service
review: Everything freshly made great coffee and lovely bread just baked very reasonable and great service despite being packed, .

title: Nice "Corner Bakery"
review: They offer actual breakfast and lunch food. The food is good. Service could be a bit better... but It's fine for what it is.

title: Another good option!
review: After 2 days of the hilton breakfast we walked a few blocks and tried the Corner Bakery. It was the same meal as the hilton at less than 1/2 the price. Even though it was early I ordered lunch and there was no problem. All...More

title: Great lunch with healthy options
review: I eat here all the time when I am at work.  Their salads are very good, great sandwiches and great baked goods too.  It's a little pricey for lunch (salad/soup/cookie combo with drink is $11) but well worth it.

title: Good option while visiting Field Museum
review: Food was good and the selection was great for being in an attraction/museum.  Slight wait for food but overall would recommend.  Great view of skyline from dining room.

title: PRICEY !
review: Well if you are a Starbucks fan, you won't mind, but for two Pumpkin LAttes at just under 10 bucks...to me its a crime...more cream than coffee in these...my daughters soup was bland and I had expected a bit more

title: They tell you how many calories in each item
review: Two of our party had salads, one had a corned beef sandwich. The food was fresh and reasonably priced. Drinks are unlimited. There is a black currant ice tea that is delicious. When spending the day at The Field Museum, this main floor eatery is...More

title: Good dependable food
review: Love the food and the fact that I can always count on this place for good hearty healthy options.  I was disappointed that they "ran out of hot water" to serve me a morning blend coffee at 9:30 a.m. on a Friday.

title: You have to eat breakfast here!!
review: There is nothing bad at this place. The food is wonderful, especially breakfast from their cold cereals to their breakfast paninis. I wish they would open one in New Jersey!! I could every meal here and be happy!!

title: Great lunch stop in the Field Museum
review: While visiting the great Field Museum in Chicago recently, we were pleased to find that their food stop was a Corner Bakery. Great menu with sandwiches, salads, soups, and panninis. Also, a good selection of fruits, drinks, and desserts. Our food was prepared quickly and...More

title: Not from chicago
review: I'm not from Chicago, so I don't know if this is a chain or not.  However, the revolving door dumps you right into the beginning of the line, the first irritation of many.  We ordered our lunch and fought through the crowd of people to...More

title: Always trustworthy and quick.
review: The Corner Bakery is found on many corners, and in the airport.  Breakfast or lunch provide quick dining and trustworthy food.  The staff seem to be cheery in every one of these places, and we ate in several as we moved around the city. A...More

title: Tasty, but a little pricey.
review: We visited the location at the corner of Michigan and Wacker.  The paninis are quite good, as well as the macaroni and cheese.  Lunch for the three of us ran nearly thirty dollars.

title: Just like every other sandwich shop
review: There wasn't anything bad about the corner bakery, but there was nothing special about this place.. Good food at decent prices- and good for something quick.

title: Our favorite breakfast spot in Chicago
review: We often visit Chicago and love to stay at the Hard Rock. There is a Corner Bakery just around the corner from the hotel. They have GREAT Paninis for breakfast and our toddlers loved the cinnamon muffins. It's not a trip to the Windy City...More

title: The Corner Bakery ROCKS!
review: We visited the Field Museum for 2 days...and enjoyed a delicious lunch at the Corner Bakery both days.  The food is fabulous and very reasonably priced.  The cookies are TO DIE FOR!  Clean and pleasant...friendly staff.  A lovely experience!

title: Great for a quick bite.
review: I love their Chicken Pomodoro sandwich.  They have great soups and sandwiches.  We also love their pastries.  If you have been to Panera it is similiar but nothing like Subway.

title: No
review: We ordered out because of corona. Spaghetti and meatballs, salad, pork chop dinner. I've heard how great the meatballs are but they weren't any different from what I've had in other places. The spaghetti was pretty tasteless. The pork chop was flattened to fill the...whole plate but tasted like cardboard. We were very disappointed.More

title: Satisfying
review: Liked the interior - dark wood, photos of old school stars such as the Rat Pack, Audrey Hepburn etc. Perfect serving size of the People’s Choice Bacon. Although I’m not a clam linguine fan, my partner noted there were ample clams. We didn’t have room...for dessert but I saw a giant slices of carrot cake and tiramisu (I think) delivered to a nearby table and they looked heavenly.  Atmosphere was a bit loud for my taste but it was a Friday night and there was a large conference in town.More

title: Good Italian food
review: Great atmosphere in this cozy restaurant. Well decorated. Our server was outstanding - she took the time to explain the menu, the specials and the wine list. The food was served piping hot. I had the fish special which was a baked whitefish - very...tasty. The wine list was good. We had the Jordan Cab and it did not disappoint. I do recommend this place..More

title: Five star for food and service - TERRIBLE for noise level
review: This would have been a wonderful dinner out but the place was so noisy that we (a couple sitting next to each other) had to shout!  The team work of the staff was so exceptional that I had to call the manager over and compliment...the team.  Too bad it was too noisy to really enjoy the place - but we did appreciate the food and service.More

title: Superb Italian Cuisine
review: We had dinner for 5 here at few nights ago. We chose it because of the proximity to our hotel and excellent online reviews. I am on a quest to find the best eggplant parmigiana in America. I look for restaurants that serve it and...always order it if it’s on the menu. I found it. This was the best homemade style eggplant parmigiana I have ever had. Huge portion, thick layer of mozzarella on top, fabulous tomato sauce and thin, breaded layered eggplant. Had it been my last meal, I would have died a happy man. Others in my party had the veal parmigiana and salmon. We had salads and my Caesar was divine. Do not miss this place. It does Chicago proud.More

title: Great Food and Atmosphere
review: Found Victory Tap early in a business trip and liked it so much I went back!  Great atmosphere and really outstanding Italian food.  Just be prepared--the portions are huge (but what's wrong with that)!

title: Big portions of well tasting food
review: Went to the restaurant with friends from work. The place is well suited for this but also a romantic dinner for two. I had the Lasagna and the Tiramisu. They tasted really good. Lasagna can be tricky at restaurants. But this was an exception. Both...courses were quite large and could easily be shared between friends. It felt generous in a way. The beer selection was good but not great. The wine list had a bit more to offer. No surprise since it is an Italian establishmentMore

title: Excellent rib eye
review: Had a great meal! Excellent sea food appetizer and the rib eye steak, just wow, great flavour, tender meat, juicy, all the good stuff. Paired it all with a great cabernet sauvignon. Add great service to it all and there you go, got an excellent...experience!More

title: Father’s Day dinner
review: We waited a bit with just water and bread. Thankfully Jamie came to the rescue. She was just getting off her shift for the night, and noticed we hadn’t been served for sometime. She was very personable and made some recommendations for our dinner that...were spectacular. The meal was great and Jamie turned it around for us. I had the homemade raviolis in vodka sauce. And for dessert the lemon ricotta cheesecake. Everything was amazing!More

title: Did The Chef Go Missing?
review: We went here due to many good reviews on open table. Wow did we get the wrong night or do people in Chicago not have good food. All the food was just terrible but the ravioli has a place in hell reserved for it. The...service was good but on this visit have to say give it a wide berth.More

title: So glad we stumbled upon this!
review: We ended up at Victory Tap as second choice, after out planned restaurant was closed. But I have a feeling we would have preferred Victory Tap anyway!! First off, the bread sampler was divine. The marinara type bread, was especially delightful. I ordered the Sicilian...More

title: Great Food, Service and Atmosphere!
review: Authentic Italian cuisine! Moderate prices and HUGE PORTIONS! The Greek chicken is packed with flavor and the lasagna is definately a winner. For a healthier choice the salmon was also a great catch. Enjoyed spirits and great service. This is a great find!

title: Great!
review: The meatball alone is worth it. Not terribly pricey, great atmosphere. Good for drinks/apps and/or dinner.

title: Great Food and Server Patrick was Super Professional
review: First off, this is a very nice and elegant restaurant, but the service and professionalism we received from Patrick was probably the most professional and kind experience I can remember. It reminded me of how you might get treated at Shula's in downtown Indianapolis or...More

title: Real Italian Food!
review: Wow, a primo antipasti salad with deluxe fixings, and when they say a large meatball appetizer they know how to make them big, but as tasty as a delicacy! I just wish we were hungrier when we went. Look forward to my next trip to...More

title: Good food, so so service
review: We arrived on a Monday night at 6:30.  No reservation for 3 people for a business dinner.  Bar area was well filled, restaurant about 20% full.  We were ushered past lots of empty tables and directed to a table right at the back in front...More

title: Go for the pizza and order some more!
review: We arrived at a good time, right before the late dinner rush.  And I am glad we did.  Once we were seated, you can see the tables start to fill and the bar area was packed.  So for me sitting here waiting to order, this...More

title: Store bought Box of linguine $1 and handful of broccoli $1, Armand's Victory Tap $$$ Pricey!!!
review: We've held off visiting this neighborhood place since reviews have been scattered. We've waited to try this neighborhood place because our friends have given it mixed reviews. And maybe we picked a bad night during a busy weekend in Chicago, but we've had MUCH better...More

title: Good food if you have the time!
review: We made a reservation for a 5:30pm dinner 2 weeks in advance. We had high hopes as we love Armand's in Arlington Hts. This was a pre-concert dinner but upon arriving, there were many open tables. We advised the staff we were pre-concert but  our...More

title: Great Italian food
review: Went here at recommendation of a local. The food was superb, as was our waitress Adrienne.  This was a very busy night being the night before the marathon.  I had the Saturday special or Braciola over cavatelli. This was so good, but too big to...More

title: Disaster visit on the night before the marathon
review: I’m now writing a review still sitting in the restaurant. It has been 1.5hours we are waiting for 4 simple pasta plates! Manager has no clue what is going on in his kitchen and when asked answers : -that kitchen got overloaded by the marathon...More

title: Great food as always
review: went to a 1 year old birthday party and has pasta, meatballs, chicken marsala, orechetti rapini, salad and great deserts.  Was done buffet style and was AMAZING

title: Excellent!
review: We had a staff dinner here and the food and service were both top notch! Very fresh ingredients, and an extensive menu. An excellent meal with attentive service.

title: Fantastic food and service!
review: We had a wonderful dinner! We were in town for a conference and had Victory Tap recommended by a local. We had the lasagna and the ravioli and both were well worth it! Everything was super tasty and the service couldn’t be beat. We would...More

title: South Loop-Delicious food & Excellent Service
review: We wanted a quick but good lunch and found it at The Victory Tap. The Minestrone soup was some of the best I’ve ever had. Shared a Caprese Salad and was full. Server was attuned to the heat and humidity outside and kept our glasses...More

title: Good food.
review: Dined here twice. First night was good food, good service - and it was really busy. 2nd night service was inattentive at best. Food - "worlds best chicken dinner" was good coating, some undercooked meat. Waiter told us mashed potatoes were "swimming in butter" but...More

title: Hands down the best meal I had in Chicago!
review: Went to dinner on a business trip and was completely blown away. Incredible wine, Caesar salad, meatballs etc... everything was incredible. Service was impeccable, can’t wait to go back to Chicago just to eat at Armand’s!

title: Chicago Pizza
review: My family was visiting from out of town and wanted to try "Chicago pizza". I suggested Armand's Victory Tap because I have had their pizza delivered to my house (different location) numerous times and have always been satisfied. Turned out Everyone ordered everything but pizza...More

title: Perfect pasta
review: The Shrimp de Jonghe appetizer is the most delicious shrimp dish I’ve ever eaten. And I can’t emphasize how perfect the Pennoni alla Vodka is. Pasta is perfectly cooked, the sauce perfectly balanced. Add crumbled sausage. It is sheer perfection!

title: Yummy Italian food in a pub type setting
review: Food was great - loved the grilled calamari appetizer. Wait staff is attentive. Beer and wine offerings are extensive.Pasta is fresh as is fish and vegetables.

title: Traditional Italian, Done Well
review: Friendly, efficient service and a homey atmosphere. I had Veal Parmigiana which was excellent. An old school classic with a huge portion of veal. When it arrived, I thought that I would never be able to finish it. It was so good though that I...More

title: This is a great spot.
review: So we trusted other review sites and this one to find a gem. Well...it worked awesomely. It was my girlfriends birthday and I wanted great food and great service. We got both.   The waiter was skilled and offered excellent suggestions. We loved the off the...More

title: Best Italian in the South Loop and maybe the city!
review: Great atmosphere with friendly service, we live in the neighborhood and are ecstatic that this place opened last year.  I would like to give you a suggestion on what to eat but I haven't had anything I wouldn't do again and I have been around...More

title: Decent Food but Really Loud
review: We went for dinner and ordered a pizza and the Meat Ball Salad.  The salad was very good and the pizza was okay.  Since we had limited time, we ordered the thin pizza because the pan pizza took longer.  We will try the deep dish...More

title: Italian Family Style
review: We began with bread and a family Caesar salad, plated for us beside the table. $14.  The server cut the Chicken Parmesan into 4 pieces on a plate before placing it on the table. $25.  I cut the Homemade Lasagna layered in a casserole pan...More

title: "Bonafide Old School Italian Cuisine in Downtown Chicago!"
review: As avid foodies and lifelong Chicagoans, we can authoritatively say that our hometown has practically as many Italian eateries as Italy itself does. But diner beware: among those many good Italian restaurants are also some ersatz joints whose cuisine makes Chef Boy-ar-dee taste appetizing in...More

title: Great Neighborhood Gem!
review: Great addition to the South Loop! We have always had a great time here. Food is authentic, hearty portions, wonderful customer service! A bit pricey for the South Loop but well worth it!

title: Makes me happy
review: This is a place where the manager helps make the place. He always remembers me and makes me feel welcome. The service is friendly and attentive. The food is above average for an unpretentious Italian restaurant. Their pizza has a long history growing out of...More

title: Best Italian and service we received in Chicgao!!!
review: My family ate here on our first ever trip to Chicago on a recommendation, and we weren't disappointed! Our server I believe was named Scott, and he went above and beyond to make our experience enjoyable! The restaurant is very clean, and seems to be...More

title: Excellent Italian food and pizza
review: Great little place for Italian food and pizza.  Stopped in just walking by.  Turned out to be very good food and great service.  I had the pizza, thin crust, which was very good.  Service was good and entire staff was very friendly.  I could tell...More

title: Good Choice in South Loop
review: Went before Bears game.  Though very crowded our table was ready and the wait staff was great.  Good selection of food and drink.  High noise level but a nice option.

title: Superb Italian in South Loop
review: Armand's Victory Tap offers excellently prepared Italian cuisine. The pastas are cooked perfectly, just a touch al dente, and offered in a wide range of sauces and styles. Chicken, veal, and vegetable dishes are all excellent. Terrific mussels as appetizer, or the slightly spicy Italian...More

title: Outstanding
review: Great location,  really nice ambiance, excellent delicious food.  Friendly, efficient service.  We had lasagna,  eggplant parm, spaghetti with meatballs,  lobster Limon over angel hair pasta, tirmisu,  calamari.   All so delicious and possibly some of best italian food in city.

title: A Winner in the Victory Circle
review: My wife and I happened to be in the south loop to pick up Hamilton tickets from a friend and we decided to dine here. Well, we'll make special trips back to the S Loop to come to Armand's. What was good? Well, it's hard...More

title: Very nice!
review: Nice traditional Italian pasta options! Thin crust pizzas are very good, lots of toppings and crisp-chewy crust!  Attentive service with a reasonably priced wine list. Look at the Italian wine options, nice selections and good values. Highly recommend!

title: Never want to go back
review: We went here before a concert at the stadium. The place was packed, which was understandable. However, it was 90° outside and they had opened their front wall so the restaurant was extremely hot. The only air-conditioned area was upstairs, which they blocked off for...More

title: Spectacular southside dining experience!
review: From the moment we arrived at the restaurant, we were greeted by the staff as old friends. The bar was well appointed with elegant chandeliers creating a lovely ambience. We arrived at our table in the dining area and were immediately welcomed by Victor, our...More

title: Delicious Italian
review: Solid pasta and pizza menu. Very tasty fare. Seafood specials were all delicious. Appetizers were all expertly prepared. Good wine list, plenty of beer and cocktail options. A definite winner, we'd happily return.

title: Fantastic Italian in the South Loop
review: My favourite neighbourhood restaurant! Classic Italian with professional old school waiters. The best Chilean sea bass with steamed garlic spinach and Huge portion of awesome lasagna. I will always recommend this as a great choice for dinner in Chicago's South loop.

title: Horrible Experience
review: Ordered a pizza through their website, to go. Received many confirmation emails, including one with a time it would be ready. Showed up an hour later and they hadn't even started preparing my food, and had no record of it being ordered. They just kept...More

title: Great addition to the neighborhood...
review: We've been south looper's for a while now and have been searching for a local Italian joint since Cafe Bionda is just a disgrace nowadays.  The stuffed artichoke was delish as an appetizer. Will order that again (w/out the breadcrumbs). My wife ordered the veal...More

title: Friendly, comfortable, cozy, tasty
review: Service is great.  Staff is friendly and very accommodating. New manager is top notch, people friendly.  The food is amazing.

title: Neighborhood Italian restaurant with great food & service.
review: From the hostess to the bus boys, the service was great!  It was only exceeded by the food!!  Each selection was excellent and required take home sacks due to the portion size.  Our waitress could have been a little more attentive and less condescending, but...More

title: Bad service by the restaurant manager
review: Had visited restaurant 4 times in the last month. The first two times the service was quite good because the servers were experienced and knowledgeable about the menu. The food was also quite good. The last couple times was very dissapointing. Actually the third time...More

title: Chicago restaurant reviews
review: It was a family gathering and after initial small confusion about table setup, we did have reservation, everything went smooth. Good selection of wines and beers. We settled for "Piccini" Pinot grigio and excellent "Alter" Triple Belgium beer. Heavy and fulfilling with great taste. Grilled...More

title: Wowser Meatballs!
review: Super busy on a Friday night. Joined a couple friends who'd heard great things, so here we are. Old Hollywood Charm decorate the interior of these Italian walls. Bread basket of an assortment of garlic breads arrive, hot, crunchy crusts, and soft interiors with variations...More

title: South Loop Find
review: Great addition to the South Loop dining scene. Great bar area, wide variety of classic Italian dishes, huge (really HUGE) portions and friendly staff. Have already been there four times in about three weeks. (Walking distance from my house.) Fun outing with neighborhood girlfriends and...More

title: Delicious Food & ambiance!!
review: First time dining here & it exceeded my expectations.  Great pasta, salad & service.  It is a beautiful restaurant in the south loop area.  Ordered the papparadelli which are home made, excellent!!  Definitely will return.

title: Delicious Food, Phenonemal Cannoli
review: We had a taste for Italian food, so we tried Armand's. I think this is my new favorite restaurant! The bread came with delicious garlic bread, regular bread, and focaccia bread. We split an appetizer of roasted red peppers and fresh mozzarella cheese. My entree--baked...More

title: Very noisy dining area, large portions
review: We decided to try this place and were very surprised by the amount of people there on a Friday night. We stood by the bar which is large and well stocked with our drinks and were taken to a narrow table. It seems they tried...More

title: Worth the Wait!
review: I made reservations through open table so my wait was a little shorter. The service was awesome and manager was very accommodating to our large party. If you like a thick lasagna chocked full of meat and cheese, this one is for you.  The chicken...More

title: Some of the best thin-crust pizza in Chicago!
review: I work near the South Loop, and am always looking new places to eat nearby. Stopped in after work last week to check the place out and was pleasantly surprised. The staff was welcoming and friendly. It smelled like heaven. And the beer selection satisfied...More

title: Just a fad
review: This is a very  uncomfortable place.  They overbook the dining room.  Service is very good.  Food is average at best.  Not a place where a real Italian would order any pasta with gravy.  Gravy tastes like lighter fluid.  Not good by any means. Articokes overrated...More

title: Nice spot in South Loop, near Museum Campus and McCormick Place.
review: So happy to have a new option in the South Loop for lunch and dinner. Armand's is beautiful with dark wood, bright lighting and a cozy fireplace. I think the prices are great for the location. House wines are $8 for a large glass and...More

title: New favorite pizza place
review: I’ve had all the “big name” Chicago pizzas, and this place beats em all.  Friendly staff, great atmosphere and the main attraction is most definitely the pie.  It was awesome.

title: Delicious Food -Friendly attentive service
review: We were party of a private party.  Everything was fresh and delicious and served by two outstanding ladies at the buffet and friendly gents at the bar.  Nothing fancy - just good solid Italian comfort food.

title: Deep Dish Desire
review: We walked from our hotel.  We wanted to order deep dish pizza to go.  The hostess Christianna was very personable!  We ordered a small Brickhouse DD Pizza: deep dish crust with lots of mozzarella, chunks of fresh tomato with Italian sausage and mushrooms on top....We are from New York and we wanted to experience this Chicago delicacy.  The crust was a bit grainy but that may be the usual?  Not a deal breaker as the abundance of toppings was excellent.  Hubby enjoyed a Peroni at the bar while we waited for our food.  The restaurant is decorated with jerseys from every Chicago sports team: Pros plus DePaul greats.  A cool place.More

title: Chicago Pizza fix within walking distance!
review: In town for gymnastics meet at McCormick Place and really didn't want to have to travel back into the heart of Chicago.  Pizano's appeared to fit the bill on getting Chicago deep dish while being able to walk from the hotel.  Was it the best...pizza, no, but it was still very good.  I'd probably add the buttered crust next time as the crust was the tipping point for me, and a bit dry/cracker like at the edges.  Otherwise great tasting sauce and ingredients.  Would go back if staying by McCormick again.More

title: Great pizza
review: We enjoyed the pizza very much. It was close to our hotel and we feed our entire family. Definitely recommend.

title: NICE BAR
review: We were attending DePaul University basketball games at the Wintrust Arena. Went to Pizanos before and after the games with friends. Great atmosphere for sports. Friendly bar staff. Good food choices at a good price. When we are in town for more games at the...arena, we will come again.More

title: Not very good
review: The pizza is not very good...I like frozen pizza better than this place.  Toppings on deep dish were cold and the thin crust is not good either.   Do not recommend.  The staff are friendly but the food is not worth going for.

title: Worst customer service experience ever
review: WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EXPERIENCE EVER! I will never order from this Pizanos again! I was given the wrong order. I ordered  half cheese and half sausage due to my roommate being vegetarian. Once the pizza arrived I noticed it was all sausage hence my roommate...cannot eat that pizza. I called to get it replaced and they stated that I have to return the current pizza in exchange for the new one. They also investigated and stated that their chefs did indeed make the correct pizza due to it being a slow night and questioned me. I stated I would be happy to send pictures of the full sausage pizza prior to being ate which they declined.Of course while waiting for the new pizza I ate my half of the pizza. I was then called by the Michael Austin (General Manager) who left a voicemail stating that I was not being “straight” with them and refused to deliver to my apartment again, he stated, “ I hope you enjoy your pizza tonight because that’s the last time we will be delivering to you.” I immediately called Michael back as I was very upset to find out being a loyal customer to Pizanos for them to think I was lying. Michael was very rude over the phone and did not show any sort of customer service. I stated to Michael that I would be happy to send the pictures to him to prove that I was not lying and I’m not trying to get a free pizza. I also stated that I worked in hospitality at Loews and would always order from them. In which he replied “I don’t need your resume”. He continued to declined and stated that if I choose  to order again that they will never deliver. I have never experience someone so unprofessional and disrespectful. I will not be ordering from them again and I am very disappointed that an experience like this from the general manager resulted in this.More

title: Business lunch
review: Was in town for a conference and we had opportunity to have lunch with a supplier we use often.  Due to location of the event, we did not want to go to far.  Restaurant is not far from the exhibition hall, which was nice.  All...ordered different things and all were very pleased, from the Chicken Lemon to the chicken parmigiana.  I had the chopped salad and was very filling.  Would recommend when in area.More

title: Nice restaurant, meh pizza
review: Selection of restaurants is limited in the McCormick place neighborhood.  This restaurant is well located, and nicely decorated.  It has a large center bar.  Staff is friendly.  The pizza itself is mediocre at best (as far as the Chicago Style pizza goes).  They use the...3/4 pound (+/-) of mozzarella on the base, but the no top layer of crust; it's only about half the thickness of other Chicago Styles.More

title: Pretty Good
review: The food and beverage were good.  Not the best deep dish but good.  Loud at times. Wait staff were attentive.

title: Deep Dish
review: We went in just to try the deep dish. We had a medium option, just cheese and it was enough for both of us. It takes 30 minutes and during that time, the staff did keep checking in on us. The crust was a highlight...More

title: Awesome Restaurant
review: We stopped here for dinner since it was a block away from the Marriott and the kids have never had deep dish pizza. This place was great! We sat outside where we had an excellent waiter. The pizza was amazing and the deep dish dessert...More

title: Pizza was great!
review: A group of us that were attending a recent conference had lunch at Pizano's on the south side. I thought the pizza was delicious and the service was fast and efficient.

title: Good Italian food
review: Very good Italian food. Waiter was not happy when we told him he had messed up our order, but the manager was right there to make things right. In spite of that, we went back for 3 nights. It was worth it, although with little...More

title: Nothing Spectacular
review: We came in for lunch while at a conference in McCormick. The place was super busy and it took quite a while to get food. We were told it would be 40 mins for pizza so we did sandwiches and those took about the same...More

title: Pizzano's Pizza and Pasta
review: We stopped here for lunch, the service was excellent and the food was great.  You wont be disappointed.

title: Pizanos Pizza - Indiana Avenue
review: Location was close to our hotel and worth trying for dinner last week.  We order one deep dish pizza (the Oprah), lemon chicken, chicken parmiagiana, and the steak sandwich.  All were excellent except the steak sandwich, likely because we thought it was like another italian...More

title: Great Pizza - Awesome choices if eating alone
review: Probably the best deep dish in Chicago.  Totally different recipe than the other place. Travelling alone on business is always a challenge going out for pizza because of the size. The waitress recommended their personal size that only has 4 slices but you can have...More

title: Late night order but should have passed...
review: Ordered a thin crust sausage  pizza and chicken strips and was disappointed to say the least. The crust was an odd, grainy soggy consistency and the sausage had an odd aftertaste. The pieces crumbled into a mess. We couldn't stomach a second piece. The chicken...More

title: Pretty good meal
review: Decent meal/service.  We were part of a large party but we were served buffet style which was probably the best way to do it.  Food was pretty good.  Not bad, not outstanding.  Easy walk from McCormick Place.

title: Great food.
review: Wanted to get the pizza but had to get next door for a volleyball tournament and the pizza takes up to 45 minutes to make. We got the ravioli and two hamburgers. All of it was great. We will be back for sure the next...More

title: Kinda Underwhelmed
review: I ordered this food via Grub Hub. A small sausage and cheese pizza with fresh basil came up to 35 dollars with taxes and tip.   To be honest i kinda expected more since Chicago's known for their deep dish pizza... but to be honest,  I...More

title: Meh, not that good.
review: We had take outs and ended up throwing most of the $90 worth of food away.  We had Chicago style pizza and they put it in the box without anything under it and the pizza stuck to the box and had cardboard stuck on the...More

title: Quiet Saturday Pizza
review: Wanted to have some good Chicago Style pie before leaving but did not want to relocate the car and pay exorbitant fees for parking.  Staying at the nearby Marriott Marquis, this was a short brisk winter walk.  Food came out quick and was hot until...More

title: Large group eating pizza
review: Had a group of 25 and were easily able to accommodate.  Rating a pizza is very subjective, so not sure my opinion would be accurate for everyone.  We had the medium thick crust in basic sausage.  I wish I would have been able to order...More

title: Great Food
review: We ordered carry out from this site. Ordered online and walked from the hotel to pick it up. The app allowed me to track the progress which was very accurate. The deep dish pizza was excellent and the spaghetti was also very good. Easy to...More

title: Great food and service
review: This is a great place. The food was delicious and the waitress helped us pick the right amount food for three younger children. She really prevented us from spending wastefully on meals. I would highly recommend.

title: Larnell-Best Waiter Ever?
review: Maybe so. We had a part of 3 in town for about a week. Dined at Pizano’s 3 times. Like the wings. The lemon chicken was strong. Meatball salad very good. Not a bad burger. But Larnell makes it. Just a great guy. Wants you...More

title: Great Chicago Pizza place
review: We were in town for a conference and this place was within walking distance of the conference center. I wanted to try Chicago style pizza and was happy with what we had. We started the meal off with garlic cheese bread which came with a...More

title: Relaxing family friendly Italian restaurant easy walk from McCormick Place
review: We were looking for deep dish Chicago pizza with a short walk from McCormick Place, since the weather was rainy and we were traveling with an infant.  Read reviews of Pizano’s, and decided to try it.  We were very pleased with the easy walk, the...More

title: Classic food. Decent spot
review: Close to our hotel.  We came late after Bears game. Two bartenders both female. One really nice, other a bit rude. We sat at bar. We had drinks and food. The Italian sausage sandwich was ok. Too much cheese for me, the roasted peppers were...More

title: Great Pizza
review: We were staying at the nearby Marriott Marquis and wanted a pizza place nearby.  Pizano’s fit the bill.  We split a large deep dish cheese and sausage, and a small vegetarian.  Everyone was great.  I did think the bottom crust was a bit hard, but...More

title: Great Deep Dish Pizza
review: This was within walking distance of our hotel and a nice surprise. Three of us split a medium deep dish pizza and couldn't finish it all. Of course we also split an appetizer of calamari which was also quite good. They have a limited beer...More

title: Great Family Restaurant
review: Server was super friendly, the food was delicious, and the prices were moderate. My daughter left the cover of her head phones, and I went back andwas able to recuperate it. Good uncomplicated meal!!!!!

title: Don't do it!
review: Arrived with a friend and we intended to get a "personal" pizza as an appetizer before ordering some pasta.  First we were told that we couldn't add all of the  toppings we wanted to our "personal" pizza because it wouldn't cook right (we basically wanted...More

title: Must East Here
review: A fun place with very tasty food choices plus excellent pizza choices.  The Hibiscus Beer was delicious.

title: Very good pizza, value for money
review: We were here during a convention, so we had to wait a full hour after being seated before our orders were taken. It was crowded. Nevertheless, the food is very good. We all left full and happy.

title: Try the tortillini
review: I dined out twice here while at a convention.  Service is fast and we had no trouble with getting a table during the weekday around 6 pm.  The tortellini that many had comments about is their specialty called Ann Marie's.  It contains a blend of...More

title: Good spot if near McCormick place
review: Great tortellini pasta, good ravioli.  Also had deep dish pizza. Nice neighborhood on Indiana Ave. If in the area, a good place to go

title: Not a Fan
review: The first time we ordered pizza from Pizano's I waited twenty minutes after arriving at the time the pizza was supposed to be ready. I chalked it up to new restaurant jitters, but when my pizza was ready the box was so light I wondered...More

title: Close to convention centre
review: Not too many choices near the convention centre, so this place is just a few blocks from the west building of McCormick Place. But be prepared to wait (the waiter warned us when we order) about 30-40 min for the pizza. Tastes decent, but not...More

title: Close to the convention center and WinTrust Arena
review: We checked into the Marriott Marquis hotel just a couple blocks away and were anxious for a quick, but decent meal. My daughter and I decided to grab a couple salads and share a small deep dish pizza. It was warm out but a nice...More

title: Poor servjce
review: I have not had such a disappointing experience in a long time. To start, the staff did not allow us to sit outside, although there were customer outside until we left.   The receptionist was rude to my wife when she entered through the wrong door....More

title: Great Food, Atmosphere and Service
review: We happened to find this place around the corner from our hotel.  We had it for dinner our first night in town and enjoyed it enough to go back for our final dinner before heading home.  The Deep Dish Pizza was delicious, and I'm not...More

title: Amazing deep dish pizza
review: Ok so I am not a Chicago local so I have a limited frame of reference for comparing Chicago style deep dish pizza, but I thought it was amazing!! One of the best pizzas I have ever eaten. Had Meat Lovers Deep Dish. It was...More

title: Friendly, pleasant atmosphere.
review: We were referred to this place by our hotel concierge. He said if we mentioned his name we could probably get a free dessert. We did and we didn't. What can you do? The staff was amazing otherwise and checked on us throughout our dinner....More

title: Pretty Good.  If you didn't order dessert, don't accept it!
review: Ate here with my family as we were passing through Chicago on the way home from a road trip vacation East.  We were staying nearby and this place was recommended by the hotel concierge.  Ordered a small deep dish for my wife and I, and...More

title: Oprah's favorite thin crust
review: If you're in the mood for a pie, but not the deep dish variety, this place was voted Oprah's favorite many years back. The crust is a Malnati's butter crust version, and it holds up well to toppings. It is sliced in a grid, and...More

title: good deep dish pizza
review: I loved the restaurant layout of restaurant and was close to Marriott Hotel and convention center. Their deep dish pizza was good.

title: Awful waiter, so-so pizza
review: Stayed at Hyatt McCormick Place.  Unfortunately, not a lot of restaurants in the immediate area.  Went to this place.  Waiter took drink order, then forgot about us for 10 minutes.  Had to flag down another waiter for sodas.  Our waiter came back with sodas, and...More

title: Good Pizza near McCormick and Marriott Marquis
review: Part of a group of local Pizza Restaurants, this is a fine neighborhood restaurant. Service was not special the night I was here which would be my only issue and 1 star deduction. Waiter was not present or very attentive. Food is plentiful and very...More

title: Great food, one block from Marriott Marquis
review: We were staying at the Marriott Marquis for a conference and wanted to get out of the hotel for a business lunch. Restaurant is one block over and was a great setting for a casual lunch meeting. Much bigger inside than I imagined. Service was...More

title: I wouldn’t eat here again and it’s not ideal for business meals
review: I never had deep dish pizza before, and because of this restaurant I don’t want to try it ever again. As soon as the Rudy’s Special was set down all I could see was the water pooling on the top - not appetizing. It was...More

title: Good food / so-so waiter
review: My wife and I came in about 5:00 on a Tuesday night. Nice local restaurant. We both had Italian dishes. Both were good and more than we could eat. Just wish our waiter was more interested in his job.

title: Good Food And Atmosphere
review: During my trip to C2E2 my friends and I dined here about 3 times and every time was great! We even had a large group of 12 and they had no problems fitting us in. There was a little issue with a drink not being...More

title: So good we visited three times in one weekend!
review: It started off with being just hungry and looking for something close to our hotel for the weekend. Soon enough we were making reservations for Saturday evening with our group of friends and family and then returning on Sunday with another group of friends.   This...More

title: Great Service, Fun Place
review: Good food, friendly and efficient staff, good energy level without being too noisy. Great experience!

title: Great atmosphere
review: We had just gotten in from a long travel day and the staff was so nice.  Thus was a first trip to Chicago for most of us so we had to try  Chicago style pizza and it was wonderful.  The staff was so accommodating. I...More

title: Fun Place, Great Pizza
review: Pizano's has Chicago style and regular pizza as well as salads and other Italian dishes plus a full bar. Food is great, atmosphere is relaxed and fun (especially if you are a Chicago sports team fan), Manager Joe is awesome, and waitstaff is friendly and...More

title: Reviews were great.... food was ok
review: I think the over-stated reviews influenced my rating, but really - this was just average pizza.  The sauce was very good, as was the cheezy garlic bread.  But there was so much cheese on the pizza, and very little pepperoni, that you could hardly taste...More

title: Good food, service ...... not so much
review: We ate there two nights in a row while staying at The Marriott for a volleyball tournament.  We tried to bring the whole team (about 30 w/ parents), but they refused to divide the tickets so only about six of us went.  That probably cost...More

title: Not Bread, No Butter, No Tip
review: Just had dinner here on quick visit, ordered our meals and when it came we asked for our bread. What's a italian dinner without bread, when we asked the waitress where's the bread that came with dinner, she has a smart remark and tells us...More

title: Horrible experience
review: The manager was extremely rude.  I was really looking forward to eating there... what a disappointment.  I would not go back or recommend to anyone.

title: Good pizza.
review: Nice restaurant. Service good.  Food was great.  Not busy on a Wednesday night.  Reasonable beer/wine selection.

title: Fantastic Chicago Deep Dish!!!
review: We were staying at the Marriott a block away and needed some Chicago Deep Dish and this was walking distance.  So lucky because this place was fantastic!  Great authentic deep dish and a cool bar space too! Loved it!

title: Homemade pasta's are to die for
review: Love their Homemade Tortellini.  Their 4 Cheese Tortellini was really good.  Then I tried their Ann Marie's Homemade Tortellini with the meat sauce and that was heaven.  Food all round is very good.

title: Friendly with pasta variety
review: We ordered the spinach and cheese ravioli, calamari, and an individual deep dish pizza. We would return for the same. We were informed the pizza would take 35 minutes but we were okay with waiting. The waitress stopped back a few times, and also someone...More

title: good pizza. slow service.
review: We went in after a concert and ordered pizza. It was good, but it took a long time. Close to the convention center.

title: Couldnt bring myself to order any food.
review: Walked a few blocks in the rain as I was told this was the place to go. Sat down, ordered a beer and when she brought it to me, she said " I will need a credit card to start your tab". I was a...More

title: Good food and a short walk from the Hyatt Regency hotel
review: I had a business conference at the McCormick convention center and was staying in the Hyatt Regency that's across the street from McCormick.  After a few meals at the in-hotel restaurants, my wife and I decided to venture out and find a pizzeria that serves...More

title: Good Pizza
review: Very nice and clean establishment, great service. Had the thin crust pizza and was good, also was there on a Sunday during Chicago football game and they played music after a touchdown by the Bears. Memorable not the best Chicago pizza as stated on the...More

title: Good Traditional Italian Fare
review: The location is convenient to McCormick place and an easy walk from the Marriott ad Hyatt.  The staff is knowledgeable, friendly and accommodating while the atmosphere is nice with a large bar area and separate dining area complete with red checker table cloths.  The menu...More

title: Good pizza...fun place!
review: A business associate and I ate here twice while staying at the Marriott Marquis for a conference. Thin crust pizza and toasted ravioli the first time, deep dish pizza and cheesy garlic bread the last day.  All selections were very good!  And they have a...More

title: Too much to eat
review: Arrived in town for a conference. Restaurant located within walking distance from hotel. Out of our 5 days, our group ate there 3 separate occasions. Loved pasta dishes. Tried individual deep pizza. And if course had to sample desserts. Each time, service was wonderful and...More

title: Great atmosphere, great food, and outstanding service!
review: We were staying at the new Marriott Marquis near McCormick Place and decided that we wanted to do something local.  Pizano's was only a few blocks away, and are we ever so glad we took that short walk.  Possibly the best calimari we've ever had,...More

title: Great Atmosphere
review: Much nicer than just a pizza place. This restaurant is one of the few within safe and easy walking distance of the Marriott Marquis and McCormick Place. They serve basically the same (amazing) pizza as Lou Malnati's, and the owner is a Malnati. We had...More

title: Great thin crust pizza with friendly service
review: This restaurant was within walking distance of the McCormick Place which made it on our short list of places to eat. It was about a 10 minute walk and not through a bad area of town.  The food was fantastic and we will likely drive...More

title: The best Blackened Salmon Caesar I have had in a long time!
review: The food was excellent - I had the opportunity to eat on the back deck/ patio and it was incredibly pleasant. Almost no street noise. Got the Mandarin Moose, Blackened Salmon Caesar and a deep dish personal pepperoni.  Great, great and GREAT!  Save a table...More

title: Great deep dish Chicago pizza
review: Authentic, delicious Chicago deep dish pizza. Surprisingly excellent fried calamari with excellent marinara sauce. It was heavily Laden with tentacles which I love. The salad could have used more mixed greens and better ingredients but the salad dressing was very good. Service was excellent.

title: Loads of cheese
review: This restaurant was within walking distance from the Hyatt Regency McCormick Place.  We ordered a small deep dish pizza which was plenty enough for my husband and I with leftovers for breakfast.  The pizza was the best we have ever had.  We had to cut...More

title: Lunch after a convention session
review: We walked from the McCormick convention center to this place.  We're glad we did.  The food is great.  It looks new.  Service was great.  Restroom was clean.  Good selection of beer.

title: Good food
review: Food was really good seevice was good as well but the idea of having large garbage can dragged across the floor in the dinning area while patrons were eating is not good oh amd sweepingunder chairs as were still eating also not great .

title: Friendly, Fast & Fresh
review: First time eating here, went with my cousin who dines here often.  This was a wonderful sushi experience. I have bern eating sushi for a long time and like to try new places. I have to say this place has some of the best and...fresh sushi l have ever had. The waitress was very friendly and we received our selections quickly.  The salmon rice ball appetizer was a good choice.  The volcano roll was spicy and the angel dragon roll was a nice complement. Love the seaweed too. Will definitely go again when I am in Chicago.More

title: Great fish, overwhelmed staff
review: Stopped in for a quick dinner on the way to a concert.  The place was jumping and we were welcomed and seated.  The fish was very good. And we will definitely return but since was slow and it seemed they were overwhelmed on an early...Friday evening.More

title: Great Sushi!
review: Great sushi! Top picks are rock shrimp appetizer, creamy Maki, hamachi carpaccio & south scallop Maki! Great for dining in or delivery!

title: Lunch with the Family
review: Nice area, unassuming right in the south loop, street parking on Michigan Ave . Coazy Atmosphere, good sushi, reasonably priced. Recommend.

title: Good sushi, great experience!
review: This was probably one of the best services I have had in a while. One of the helpers would clear plates as soon as we were done, ALWAYS had our water filled and was just always around to help. :) Also loved there complimentary fried...seaweed, so good!More

title: Great little spot on Michigan Avenue
review: This restaurant was close to our hotel and we stopped in after flying in for a conference. The food was delicious. We ordered a bunch of different rolls and stuffed ourselves. Everything was great.

title: Incredible experience start to finish!!
review: Visiting Chicago we wanted to have something light and tasty and found some good reviews for South Coast and decided to give it a try. So happy that we did. We had some scallops for appetizers and they were tasty albeit a tad overcooked. For...dinner my wife had sushi which was great as advertised and I had the Chilean Sea Bass. Great portion size, especially for the price, and it was perfectly cooked. Simple presentation with just a brown butter glaze made the fish the focal point of the dish and it was exceptional. To top it all off, even though it's been open for ten years, the customer service hasn't slacked off. Our waters were never empty and our server made sure everything was great the whole evening. A great experience through and through and since we only live a couple hours away this will be a regular any chance we get. Well done South Coast Sushi!More

title: A pleasant surprise
review: We found ourselves wandering around late on a Monday night, trying to find a place to eat. This place was open so we decided to give it a try. On Mondays they offer half price bottles of wine, which was good news to start the...meal with. All the fish we ordered was so fresh and buttery, we were pleased with the quality. Service was very attentive and professional. The price at the end of the meal was a bit high, but it seemed worth it all things considered.More

title: You get what you pay for!
review: I have been going to South Coast for at least the past 7 years... and never once have I been disappointed. The service was always good there, although it can get a little slow during busy times. I think that's partly due to the amount...of carry-out/delivery this place handles.   The spicy tuna roll is different every time (heat-wise) which I love.... all depends on who is making it.  You  get actual chunks of fish as well, instead of that tuna mush you get at some places. If you want an off-menu roll, ask for the Tuna on Top.  It's a special every now and then but they'll make it if you request it.  While it's pricey I don't mind paying for good sushi. It's well worth it my mind.  Would be awesome if they were open for lunch as I work from home a lot and wouldn't mind walking over and grabbing some rolls to go.More

title: Fresh Sashimi, Oysters & Tasty Cocktails
review: One of my favorite places to enjoy sashimi and sushi rolls. They Sparkling Lychee is my favorite drink. Love the Hamachi Carpaccio, fresh oysters and Crunchy Maki.  Frequently dine here with friends (ladies between 35-40 yrs). Looking forward to the next visit. Make reservations if...you can. Otherwise, you might wait on a Thu-Sat night after 6:30-7:00 pm. The front lounge area seems like wasted seating which could be used for regular diners. Might not have to wait as long.   Bartender was a little flustered when we arrived. Tried to order a beverage while we waited, but she told us she was too busy... and the place wasn't that crowded. Even if it was, there are better ways to respond. Good thing she makes her tips off of the table servers. The only reason I'm docking 1 star. I've been too many times before where service (at the table) is impeccable... but I'm rating off of my latest visit.   Sashimi is always fresh. The fresh oysters are delicious. They usually have good specials, so don't forget to ask because sometimes the servers don't offer them up right away.More

title: not as good as advertised
review: I went here due to the good reviews, but was disappointed. They had a three course special but they would not let one person in the table have it if the other one did not have it. I went with a friend and she wanted...to order that, but I wasn't too hungry and wanted something small so they didn't let her get the three course deal. The drink I ordered didn't taste sweet and tropical as it was described. My friend ordered food items that were not how they are typically made. She lived in Japan for three years and said the food she ordered was not real Japanese food. I had Philadelphia rolls and they were good. But you can't really go too wrong with those. Overall I think the food was too expensive for the quality it had.More

title: The Best Sushi in Town!
review: The sushi is excellent. The drinks are good. The atmosphere is eclectic.  The servers are nice, knowledgeable, and helpful. My favorite sushi spot in Chicago.

title: Consistently good and fresh!
review: We've frequented South Coast on a number of occasions (we live within walking distance). Consistently good and the service is always attentive. I've even brought foreign business colleagues here for a evening meal. Delivery is equally good and firm favourites are the rolls.  Always flavourful,...always fresh.  If you are driving, note they have some free parking across the road on Michigan.More

title: Never crowded... delicious food
review: One of my favorite restaurants in the South Loop: fantastic sushi, prompt service, nice decor. It is a little out of the way but worth the walk or cab ride.

title: Good food
review: Food was really good seevice was good as well but the idea of having large garbage can dragged across the floor in the dinning area while patrons were eating is not good oh amd sweepingunder chairs as were still eating also not great .

title: Friendly, Fast & Fresh
review: First time eating here, went with my cousin who dines here often.  This was a wonderful sushi experience. I have bern eating sushi for a long time and like to try new places. I have to say this place has some of the best and...fresh sushi l have ever had. The waitress was very friendly and we received our selections quickly.  The salmon rice ball appetizer was a good choice.  The volcano roll was spicy and the angel dragon roll was a nice complement. Love the seaweed too. Will definitely go again when I am in Chicago.More

title: Great fish, overwhelmed staff
review: Stopped in for a quick dinner on the way to a concert.  The place was jumping and we were welcomed and seated.  The fish was very good. And we will definitely return but since was slow and it seemed they were overwhelmed on an early...Friday evening.More

title: Great Sushi!
review: Great sushi! Top picks are rock shrimp appetizer, creamy Maki, hamachi carpaccio & south scallop Maki! Great for dining in or delivery!

title: Lunch with the Family
review: Nice area, unassuming right in the south loop, street parking on Michigan Ave . Coazy Atmosphere, good sushi, reasonably priced. Recommend.

title: Good sushi, great experience!
review: This was probably one of the best services I have had in a while. One of the helpers would clear plates as soon as we were done, ALWAYS had our water filled and was just always around to help. :) Also loved there complimentary fried...seaweed, so good!More

title: Great little spot on Michigan Avenue
review: This restaurant was close to our hotel and we stopped in after flying in for a conference. The food was delicious. We ordered a bunch of different rolls and stuffed ourselves. Everything was great.

title: Incredible experience start to finish!!
review: Visiting Chicago we wanted to have something light and tasty and found some good reviews for South Coast and decided to give it a try. So happy that we did. We had some scallops for appetizers and they were tasty albeit a tad overcooked. For...dinner my wife had sushi which was great as advertised and I had the Chilean Sea Bass. Great portion size, especially for the price, and it was perfectly cooked. Simple presentation with just a brown butter glaze made the fish the focal point of the dish and it was exceptional. To top it all off, even though it's been open for ten years, the customer service hasn't slacked off. Our waters were never empty and our server made sure everything was great the whole evening. A great experience through and through and since we only live a couple hours away this will be a regular any chance we get. Well done South Coast Sushi!More

title: A pleasant surprise
review: We found ourselves wandering around late on a Monday night, trying to find a place to eat. This place was open so we decided to give it a try. On Mondays they offer half price bottles of wine, which was good news to start the...meal with. All the fish we ordered was so fresh and buttery, we were pleased with the quality. Service was very attentive and professional. The price at the end of the meal was a bit high, but it seemed worth it all things considered.More

title: You get what you pay for!
review: I have been going to South Coast for at least the past 7 years... and never once have I been disappointed. The service was always good there, although it can get a little slow during busy times. I think that's partly due to the amount...of carry-out/delivery this place handles.   The spicy tuna roll is different every time (heat-wise) which I love.... all depends on who is making it.  You  get actual chunks of fish as well, instead of that tuna mush you get at some places. If you want an off-menu roll, ask for the Tuna on Top.  It's a special every now and then but they'll make it if you request it.  While it's pricey I don't mind paying for good sushi. It's well worth it my mind.  Would be awesome if they were open for lunch as I work from home a lot and wouldn't mind walking over and grabbing some rolls to go.More
