If you are driving, note they have some free parking across the road on Michigan.More

title: Never crowded... delicious food
review: One of my favorite restaurants in the South Loop: fantastic sushi, prompt service, nice decor. It is a little out of the way but worth the walk or cab ride.

title: Great Little Spot
review: I have visited Chicago before, so my second time around I was not really looking for anything famous or well known. A friend and I walked here from Hyatt McCormick Place. It was very high class sushi wish a great modern twist!

title: If you like sushi... avoid
review: I'm a sushi lover, and recently moved to the South Loop, so I couldn't wait to check on this place, the closest Japanese restaurant from home. I was really looking forward to make it my place to go in the neighborhood! Besides, the space looks...More

title: Nice restaurant in a quiet neighborhood
review: This restaurant is a bit outside of  downtown, but ins an up and coming neighborhood.  We loved walking to it from our hotel.  You get a free appetizer each night.  the selection is good and the food is well-prepared.  The staff are very nice and...More

title: awesome
review: We went after our conference of 10 hours.  You get a free appetizer with order. Ours was seaweed tempura, it was amazing. The fish was fresh and very good.

title: Back to back sushi
review: Came here 2 nights in a row!  since we were staying at the Hyatt McCormick Hotel, this place is walking distance from the hotel, just less than a mile away.  The maki, himachi and toro were awesome!  The service on the first night was better...More

title: Highly recommend
review: Great sushi. Nice atmosphere. Pricey, but worth it. If you want good sushi South Coast is the place to go.

title: Very good sushi in Southside
review: We brought some clients from Ishikawa, Japan and had a wonderful meal. The very attentive waitstaff provided good recommendations on appetizers, Nigiri and Maki. The cold sake was very good, though I would avoid the "sparkling sake".

title: Great Food, Service and Atmosphere
review: The meal that I had here was excellent.   They recommended a nice tuna sashimi appetizer - very fresh fish, beautifully prepared.  For entrees we had two rolls which were very nice as well.   Wine by the bottle was priced very fairly with minimal markup.     The...More

title: Top notch sushi!
review: Cool atmosphere, unassuming location, open airy feel inside. Top notch service! Miso soup was the best I've ever had, sushi and sashimi fresh and flavorful and the bento box the perfect lunch (large and filling - highly recommend, so much more than a "box"). Will...More

title: Exceptional
review: If you're looking for sushi in Chicago look no further this is it! Good fish great staff................

title: Great sushi in the south loop
review: wonderful sushi and sashimi as well as appetisers - great service too and our party felt very well looked after.

title: Great sushi!
review: Loved the sushi and the restaurants' ambience. Great sushi! I was a sushi wabi fan and once it closed I thought I would not find sushi that was as good. I was wrong, it is as good if not better. Love this place, I do...More

title: Great food
review: I went with a friend and we had a good time. The appetizer and food was really good. I ordered a martini and it was very tasty.

title: Good food and nice staff thst are polite
review: Its a little pricey but the food snd staff make up for it. Also it was sweet as they gave us a free wallet for Christmas!!

title: Excellent sushi and fusion asian cuisine
review: This restaurant is a must-eat in South Loop of Chicago. The decor and atmosphere are warm, modern and trendy. It's quite busy so you should book before going or wait over there before getting a table. Sushis are tasty, fish is very fresh. Other dishes...More

title: South Loop fave
review: this is one of my fave neighborhood sushi spots. I like to sit at the tables in the windows in the summer. the windows are open during the summer months and the sushi is great! The spicy rolls are the best!

title: the best tuna in town every single time
review: of the dozens of times i've taken people to this, my favorite sushi restaurant in chicago, never once have the words 'oh my god' not been uttered.  language in lacking when it comes to describing their fish.  it's always fresh, the texture is always perfect...More

title: Good sushi
review: A little loud but the sushi is very fresh. Try the dragon rock roll.   A 4 minute drive from the McCormick center.

title: Always Great!
review: Love South Coast!!! A big fan of Coast, and was super excited when they opened a location in the south loop. Right up the stree from my house so stop by quite frequently! Service is always great and prices not bad at all!

title: Awesome location, even better sushi!
review: This place is south of downtown Chicago, at the edge of what is considered the "South Loop".  Recommendation came from my 14 year old daughter (yes my twins are sushi conosuiers lol). We've been here about 5 times in the past 4 months and have...More

title: One of the best
review: My colleague took me here when I was in town on business - both of us are sushi fans.  This place was packed at 9:00 on at Thursday night.  BYOB, but no big deal since there's a liquor/wine store at the south corner of the...More

title: So So Sushi
review: I had diner there today.  It was quite empty (Sun night).  I'm a sushi / sashimi addict, so I concentrated on freely ordering those from their menu.  I skipped rolls and other stuff.  They're not for me.  The quality of the fish they is uneven....More

title: Loved the Popper & South Scallop.  Some items seemed a bit overpriced and a $20 service fee for BYO is steep...
review: Loved the Popper & South Scallop.  Some items seemed a bit overpriced and a $20 service fee for BYO is steep.  Excellent food, though, and a very cool atmosphere.

title: good sushi, I miss the byob
review: good sushi, I miss the byob

title: A great daily basic!
review: A great daily basic!

title: I love the decor..contemporary chic and a twist of interestingly odd with amazing food and service. To begin, I had the...
review: I love the decor..contemporary chic and a twist of interestingly odd with amazing food and service. To begin, I had the spicy Miso soup which had jalapenos giving it a nice unexpected kick.  We then had the soft shell crab and asparagus beef appetizers which...More

title: Best Fish and really great staff. BYOB and nicely tucked away.
review: Best Fish and really great staff.  BYOB and nicely tucked away.

title: One of my favorite sushi...
review: One of my favorite sushi places in the city - very fresh. Get the fresh wasabi! Bonus is it's BYOB

title: Excellent food, reasonably priced
review: This hidden gem is couple of blocks west from McCormick Place and was recommended by a hotel staff person.  Roasted chicken and various vegetarian curie dishes are delish.  It's counter service and reasonably priced.  You can there walking almost entirely inside by following the sky...bridges west and exiting at the Hilton Garden Inn and then 2 blocks at ground level west.  The only negative and I mean only negative is that food is served in plastic containers and no recycling in sight, so everything goes into the trash.  Seems not so environmentally friendly.  Still, excellent food and fed us both for less than $20.More

title: Omg, how does this not have a higher rating?
review: I'm staying at the Marriott Marquis a few blocks down the street and noticed this had an expensive food for Chicago. I got the chicken tikka masala with sides of glazed carrots, elote corn, and mixed veggies. It also came with some garlic bread. There...was so much food I only ate 1/4 of it. Easy take-out and you can order aheadMore

title: Good option for quick food
review: This is like a fast food joint, but with better quality food. Many options (many of them fried though), but also healthier alternatives. Low prices ($8-10 a meal). So if you are at McCormick and want to eat out something quick, this is a good...optionMore

title: Good food, large portions
review: Ordered take out and recieved fresh, hot meals with generous portions. We tried a lot of items and most were very good. The bread, curry carrots and chocolate cake were the only disappointments. The catfish, quinoa platter, and the neapolitan make-your-own pasta were all fantastic!

title: Poor Management/Customer Service is also a Reflection On Your Business
review: I am a frequent customer of this restaurant or should I say I was.  On my most recent visit, I called in my order (Italian salmon salad with dressing on the side) for a pickup.  When I got home I noticed there was no dressing...or garlic bread included with the order,  Fortunately, I had salad dressing at home or I would have had to eat a salad without dressing.  I called the next day and asked to speak with the manager, Jessica.  I was told Jessica was in a meeting and I left my name, number, and order number for a call back.  On my subsequent call the same day, I was  told she had not arrived at the restaurant.  I never received a call back.  I called three days later, again, I was told Jessica was not in the restaurant and I left my name, number, and order number.  I never received a call back.  It's obvious I'm not going to get a call back.  Seems Jessica is only interested in getting the money and not repeat customers.  So, if you have a complaint, don't expect it to be resolved with management.  Poor management/customer service is a reflection on the  business as well as the quality of the food!More

title: Great Inexpensive Spot Near McCormick Pl
review: I stopped here for a quick bite and was not disappointed. The restaurant has great options and is not very expensive. After eating lunch in the restaurant I ordered a dinner to go. Red velvet cupcake is a must!

title: Delicious Food on the go!
review: Mmmmmm! Everything is so good.  Tilapia, angelhair pasta, fried shrimp, lemonade. Everything is just delicious. Best to carry out but they do have some sit down tables.

title: Great spot near McCormick place
review: If you happen to be at McCormick Center or the adjacent Marriott or Hyatt, this is a great option.   The seating area is small, but they do take out as well. There is a wide variety of options, in both lunch and dinner sizes. I...was there for dinner and can say the portions are huge, and the prices are reasonable. I ordered the salad with chicken on top. The salad was fresh and the chicken was tender. Definitely recommend!More

title: Great food for reasonable price
review: A cafeteria-style restaurant with fast service. There are 2 sides: I personally prefer the kitchen side than the chicken side.

title: Delicious meal
review: You can’t judge a restaurant by its outward appearance! This place serves huge portions of really delicious food. There is limited seating, and it’s very casual. You need to be very hungry or plan to split a meal or take some home.

title: Very reasonable
review: For being in this area, the prices are very good. I got the fried fish platter. It was ok. If I went back I'd get something else. The salads looked really good.

title: Great food
review: My coworkers and I were at McCormick’s for a conference, then we decided to have lunch at Chef Luciano.  I wish there were more tables there.  Food was incredibly tasteful!!! I got the lentil platter and it was cooked to perfection. Such a delicious blend...More

title: Lunch at Conference
review: This was my first time visiting this restaurant and it was delicious we had the fish curry and yellow rice.

title: Hidden Gem
review: You can easily pass in front of this Restaurant and never think that one of the best juicy and tasteful chicken you'll eat in your life...we have been to many cities and try different baked chicken ,but this surpasses all of them including 5 star...More

title: Good for it ambitions
review: This is not a bad place to "get a bite to eat." The ambiance is "interesting" and the food is alright. I know people who think more highly of it than I do so this is a personal rather than a professional review. I have...More

title: Lunch Date
review: Walkable distance from the McCormick Place. Very neat restaurant that is split with a kitchen option and a chicken option. I chose the kitchen side and got a pasta meal. Reasonable prices and as a small group we didn't need to wait long for our...More

title: Grilled Chicken, some rice, nothing better.
review: This walk in with a couple of tables place serves tasty basic legs and thighs chicken, either curry or grilled. Their frozen lemonade is also a treat.

title: Food is Incredibly Good
review: Chef Luciana's is somewhere you can always stop and get good food on the go. You can taste the love in the food , you can't go wrong whether its fish , pasta your going to hit an homerun. If your looking for good food...More

title: Best place in the area
review: If you're looking for good food friendly staff at a reasonable price you're at the right place. Close to the McCormick Place you will not find anywhere better. I will recommend any of the fish dishes or the roasted chicken. The lemonade or ginger beer...More

title: Good local spot near MCormick Place
review: I tried this because it is within walking distance of MCormick Place convention center. It is a safe walk alongside a busy street. I had the jerk chicken dinner.  Large portion.  A bit spicy for my taste but probably fine for others.  Chocolate cake was...More

title: Way Better than I Thought
review: We read a review in Trip Adviser, it was close to our hotel so we went. The place is basically a take out with a few tables to wait for your order or eat.  You place an order at the counter and then pick it...More

title: Small but mighty...tasty!
review: There might not be a lot of seating, but the food is great a Chef Luciano's. There are many choices on the menu, and, believe me, you get a ton of tasty food. I ordered the quinoa plate with chicken, while my husband had balsamic...More

title: Just OK, not that vegetarian-friendly
review: This is a bit of an odd fusion place. It offered much better value than the food court at McCormack place but I probably wouldn't recommend it otherwise. Seating is limited and in retrospect we should have gotten our food to go and carried it...More

title: what a hidden gem
review: Love this place. my husband and I are in town for the weekend and came across this on Trip Advisor. couldn't believe my taste buds. One night I had fish curry and second night jerk Chicken. The tastes are amazing. Wish we had a place...More

title: A bit of every spicy cuisine from around the world
review: It seems like mostly a take-out place but there are a few tables to eat in. The food ranges from Cajun to East Indian to Caribbean. The portions were more than generous. Try the ginger beer as a beverage.

title: Indian Italian food?
review: First, this is basically two restaurants, a sit down side and a take out side that has a few tables. We ate at the take out side. Second, by the name you would expect an Italian place, but it's a chicken shack with a few...More

title: Great find
review: I visited this small, mostly take out place based on reviews on TA. I had the chicken rosselini. It was pasta with chicken, vegetables, marinara and a generous dose of melted parmesan. It was absolutely fabulous!!!! Enough for 2 dinners, I finished it the next...More

title: Great lunch value
review: The food was excellent and a great value for lunch. The ten dollar lunch special (with several choices) came with rice, beans and a drink. I had the jerk chicken which had an outstanding flavor. Why go to a fast food joint when you can...More

title: Great food
review: The salmon dish was sooooo tasty.  And the spinach was good as well....almost forgot about the delicious lemonade!    They also provided ice cold water while you waited for your food to be freshly made.  I would recommend travelers to stop in

title: Luciano's is worth a visit.
review: I Went here during the Chicago Auto Show. I was staying @ the McCormick Place ConventionCenter, and came across this place while I was out exporing the area. This place is in the Southside and only a 10-15 minute walk from the McCormick Center. Most...More

title: A hint of Asian-Indian flavors
review: Conference food at the local McCormick Place stunk so we wandered outside and opted between Harold's Chicken Shack and this location. I was glad that Chef Luciano's had options for roasted instead of fried chicken. I ordered the 1/4 chicken with sides of spinach and...More

title: Great food and service!
review: We had no idea what this place was, but figured we would try something different.  It is a very small place with just a couple of tables, so we took food back to our hotel at McCormick.  The staff treated us great and we had...More

title: Valentine's Meal
review: I have been eating the same meal every Valentine's day for the last 12 years. I only go for that special day. We get it to go and enjoy it at home, presentation on the to go plate still feels special. The Jerk Chicken is...More

title: Good Chicken Tikka
review: I ate lunch here while attending a conference at the McCormick Center. It should be pointed out that Chef Luciano doesn't have a lot of competition within walking distance of the McCormick, but I was still favorably impressed. I had the chicken tikka, which felt...More

title: Food coma portions
review: While staying in Chicago for an extended weekend we found this gem.  Food was delicious with large portions that you could share with one or two other people.  Depending on your appetite!  It has a diner atmosphere.  So if you are looking for an elegant...More

title: What a surprise
review: This week I was on a business trip and had to grab a quick bite outside the McCormick Conference center.  Options were limited.  I wanted something semi-healthy, not fast food, and nothing fried.  We found this little spot and gave it a try.  It isn't...More

title: Not.what I expected
review: Friendly service..but not so sure about the food...ordered an Italian Salad and it came out a hot salad...with grilled veggies soaked in oil and what tasted as apple cider vinegar....Maybe it is a local fare...but just not what I was expecting....be sure to try the...More

title: Sick of the typical - come here
review: Love eating here but everytime I do  - I think - I could have eaten at some fancy restaurant for a few more bucks.  The food is good but I lil bit high for take out.  There are tables inside for dining in but for...More

title: Expensive Take Out
review: I've heard about this place for years. The food was mediocre but very expensive.

title: To be honest I think it...
review: To be honest I think it is over rated

title: Not recommended for Brunch
review: We had been aimlessly wandering in search of a great Brunch spot and ended up here.  We found the food to be quite disappointing.  I had the Eggs Benedict and can't recall what my husband ordered.  The service was lacking and we found ourselves wondering...where our waiter had gone, when in need of Bottomless Mimosa refills.  I am sure this restaurant is better for Mediterranean but we cannot speak to that.More

title: Giant breakfast wrap!
review: I wanted my fix of Mediterranean food while in the city but happened upon their weekend brunch instead. I had the breakfast wrap with applewood smoked bacon. It was so large I opted to use a fork and knife - great value! I enjoyed the...atmosphere here. There is a small bar area as well as an upstairs area that looks over the restaurant. Hopefully I’ll be able to try their Mediterranean food before we leave the city.More

title: Can't wait to go back
review: Amazing food. The bacon wrapped dates mouth wateringly good. Beautiful space. And Sean, our waiter, took amazing care of us.

title: horrible experience !!!!
review: if i could put less than 1 star it would be perfect , i didn’t ask about the origin of this restaurant and i hope its not Lebanese otherwise its a shame , taboole looks like everything but not taboole , like seriously cucumber ?...fatoush with spinach ? and here we go with the horrible biryani the taste of the rice is indescribable , it stinks 😀😀😀   i strongly NOT recommend this restaurant 😄More

title: So so
review: The falafel was good. The shish kabobs were tough and chewy, and so were the grilled veggies. They did not have the ingredients to make one of the drinks, so they basically brought flavored vodka and ice in a big glass.  Nit even drinkable. It...was raining hard and there was a big pool of water under our table.More

title: Hoped for the best
review: When we visit Chicago we always try to have a Mediterranean meal because we have no options where we live. Our favorite, Ema, was closed for a private function so we took a chance here.   The ambience was fine and our server could not have...been a nicer gentleman. However, the food was very average. My wife had tabouli and chicken kabob. I had tabouli and the hummus with steak. We would have expected these to be “fastballs down the middle” for a middle eastern restaurant. All were poorly seasoned and nowhere near reflective of authentic cuisine.  The service was warm and sincere but slow. Fortunately, we were not in a hurry. I would also mention that the drinks were watery. The food and drink would need to improve considerably for us to consider returning. Stick with Ema.More

title: Very Nice !!!!
review: Delicious food and a great nice atmosphere! What a party! Also the service was so nice. Soon we are going to eat with the work there and even consider giving a party there for a large group. Highly recommended.

title: Good food
review: We all loved our Fallafel warp. It was very tasty and well made. Warning! It is big. Next time we will share a wrap and get something on the side.

title: Shrimpa!
review: Very good shrimp platter, served on basmati rice. Tasty and fresh.  Grilled chicken kebab platter also good.  Picked up, so can’t speak to service or ambience.  Excellent location.

title: Terrible, unprofessional, and awful "live music"
review: We were a party of 7, visiting my sister and her husband who are students at UChicago.  The US generally does better than other parts of the world (especially Europe) when it comes to service, but Kurah is NOT an example of this. Here's what...happened:   - Our table took 15 minutes to prepare, even though we had a reservation  - Our server took another 10 minutes to arrive  - She knew nothing about the menu, just reading descriptions from the printed page when we asked questions about dishes  - Our wine order was wrong, and then when it was corrected, the server just poured from the bottle without opening it in front of us or showing us the label (standard practice for any decent restaurant)  - Our first course took about 20 minutes to arrive, our next course was easily another 40-50 minutes. When we asked the server to check on the food, she said, "I'll bring it out when it comes out, OK?"  - When the bill arrived, I noticed they had automatically added 20% gratuity, and had them remove it. I received multiple excuses during this process, including, "We had a big party before you", "The bartender was slow"..... All of this when the restaurant was practically empty.  - Finally, there was a "singer" with a piano in the room who had the most atrocious voice. Painful.  I'd recommend this place be shut down. The food actually was OK, but not worth the frustrating experience.More

title: Good food, TERRIBLE service

review: The food was fine - nothing spectacular but tasty enough. The falafel would have been much improved if it was served with hummus. The beer was good though.

review: Stopped in Saturday afternoon for a late lunch. We ordered a mix of hot and cold tapas, along with wraps. I would highly recommend the pomegranate tabouleh especially, although all the appetizers were good. The bread for the wraps was amazing - warm and chewy,...More

review: The food was excellent in flavour. The service very personal, catering to our special vegetarian needs without garlic. review: I am an Arab so I am more than familiar with most of the items on the menu. Each dish I tried had a delicate taste to it. The creative mix of ingredients playing with amd beyond a traditional recipe was a pleasurable experience. The...More

review: Kurah is located in our Neighborhood at S Michigan Ave. & 14th St.  The outdoor tables are along 14th St.  This is a busy area because the tables are located next to the entrance of a condo building.  The restaurant inside is beautiful and has...More

review: Amazing food and service! Highly recommended, Asian fusion cuisine with dishes from all Asian countries! If you don’t like spicy food order mild..

title: Hidden Gem in my hometown the best town it’s Chi-town baby
review: Oooh weee! This place is so beautiful when you walk in. It’s so  divine, elegant, enthralling, enticing, excellent, exquisite and just everything you could ask for to have a great time! The drinks are absolute phenomenal. The food is great and the staff is cool...AF! The most amazing Pacific Islanders run the spot and they have the most appealing attitudes. They were so so nice.More

title: Great local South Loop Spot
review: Great place to go hang-out and have a variety of dishes.  Fair priced and very friendly staff.  The owner remembered us after one visit and is a wonderful example of a restauranteur.  If you are looking for a good choice of Asian and Polynesian cuisine,...and local-place prices then this is the spot.  UrbanJoe calls this a must stop.More

title: Don't Dine Alone
review: On Saturday, July 27, 2019 at 1 PM,  I dined at Asian Outpost by myself (I usually dine with others). There were perhaps, four customers dining inside (they have Al Fresco dining). The waitress barely spoke English. Another staff person had to come over to...answer my question,"are the desserts  made in house (they are not)?" When couples arrived, they were greeted warmly.  The staff even engaged them in limited conversation. As you enter the restaurant, it is cluttered and nasty looking. The inside is pleasant and very relaxing. The dish I ordered was Kage Shadow listed under Signature Japanese. My lunch was 5 star (*****). My dish was beautifully presented and delicious. One a scale of 1 - 10, it was a 10. FYI, I'm always respectful, easy going and a big tipper. So why one star? The staff made me feel like an interloper, because I dined alone. As I left, the staff person who answered my question regarding  their dessert menu, totally ignored me. Being treated in such a cold manner, spoiled my lunch. The staff at the Asian Outpost should  be trained to treat each customer respectfully and made to feel welcome. I've dined at many other neighborhood restaurants in the South Loop, where I'm made to feel welcomed and my wait person always acknowledges my departure. When you dine at the Asian Outpost, go with someone.More

title: Neighborhood Gem
review: No explanation for our delay in trying this hidden-in-plain-sight-neighborhood-gem, so glad we decided to walk over tonight.  Many seating options including sidewalk for pleasant weather.  We started with sushi & the generous bowl of Vietnamese Home Style Noodle Soup. My husband was very happy with...his tuna sushi & I enjoyed the soup although it's too noodle-heavy as a starter & definitely enough to share. The dense,slightly sweet chicken fried rice was tasty another shareable dish & the Smothered Roasted Pork Belly was delicious (too fatty from a texture perspective for me) the non-greasy sauce had a deep, rich flavor, generous enough to allow for my husband's breakfast experiment tomorrow morning topped with over-easy eggs.  We plan to return, from the full dining room & counter full of carry-out orders, we are not alone in our affection for Asian Outpost.  .More

title: Another mediocre and amateur South Loop restaurant
review: Asian Outpost can best be summed up by the term “wasted potential”. This place really needs some refinement. First…the good. This place is in a great location and the South Loop desperately (and I mean desperately) needs some good restaurants. I can see that the...hundreds of people that walk by this place every day are intrigued by the name and the large menu; and the food (at least the Chinese, Thai and sushi part of the menu) is actually quite good. Stick to the egg rolls, Pad Thai, and fried rice and you won’t be disappointed. Their beer selection and some of their cocktails (like the Freaky Tiki and Asian Martinis) are also quite refreshing. Now…for the bad. As others have posted, this business is definitely geared towards take-out and delivery and stuck in a rut. The staff hasn’t been trained properly (Ever hear of a Chinese fire-drill? Watch the staff look for your bill). Your food and drinks will take at least 20 minutes to arrive (Don’t eat here if you’re in a hurry). The menu is way too big and confusing. (The Hawaiian, Korean and “Soul Food” part of the menu is pretty awful). Large menus like theirs are just obnoxious and in an Asian restaurant can be downright dangerous (The greasy fried items on the menu like the sliders and fried chicken should be renamed “Mao Tse Tung’s Revenge”). The interior décor is totally amateur and way too bright (You’ll need a pair of sunglasses and some SPF 45 to finish dinner). A hodgepodge of Asian trinkets and tableware lit by way too many halogen bulbs make this place look cheap and dated. When I hear “Asian Outpost” I want to see a charming import-export motif; shipping containers with Asian labels, pictures of exotic trading ports and the like not some hanging LED lights and Chinese lanterns from the year 1989. I really want to like this place but it needs a professional overhaul. Cut the menu in half, bring the staff and décor up to Chicago standards, make it more refined, less confusing and this restaurant could be the gem of the South Loop.More

title: For Dinner
review: We went there for dinner.  Eversthing was fine. Delicious good, fast cooked, kind & attentive service.  We'll definitly come back!

title: Nice atmosphere, decent dinner
review: I picked this place because it was walking distance to my hotel and had decent ratings. I wasn't disappointed. Good food (not spectacular, but good) and pretty inexpensive for the area. Definitely recommend to folks not wanting to break the bank and have a decent...meal.More

review: I am in town for a conference and ordered for delivery to a local hotel.  The food arrived in the timeframe quoted.  The food was warm and very delicious!

title: Dirtiest place every with poor food
review: Another bad restaurant choice during my visit to Chicago.  Restaurant was extremely dirty and unkept.  The seat cushions had stains on all of them and the bathroom was an absolute mess.  The bar looked like an explosion went off in it.  This was more of...a takeaway place than a restaurant anyone would eat in.  Anyplace that serves everything specializes in nothing.  The staff was friendly but I do not even think they recognize the details on what needs to be fixed.More

title: Pleasant Dinner
review: Very delicious food and nice decoration. Service is very good too! Ordered food by recommendation and they are actually good!

title: Asian Comfort Food
review: If you’re looking for General Tso’s chicken or combination fried rice keep heading west to Chinatown. But if you want Asian food without the American made gimmicks, Asian Outpost is for you. The owners (Lois & David) are the folks behind Hot Woks, Cool Sushi...and they really know their stuff. The menu is diverse, blending Thai, Chinese and Japanese favorites including stir fry, entrees, ramen and sushi. You MUST try the fried chicken. We’re also fans of the quinoa salad. They have large booths and a nice outdoor space as well. Service is usually good and if it’s not, the manager is always available. A great way to break out of your Chinese carry out rut!More

title: Variety of Asian cusians
review: Enjoyed our dinner.  Had the spicy peanut noodle dish and pad Thai. Food was delicious, portions were on the smaller side.

title: Messed up my order and not willing at all to fix it
review: Missing things from my pick up order. Originally they said they would refund the item then called back just to tell me they wouldn't. Wouldn't deliver a complete item either. I rarely leave reviews but an apology doesn't help when I have to go get...food somewhere else after I order food from here. Pretty disappointing.  Plenty of other restaurants in the area that don't pull this nonsense. No reason to deal with terrible customer service and mediocre food.More

title: Lunch with the Family.
review: Stopped here on a Saturday afternoon for lunch with the family. The menu is really very nice with a lot of choices.   The food was very fresh and well prepared. If you like Thai/Asian cuisine I would highly recommend this location. A word to the...wise the potions are very large and can probably be split by two people.More

title: Sunday dinner
review: Amazing food and service! Highly recommended, Asian fusion cuisine with dishes from all Asian countries! If you don’t like spicy food order mild..

title: Hidden Gem in my hometown the best town it’s Chi-town baby
review: Oooh weee! This place is so beautiful when you walk in. It’s so  divine, elegant, enthralling, enticing, excellent, exquisite and just everything you could ask for to have a great time! The drinks are absolute phenomenal. The food is great and the staff is cool...AF! The most amazing Pacific Islanders run the spot and they have the most appealing attitudes. They were so so nice.More

title: Great local South Loop Spot
review: Great place to go hang-out and have a variety of dishes.  Fair priced and very friendly staff.  The owner remembered us after one visit and is a wonderful example of a restauranteur.  If you are looking for a good choice of Asian and Polynesian cuisine,...and local-place prices then this is the spot.  UrbanJoe calls this a must stop.More

title: Don't Dine Alone
review: On Saturday, July 27, 2019 at 1 PM,  I dined at Asian Outpost by myself (I usually dine with others). There were perhaps, four customers dining inside (they have Al Fresco dining). The waitress barely spoke English. Another staff person had to come over to...answer my question,"are the desserts  made in house (they are not)?" When couples arrived, they were greeted warmly.  The staff even engaged them in limited conversation. As you enter the restaurant, it is cluttered and nasty looking. The inside is pleasant and very relaxing. The dish I ordered was Kage Shadow listed under Signature Japanese. My lunch was 5 star (*****). My dish was beautifully presented and delicious. One a scale of 1 - 10, it was a 10. FYI, I'm always respectful, easy going and a big tipper. So why one star? The staff made me feel like an interloper, because I dined alone. As I left, the staff person who answered my question regarding  their dessert menu, totally ignored me. Being treated in such a cold manner, spoiled my lunch. The staff at the Asian Outpost should  be trained to treat each customer respectfully and made to feel welcome. I've dined at many other neighborhood restaurants in the South Loop, where I'm made to feel welcomed and my wait person always acknowledges my departure. When you dine at the Asian Outpost, go with someone.More

title: Neighborhood Gem
review: No explanation for our delay in trying this hidden-in-plain-sight-neighborhood-gem, so glad we decided to walk over tonight.  Many seating options including sidewalk for pleasant weather.  We started with sushi & the generous bowl of Vietnamese Home Style Noodle Soup. My husband was very happy with...his tuna sushi & I enjoyed the soup although it's too noodle-heavy as a starter & definitely enough to share. The dense,slightly sweet chicken fried rice was tasty another shareable dish & the Smothered Roasted Pork Belly was delicious (too fatty from a texture perspective for me) the non-greasy sauce had a deep, rich flavor, generous enough to allow for my husband's breakfast experiment tomorrow morning topped with over-easy eggs.  We plan to return, from the full dining room & counter full of carry-out orders, we are not alone in our affection for Asian Outpost.  .More

title: Another mediocre and amateur South Loop restaurant
review: Asian Outpost can best be summed up by the term “wasted potential”. This place really needs some refinement. First…the good. This place is in a great location and the South Loop desperately (and I mean desperately) needs some good restaurants. I can see that the...hundreds of people that walk by this place every day are intrigued by the name and the large menu; and the food (at least the Chinese, Thai and sushi part of the menu) is actually quite good. Stick to the egg rolls, Pad Thai, and fried rice and you won’t be disappointed. Their beer selection and some of their cocktails (like the Freaky Tiki and Asian Martinis) are also quite refreshing. Now…for the bad. As others have posted, this business is definitely geared towards take-out and delivery and stuck in a rut. The staff hasn’t been trained properly (Ever hear of a Chinese fire-drill? Watch the staff look for your bill). Your food and drinks will take at least 20 minutes to arrive (Don’t eat here if you’re in a hurry). The menu is way too big and confusing. (The Hawaiian, Korean and “Soul Food” part of the menu is pretty awful). Large menus like theirs are just obnoxious and in an Asian restaurant can be downright dangerous (The greasy fried items on the menu like the sliders and fried chicken should be renamed “Mao Tse Tung’s Revenge”). The interior décor is totally amateur and way too bright (You’ll need a pair of sunglasses and some SPF 45 to finish dinner). A hodgepodge of Asian trinkets and tableware lit by way too many halogen bulbs make this place look cheap and dated. When I hear “Asian Outpost” I want to see a charming import-export motif; shipping containers with Asian labels, pictures of exotic trading ports and the like not some hanging LED lights and Chinese lanterns from the year 1989. I really want to like this place but it needs a professional overhaul. Cut the menu in half, bring the staff and décor up to Chicago standards, make it more refined, less confusing and this restaurant could be the gem of the South Loop.More

title: For Dinner
review: We went there for dinner.  Eversthing was fine. Delicious good, fast cooked, kind & attentive service.  We'll definitly come back!

title: Nice atmosphere, decent dinner
review: I picked this place because it was walking distance to my hotel and had decent ratings. I wasn't disappointed. Good food (not spectacular, but good) and pretty inexpensive for the area. Definitely recommend to folks not wanting to break the bank and have a decent...meal.More

title: Delicious food delivered
review: I am in town for a conference and ordered for delivery to a local hotel.  The food arrived in the timeframe quoted.  The food was warm and very delicious!

title: Dirtiest place every with poor food
review: Another bad restaurant choice during my visit to Chicago.  Restaurant was extremely dirty and unkept.  The seat cushions had stains on all of them and the bathroom was an absolute mess.  The bar looked like an explosion went off in it.  This was more of...a takeaway place than a restaurant anyone would eat in.  Anyplace that serves everything specializes in nothing.  The staff was friendly but I do not even think they recognize the details on what needs to be fixed.More

title: Pleasant Dinner
review: Very delicious food and nice decoration. Service is very good too! Ordered food by recommendation and they are actually good!

title: Asian Comfort Food
review: If you’re looking for General Tso’s chicken or combination fried rice keep heading west to Chinatown. But if you want Asian food without the American made gimmicks, Asian Outpost is for you. The owners (Lois & David) are the folks behind Hot Woks, Cool Sushi...and they really know their stuff. The menu is diverse, blending Thai, Chinese and Japanese favorites including stir fry, entrees, ramen and sushi. You MUST try the fried chicken. We’re also fans of the quinoa salad. They have large booths and a nice outdoor space as well. Service is usually good and if it’s not, the manager is always available. A great way to break out of your Chinese carry out rut!More

title: Variety of Asian cusians
review: Enjoyed our dinner.  Had the spicy peanut noodle dish and pad Thai. Food was delicious, portions were on the smaller side.

title: Messed up my order and not willing at all to fix it
review: Missing things from my pick up order. Originally they said they would refund the item then called back just to tell me they wouldn't. Wouldn't deliver a complete item either. I rarely leave reviews but an apology doesn't help when I have to go get...food somewhere else after I order food from here. Pretty disappointing.  Plenty of other restaurants in the area that don't pull this nonsense. No reason to deal with terrible customer service and mediocre food.More

title: Lunch with the Family.
review: Stopped here on a Saturday afternoon for lunch with the family. The menu is really very nice with a lot of choices.   The food was very fresh and well prepared. If you like Thai/Asian cuisine I would highly recommend this location. A word to the...wise the potions are very large and can probably be split by two people.More

title: Great variety of Asian Fusion.
review: Very helpful staff. Great selection of food. All of it fresh. Something for everyone. The ambience was pleasing and we never felt rushed. Highly recommended. A very good kids menu too. Full bar but not an extensive sake selection. Great portions.

title: Delicious meal and beautiful ambiance!
review: This place was awesome! The food and drinks were so good and super affordable. There are plenty of vegan/vegetarian options to choose from. The service was great. The ambiance was very relaxing. We still can't believe how cheap it was to dine here! Definitely recommend...More

title: Yummy on a budget
review: We recently moved to the South Loop and this was the first restaurant we decided to explore. It was so good. For dinner I had the Ginger Chicken, which by the way, YUM! For an appetizer we had Calamari and an amazing dip to go...More

title: Dinner with Family
review: Stopped her with my son his wife and 2 year old granddaughter. The quality of the food was very good. The quality of the sushi was really great.  The rest of the meal pork belly, ribs, and garden veggies seared in a wok had a...More

title: Can't Miss Trying This Place When in Chicago.
review: Unique and homey. Has an old world feel to the place but great mix of Asian food. We had the garlic and ginger fried chicken, the Chinese barbecue ribs. Ramen was excellent. I was quite surprised. It was walking distance from the Hilton by Grant...More

title: Best of Chicago
review: We stumbled upon Asian Outpost on Trip Advisor and couldn't have been more pleased.  Walking in the front door we knew we had made a great choice. Superior ambience with great views. Our waiter was very attentive and helpful with the menu.  Fabulous pot stickers,...More

title: Great Asian Fusion food in a funky Asian atmosphere
review: I have brought family and friends here a few times, and it is always awesome. The food is delicious, and I have never had to wait for a table. I keep meaning to try their Ramen noodle soup, but get distracted by other delicious options....More

title: Great Food and Fun Atmosphere
review: Rustic Chinese Decor that is fun and modern!  Food and Drinks were fabulous!  We had two appetizers, tempura and lettuce wraps, both very tasty and well done.  Our entries were excellent. I've never ordered ramen at a restaurant. I ordered the Tonkatsu Ramen and my...More

title: I will be back!
review: I will start with that fact that this is a great place in all the things that matter: Food, Location and Service (Natty was great.)  From the minute I stepped in the door, Asian Outpost was a great experience. The hostess was not at the...More

title: Pleasant Surprise in the South Loop
review: We visited the place a few days ago by chance. Living in the South Loop we keep trying restaurants in the area to see if we find our next favorite. Well, guess what: the search is over! The good taste of this family-run restaurant is...More

title: Great choice
review: Visited here as a group of four and we were not disappointed.  The restaurant is upstairs and it's got a great style to it.  The food was delicious I had the salmon pan seared with soy and ginger and my friend had Ramon noodle soup...More

title: Nice Asion place for dinner
review: We went there as a group of 10 on a Saturday night without reservations.  Staff was extremely friendly and made it happen. The decor in this restaurant is very nice. Staff is professional, fast  and friendly. The food was very tasteful, certainly different and better...More

title: Delicious!
review: Visiting from out of town and found this restaurant. The food and service were both spectacular.  Loved the gluten free options (including gluten free soy sauce), and everyone in our group enjoyed their food.

title: Excellent review
review: Very enjoyable visit.  My wife and me celebrated our wedding anniversary.  We had wine, salad and entree.  The salad and entree were plated properly and served without distraction.  We would definitely visit again.  We would not hesitate including our friends and family.

title: Great food and service
review: Late to review this place but have been many times. The service is always good and food is delicious. We've had many items and generally order the ginger garlic fried chicken, a sushi roll and roasted pork belly sliders (a favorite of ours).

title: Delicious food, great service, great location
review: A great Chicago spot with nice sidewalk seating for a sunny day. Really good food. Kombucha Squash eggrolls and Sauteed Brussels sprouts are excellent appetizers.  Really enjoyed the Spicy Nutty Noodles. Simple dish with great flavor- lives up to its spicy description.  Servers were very...More

title: Must try! You'll be hooked
review: My boyfriend and I decided to try this place after seeing good reviews. This place was pretty awesome. If you are looking to try something different but don't want to be dissapointed then this is the place for you! I recommend the cucumber salad. We...More

title: Amazing!
review: This place literally made my day. We ordered the pot stickers and lettuce wraps to start with - YUM. Then ordered the Ginger-garlic fried chicken for the kids. My kids are so picky and they couldn't stop eating it. The sauce is on the side...More

title: Dining In!
review: I live in the South Loop and have been hesitant to try Asian Outpost.  The space has been home to many restaurants so I was naturally skeptical.  We ordered take out online and had a great experience.  The menu isn't traditional but there were plenty...More

title: Nice Asian Option in the South Loop
review: We have walked by this restaurant a few times and finally decided to try it out and we were pleasantly surprised.  Very friendly service and the food was very good and reasonably priced.  We had traditional noodle dishes but plan to go back and try...More

title: Asian Comfort Food
review: Very rustic and homey.  Food was more like Asian soul food. Very different experience. My parents loved it.

title: Excellent service and food
review: My girlfirends and I stopped here for lunch and were pleasantly surprised. The young woman who waited on us ws amazing. One of our friends is gluten intolerant and our waitress made multiple trips back to the kitchen to make sure she had a gluten...More

title: Average food, poor service
review: We were disappointed in the quality of the food and the poor service.  The restaruant seems to have a problem with identity -- is it Asian, fusion American, or some other mix.  The noodle dish was bland and lacked any distinctive spice flavors.  A specialty...More

title: Still getting it right
review: My husband and I visited the Asian Outpost in Chicago and were a little disappointed.  We found the miso soup to be very good but the lettuce wraps disappointing and the service disappointing as well. We were greeted immediately by the waiter but instead of...More

title: Try Mamas Ginger Garlic Fried Chicken
review: This restaurant is located in the south Loop on S. Wabash ave.   The Fried chicken is lightly fried and seasoned, with no greasy aftertaste.  My choice of 2 sides are the ruby red slaw and the corn bread.  Also try their noodles and sushi. The...More

title: Amazing
review: I never thought I would order fried chicken at an Asian restaurant, but the waiter recommended it and it was absolutely terrific.  The Chef came out and visited us and he was a fascinating, not very humble young man.  But his food backed up his...More

title: Small but well thought out menu!
review: Oriental comfort food at its best! is the number 1 priority at this restaurant. Good quality dishes & bursting with the right flavors, eclectic decor( oriental, vintage and industrial), excellent exhaust in place will not make you smelling like the food you just ate when...More

title: Food is king at this place.
review: My wife and I started out with pork belly sliders. She  had their version of fried chicken and I had the ramen noodle soup and sushi. We were blown away with the food as well as with the service. Please go and enjoy this wonderful...More

title: So Glad it's within Walking Distance!!
review: Eclectic is the word here.  You can get some traditional Asian food such as sushi, but I like the idea of having other options.  The fried chicken is unbelievably good--you'll never want Col. Sanders or Brown's again!  The ribs are extremely flavorful and practically fall...More

title: Exile Me to this Asian Outpost
review: So think Chinese restaurant meets Yellowstone Lodge. Then add really good servers and owners who come around and ask about your meal. And of course put some delicious and unique items on the menu. Then you've created The Asian Outpost. Oh, and make the portions...More

title: Yuuuummmmmmm!!!
review: So glad to see a new awesome place in the southloop.  This place is very good.  One of the best fried chicken I have ever had!  It's very crispy and very moist.  They use a pressure fryer and it makes all the difference.  The ginger...More

title: Not at all what I expected...in a good way
review: This restaurant opened in out neighborhood a couple months ago by owners Lois and Dave who have 4 other Asian restaurants. We walked over to see if it was good or not.  All I can say is WOW!  Our waiter described the menu as "Asian...More

title: Nice
review: Cool space, nice people, though the cortado came out like a latte - undrinkable if you don't like a huge cup of warm milk. Tasty gourmet poptart (great idea)!

title: Nice for a quick bite to eat
review: We were on a tight schedule on Sunday mid-day looking for a quick breakfast and coffee. This place was near our next stop. Loved the local bakery cafe option.  Muffin and scone and coffee!!  Just enough to tide us over.  And reasonably priced.  Yummy!!

title: Nice place but longer lunch wait
review: We went here around lunch time on a Saturday. We had french toast and biscuits and gravy. My wife had tea and I had a beer from their draft. The staff was friendly and the food arrived earlier than we thought (said 30 minutes, but...was brought out between 15-20). The only difficulty was that it was an hour wait to get in. The line looks deceptively shorter than what it is. While the food was rather good, I don't think we'd be willing to wait that long again. If you catch it without a wait though, then it is worth the money paid.More

title: Fabulous Coffee
review: We found a very special little Bakery and coffee shop. You could just pay for the wonderful smell of baking bread. Combine that with coffee and fresh toast and home made jam set us up for our days out in Chicago. Good value for money...and very friendly staff.More

title: A tad Overrated
review: We were directed to Spoke and Bird by our hotel. A very trendy spot that is just above a coffee house. The whole process to even get to order our food was arduous. They have limited offerings is you are hungry. I had a chicken...salad sandwich. They put on what the consider to garnish- pickled kale stems. It was not pickled and why? Why the stems? They were not good. It is a hard pass for me.More

title: Great place with a kid and dog
review: When you have a two year old who doesn’t sit still, it is a great place to visit for breakfast. They have inside dining area too but their outside fenced area accommodates lot of people. We went to their South Loop location. You order and...pay first and wait for them to serve you. Waiting time was not very long. I ordered myself Egg Sandwich but wish I had ordered Bake House Strata which I tasted a little from my wife’s order. Sandwich was average but very filling. Had ample space to run with my grandkids and keep him occupied. I will go there again with additional knowledge of what I am going to order next.More

title: More than a coffee house
review: We had a delightful breakfast. The food was very tasty and service was very good. The seating area is “across the hall” from the room where one orders. They bring your order too your table. Very pleasant neighborhood.

title: Excellent personal service..by the manager!
review: Celebrating a graduation with family with lovely fresh and wholesome food (and coffee!) but the stand out impression was created by the manager who served us so personally and kindly paying particular attention to grandma and grandpa (btw good way to get a nice tip...;-)More

title: Nice outdoor space
review: This little cafe had the greatest outdoor space for seating! They were extremely dog friendly and the food was wonderful as well!

title: Very pleasant to sit with a baby
review: Stopped in while providing daddy day care for my tiny daughter while my wife went to a conference.  Very nice French toast and coffee. Beware the ‘bronut’ if you worry about your blood sugar!  Family changing room through the back in the play area (which...a nice lady helped me find).More

title: Very unique options for breakfast and lunch.  I would return!
review: Nice corner building with many windows and ample charging stations. Good families, couples, friends or just needing to work by yourself while grabbing a bite.  Quaint court yard area for larger parties.

title: Great place for a delicious lunch
review: We discovered this place while driving through the area. What we found was an eclectic menu offering delicious choices and healthy sides. This is a must visit place if you are in the area.

title: Coffee and business
review: Grab a coffee, wine, or beer and enjoy purple grits, egg sandwiches, or salads and have a business meeting, do work on your laptop, or catch up with a friend.

title: Excellent coffee!!!
review: Oat milk cappuccino - incredible coffee! Loved every single cup of it and went there every morning for the 8 days I was there. I never had anything else but that’s one not to miss :)

title: Perfect spot for breakfast!!
review: This cafe came highly recommend and I was very excited to check it out. The Spoke and the Bird had a huge outdoor eating area that was perfect for our September morning. The food was amazing and I loved my tea. I ordered the French...toast and my friend ordered a egg and ham breakfast sandwich and we enjoyed every bit. We will be back before we head home. The customer service was spot on.More

title: Excellent coffee
review: Australians have such a hard time finding good coffee when attending Conferences in the US. So happy to find this wonderful cafe a short walk from the Marriott Marquis and McCormick Place.

title: Great little cafe
review: If you are looking to get away from the crowds at the convention center for a short while, take a quick walk to get to the Spoke & Bird.  It's a pleasant 20 minute walk or so, depending on how fast you walk, through nice...More

title: Slice of Heaven
review: I was staying at the Marriott Marquis and wanted a lovely brunch spot that I could walk to while dragging luggage. The Spoke & Bird was a short, pleasant walk through the Chicago Women’s Park. The food is baked fresh in house and the coffee...More

title: Third visit in 2 days says it all!
review: Relaxed, great staff, really good food and coffee. Lunch yesterday was a fabulous kale salad, eggs for breakfast today also great. Delightful relaxed outdoor eating area for this time of year. Worth the reasonably short walk to avoid typical hotel food!

title: Delicious Meal in a Neat Neighborhood
review: On a nice July day, I enjoyed a tasty sandwich and salad in the outdoor eating area. Dogs were welcome, and many people were out enjoying the fresh air. There is also an indoor eating area and lots of unique food choices.

title: Potential to be Awesome!
review: We have been here 3 times in the week we were visiting our daughter. Today was a total bust! Waited in-line for 20 min at 11:30 am and they were out of most of the lunch items and no substitutions. So we had coffee:(

title: Good food...light on atmosphere
review: This is a bit of a hole in the wall but a great find. I had the turkey burger and it was delicious. They have a good gluten free menu. Check it out!

title: Breakfast w dogs
review: Great to walk to with dogs! Came for breakfast, nice atmosphere. Of course dog friendly- we always go everywhere with our furry friends!

title: Not what we expected!
review: We visited on a very cool Saturday, around 12:30 PM. The servers and workers were very kind and patient when we arrived and ordered. This place was packed, but this is the only place -very nearby- to eat in this area! I will note that...More

title: Yummy
review: I have only gotten lattes here. They make me a lavender mocha. It is phenomenal. I ask to have it put in to a larger cup so they can add lots of foam. They are happy to accommodate me. Friendly baristas. They have a nice...More

title: Classic breakfast
review: Ordered their classic breakfast with eggs over easy. Only disappointment was that the two eggs were way overdone for an over easy order. Meal came out hot with three strips of bacon done nice and crispy. Potatoes were cubed and portion was generous. Whole wheat...More

title: Good food - nice atmosphere
review: Good food with friendly staff and nice atmosphere. It was within walking distance of our hotel. The food was homemade and it was a nice place to enjoy breakfast.  I would recommend it for a quick bite to eat for breakfast or lunch.

title: Wish it were better
review: I have been stopping by for years, even before the ownership changed spiffed the place up. The sign and name are attractive and the location is good. They are advantaged by the lack of competition if the area. The biggest plus is their large and...More

title: Great neighborhood place with a nice outdoor patio
review: A cool little neighborhood joint with a good vibe and casual atmosphere.  We love to grab breakfast there on a walk and enjoy the outdoor patio and fresh food-the crepes are fantastic!  We are frequent diners, especially in the warmer months...

title: Attitude
review: The two owners of this restaurant are absolute terrors. They remind me of our current president who immediately loves anyone who has anything positive to say about him but otherwise goes into attack mode if anyone is critical. A condescending, bullying attitude is no way...More

title: BLT Sandwich with Side Salad the Best Meal I Had in Chicago
review: Except for waiting several minutes in line at lunch, everything about this meal was good, including the frangipane galette I ordered for dessert. Even found a little shade in which to eat my lunch al fresco.

title: Great Breakfast
review: We took 8 people, ordered different breakfast items, everything was awesome.  The home made biscuits were the bomb!  They also have beer for breakfast.

title: Dog friendly,  breakfast/coffee house
review: This was a great place to walk to from Burnham harbour. They have outside seating and is dog friendly for out 2 Aussies. Had a vanilla latte and the stratta both were very good. The stir fried house potatoes are the best I have ever...More

title: The open kitchen really lets you hear all the F* bombs the staff is dropping
review: Stopped in for a drink on our way to Soldier Field. Friendly staff, nice little beer selection, good patio, and a big sign that told us their specialty was "Biscuits and Gravy". It sounded good enough to make us come back the next morning.   We...More

title: minimal menu
review: very disappointing. very nice young team but very minimal menu. more like a students hangout place than an eatery.

title: Fantastic breakfast and outdoor patio
review: Quick service, fantastic food, relaxing patio seating.  We had the egg sandwich and breakfast strata.  Both were excellent.

title: Not worth the frustration
review: Walked here from McCormick place for business lunch at noon and was informed that they did not serve food and stopped taking orders. Not reliable.

title: Great space, small menu
review: My mom and I ate outside here for lunch, and we really loved it. It is rare to find so much space to be outside in this area. We both got sandwiches which were very good. The salads were also very tasty. The food menu...More

title: Gem in city
review: Looking for a place for breakfast in the area. It is on a corner 18th Street, easy to find but need some patience to find parking. Shop operated like a coops, there is a daycare on the same place. You place your order in one...More

title: Excellent breakfast
review: I've only tried the breakfast here - with a large group and everyone was happy with their choices.   A little pricey for breakfast, but the food was excellent, as was the coffee.  Order at the counter, and they bring your food to you, so not...More

title: Cute. Nice atmosphere on a late Sunday morning
review: Nice to unwind with a bowl of soup and a latte. Not crowded. Well spaced. It's raining, but looks like they have a really nice patio seating area. My French Onion soup has some kick to it, almost spicy.

title: Wonderful patio
review: The patio is large, the location is peaceful (park nearby), and the food is good.  No GF bread options.  House made ketchup is tasty.  Would eat here again.

title: Breakfast no more.
review: Went for breakfast with family. Waited for food over 30 min.  Unfriendly personnel. Food is too expensive and average.

title: Hidden Coffee Shop
review: One of the loveliest undiscovered gems in the city. Spoke and Bird uses sustainably sourced ingredients to create coffee shop magic. Their cheesy grits, local beers, and pastries (made minutes away at their bake shop) are not to be missed. In the summer, their large...More

title: Breakfast
review: Went on a Saturday morning and had a good quality breakfast with coffee. Walkable from McCormick place. Great coffee to start the day.

title: BLT Sandwich with Side Salad the Best Meal I Had in Chicago
review: Except for waiting several minutes in line at lunch, everything about this meal was good, including the frangipane galette I ordered for dessert. Even found a little shade in which to eat my lunch al fresco.

title: Great Breakfast
review: We took 8 people, ordered different breakfast items, everything was awesome.  The home made biscuits were the bomb!  They also have beer for breakfast.

review: Nice to unwind with a bowl of soup and a latte. Not crowded. Well spaced. It's raining, but looks like they have a really nice patio seating area. My French Onion soup has some kick to it, almost spicy.

review: The patio is large, the location is peaceful (park nearby), and the food is good.  No GF bread options.  House made ketchup is tasty.  Would eat here again.
