title: Breakfast
review: Went on a Saturday morning and had a good quality breakfast with coffee. Walkable from McCormick place. Great coffee to start the day.

title: What a find!
review: Breakfast menu is diverse. Whether you want bacon and eggs or a bit more healthy with granola and yogurt, this is the place. Portions are filling, coffee and latte options are wide as are cold drinks. Only downside is seating is sparse. Prices are reasonable.

title: Local restaurant
review: Very busy lunch group from the neighborhood near Prairie Ave area.All the bread and pastries are made fresh daily.They use local farm partners.The food is very fresh and sandwiches are good.I had the honey &tea chicken sandwich.They have all day breakfasts lunch and dinner.The location...More

title: Great breakfast and excellent espresso
review: Cool vibe hipster place, with a nice set of breakfast and lunch menu options. Espresso is excellent but not world-class. Service is a bit slow, but the food items are well-crafted and worth the wait.

title: Great Food, Slow Service
review: I stopped for lunch and had an omelette and coffee. The coffee was great, a really rich blend. Omelette was well made with fresh ingredients.  However, it took 25 minutes for my food to arrive and I was in a big rush to finish before...More

title: Speaking of The Spoke
review: If you are in need of a gourmet roast beef sandwich - look no further. This wonderful Cafe/ beer garden is the perfect place for an afternoon bite. Stop in, well worth the wait in line for a great sandwich.

title: A great quick bite
review: We found this place shortly after checking in to our hotel. After a day of travel, we were pleased to find such a nice place offering both coffee and beer. I had the mushroom sandwich, and partner had a roast beef, I believe. Both sandwiches...More

title: Unique local cafe
review: Stumbled upon this place and tried the classic breakfast and was pleasantly surprised.  Good food and great atmosphere.

title: Unique & friendly cafe with great farm to table American cusine
review: I stumbled across this hidden gem in Chicago's South Loop / Prairie District Neighborhood. It's one of the few places with any real character in the area. It sits inside a building that I believe is owned by the City of Chicago and adjacent to...More

title: Excellent Local Farm to Table
review: Our new go to brunch place. Very fresh, everything local and homemade. Pleasant outdoor seating. Good craft beer selection as well. Everything on the menu looks good.

title: Just give me pancakes...
review: As a neighbor to this establishment, I was excited when they moved in... however, the hipster take on easy to make meals did not impress.  Went there once and have not been back.  I ordered the pancakes and they came out cold.  Like not lukewarm,...More

title: Classic breakfast
review: Had the opportunity to sit outside on a lovely Sunday morning.  The Classic Breakfast was perfectly prepared.  The jam is great with white toast.  My husband enjoyed his coffee.  Very relaxing.  We are from out of town and without our dog but love to find...More

title: Lunch stop on bike ride
review: Bike ride stop for lunch.  Nice outdoor seating and large indoor seating areas.  NO place to lock your bike!  Seem strange given the name.  You ordered at the counter and take a number to your table.   They must have been short staffed as you had...More

title: Such a great place!
review: As soon as I walked into the Spoke & Bird for dinner, I knew I would love it. It has a very quaint, sort of hipster vibe. They had craft beers and specialty coffees on display. I wished I could come back the next day...More

title: Three strikes You're Out
review: I love the location. I love the name. I love the outdoor seating area. I don't love the service or the food. First time staff too busy talking to take my order. Second time my sandwich was meh. Third time thought I'd try soup and...More

title: Quick lunch before visiting Glassner House
review: On one side of Glassner House it is this place where one can get sandwiches, burgers, Hot dogs, etc. Tve food is ok. The place has indoor tables as well as a terrace.

title: Food is amazing
review: My wife and happened to stumble across  this place. What a great surprise the food was tasty and served fast. They have lots of choices for coffee and beers. I would recommend this place to anyone. The seating is a little strange because they share...More

title: Great local restaurant
review: This place had excellent burgers and a beautiful outdoor patio. Also, they have great coffee. I would definitely return when visiting Chicago.

title: Nice location but lot's of better options in the South Loop.
review: I remembered this location when it was under previous ownership, Lovely location in a quiet neighbourhood with outdoor seating next to a park - what more could you ask for on a sunny Chicago afternoon!  Unfortunately the food just wasn't up to the ambiance. Party...More

title: Perfect place for a mid-morning break
review: Visiting Chicago and the Glessner House. Delightful cafe for a break- good tea and cake. Relaxed and welcoming. Oddly spacious. If only there were more places like this.

title: Nice little brunch
review: This crafty little nook serves up nice breakfast options and accommodates a variety of patron. To the left is the kitchen and bar for quick orders (no wait staff) and the quaint dining room on the right offers tables, booths, and many wall outlets to...More

title: Good
review: I thought the food here was very good. It is a little confusing so if you are a first timer, you order and pay in one room (also get drinks there), then take a table number to one of two OTHER rooms, and then wait...More

title: Breakfast mixed, expected better
review: Nice looking restaurant. Ordered 3 different dishes. Egg sandwich tasty as were home fries. Pancakes very dry and a little overcooked/burnt . French toast only OK. One good option, one average and one poor. Expected better for the price!

title: Sad breakfast
review: Recently had breakfast but it must have been a bad day since the pancakes were dry and were served with a savory garlic butter and a large portion of bacon hash and cost $12. We also had a mushroom omelet but the mushrooms were large...More

title: Fail
review: Staff is unfriendly and the portions are extremely small. Ordered poached eggs and they came out hard as a rock. New ownership and sit down service would be needed here for me to come back.

title: Cool and Nice Eatery
review: pretty cool simple and healthy meals and specialty drinks restaurant. I had omelette, which I liked. The ambience and service were cool, thoughtful, and nice. If you're in the area, check it out. You can also bring your computer and work.

title: A hidden gem in a quiet neighborhood.
review: This was a pleasant walk from our hotel which I did not consider to be breakfast friendly, so I ate here a few times.  The pancakes with bacon jam and bourbon syrup are amazing.  I had to take some back with us for lunch.  we...More

title: Wonderful in the neighborhood --all day options
review: We recently stayed in the area and walked to this place all three mornings for breakfast and never tired of the options.  They have lots of room inside but a lovely variety of tables to enjoy al fresco (weather permitting).  You can simply get coffee...More

title: Excellent South loop cafe!
review: Stopped by on a lake front bike ride to recharge and was pleasantly surprised by the quality of food and space! Great big outdoor patio and lots of space indoors as well. Service was great, food looked amazing and was reasonable priced. Breakfast and burgers...More

title: A hidden Gem, go try Pita Heaven
review: Just needed a snack, so thought we would drop in here... Checked out the menu then ordered a Donna Kebab and fries... Took a seat with a large soda and waited.. Around 5 minutes later our dinner arrived... So big fresh and hot too! Well...- super, really enjoyed. Fast clean tasty friendly service and so much food at a great price. Highly recommend!!!More

title: Delicious!
review: Well, i was craving for gyros since i got to Chicago and yesterday i found out that Pita Heaven offers a 2x1 special  I was with my parents and the 3 of us asked for lamb gyros. None of us ate the second one, they...are pretty well served so you will only have 2 if you are really starving.  ProssMore

title: Gem
review: I love small eatery businesses where there is obvious care put into all aspects of the place including the food, the service, the cleanliness and the vibe.  This place was all of that.  Everyone worked hard and they wanted me to like what I ordered...despite this place being a volume establishment......and I absolutely did like it.  The best way to describe this is high quality, wholesome Greek-ish fast food.  I would eat here again in a minute.More

title: Delicious food with generous portions
review: I was with a group and was a little hesitant at first but the food was delicious.  I ordered the chicken pesto panini and there was more than I could eat.  The prices were very reasonable.  I would highly recommend this restaurant to others.

title: BEST gyro meat ever
review: I have taken food to go from the restaurant and have used them for catering in my office.  Hands down THE BEST gyro meat I have EVER had.  I don't know how they do it, but they do it.  Everything is super fresh.  The Mediterranean...salad with the  honey mustard vinaigrette is amazing - throw in some chicken gyro meat and ah......heaven. I highly recommend this food!!!More

title: good food, great options
review: they have homemade chips from fresh cut potatoes. the chicken pesto pannini is delicious and filling. the price is right and the baklava tastes very authentic.

title: Greek!!!
review: I wanted a gyro and this hit the spot! Fresh food, clean restaurant and friendly staff!!! I am from this area and have lived in Florida the past 20 years and can't find a decent gyro there so I was definitely hankering for a true...gyro.More

title: "Hit the Spot" Food
review: I always drop by here to pick up something quick when I don't feel like cooking. The burgers and grilled chicken sandwiches are my 'go to' meals. I haven't actually tried any of the Greek food but what I usually order is always very tasty....The prices are good especially for the amount of food that you get. I typically order pick up and food is consistently always ready around 15 min. Glad to have this place nearby.More

title: Gyros were huge!!
review: My friend and I were hungry after ice skating and we stopped in here. Such a cute, clean place! Service was great!! Food was so good and BIG portions, for the gyros anyway ( that's what we both got.)

title: Delivered right to my hotel
review: I used the yelp app and ordered online... it was delivered right to my hotel and absolutely delicious.  The portion was huge and could probably feed 2 people. I will definitely order from them again next time I am in Chicago.

title: Great seafood!!
review: I purchased 1 shrimp avocado and didn't really know what to expect.  I loved what I got!  It had TONS of baby shrimp along with avocado and other veggies and a warm pita bread that was awesome!!  I could taste the lime in the shrimp...More

title: Great Food, Great Prices
review: My kids (17 and 12) and I went here after skateboarding and sightseeing in Grant Park.  Pita Heaven is a 10-minute, half-mile walk south from there.  The gyros and wraps were enormous, hot, and tasty.  We almost could not finish our side dishes.  Staff was...More

title: Restaurant a bit basic, more fast food but food excellent
review: We visited and thought this was a traditional restaurant but it was more like a fast food chain inside. However, the food was not!! Shared a large main and it was really lovely, chicken kobob (kebab) meat kebab meat patty potatoes pitta and salad, impossible...More

title: Great tastes and tremendous value right on Michigan Avenue!
review: I was craving Greek food after our day at the museums and there it was.  Thanks, to Trip Advisor, we found one excellent place for an early dinner.  They also deliver via GrubHub, but we took our seat and watched a March Madness basketball upset...More

title: Flavorful, fit and fun!
review: I absolutely LOVE Pita Heaven.  It is in my neighborhood and an amazing place for flavorful food that accommodates my fit lifestyle.  The staff is always friendly and the food is extremely fresh and plentiful!  I alternate between the Chicken Gyro (Schwarma) and Mixed/Combo Plate.

title: I'm hooked!
review: Pita heaven is the best! The food is fresh, the staff is friendly, and the flavor are great.  The gyros wrap is made to order and the tzaziki sauce is great! Done delivery which was fast, and take out which was even faster! Highly recommend...More

title: Best delivery
review: Whether you are a tourist hungry late at night or a local craving a good  burger or gyro, Pita Heaven is your destination. Have had gyros, chicken gyro, cheeseburgers and arugula salad all delicious and not too pricey. It is our go to delivery spot...More

title: Ogden Ave location is good, too
review: 1676 Ogden Avenue location is close to medical centers (Rush, UIC, Stroger) and to the United Center, offers tasty fresh Mediterranean flavors. Friendly counter staff guided us to their juicy gyro wrap and chicken kabob, a lemony cream of chicken soup, and falafel. Generous portions....More

title: Chicken was great but overpriced!!
review: So I'm trying to get as much protein in my diet as possible and when insane pita heaven I said to myself yay healthy! I ordered a chicken kabob wrap and it was ok. They took super long to make it which means I had...More

title: Didn't know what Tahini was...
review: I stopped in to have some falafel and the menu was: falafel,tomato,lettuce with tahini on a pita.  It came with Greek yoghurt sauce. When I asked for tahini they said the yoghurt was tahini. I explained that tahini comes from beans not yogurt. The waitress...More

title: Premium Greek Fast-Food
review: May be the best gyros I've had outside of Greece. Also, don't miss their dolmades (stuffed grape leaves).  The food is very high-quality for a fast-food price. I wouldn't bother with the "plates"; instead order the cheaper ala-carte options, as the plate tends to just...More

title: A winner, great food.
review: I really enjoyed the good, just happened to stop in as I was walking by. Good price, food and service. I was also very impressed with 'Tyrone ", he acted like a greeter, welcoming people to the restaurant. Kudos to him!

title: Fast food but doesn't taste like it
review: Good for a quick bite if your near by, nothing special but good food quick that doesn't feel like your eating fast food

title: Fast food in a Upscale Environment
review: The food is good, it is quick service, order at counter, delivered to your table. Real plates and forks. Prices are within the fast food range. Quick, friendly. I call it upscale because for a fast food restaurant, it is decorated very nicely, faux stone...More

title: great gyros, great service
review: Pita heaven has a very diverse menu that can satisfy just about anyone's tastes.  I personally chose the gyro.  The gyro was amply filled with meat with a great cucumber sauce.  The tomatos were fresh and crisp and the onion not over powering.  The gyro...More

title: Heavenly Lunch
review: Friday we found our way to Pita Heaven to have a Veggie Pita.  Because we were trying to eat light, the two of us split a meal.  We were provided separate plates that had a huge amount of the most delicious freshly made chips.  The...More

title: A Well Delivered Feast
review: I found Pita Heaven on GrubHub, knowing that after 8 days in the convention center we'd get tired of the same old food. Their menu is primarily Greek/Mediterranean, but everyone in my team found something that appealed to their stomachs.  The delivery driver arrived well...More

title: Great food, good drink selection
review: The food here was delicious and lived up to the expectations reading the menu. The drink selection was pretty large with a lot of local selections. The restaurant vibes were nice. Service was good.

title: Great vibes.
review: Great beer. Great sandwiches. People were very friendly and I would and will definitely go there again.

title: Be patient. It's worth it.
review: We came here for dinner on a Monday night.   Got there fairly early at 6 pm and I would say we were the last to get through with out a significant wait.   The place was busy and popular.   Service was on the slow side.   But...it was no wonder why.   The place was packed and they were clearly understaffed as is happening everywhere.     The food was amazing.   It explained why they had the crowd they did.   Be patient.   It is worth it.More

title: Two days in a row
review: Need I say more.  It was great enough to go back.  Portions are quite large but we finished our food because it was so good.

title: Worst service in the South Loop
review: I've been to this location numerous times hoping I would enjoy the same experience I've had at their other Chicago location only to be dissatisfied every time.  The food is average, but the service and employee morale are horrible.  If it weren't for tourists and...the area hotels this place wouldn't stand a chance.  This wasn't a one-and-done for me as I've given this place about 7-8 chances....good luck if you attempt.More

title: Great pub with a unique craft beers and some funky pub food
review: Heading out from a conference, starving and googling like mad to find something local where we could sit and eat. Found FatPour. Good find!

title: Very busy fun vibe great for brunch too.
review: Capping off our gymnastics weekend we went here to celebrate before heading home.  It was brunch time for us on a Sunday so the offerings of breakfast tacos, fruity pebble french toast etc. sounded great.  Everything was very good and nice portions.  Would go again,...would love to try later in the day, but we noticed it got VERY busy towards the evenings.More

title: Interesting Place
review: This definitely a place I'll try again.  There is a great craft beer selection.  And the atmosphere is pretty good.  The biggest problem is that I had my heart set on a maple bacon burger that I had seen on their menu before we came....Well what we didn't realize is that it was on the dinner menu.  We got there before 3 which is when that menu starts.  So we had to order off the brunch/lunch menu.  I went ahead and had breakfast tacos and they were decent.  Hopefully i'll get back some time to try their dinner menu.More

title: Had the most amazing pizza
review: Had the most amazing pizza here tonight. I did a build your own, bacon, mushrooms and ipa onions.  Was one of the best pizzas I’ve tasted for years!!  Had crab cakes to start and they were equally great! Excellent chef/kitchen here. Very nice bar and...atmosphere with friendly staff. Will definitely be returning.More

title: Good Option for Solo Business Traveler
review: This is steps from the Hilton hotels triplex front door. I ate there 3 nights in a row. The food is very good- fish tacos, margherita pizza and kale salad especially. Lots of vegetarian choices.  Pretty thoughtful small wine list too but they were definitely...not big pours at $12-15 per glass. The many many beers are much better value. Service was attentive too.More

title: Very Cute Bar
review: The food here is great. The employees are nice and friendly. Very helpful Staff. Do try the skillet cookie and the nachos!

title: Volleyball group meal
review: Fatpour did a fantastic job hosting our group of 20+ people for our volleyball team meal. The burgers are great, watched the football game on the big screen and bloopers instead of commercials in between. Everyone had a great time and would definitely return.

title: First time..first night @ Chicago
review: Excellent Food and Service. The best way to be welcomed at a new city!  We went late, Wednesday before Thanksgiving Day.

title: First time visiting Fatpour
review: First time visiting Fatpour Tap Works in Chicago. The menu and food were amazing. Couldn’t decide what to get. Our server Quin did an excellent job. I can’t say enough good things.

title: Quick and easy for my son and me on gameday
review: My son and I stayed at the Hampton Inn for the Chiefs/Bears football game on Sunday night. After being told there was a 30 minute wait, we got seated in less than ten minutes. My son's burger was good and my nachos were outstanding (and...More

title: Lunch visit
review: We picked this due to close proximity to our hotel.  I ordered the Fried Nashville Hot sandwich with sweet potato fries.  The food was good but it took approximately 30 minutes to receive our meals.

title: Gringo Tacos!
review: I had the Gringo Tacos on two occasions... they were excellent! Especially on a cold fall day! Nice and a little bit spicy with fresh cheese on top!

title: Nice pub in the McCormick Place area
review: Nice location with average food.  There is a decent selection of draft beer, but with their name, I expected better.  The food was reasonably priced and tasted good.

title: The food was a mixed bag.
review: The food was a mixed bag.  Fried cheese curds where stuck together.  They where not cold enough when put in the frier.  Chicken sand egoid.  First and only restaurant that had a credit card fee.  Checked

title: Good value for money
review: Excellent food and beer! If you like a crisp IPA, go for the Revolution Anti-Hero IPA, it's very tasty. The burgers are great, I particularly enjoyed the "Squeaker". Also great martini's!

title: Simply TERRIBLE!!!!!
review: First trip to Chicago and high expectations...so disappointed with the bad manners and terrible welcoming committee at this place!!! Waited over 1h15min and finally when a table got ready (although tables got ready before but we were simply ignored) they were upset that when we...More

title: Good food and beer
review: The beer list is huge here and is a mix of tap and bottled.  The food was really good.  Had the Mac and cheese with added mushrooms and pork belly that was great.  The crab cakes were also really good.  Also had a side salad...More

title: I'd say it's more than a sports bar (although there are a lot of TVs)
review: I was at a conference in Chicago last week and found this place on TA. Had pizza on Monday evening with enough to take back to the motel and warm up again Tuesday. My partner had a large (& loaded) burger and said it was...More

title: A good option while staying in McCormick Place
review: I had a quick dinner at Fatpour Tap Works-McCormick during my stay for a conference at McCormick Place.  It is conveniently located within the convention center area.   I'm not a big beer drinker, so I can't say much about their beer offerings, which I think...More

title: The gem of the neighborhood
review: Very cool place!  It's newly completed (or so it would appear), has what I would think is the largest selection of beers in the area, top-notch appetizers, and an overall cool vibe.  Not inexpensive by any stretch, but definitely worth a trip if you're staying...More

title: Very impressed
review: Went there for dinner. Was not expecting much, as I thought it was more about of a bar. We were wrong, it has a great menu, and the few items we had were very good. I had the pasta, and my wife had a sandwich....More

title: One out of two was good
review: Went 2 times first was good and second left because didn’t get service in a timely fashion. First time I had a good pizza and a cold beer, nice server and overall a good experience.(Dinner)  Second time sat down and waited 10 minutes because no...More

title: Fatpour—Great Food, great drinks, excellent service
review: My wife and I were staying at Hilton’s Home2Suites in Chicago recently. Fatpour is basically attached to the complex on the corner of Cermak and Indiana.  Fatpour is not a ritzy restaurant but an upscale bar and grill/sports bar. Essentially, great food/drinks and superior service....More

title: Terribly managed restaurant
review: Trade shows taking place at McCormick Place and yet they had only 3 servers working the entire restaurant. Given a 45 minute wait time with multiple tables empty.  Front hostess was rude letting us know she just worked there and couldn’t do anything about the...More

title: Work with Mikaela
review: Wanted to throw a party for my family and friends and didn’t know where to start. Was introduced to Mikaela when I sent in a party request and it was the best. She made the process go very smoothly, stayed within budget and was a...More

title: Nice beer selection
review: This is a nice place for a meal or to watch a game while having some local, and non-local brews.  I highly recommend the pork al pastor tacos.  Also had the black bean hummus but not overly impressed with that.  Friendly service and very convenient...More

title: great dining experience
review: Great food.  Great atmosphere.  Easy to get in.  Wait staff was knowledgeable and helpful.....very friendly!  Will visit again!

title: Lots of Food and Drinks
review: We have been there three times, and two were during busy dining time where we were quickly seated. Since we were just two people it was easy to get a seat. The server has been quick and the back up help as well in getting...More

title: Yum
review: Crab cakes were awesome. Great beer on tap and great service from Beatrice. Nice atmosphere and seating.

title: Nicely prepared food
review: All the dishes we ordered, three, were prepared exactly as requested.  The server was most knowledgeable and took the time to explain items which cause confusion.  The selection of beer is wide and varied.

title: Great food, good service
review: Came here a couple of times this week and each time had a fantastic experience! Good food, good drinks and great service. We were upstairs each time.  Their tacos are epic, as are the burgers, and their selection of beer is pretty impressive too

title: Nonexistent service
review: Ambience nice. When we came in it was practically empty. Half of us received our food in timely fashion, For 4 of our party food arrived over an hour and a half later. We were in the restaurant two and a half hours just to...More

title: Tapped Out.
review: Thank god for this place!   Amazing location to meet if you’re at McCormack place and don’t want to walk outside!   Awesome connected to the 3 Hilton properties and walkable from Hyatt too.    Food is good.  Be careful of the Fatpour Burger.  Its gluttonous.    Good beer...More

title: Mixed Reviews
review: Howdy, two people in our six-person party said their meals were absolutely fantastic, two were average and two said "meh".  The atmosphere is sports/TV, and would be perfect for teens/young adults/sports fans.  We went in winter and they sat us by the door so we...More

title: Nice Bar/Restaurant
review: Enjoyed a much needed cocktail after a long day getting to Chicago.  Attached to hotel but have to access from outside. Staff was awesome, very friendly and funny.

title: New location open!  Great atmosphere!
review: Went to this newly opened Fatpour for a Friday night dinner... I was staying at the Hilton next door and didn't want to go far.  I didn't have to wait, even on a Friday night!  Definitely a sports bar atmosphere, which I liked.  Bar and...More

title: Best Samosa Ever!
review: Another review of this fine restaurant.  I confirm my July 2019 review—-best samosa ever.  Flaky, not greasy, and packed with flavorful fillings.  Great breads, including Aloo Paratha, traditional naan, and green chili naan.  Chicken Chili Masala had the right amount of heat and great flavor....Aloo Gobi and Shrimp Biryani also quite flavorful. Great location on Michigan Ave and 13th.  Huge portions and reasonable prices.  I highly recommend and I will return.More

title: Awesome food
review: Awesome food   We visited on Sunday. The buffet had all options. Food was good with various options. Price are reasonable. Kids enjoyed the meal. Service was good. Owner was very polite. A must try.

title: Mixed Bag
review: We had dinner at the Nepal House and some of our fare was excellent and some of it was lacking. It’s hard to rate this restaurant as a whole. The bread (bhatura), samosa, and biryani were excellent. The dal and Kheer were close to tasteless....I really can’t explain the disparity. Your experience then will likely vary with what you order.   The menu was primarily North Indian though there were Nepalese offerings.   Service was ok. We did have to ask for someone to take our order after a time.More

title: Tasty and varied
review: Had a very enjoyable and leisurely dinner, excellent momo's, vegetarian, and non-vegetarian dishes.  Staff friendly and attentive.

title: No parking
review: They dont offer parking but maybe because of that they are not busy during lunch. They serve Indian and Nepalese food. They serve buffet during lunch on Sunday when we came and it was just what we needed. Nothing special but nothing bad. I would...gladly come back here since they have good options for vegetarians . I really enjoyed their specialty “pita” bread and spinach and cheek peas .  I liked that dishes were well described so I knew which dishes didn’t have meat. The place is on a smaller side with small buffet but again it was not crowded . We didn’t order alcohol but I saw on a window a note saying that they have a license to sell it.More

title: Great samosas!
review: Best samosa I’ve had—flaky crust, not greasy, and the perfect degree of spice.  Excellent bread, one of which was also spicy.  Chicken curry was good but not great.  To my taste, the sauce needed to be thicker, with more flavor and spice.  That said, I...would eat here again.  We had delivery so cannot speak to service or ambience.  Location is good and the restaurant looks inviting.More

title: Appreciative quick delivery service
review: Main dishes were Akeem’s Mutter $17.95 & Chicken Vindaloo $16.95 both lacked  flavor. We were surprised it was our dinner entree. It seemed way overpriced. The Cheese Pakora $6.95 appetizer presentation looked appealing but had no taste. Appetizer vegetable Samosa $5.95 was Okay. The star...was appetizer Lamb Samosa $5.95. The 2 large pieces were full of ground lamb & peas fried in a tasty breaded knot. It was also filling. I would just be happy with this item for my dinner if there is a next time.More

title: Delicious food
review: We came across this restsurant while walking on the Michigan Avenue. The owner was a nice gentleman and explained what was on the menu. We inquired about the Halal meat and dishes which were also available. The food was delicious and was served in good...quantity at reasonable price.  We visited this restaurant the following day and had a great mealMore

title: Terrible Service and the food was like the service
review: If I had the option to give a Zero I would!  To start off the customer service was terrible.  I sat, and two other parties came after me whose order was taken rather quickly.    I ordered simple things; Mango Lassi, Vegetable Momo, Tandoori Prawn, and...garlic naan.  The Lassi was incredibly sweet and not made with fresh mango.  The Vegetable Momo had really good flavor yet put together real sloppy so they did not stand up trying to dip in the sauce.  The Garlic Naan came about 10 minutes after my food and was cold plus did not taste cooked.  The shrimp was literally killed, they were so overcooked it was even difficult to cut.  The server never came by to ask how things are and when I asked for the check, they asked if I wanted to take the food home, I said it was so overcooked it was not edible and the naan was cold to start.  They said ok and brought my bill.  I told the man at the front about the shrimp as I left, and they looked at me like I was nuts and said ok.  This is one place I WILL NEVER COME back to.  Service gets a ZERO, the Food a 1 because the momo had flavor.  Not sure how it stays open with service like that.More

title: Very disappointing
review: Went for dinner based on the reviews- ordered their specialty- chicken tikka masala. It came in 1 min so clearly was not made fresh. It was luke warm- realized they served from lunch buffet left overs. Really?? That’s just wrong! Will not go back especially...since it was not very good either. Where is the quality?More

title: Good lunch buffet
review: A nice selection of flavorful food for the lunch buffet. Butter chicken really good as well as some of the other items. Service was not very friendly

title: Good food and service!
review: We were craving for good Nepali good and so decided to try this one. Momos were delicious as my husband who is from Kathmandu always complains about momo sauce wherever he eats. This one did satisfy him. Main course was Indian and tasted good. What...More

title: Not bad at all, but just missed the mark!
review: Early Thursday evening and the place had a couple of families and two individuals eating as well as a never ending procession of Uber Eats type food delivery guys picking up their orders. All a good sign. I ordered the Nepal spicy vegetable soup to...More

title: There are better Indian restaurants in Chicago
review: My impression of this restaurant was not so good. The food didn't taste as good as it normally does in Indian restaurants in the US. I had lamb samosas as appetizer, but they didn't taste good. The lamb meat was kind of greasy in its...More

title: Very Mediocre
review: A small family run place close to the Shedd Aquarium.   In winter dit as far from the door as possible otherwise you will be blasted with cold air every time someone comes in it leaves.  Service is friendly and swift. In fact, they almost seem...More

title: Get ready for your tastebuds to tingle!
review: If I ate here as often as I would like, I would weigh 1000s of pounds because the food is so delicious that I am unable to stop eating whenever I eat here. I cannot remember the names of all of the dishes served here...More

title: Thanks for riminding us our amaizing visit to Nepal!
review: We came to celebrate a family gathering, enjoyed the food (Dahl and Garlic Naan, of course... , great vegi Momo, Tandoori chicken, and Palak Paneer), and the memories it raised of our family's trip to Nepal. We sure be back to check out other dishes...

title: Awesome Indian food
review: A reasonably priced Indian restaurant. The buffet spread was decent with a lot of  options especially North Indian variety of food like Naan, Paneer Tikka, etc. Be sure to try their Tandoori chicken it was yummy.  The location is quite close to all the tourist...More

title: Love Indian Food
review: The service was very friendly and the food was mouthwatering. You can eat-in or take-away and they also have a Saturday lunch Buffet (all you can eat). The restaurant is quiet and cosy and great value for money. We went there several times during our...More

title: Food was good enough that we went back
review: We had take-out here twice. The wait time seemed to be a bit longer than they said each time. Inside it's very plain (not meaning that negatively), and they have a few chairs at the front for the take-out people to sit in while they...More

title: Go to try out Indian/Nepalese
review: The place is in a quiet part of the town, never too crowded. Sometimes I felt they were in hurry to send you out so they could close down the shop. Coming to the food, I ordered few curries and naan. The quantity is decent,...More

title: Best Indian Food on Mich Avenue
review: it is not too crowded or empty, staff is very friendly and have enough choices to choose from. Also our orders are served within 10 mins (thats a huge plus for indian restaurant), taste is ok  I can fill up on tasty naan and a...More

title: Great food and friendly staff
review: We were visiting Chicago on a business trip and visited the S. Michigan branch. The chicken momos were really good, we also ordered the navaratam korma and the chicken sahi korma which were really great. They came along with white rice and we ordered the...More

title: First Nepalese Dinner
review: We like to try foods we can't get at home when we come to Chicago.  Nepal House may break that tradition, though; it was that good.  We started with Chicken Momo, dumplings served with a mild, but flavorful sauce.  Our son had the Chicken Basmati,...More

title: Tough meat
review: I had the food delivered. So I can't comment on the ambience of the restaurant. The food was delivered on time. I ordered a lamb curry. The meat was so tough that I could not cut it with a steak knife. The vegetable dish was...More

title: I'd go again
review: Picked this place just because its name suggested something "different," and it looked promising from the outside. A lucky choice. Clean, fairly quiet even when full (as it became when the rest of the post-game crowd trickled in from Soldier Field). The chicken madras was...More

title: Good Food
review: Was there for lunch (a la carte) and buffet on 2 consecutive days. Food was good when I was there for lunch. Buffet was sort of ok, not much in the taste department as compared to the lunch I had the other day. Lunch was...More

title: Buffet after museum
review: Was wonderful food and very friendly and nice staff. Wife had never had Indian food and enjoyed. Will visit again.

title: Great lunch buffet
review: I stopped in for a quick lunch with my daughter and was pleased with the selection and freshness of the choices. I went up maybe one too many trips but the delicious mango pudding was well worth it The ambiance is clean and comfortable. Service...More

title: A great Indian restaurant!
review: I am pretty picky about my Indian cuisine, and this is the best place I have found in Chicago.  Everything we have tried off of their menu has been delicious and authentic.

title: Fabulous lunch buffet
review: We try to eat Indian cuisine at least once every time we're in a new city. Nepal house exceeded our expectations! There were many options on the buffet for my vegan husband, as well as for my omnivorous self. We didn't arrive until about 2pm,...More

title: A Fine Choice
review: The Nepalese restaurant in our hometown, "Hooterville," closed last year and so we were pleased to see there was a Nepalese place close to the Chicago Hilton during a recent conference there. The food was excellent and the service very good.

title: Delicious Nepalese and Indian food!
review: While visiting my brother here in Chicago, he brought me and my friends to this lovely place near his flat. The service is fantastic, there were complimentary snacks with spicy and savory sauces, and the main dishes were delicious and authentic. I asked for my...More

title: Good Indian/Nepalese food
review: Had their lunch buffet during our visit to Chicago. The food tasted great, and not unhealthy (unlike most Indian buffets). The setting of the restaurant and staff were spot on as well. Good for having special lunches with family.

title: Very good food
review: Very good taste and the meat is soft and tender, the hot dishes are really good i will come back. Just to improve give one rise pot for every 2 guests since we have one to 4 and wasnt enought.

title: Good and Convenient
review: After a morning at the Field Museum, I was looking for a nearby place to get lunch.  Just a few blocks away was Nepal House, and they had a lunch buffet.  It wasn’t too big or fancy but it hit the spot.  The food was...More

title: Awesome Indian Food..Lunch Buffet is great..
review: During our recent visit to Chicago(/McCormick Place), happen to visit this place.. Like their service and setup (easy access using Bus #3 on S Michigan Ave and 13th St as well). we really enjoyed their Lunch buffet. Ordered the chicken biryani for dinner for pick...More

title: One of the hidden gems in South loop
review: We finally decided to go here (across the block from our place) one lazy evening. And we were so pleasantly surprised! We had Vegetable Momos , Nepali Chicken wings and Chicken Biryani. All were top notch! We will definitely go there again and again!

title: Awesome place
review: Great Nepali food, good atmosphere and very courteous staff. Definitely highly recommended and will come back if in the area.

title: Tasty Lunch Buffet
review: Looking for something different and inexpensive for lunch while in the south Loop area? Try the Nepal House. They have a buffet available from 11:30 AM to 2:30 PM for $11.95. It is a smaller size restaurant, nicely decorated and very clean. The service was...More

title: Flavorful Nepali/Indian cuisine
review: We had the Tandoori Peshkash and the potion size was good enough for 2 people. Nepali Khasi was one that I loved because the meat was cooked to perfection with aromatic Nepali spices. It came along with rice. Staff were friendly and hospitable. Service was...More

title: Loved Veg Momos
review: I am vegetarian and wanted some nice Indian/ Nepali food. Nice food at affordable prices. Their veg Momos are must try. Hot and nice. Other Indian food we ordered was all right too. Fast service and nice friendly staff.

title: A very affordable and pleasant adventure in the Subcontinent
review: On recommentation of the hotel staff I ventured to the Nepal House. You are met with hospitality, the scent of sandalwood bathed in the warmth of friendlness. The service is prompt, courteous, and polite. They aare quick to guide through the menu and explain everything,...More

title: Great food, great service
review: I was here on November 20 with a large group of 12 colleagues.   When I got there the table was set and ready for us.  The staff there were all helpful and very polite.  They were completely fine with 12 separate checks for 12 different...More

title: Very good Nepal and Indian food
review: Very cozy restaurant with tasty Indian food and some Nepal dishes on the Menu. The absolute best is the Nepali goat dish. I thought I don't like goat (I can hardly eat lamb and don't like game taste) - but that goat was spectacular! Nice...More

title: Nepalese Food in Chicago
review: They serve a mix of Nepalese-Indian dishes here. The buffet is very affordable. The food is delicious especially the Chicken Tikka Masala, and curried veggies (forgot what it is called). I found the Kulfi Pistachios very sweet tho and pricey for a small serving. The...More

title: Bad idea if you want a real taste of Nepali cuisine
review: During our stay in Chicago, we ordered chicken momos, chicken tikka and goat chhoela. Delivery service was good (tipped decent). Chicken momo was ok but not a restaurant quality. As far as chicken chowmein and goat chhoela are concerned, my worst experience ever. Being a...More

title: Junk
review: Service slow, tried to talk me into buffet, i ordered off menu. Chicken tika marsala was watery with no flavor or spice to eat. Naan was cold and burnt. Terrible experience.

title: Great find
review: We enjoy Indian food but have never had Nepali, so had to try it. They do Indian too. Walking in, the smells are wonderful, and seeing Indians at several tables we knew that was a good sign. The food was great and the portions huge...More

title: Fine Indian/Nepalize restaurant
review: An excellent south loop Chicago restaurant with Indian and Nepalize cuisine (very similar, in fact). My wife and I each had Biryani - I had lamb and she had shrimp. One impressive thing is that the flavors were very different, beyond the lamb and shrimp...More

title: Great Indian food
review: We stopped here before the soccer game at Soldier Field.  The food was delicious and the service was incredibly attentive.  The garlic naan was great.  The vegetarian options are plenty and the teenagers liked the butter chicken. I'd go back if we were in the...More

title: Chicago Trip
review: Would recommend to all who want to taste Indian food during Chicago Trip. Food is good. Very near to Field museum walk able.

title: Enjoyabl
review: The food is super and you can really enjoy the Indian hot spiciness here.... Try the masala tea here... It's my favorite....

title: International club field trip
review: We came here for a taste of Nepalese cuisine. We felt like we had an authentic experience here. I loved the Naan (bread) and the sauces the meats were served in were flavorful. I ordered chicken and think the meat was chicken thigh. I prefer...More

title: Tasty
review: For lovers of ethnic cuisine, the food at this place is fine and tasty. Many varieties of Indian and Nepali dishes are available. Good food.

title: Delivery...  terrible
review: Perhaps this is a good place to dine while in Chicago, but I wanted something warm and spicy in my hotel room.  I paid a LOT to have this food delivered, and wrote specifically that I was in a hotel and would need utensils.    The...More

title: Good lunch buffet
review: Decent lunch buffet, Indian-type flavors.  LOVED the soup, and the naan was also good.  Nice selection of veggie and non-veggie entrees.  Unusual to see goat on the menu--and it was pretty good.  A bargain for a filling lunch.

title: Spicy Hot Biryani!
review: Located in the South Loop, Nepal house tries to provide not just food but an experience and succeeds with beautiful ambience, music and a delectable menu. We dined here in March; with cold weather, we started off with some Masala chai. This was followed by...More

title: decent indian food for buffet. did not see too many nepali dishes out in the buffet options
review: Reasonably priced when it came to the buffet. They had a decent number of vegetarian options. The location is quite close to all the tourist spots and there is a public parking spot 0.2 miles from the hotel.  I did not see too many nepali...More

title: Awesome Indian Food
review: I ordered delivery from here to my hotel room.  Delivery was prompt and the food arrived hot.  I ordered a Nepali goat appetizer (Goat Chhoela) which I have never had before and it was excellent.  For my main course I had the Lamb Tikka.  It...More

title: tasty
review: I have had a lot of Indian food, and had the lamb tikka masala. It was sweeter or fruity compared to what I'm used to eating, but tasty.  The appetizer, tandoor pashkush, had a variety of tandoor meats which was also tasty. Order the naan...More

title: Less than mediocre
review: It's not that expensive, but the food is not worth the price.  Certainly the worst Indian I've had in a while.  The atmosphere is quite nice, a bit snazzy though I'm not sure why they have a TV on.  The service wasn't bad. The Paneer...More

title: Good local place
review: If you live in the area or are staying in the south loop, this is a good option for ethnic food. The prices are fair (though I think they could be a bit lower) and the service is good and fairly speedy. I'd say fairly...More

title: Great Nepalese Food
review: To start, I'm not sure how this was Nepalese.  It tasted just like Indian, but having said that, it was very, very good Indian food.  My favorite was the Baghan Barta and the filled nan (we had several different kinds).  My kids loved the Chicken...More

title: Below par!!
review: I and my wife love to go to Nepali restaurant just because we love momo's. So we went there ordered momo's and veg samosa as starter. As soon as I order momo the waiter says " Do you know it takes a long time to...More

title: Neighborhood gem
review: Chicken tikka masala,and lamb khadai so yummy!!!  King fisher beer delightful   Bring your friends and share a variety of foods

title: Culinary Delight, and great service
review: This was a last second decision to stop here for dinner and we were so happy we did.   The food is absolutely wonderful and I wouldn't change a thing.   Our eyes were much larger than our stomachs but its just as good the second day....More

title: Good Indian Food in South Loop
review: We stopped in on a very frigid Sunday night. It wasn't very busy, but felt warm and cozy. The staff was very attentive and the food was really good. There were many recognizable Indian dishes like tandoor chicken and korma and the indian breads naan...More

title: Yummy!
review: Great food!  Wonderful lunch buffet on saturdays.  Nice selection and food was hot (heat, not spice).  Yummy samosas and butter chicken.  Staff was very accomodating.

title: A Great Neighorhood Gem
review: Nepal House has a very extensive menu.  The restaurant is in our neighborhood on the corner of S. Michigan Ave & 13th St.  The restaurant is small and quaint.  The décor transports you to another country. The staff is friendly and helpful with the menu....More

title: Good Food
review: Nepal House, Chicago restaurant was a good one. It has many North Indian variety of food like Naan, Paneer Tikka, etc. Good Indian restaurant.

title: Great food and service
review: Food was fantastic - always a thrill to find a good curry. Interesting menu, caters to all tastes - vegetarian as well as face eaters.   Great service. Nice ambience.  Wait staff were very friendly, efficient.

title: Lackluster Food and Spotty Service
review: The food here just isn't very good.  It tastes like I cooked it (not a good thing.)  The service is sometimes good and sometimes very bad.  At least it's cheap.

title: Authentic, homemade, fresh.  Like your Mom went back into the kitchen and made it just for you.
review: Authentic, sweet, inviting place that felt a little Old World Italian but not in a heavy way, more cozy and pleasantly simple.  Located right on busy Michigan avenue, we were just one step up off the sidewalk and could see out to the active street...More

title: Nice BYOB Sushi Restaurant
review: A nice example of a downtown Chicago sushi restaurant.  It is BYOB and it’s close to the McCormick Center.  They offer a wide variety of sushi and sashimi.

title: Fell in love with sushi here
review: Before Kai, I was a vegetarian.  After Kai, I'm a pescatarian.  The veggie options are great - I love the kampyo rolls so much, and am always tempted by so many of the veggie rolls.  My friend's spicy tuna roll looked so good that I...had to try it; it was as good as it looked.  Kai has set me up to feel disappointed when I have sushi elsewhere.More

title: Wow!
review: Like so many others have said, this is an excellent place for sushi.  Order a large variety, bring your own wine and enjoy the summer weather on the patio.

title: Love This Place
review: I can't think of a single thing I don't like about this place. Good patio seating, BYOB, tasty spring rolls, refreshing cucumber salad, delicious maki rolls, and good service. It's cute for casual dining with the fam, special occasion, or just a simple date night.

title: So delicious!
review: Spring rolls and lobster mania roll were to die for! Staff was extremely friendly. Great place for some sushi!

title: Simple Sushi Service
review: Walking into an empty sushi restraint is never a good sign, and at first we thought the same.  Little did we know that at 5:45 we had just caught the front wave of patrons.  The simple menu could use some formalizing, but paper menus allow...for easy adjustments.  Highly recommend the Salmon Belly (best sushi texture) and their Texas roll for a combination meal with some fire to it.  Didn't confirm of it was a bring your own bottle place, yet did see 3 different sets of people carry in their own choice liquid.  Give it a shot, and see if your stars match mine.More

title: great sushi and nice attentive service
review: A sweet little neighbourhood restaurant, so close to the park, museums and Roosevelt CTA station. The Sushi was delicious (we liked especially the green turtle one).  We enjoyed their kind and effective service! BYOB - they were helpful in advising us to buy our wine...in the near supermarket. We sure be back!More

title: Fantastic sushi
review: Really an outstanding place, everything was great! The rolls are loaded with fish and the sashimi had very generous portions.  (service on the slow side, but not critical)

title: Outstanding sushi in the Museum District
review: Visited Kai Sushi after a day wandering around the Loop and the museums and parks of Chicago. Exactly what we needed after a long day out: high-quality sushi with exceptional service. The Hamachi special roll was perfect, and even standbys like spicy tuna and shrimp...tempura were fresh and delightful. The added touch of a sliced cucumber amuse bouche and a diced orange at the end were beautiful and much appreciated. We were really happy to find this place and to get exactly what we wanted.More

title: Delivery not available all the time
review: Had delivery twice and the food was good but last night said too busy to deliver. Then sent a text I would get a free roll next time for the inconvenience.

title: Dinner with family
review: Excellent dinner with the family at Kai Sushi.  The wait staff helped us with the. The wait time was quick and efficient. We will return.

title: Great Sushi Restaurant
review: We took our adult kids to eat here on a Thursday night. It is a BYOB restaurant which is great to know so you can save money on drinks. The sushi was very fresh and tasty. We had a few assorted platters and all of...More

title: Fresh sashimi, well-made maki, great service
review: I'm from Vancouver, Canada and of Asian descent so I'm knowledgeable and picky about Asian food. I actually prefer the no-frills sushi places (usually operated by Koreans) over fancy ones where everything is drowning in sauce (typically Japanese operated). Most people don't know that sushi...More

title: Horrible Service
review: We have been frequent customers at Kai for the last two years since we live nearby. It was a convenient BYOB near where we lived with decent food. However, after our most recent experience, we will NEVER go back and urge others to do the...More

title: No comprehension
review: Ordered take out, asked for two bills solely got one, asked for spicy mayo, got none, asked for extra ginger, no ginger at all. The sushi was subpar and the service was even worse. Would never order again.

title: Wonderful sushi in little gem of a restaurant
review: I love Kai Sushi! It's consistently delicious and fresh. I live within walking distance but recommend going out of your way for this lovely little spot. Prices are low, portions large, choices are endless, it's BYOB and there is a wonderful wait staff to help...More

title: Sushi snob says sushi win!
review: I even ordered the wrong roll and it was still good!  This little gem was recommended by my local friend as I was visiting and looking for good food in the area.  Don't pass up this place!

title: Top notch sashimi
review: A few colleagues and I came here while at a conference at McCormick just because it seemed like a good walking distance. We were all blown away by the incredible sashimi platter, some of the best I have ever tasted and the cost was a...More

title: Good Casual sushi spot
review: We were here last Saturday and I can see why this place has high ratings.  The quality and price makes this place a very good value.  If you want simple fresh and satisfying sushi been this might be the place for you.  My go to...More

title: Eat Outside if You Can
review: This little spot doesn't look like much, but we had a great experience! Our server was knowledgeable about the menu and made great suggestions based on our preferences.  I always enjoy ginger ale with my sushi and they have it, but it is BYOB so...More

title: Nice Dinner
review: I had dinner with my wife, daughter and grandson at Ha I Sushi.  I had walked by this restaurant many times.  We were unsure of our sellections, but the server helped us and we had a very fine meal.  My grandson has some allageries, but...More

title: Humiliating
review: I have just had the most humiliating experience of my LIFE!!! We recently visited Kai for a late Sunday lunch. After ordering WAY TOO MUCH FOOD, and the waiter John (the blonde guy) didn't even advise that we were ordering way too much. He totally...More

title: Amazing (from an sushi enthusiast)
review: I have eaten sushi at places across NA and Asia and boy I wasn't expecting a little Chicago sushi place to make the cut of some of the best sushi I have ever had!

title: Great Lunch
review: Normally I like the spicy rolls, but this was so fresh that the plain salmon roll was even better.  Lunch special cam with miso soup. We really liked that the bill came with orange slices to top it off.

title: Late afternoon lunch. Close to the Field Museum.
review: After spending most of the morning and part of the afternoon at the Field Museum, I was quite hungry. Fortunately Kai Sushi was a 15 minute away. It's open all afternoon, has a casual neighborhood vibe, I sat my self by a window and watched...More

title: DON'T WALK BY THIS ONE!
review: Forget atmosphere and setting (important as they are) and just fixate on food. I challenge you to find finer yet affordable Japanese food anywhere. Forget the small interior, the sidewalk tables just across from the elevated railway, bring your own bottle of wine ( not...More

title: EXCELLENT
review: This is my first visit to Chicago. Staying in the South Loop, I used Trip Advisor to assist me in finding a decent place to eat that was close by. I was VERY impressed. Kai Sushi is a very clean establishment with VERY friendly and...More

title: Fantastic food at decent prices
review: Our friend took us here because he said that it was a really good sushi place.  I was a bit skeptical at first because it's just a small simple restaurant, but the food really was very good and not overpriced.  The sashimi was fresh, and...More

title: Great Food, Service and Atmosphere
review: Stopped in on a windy day after searching Yelp for a sushi place close to Shedd.  Great food, service and atmosphere at Kai completed a fun day out with family. We had various nigiri & sashimi (salmon, albacore, mackerel, yellowtail) a rainbow, tuna and Califirnia...More

title: Good Solid Sushi
review: Was staying at the Hilton.  I wanted some good, but not over priced sushi. The quality was very good. The taste was very good. I was overstuffed for under $50.

title: Fresh, creative, well priced
review: We stopped in midday during the week.  Not a super popular area, but safe and clean. pleasant host /waiter.  Complimentary cucumber salad was tasty.  Diverse menu.  Very fresh tasting sushi.  Good portions and good costs.  Would certainly return, and definitely recommend.

title: Fabulous fresh sushi
review: I am so surprised that this place does not have more reviews. ... Easily one of the best sushi places I have been too.  While their menu seems smaller than what you would expect at a sushi resturant,  each of of rolls was well prepared....More

title: Nice south loop sushi spot
review: Fresh, delicious rolls. Great service. Our favorite roll was the ocean roll. Street parking, BYOB, patio. Nice cucumber salad amuse bouche and original rolls. Slightly out of the way for us, but we'll definitely be back

title: Excellent service
review: Stopped on our walk from Marriot to downtown Chitown. Variety of beers, food was good and service was great!

title: Average sports bar - lively atmosphere - bland food
review: I visited the Weather Mark Tavern on Friday, April 12, 2019, around 6pm with my family, kids aged 9 and 11. We got there just before the dinner rush and had no problems getting a table. We asked for a reservation, and they were willing...but told us there would be tables when we arrived. They were spot on. We were served promptly and courteously and the atmosphere was noisy - but not so noisy you had to yell to hear (at least at the time we were there). The food was fine, but on the bland side. I had the fish and chips with the friend pickles, my son ordered the fish tacos, my wife ordered the crab cakes, and my daughter ordered mashed potatoes (side) and a ceasar salad. The friend pickles and steak fries that came with my order were solid but had no interesting spices or flavors. The fish (cod) was fine with a thick batter which allowed the fish to squish out when you tried to cut it - this was not a problem. Fish and chips is typically on the blander side of things, but the batter was just ...batter...nothing interesting. The fish tacos had pico de gallo, but you couldn't taste the separate components. It all just kind of blended together. IMHO, a good and interesting dish combines the blending of flavors, separating out the distincting components, and makes it interesting with different textures. This had none of that. Crab cakes were bleh according to my wife. I tried the mashed potatoes - they were buttery and smooth, but nothing else. If you like interesting flavors and textures  in your food - this is not the place for you. If, however, you prefer your food bland and non-adventurous -  to basically fill you up, then this would be a great place for you.More

title: Brunch
review: Omg! This place was great! We went here this morning for brunch and got the bottomless mimosas! YUMMMMM! And all of our food was great too! I got the Bloody Mary grilled cheese(I’ve been waiting to find a place who makes this and I’m so...happy I got it!!) will definitely be back!!!!More

title: Good Pub Food in the South Loop
review: Very casual place for drinks and bar food. Fun place to go watch sporting events. Lots of room to hang with friends. Some areas have couches. There is a decent list of beers and variety of food. Service is usually pretty consistent.

title: Dinner
review: We had a team dinner here and it was great. Server was very friendly and focused.  Not the best music playing (hard rock) and it was very loud but the food was outstanding and the kids had a blast. We think they had only one...cook so it was hard for the food to all come out at once for a big party (we had 11 people at each table) but they were working hard and moving fast. Everyone was pleased with their meal and we would go back.More

title: A real hidden gem in the South Loop
review: My wife and our family have eaten at Weather Mark multiple times and we have never been disappointed.  The food is excellent and the bar drinks are even better.  Mark, the owner makes it a point to stop by your table to make sure everything...is okay.  The grandkids love the boating atmosphere. and the fact that Mark gives them helium balloons if they eat all of their food!More

title: Great Beer and Service
review: Stopped in looking for some Zombie Duct on tap and found it.  Had a fantastic burger and great service.  One of the best burgers I have had in a while.

title: Review of the Bar
review: I thought it was average at best. There were a ton of fruit flies buzzing around the bottles which makes me question the cleanliness of the behind the bar area.  I probably wouldn’t go back

title: Missed the Mark
review: We stopped in here to let rush hour traffic diminish a bit. Here's the scoop:  Ambiance: Nautical themed bar that has cozy sofas that have sails on the wall for semi-privacy, high boy tables, regular tables, and outdoor seating.   Server: Service wasn't that great as...our server really didn't check on us often. We found this strange as the place wasn't crowded at all.   Food: My partner had a burger and I had a corned beef sandwich. It seemed as the cook forgot to season the hamburger as he could not taste a sprinkle of seasoning. The corned beef sandwich was a big chunk of solid meat instead of shredded meat.   Bathrooms: There were three individual bathrooms with one toilet. So be mindful of this if you go here for drinks and it's crowded and you need to go potty asap!  Parking: Metered street parking.More

title: don't miss this place
review: it may be 'nothing special' to some people, but our experience here was great!!  we went here twice while visiting chicago.  the food is very good and very affordable for good portions.  you won't leave hungry!  the staff is helpful and fun!  the owner, one...of the nicest guys you could meet!  the decor is nautical and comfy.  we will be back on our next vacay in chi town.  trust me, if you are in the city néar south michigan ave, stop by for a bite and a drink!!More

title: Large brunch portions
review: On our trip to Chicago, we were looking for a place to have brunch, and found the Weather Mark Tavern. The food was delicious and the portions were large. We also enjoyed the bottomless mimosas and the staff was friendly.

title: Best food at tavern evet
review: This is an amazing local tavern.  But right on Michigan ave.  I hope this place stays open and as is, as area develops.  Really great food.

title: Just OK!
review: Nothing special, just OK. We stopped by because it is located very close to McCormick Place, but not sure if I will go back.

title: Great neighborhood bar
review: Great hangout spot.  Trivia on Thursdays.  Great brunch with bottomless mimosas on the weekend!  Good amount of tvs for a game too.

title: Nothing Special (Except the bottomless mimosa's)
review: We went for the bottomless mimosa's and they did not disappoint.  The food, unfortunatley, was just average.  I love a good brunch, especially if there are lots of options. There were not a lot of brunch options, and the food was just OK.  If I...had to choose a restaurant to go to for brunch, it wouldn't be this one, but I would go back if my friends wanted to go.More

title: Excellent service
review: Stopped on our walk from Marriot to downtown Chitown. Variety of beers, food was good and service was great!

title: Just OK!
review: Nothing special, just OK. We stopped by because it is located very close to McCormick Place, but not sure if I will go back.
