title: Nice spot near McCormick place in South Loop
review: We stopped in during  a break from a volleyball tournament at McCormick Place (8-10 min walk and safe),  Nice lively  (fun) crowd gathered in the cool decorated (sail boat theme/pirate) bar.  You feel comfortable as soon as you walk in the door.  the service was...More

title: Love this place!
review: Weather Mark is a great local spot that is casual with a dive bar attitude in a much nicer setting. They have great beers on tap and a friendly staff.

title: Seems like a fun place
review: quick late dinner on a quiet night.  Nothing much happening, but, a nice room and the appearance that this place could be fun, on the right day with the right crowd.  The dining options were diverse, the wine list much better than expected.  The beer...More

title: Excellent day to enjoy the outdoors
review: Had a great Bloody Mary for only $6.00! Enjoyed some guacamole and quesadillas.  Service was great and so was the food!  Great atmosphere too!

title: Great find for fun and good food!
review: This place has delicious bloody Mary's, great burgers and finger foods to please. The service is excellent and the owner takes pride in being involved! My favorite place for a Bears game!

title: Awesome service, great location
review: We went here to celebrate my son's 21st birthday with 20+ people.    Chose it for location and brunch pricing...  The service by Victoria was just awesome...she handled the large party extremely well, was very attentive to all of us, and was extremely friendly too.    The...More

title: Awesome Burgers, Awesome Service
review: Our family was looking for burgers and fries after a long day at the Aquarium and Planetarium. Weather Mark Tavern was the perfect choice. The burgers were cooked to our specifications, and the steak fries were delicious. The staff was very attentive and super-friendly. We...More

title: Super easy to find tavern off Michigan Ave
review: Good place to have Sunday brunch in the South Loop! Easy to find, right by a bus stop and a couple blocks from the Roosevelt red line. Seat yourself, great service who didn't have a problem slipping the check for us. The food was just...More

title: Good food
review: We have never been disappointed here. The food is very good and it's more than just "bar" food. Good burgers, we love the salmon dish, and the tuna sandwich is great! We have always had good and friendly service. In the rare time that something...More

title: What a nice find!
review: During our stay for an event at McCormick Place, my friends and I were walking around to find somewhere to eat... we basically browsed through bunch of options before we ended up here... Big location, they had a 3 table outside seating (which was our...More

title: subpar
review: Had same experience as most here, food was good but service was poor on first visit as i sat at the bar and a little better on second as I was at a table. I waited over 10 mins for a drink while I watched...More

title: Delicious food, who knew bar food could be soooo good!
review: Great fun, good place to watch a game, delicious food and nice staff.  Very clean, cute patio to people watch.  Huge selection of Rums or anything else u might want to drink.

title: Awesome ambiance & food!
review: Walking around down town Chicago and found this place! The atmosphere is what lured us in. Really neat sailing theme going on, also it is all open so you can sit outside as well. Food was VERY good along with the service! Build your own...More

title: Online reservations, great service, fun place, good food!
review: Looking for somewhere to eat we found this place on yelp and trip advisor and the ratings were very good.  We didn't want to get stuck waiting so we were able to book your reservation through open seating which was very very nice. All of...More

title: Outstanding sailing themed bar
review: The Weathermark is a sailing themed bar with an eclectic collection of clients: you can run in to anyone here, including MMA fighters and sailors. The staff are friendly and easy going, and the food is excellent, particularly for 'pub grub'.  Besides the sailing themed...More

title: Nice place
review: It's a decent place...we had good service and the food was pretty decent. It was a chance visit after another event and it happened to be pretty decent

title: Great bar for some food and drinks
review: The drink menu is great with several options for wine, cocktails, and local beers.  The food is about what you would expect at a bar.  I recommend the fish and chips.  The nachos are ok. Sometimes it has real cheese and other times it is...More

title: fun spot with good food
review: Love the sailing theme.  Bloody Mary special is good.  Food is always good.  Normally we go on Sunday and it is pretty quiet but enough people to make it interesting.

title: Fantastic neighborhood bar with great food til midnight
review: I spend a few weeks a year in Chicago and this is my favorite place to hang out and grab some food and drink, at any time of day. The staff are always great and the beer selection always leaves me spoiled for choice, especially...More

title: Great Place
review: I loved the Weather Mark they had great food as well as 3 Floyd's on tap. They also were very accommodating with my large group on a night with a Hawks playoff game.

title: Poor Mark...
review: I stopped in one late week night at the recommendation of a friend...I'm beginning to question our friendship and her taste!?  JK Anyway, there's not much favorable to comment on.  The drinks were bad, the food was bad and the service wasn't that much better....More

title: Very cool place
review: Went early on a sat night with 3 kids. Very friendly staff, good beer selection, above average food for a Tavern setting.  Great burgers. Reasonable prices with birthday special treats.

title: Nice!
review: Went in with my husband on the Saturday before st. Pattys day. Packed but not uncomfortably so. Found a high top table quickly. The music was loud but really good. Service was good for how busy it was. Ordered beers that came quickly and had...More

title: Awesome!
review: We went here tonight, on a Monday night around 8. There was no wait. Everything on the menu looked delicious. Very good variety and yet still a lot of stuff you wouldn't tend to see on a regular tavern menu. I ordered the chicken feta...More

title: Best burger in town
review: Was there with some friends , and I think I had the best buger in town ,Friendly service , very good weekly special , I will go back again

title: Neighborhood Bar
review: The Wheathermark is a nice place on South Michigan.   I would very much like to say that it is a go to bar, but the service is usually questionable.  Rarely does the staff even say hello when you sit at the bar much less ask...More

title: South Loop Pub/Tavern that's not on Dearborn or Wabash!
review: What a nice little spot for drinks and lunch on a Saturday afternoon, or any weekend night. The food was REALLY good, the drinks reasonably priced, and the service was restaurant quality (as was the food). I highly recommend the "Stormy" and "Devil In Blue"...More

title: Clean, comfortable modern hotel restaurant
review: Clean, comfortable modern restaurant serves all 3 meals. Good variety of attractive dishes. Fair wine list. Reasonable prices for a hotel restaurant. Small bar in center, snack stand adjacent.

title: Pleasant setting, good food and EXCELLENT staff/service
review: I went with a friend for lunch in the midst of a convention occurring at the McCormick Convention Center while I was staying at the adjacent Marriott Marquis Hotel. The restaurant is on the lobby floor of the hotel. My friend and I both ordered...their fried chicken sandwiches but were unaware about how very spicy that sandwich is -- when we indicated to the manager & waiter that we could not eat the sandwiches (neither she nor I can handle spicy food), there was no hesitation at all in offering to replace our orders with other choices; I applaud them for not only the act of replacing the orders but their most positive "no problem" attitude!More

title: Amazingly good hotel restaurant, great service.  Who'd have though!
review: A sleek and modern facility, definitely "high energy" (aka LOUD), service was great.    Our pre-dinner drinks (Negroni and a local Rye) were delicious.  The hamburgers (W&B) were perfectly cooked, and again were delicious.  The wines are expensive, but good selections.  An excellent choice if you...don't want to venture out from the hotel, and you won't be culinarily deprived if you stay...More

title: Comfortable, Contemporary, Delicious
review: With so many choices in Chicago, I still ate here three out of four days. The atmosphere is incredible and the service staff amazing. I’m so pleased with the soups and salads I had for dinner and the BLTTA (bacon, lettuce, tomato, turkey, avocado) sandwich...was amazing.More

title: Very good for a hotel restaurant
review: I went for a Friday night dinner, as I arrived to the hotel around 8.30 pm. The bar area was busy, the rest of the place - seating area - was half full. I was promptly seated and the service was very good, attentive, friendly....The menu seamed limited, but do not hesitate to ask, they have some additional stuff such as fries, ice cream, etc. I got a side salad and pork chops. The main course was very good, nice presentation, good taste. I finished with an ice cream - ordered 2 scoops, got 3, I was told it was a mistake, the extra was on the house anyway. I also like their cup for espresso:-).More

title: Nice breakfast
review: This is an unpretentious restaurant in a quiet setting within the Marriott Marquis hotel. The food is not priced as if it were a diner but the prices are acceptable. Most important the breakfast food was very good!

title: Never expected a Marriott hotel to have a decent restaurant and bar . . .
review: . . . but this lovely, modern hotel across the street from the McCormick place where we were attending a week of meetings had exactly that. The breakfast was delicious. Later in the evening we would wind up at the bar for late night snacks...and drinks (I confess, the cocktails were over-priced, but certainly delicious--2 weeks ago while working in San Francisco we had vodka gimlets at the wonderful Buena Vista Cafe by the wharf for 12 dollars. The price at the bar at the Woven and Bound for the very same drink? a whopping 38 dollars). That aside, the drinks, food, and service were grand.  Also, a good thing for older folks like us, the noise level was tolerable. So the four of us--all over 65--had a terrific time.More

title: Torn on dessert rating
review: We stopped here later on to get dessert before going up to the room. The split rating is mainly for food being near a 5 while service was near a 1. The host did keep wandering away while we were there so it did take...a little to get seated. It took a little before anyone came over so we gave our orders right away. Even with that, it took 50 minutes to get our more routine desserts, eat (they were smaller bites), and leave. Overall, we got a water refill when the food came/delivered by someone else and once when they came by so we could ask for the bill. It then took another time of asking to get it. The desserts were really good and I'd recommend the cake and donuts, but given how slow everything was for us and the tables around us, we couldn't really recommend the place for a mealMore

title: Scrambled Eggs...
review: We did the breakfast buffet. The spread was adequate, and the fare was reasonable. I love scrambled eggs, and perfectly prepared ones are hard to find; most seem to be over-cooked. These were perfect and tied with the ones I had at the Boulevard 9...Hotel in Nadiad, Gujarat State, India.More

title: Good wine selection
review: This bar in the Marriott marquis has a good wine selection. Good option for relaxing during or after a meeting at the convention center.

title: Service was poor and who charges $4 for normal iced tea
review: We were in town for a family event. We had been going all weekend. We had enough time to have a nice sit down bite before we left for the airport.  Not quite enough to go downtown to a “better” restaurant so we decided to...give this a try since it was in our hotel.  The hotel it’s self is great and the staff is awesome. Woven and Bound not so much. We were in during the early afternoon about 2:00. The place was not very busy and we were seated by a few other groups.  Not long after we were seated one of the people in one of the other groups got up and hunted down one of the servers. I wasn’t sure what the issue was but I soon found out. We waited for 10 mins before a server acknowledged us. Even then it was I’ll be right with you.  He then went to the table where people had complained and took their order, then another table and then us. He took our order very curtly and left. Mind you he had not even given us water. We ordered an iced tea and waters with the meal. Another 5-10 mins went by and no water or anything. There were three or four wait staff looking like they were doing things but obviously were not. I got up and asked one of them for our iced tea and water. Several minutes later she showed up with a pot of hot tea and no water. I told her we wanted iced tea and water. She looked annoyed that she had not listened and gotten the wrong kind of tea for us. Like it was our fault. Eventually we got our drinks.  We sat for about 20 mins. Waters and tea empty and no food. It wasn’t just us. There were people having to flag down staff for their checks, more water and wondering when food was coming. Finally he filled our water and tea. Then waited a bit more for food. I will say the food was good. One of the group felt their burger was dry and not that good but the turkey sandwich I had was good. We asked for our bill as soon as the food came since our time was now tighter than it should have been to make our flight.  The check came out and it was wrong. We were double charged for a couple items. One of which was iced tea. Who charges $4 for a Lipton style iced tea?  He fixed the double charges and gave us our corrected bill. We paid and left.  If it had been super busy or there wasn’t much staff, I could understand some of the wait. But there were 4 servers and maybe 12 groups in the restaurant.  I think you would be best served going to a better place downtown or just plan on paying more and waiting longer for good but not great food.More

title: First night in town
review: Great cocktails at our table before dinner. The bar has an extensive selection and we were able to order specific brands of our favorite vodkas. Our food arrived fairly quickly even though the restaurant was extremely busy.  The Bacon wrapped dates and Roasted beet salad...were delicious as was the Dry aged NY Strip Steak.More

title: Good lunch
review: This is a  hotel restaurant that is very appealing and inviting. I had a very tasty salad for lunch and my wife had a burger without the bun since she is doing Keto. Her slice of tomato was the bottom slice that most throw away....The hotel was full and many we trying to eat and get back to the convention so the service was strained at best. Another downside is the pricey menu.More

title: OK, but not your best choice in the South Loop
review: Had lunch here twice in two weeks. Son and Family are a ten-minute walk away. The Chicken noodle soup lunch with a roll was excellent!  Another day, when I was more hungry, the Italian half sandwich (the sandwich of the day) with tomato soup and...fries was pretty good. I don't particularly like fries with pepper on them; McDonald's doesn't pepper its fries for a reason. The Grandkids had Chicken Fingers and Fries. Other than a few salads on the Lunch Menu,  the Menu is pretty limited but reasonably priced. The Dinner Menu is also limited and over-priced.  The atmosphere is not the best- you have high ceilings and glass walls giving you a view of the McCormick Place parking garage and offices. The service was good, but slow!  There's a food court attached which may give you a better lunch - pizza, potatoes, etc. - if it is open!  I'd walk North 15 minutes on Michigan Ave and find a better place.More

title: Prepare to wait for service
review: Long waits for waitress.  Very average food.  You need to make a reservation for lunch when a big convention is at McCormick

title: Clean, comfortable modern hotel restaurant
review: Clean, comfortable modern restaurant serves all 3 meals. Good variety of attractive dishes. Fair wine list. Reasonable prices for a hotel restaurant. Small bar in center, snack stand adjacent.

My friend and I both ordered...their fried chicken sandwiches but were unaware about how very spicy that sandwich is -- when we indicated to the manager & waiter that we could not eat the sandwiches (neither she nor I can handle spicy food), there was no hesitation at all in offering to replace our orders with other choices; I applaud them for not only the act of replacing the orders but their most positive "no problem" attitude!More

title: Amazingly good hotel restaurant, great service.  Who'd have though!
review: A sleek and modern facility, definitely "high energy" (aka LOUD), service was great.    Our pre-dinner drinks (Negroni and a local Rye) were delicious.  The hamburgers (W&B) were perfectly cooked, and again were delicious.  The wines are expensive, but good selections.  An excellent choice if you...don't want to venture out from the hotel, and you won't be culinarily deprived if you stay...More

title: Comfortable, Contemporary, Delicious
review: With so many choices in Chicago, I still ate here three out of four days. The atmosphere is incredible and the service staff amazing. I’m so pleased with the soups and salads I had for dinner and the BLTTA (bacon, lettuce, tomato, turkey, avocado) sandwich...was amazing.More

title: Very good for a hotel restaurant
review: I went for a Friday night dinner, as I arrived to the hotel around 8.30 pm. The bar area was busy, the rest of the place - seating area - was half full. I was promptly seated and the service was very good, attentive, friendly....The menu seamed limited, but do not hesitate to ask, they have some additional stuff such as fries, ice cream, etc. I got a side salad and pork chops. The main course was very good, nice presentation, good taste. I finished with an ice cream - ordered 2 scoops, got 3, I was told it was a mistake, the extra was on the house anyway. I also like their cup for espresso:-).More

title: Nice breakfast
review: This is an unpretentious restaurant in a quiet setting within the Marriott Marquis hotel. The food is not priced as if it were a diner but the prices are acceptable. Most important the breakfast food was very good!

title: Never expected a Marriott hotel to have a decent restaurant and bar . . .
review: . . . but this lovely, modern hotel across the street from the McCormick place where we were attending a week of meetings had exactly that. The breakfast was delicious. Later in the evening we would wind up at the bar for late night snacks...and drinks (I confess, the cocktails were over-priced, but certainly delicious--2 weeks ago while working in San Francisco we had vodka gimlets at the wonderful Buena Vista Cafe by the wharf for 12 dollars. The price at the bar at the Woven and Bound for the very same drink? a whopping 38 dollars). That aside, the drinks, food, and service were grand.  Also, a good thing for older folks like us, the noise level was tolerable. So the four of us--all over 65--had a terrific time.More

title: Torn on dessert rating
review: We stopped here later on to get dessert before going up to the room. The split rating is mainly for food being near a 5 while service was near a 1. The host did keep wandering away while we were there so it did take...a little to get seated. It took a little before anyone came over so we gave our orders right away. Even with that, it took 50 minutes to get our more routine desserts, eat (they were smaller bites), and leave. Overall, we got a water refill when the food came/delivered by someone else and once when they came by so we could ask for the bill. It then took another time of asking to get it. The desserts were really good and I'd recommend the cake and donuts, but given how slow everything was for us and the tables around us, we couldn't really recommend the place for a mealMore

title: Scrambled Eggs...
review: We did the breakfast buffet. The spread was adequate, and the fare was reasonable. I love scrambled eggs, and perfectly prepared ones are hard to find; most seem to be over-cooked. These were perfect and tied with the ones I had at the Boulevard 9...Hotel in Nadiad, Gujarat State, India.More

title: Good wine selection
review: This bar in the Marriott marquis has a good wine selection. Good option for relaxing during or after a meeting at the convention center.

title: Service was poor and who charges $4 for normal iced tea
review: We were in town for a family event. We had been going all weekend. We had enough time to have a nice sit down bite before we left for the airport.  Not quite enough to go downtown to a “better” restaurant so we decided to...give this a try since it was in our hotel.  The hotel it’s self is great and the staff is awesome. Woven and Bound not so much. We were in during the early afternoon about 2:00. The place was not very busy and we were seated by a few other groups.  Not long after we were seated one of the people in one of the other groups got up and hunted down one of the servers. I wasn’t sure what the issue was but I soon found out. We waited for 10 mins before a server acknowledged us. Even then it was I’ll be right with you.  He then went to the table where people had complained and took their order, then another table and then us. He took our order very curtly and left. Mind you he had not even given us water. We ordered an iced tea and waters with the meal. Another 5-10 mins went by and no water or anything. There were three or four wait staff looking like they were doing things but obviously were not. I got up and asked one of them for our iced tea and water. Several minutes later she showed up with a pot of hot tea and no water. I told her we wanted iced tea and water. She looked annoyed that she had not listened and gotten the wrong kind of tea for us. Like it was our fault. Eventually we got our drinks.  We sat for about 20 mins. Waters and tea empty and no food. It wasn’t just us. There were people having to flag down staff for their checks, more water and wondering when food was coming. Finally he filled our water and tea. Then waited a bit more for food. I will say the food was good. One of the group felt their burger was dry and not that good but the turkey sandwich I had was good. We asked for our bill as soon as the food came since our time was now tighter than it should have been to make our flight.  The check came out and it was wrong. We were double charged for a couple items. One of which was iced tea. Who charges $4 for a Lipton style iced tea?  He fixed the double charges and gave us our corrected bill. We paid and left.  If it had been super busy or there wasn’t much staff, I could understand some of the wait. But there were 4 servers and maybe 12 groups in the restaurant.  I think you would be best served going to a better place downtown or just plan on paying more and waiting longer for good but not great food.More

title: First night in town
review: Great cocktails at our table before dinner. The bar has an extensive selection and we were able to order specific brands of our favorite vodkas. Our food arrived fairly quickly even though the restaurant was extremely busy.  The Bacon wrapped dates and Roasted beet salad...were delicious as was the Dry aged NY Strip Steak.More

title: Good lunch
review: This is a  hotel restaurant that is very appealing and inviting. I had a very tasty salad for lunch and my wife had a burger without the bun since she is doing Keto. Her slice of tomato was the bottom slice that most throw away....The hotel was full and many we trying to eat and get back to the convention so the service was strained at best. Another downside is the pricey menu.More

title: OK, but not your best choice in the South Loop
review: Had lunch here twice in two weeks. Son and Family are a ten-minute walk away. The Chicken noodle soup lunch with a roll was excellent!  Another day, when I was more hungry, the Italian half sandwich (the sandwich of the day) with tomato soup and...fries was pretty good. I don't particularly like fries with pepper on them; McDonald's doesn't pepper its fries for a reason. The Grandkids had Chicken Fingers and Fries. Other than a few salads on the Lunch Menu,  the Menu is pretty limited but reasonably priced. The Dinner Menu is also limited and over-priced.  The atmosphere is not the best- you have high ceilings and glass walls giving you a view of the McCormick Place parking garage and offices. The service was good, but slow!  There's a food court attached which may give you a better lunch - pizza, potatoes, etc. - if it is open!  I'd walk North 15 minutes on Michigan Ave and find a better place.More

title: Prepare to wait for service
review: Long waits for waitress.  Very average food.  You need to make a reservation for lunch when a big convention is at McCormick

title: Bad
review: The newly designed space is warm, modern, comfortable and refined. The bar area is huge but some of the seats are difficult for the servers to access and require a long reach. The menu is limited and appears to be loaded with pre-made things that...More

title: Nice Breakfast
review: I shared breakfast with 2 associates at Woven & Bound.   Service was a little slow and our server was less than outgoing but the food was very good and the space was very inviting.

title: Marriott Marquis featured restaurant-
review: A good restaurant with an extensive menu-try the avocado fries-this restaurant is open from very early morning to late evening-staff is friendly,well trained and very helpful-

title: If you're hungry and tired, this will do the trick
review: The food is excellent but so expensive that we only ate here once. It is inside the Hotel; convenience is the only reason to frequent this place. 2 cocktails (gin & tonics) cost us $23. The salad was delicious but when we finished that and...More

title: Damn good burger!
review: I'll admit I was craving a burger and just ordered on the fly. To my surprise there was a mountain served on my plate. Two burger patties and a pork patty! It was really flavorful. Good cocktail menu. Try the copacabana! Super friendly staff as...More

title: Eggs Benny!
review: Wow - went with the Eggs Benny at Woven and was not disappointed.  Wolfed down the 1st egg before catching my breath and taking a pic. Thus the picture looks like a crime scene but a delicious crime it was! I normally steer clear of...More

title: Beautiful place, great food.
review: We went for my husbands birthday because we were staying at the Marriott. We were kind of expecting your typical run of the mill mediocre hotel restaurant after a long day of running around and were pleasantly surprised to have had one of the best...More

title: Yummy avocado fries
review: First time eating in Marriott Marquis Woven & Bound Restaurant.   We shared the signature dishes -: avocado fries - really yummy along with the wild mushroom pierogis.   The Vice District Burger was good.   The house Cesar actually had white anchovies on it. Had a side...More

title: Very Good Hotel Restaurant
review: Had lunch here and it was delicious. Very good service. The burger was prepared correct and the meal was perfect. Nice to find a well run and delicious hotel restaurant.

title: Great Restaurant Located in Marriott Marquis Hotel
review: Went here with some colleagues and a customer for dinner (we were staying at the Hyatt at McCormick Place down the street and walked here), we did make reservations (probably weren't necessary, but we did just in case). This restaurant is located inside the Marriott...More

title: Reasonable quality but expensive
review: Not many nearby places to eat if you are staying at the Marriott Marquis. If you don't want to walk to Chinatown (about 15-20 mins) then you will probably eat at Woven and Bound.  Food is reasonable but you are paying hotel prices. Had the...More

title: Just a Lovely Experience for Lunch near McCormick Place,South Loop, Museum Campus,Chinatown
review: We stopped in Woven and Bound in the Marriott Hotel near McCormick Place on our walk home from the Auto Show. What a great experience! Beautiful setting, amazing creative food, excellent wait staff and just an overall wonderful dining experience. The Napa Valley Rose wine...More

title: A disaster at first glance
review: Let me tell you about an unfortunate experience that did not have to go in the direction that it did. Walked into this rooftop with a reservation. Greeted by Lenell who is the security at the door. I showed him the reservation, which the confirmation...is attached to this post. I was told that he could Not find our reservation in the portal. Even told that maybe I did something wrong. Clearly, the reservation says confirmed. Also even have the $1 charge they deducted from my account to hold the reservation.  I’m confused and decide to sit, reflect, and look further into the reservation system. Behind me was a woman that did not have a reservation. She walks up and chat with Lenell, who whispers that he will allow her upstairs to a table. She walks out to go and get a girlfriend for their table that was graciously given to them by Mr. Lenell.  Just as he turns she walks away, in walk three other people experience the exact same issue as me originally. Meaning, they present a confirmation for a reservation and is told that they can’t be found in the system.  One of the gentleman from the group speak to Mr. Lenell, who in turn allow them upstairs for drinks at the bar.  I'm listening and floored. I approach him and ask if we could sit at the bar for drinks.  We wait and ultimately refused to the rooftop. So, I notice Mr. lenell speaking to a guy about walk ins. U inquire if that is the manager.  He informs me that his name is Chris. We review everything that happened above. I’m told to restate things about the situation, which I do a review for Chris. I’m then informed to calm down. Just then, Mr. No Name Interjects to inform us that the group let up earlier did not have a reservation, and that he allowed an additional person from their party up to join them. This enrages me as I am explaining exactly what Mr. No Name interjects with to Chris as a major problem. He listens but doesn't remedy the situation. Such a horrible experience, especially when we did our due diligence to reserve ahead. At this point; will not return. Also, We chose to eat at raised, an urban rooftop bar. View is exceptional and vibes are great. Totally recommend it!More

title: Great Place To Start The Night
review: Who doesn't love a rooftop?! I swung by over C2E2 weekend, which surprisingly didn't cause too much foot traffic considering McCormick place is across the street. However we did run into a private event being held which resulted in us eating at the bar.   Honestly...I'm not one for eating at the bar, but I truly didn't mind it as the bar faces the outside deck and igloos. The ambiance was nice, there was enough room for all of our plates, and the bartender was extremely attentive while communicating well with the kitchen.   We ordered the tuna tar tar, Sith burger (limited Star Wars release for C2E2, and crab dip). VU makes a really great burger and the tuna tar tar was very well executed. The crab dip was simply okay, it's not something I would speak ill against, but I wouldn't order it again. I'm trying to understand the vision with the pork rinds. I found that they simply overpowered the dip and pulled focus away from it overalls.   In short it has a cute vibe, and would be perfect way to kick off a girl's night or date night.   Ambiance 5/5 Food 4/5 Drinks 5/5  Overall experience 4/5More

title: Hosted a corporate event here
review: Hosted a corporate event here and it was perfect. The maitre d’ was great helping me coordinate the drink tab and hors d’oeuvres. The view was spectacular and the outdoor igloos on the rooftop were a huge hit. The food was also delicious. We had...sliders and fried mushrooms and veggie trays and more. All wax great!More

title: Drinks and light dinner
review: The vegetable platter was HUGE.  Plenty for 4 to nibble or filling for 2.  Salmon tartare also excellent

title: Breakfast and Dinner are bot h winners
review: We came for dinner and then came back for breakfast.  Great views and a lot of fun.  Try the outdoor rooftop igloo.  It's heated and a blast!

title: Great bar, wonderful servers with excellent small plate dishes!
review: Took my team up after meetings and had a wonderful experience. Brittany took excellent care of us. Wonderful view, great atmosphere, went back several time during our trip.

title: Meeting place
review: Private place to meet with your friends for food and drinks.it's a very nice bar. Didn,t stay long, but I will go back.

title: Cool bar at the McCormick place, who knew?
review: What a surprise to find this rooftop bar at the McCormick center.  We were told about this place as we were heading over to the Hilton Gardens for an event.  We took a small door beside the reception desk to a lobby to take an...elevator to the 22nd floor.  The door opens up to a great modern room with a nice bar that runs down one half of the room.  We sat at the bar and they had happy hour drinks and food.  The grilled octopus gotta was excellent and only $5 during happy hour.  Our bartender, Brian was excellent and really took good care of us.   Next time I have to be at a mind numbing trade show at the McCormick, you know where to find me.More

title: The view is nice!
review: Great service, food is good, the ambiance is nice and intimate, really a good spot for an after work mixer.

title: Overpriced and mediocre food
review: The title says it all, several of the dishes were extremely overloaded with salt (I hope rather by accident than on purpose). Service was ok, and yes you never expect a rooftop bar to be cheap but we were certainly in better ones during our...stay. A plus point is, however, the modern and relatively new interior.More

title: Great view, service, and fun atmosphere.
review: Nice place to meet nice people.    But be warned, the bathroom mirror is see-through and if you have been abused, this might cause you a fright.  It did me and the manager was very apologetic and kind.  I think knowing woud help... and they probably...More

title: Event
review: We had an event on the rooftop and the service was excellent, bar tenders were very good. When we came to the restaurant we were greeted and directed to the roof top. Overall staff was attentive and I would recommend a event there for anyone....More

title: Great Rooftop Spot
review: Solid food, good drinks, but the real selling point is the view!  What a view it is.  Comfortable space as well, lots of indoor and outdoor seating so you can enjoy it in many seasons.

title: Best bar food
review: Indoor and outdoor seating with great views. Super friendly wait staff and really creative menu. We had the Shrimp Springrolls and bacon and arugula flatbread. FYI, if you are staying at the Hilton Garden Inn below...you get to eat breakfast up there!

title: One of my favorite rooftops in Chicago
review: Love this rooftop. Great location, beautiful view, great decor and ambience.The drinks are great and the food is delicious.  The bathrooms are pretty cool! :)

title: Beautiful views of Lake Michigan and Sunset!
review: Wife and I stopped in for a couple of drinks before dinner in the west loop, and we were delighted to discover VU. Spotless patio area, very modern and elegant just an amazing location. We each tried a couple of the specialty cocktails which were...More

title: Security is unreasonable
review: Would t let me up w my briefcase. Required me to check it in which I chose not to do. I offered for them to search it and they would not. Security is of course important but I have a reasonable option.

title: Don’t know their own policy..
review: I'd give this place 0 stars. We live 2 min walking distance from this place. We called and asked if there was a dress code and were told no by Erin. We showed up and were not allowed in the building because one of the...More

title: Didn’t live up to the hype
review: After hearing so much about this rooftop bar, I put it on my bucket list for my honey and I to check out. We went on a Sunday for brunch and were seated on the side with the view of the lake. The inside of...More

title: Very Cool💥
review: We were a large group getting together to celebrate the 4th of July and visited the VU on top of the Hilton near McCormick Place.   Beautiful views, stunning decor and fabulous, spacious lounging couches, easily accommodates a large group with room to spare.  There are...More

title: Great view from the South Loop of Chicago
review: Great and much needed concept for the South Loop of Chicago. If it is warm enough sit outside as they have comfy seating. Decent menu and drinks, however, their alleged happy hour is not advertised or not pushed by any means. I went with a...More

title: Go: The Tapas, the food, the service
review: I’d go out of my way to get here again.  Great service by all staff, the view of the lake is amazing, and the tapas was unique, well-crafted, and delicious.  Highly recommend.

title: A good time
review: I enjoyed myself at this location.  My negative comment is the servers, bussers, bartenders are all dressed in black. I placed a food order with a busser (whom did not tell me as such) and my order was never submitted. Eventually my order was placed...More

title: Great food and bar with a stunning view
review: The tapas and drinks were great.  I was there with a corporate group.  After a great dinner of tapas served family style- There was a selfcontained Karoke room  Great fun and tea building.

title: This South Loop Rooftop Bar is a Game Changer for 2019
review: I have to say that the South Loop getting on having a rooftop its definitely a great investment because this place has such an awesome view of the South Loop and the Sears Tower, all of downtown and even McCormick Place this is the creme...More

title: New Year,s Eve 2018
review: Beautiful venue. Very crowed. Unable to navigate to windows to view firework. Disappointed, no count down to the New Year. It was very busy. Would like to go back during it’s regular business hours. Very conveniently accessible to 3 hotels.

title: Unexpected Surprise!
review: Oh my!  This was such an unexpected surprise as I had no clue that a bar was on the rooftop.  The food here is amazingly good and although it was a lot going on, our server was very impressive.

title: Thank you Vu for your gracious hospitality!
review: I was supposed to meet a colleague at this wonderful restaurant for breakfast but, sadly, I mixed up the location in the hotel so I didn't actually get to eat at Vu.    However, the staff was friendly, accommodating, and welcoming!  I look forward to returning...More

title: Fave
review: Vu is now one of my fave rooftops in the city. Being a south loop resident it’s a nice addition to have the rooftop. I love the ambience, the 2 terraces with the firepits and the drinks. I ordered the Tuna Poke which was tasty....More

title: Gorgeous views, craft cocktails & food!
review: This space has stunning views of Chicago from all angels. Since it was chillier outside, we sat inside by the windows, but were able to check out the private rooftop options with fire pits and waterfalls! The cocktails were well executed and the food was...More

title: Great Bartender
review: Great place not super over the top or incredible but good drinks decent prices.  The bartenders I have had there are always great.

title: Cool place
review: First bar I ever went to in an America. Luckily enough it was open mic night and some comediants were invited on stage. Had some good laughs and a nice beer.

title: BARTENDER AND MANAGER ARE RUDE!!!
review: The worst customer service we have ever experienced RACIST BARTENDERS AND MANAGERS!  If I could of given you a -5 I would !! We (wife as I ) for asking the bartender for a little more vodka since he made our drinks weak as all...heck!  Manager was no help either !!  Both of them were RUDE AND RACIST  telling us “F#@$ YOU!” And we were refused a refund on our NEW drinks that we had just purchased.  WHAT A RUDE CREW THEY HAVE WORKING FOR THEM!!!More

title: Great place to hang out
review: This bar is a great place to be if your in to rock or heavy metal. The decorations are kool and the atmosphere is one big party. Prices and food are reasonable. We usually have our end of the year party outside on the roof...top and we always have a great time. The owner Robbie is a great guy that does alot for school and organizations. He rocks!More

title: Bears pregame
review: Went to Reggies before a Bears game. Very little parking but a fun place . A $12 fee for a buffet before the game and after was fantastic. Plenty of food and a good variety. Bands playing on different levels all day. Good drink prices...and a shuttle to take you to events and back.More

title: Great bbq burger
review: Ask for the bbq burger. Great ambiance, very good food and not expensive. Nice live music. Great experience.

title: Class amongst fun chaos!
review: Fun, entertaining and great food place.  All were very nice but Calling out server Trevor for excellent service! Not typical millennial that gets a bit slow - always checking in, going above normal care. Made our first visit not our last.  Excellent pre-game buffet. I...did wonder tho about the guy charging for the buffet on first floor.  Random amounts and not to everyone. May want to tighten that up. Great place tho!More

title: Horrible experience
review: Came down for a gig from Puerto Rico. Always heard good things about the place and was exited to get there went to the bar to get something to eat and one of the waiters shoved me to the side and told me to -...Get out of the way!- when I asked what I did she just told me all rudely that I was in her way. Then she went on her way looking at me as if I was some thing  bellow her. I have worked in the restaurant/bar business for years and never have I ever seen or heard of this kind of customer service in my life. Don’t go! It’s not worth the horrible expirience. A thousand thoughs ran through my mind. A big mistake to waste my night here.More

title: Interesting
review: Was directed here as w3 were early for event round the corner. As two sixty somethings from U.K. we felt a bit out of place amongst the tattooed and t shirted heavy metal types, but a great place to people watch. Good selection of nice...beers in dark clubby atmosphere, reasonably priced. Nice experience.More

title: ... And we returned with a larger group 3 days later!
review: I was staying at the Marquis for 10 days for a conference at McCormick and walked to Reggies. Reggies is an original. We ate in their streetiside seating on our first visit because the rooftop was crowded and the main restaurant was setting up for...a band performance. Excellent comfort food and pasta. I had the chicken-fried chicken TV dinner. I highly recommend it.  Three days later we returned with a large group and found plenty of seating on the rooftop. Great service and more excellent food. Everyone in our group of 10 was satisfied.More

title: Great staff - free transport to baseball too!
review: Came along early to get a ticket to the baseball game with the transport in the bus. Had a great time chatting with the staff. Very cool place with a real vibe. It gets louder as the day goes on too!

title: We Are Not Happy Til You Are Not Happy
review: Visited this Bar last night for Pre Chicago Blues Festival Party. This is an excellent music venue and has great atmosphere. All the performers were great but for me the standout on the night was Oscar Wilson. Another notable was Milwaukee Slim, My only quibble...More

title: Lunch after the Auto Show
review: Truthfully I had my doubts about entering this establishment. I sent my BF in to check it out. If you enjoy heavy metal, punk musical venue with a good brew list you will be in your element.  Granted we were in search of food.  We...More

title: Decent Bar Food
review: Reggies is better than average bar food. When they get busy the kitchen slows down but if your in no hurry, the burgers are good and so is their pulled pork sandwich. Look for daily specials on-line.

title: Riot Fest
review: What a great bar! Staff were amazing, fair prices drinks and great booze features. Their wings are awesome and enormous. Reggies Rock Bus is off the hook. Awesome free entertainment with refreshments to and from events. I would come back to Chicago just to see...More

title: Good Music and Bar Food
review: Jazz music on the main floor and DJ on the second floor. Reggie's was on the Jazz Tour so it was very crowded. The wait staff were very nice. The crowd was mature and appreciating the music. Good location for Jazz and bar Food.

title: Not Worth Going before going to Soldier Field
review: We were told to try this place before attending a U2 Concert and take the bus to the concert.  It took half hour just to get get our drinks which we were getting ready to leave and just go to McCormick to park. The food...More

title: Good pub grub.
review: Quick cab ride from the McCormicks place. Nice rock vibe. Lovely portions and good prices. I ordered the hillbilly chili and Carlissimo burrito (see pictures). Would visit again.

title: Fun, Preconcert Spot
review: I was in town for a Dave Matthews concert and we decided to try this place out!  I had their mushroom swiss burger it was to die for!  We sat on the rooftop which had a fun atmosphere.  They offered a free shuttle over to...More

title: Cool old vib tavern
review: Real good food - 2 bars 1st and 3rd floor - you have to visit the old record store on the second floor. You will find something you cant live without!

title: Best place in town!
review: Reggie's Playland.  Great music!  Great wings!  Great rooftop bar! Great people watching! Perfect combo of music and sports and busses will take you to all local events.  Owner, Rob, ROCKS!

title: Just okay......
review: Came here with friends on a Saturday night after the Pearl Jam concert. Sat on the roof top.  Atmosphere is nice for sitting/drinking with friends.  Roof top bartenders were not the friendliest, though, so that was kind of a buzz kill.  Also, there is a...More

title: Good Bar with live rock
review: Good Bar food Great prices. Close to the convention center. Bartender informative. Many Many different types of liquor and beers. Cold beers as well.

title: Fun in the Sun!
review: Loved hanging out on the sunny roof deck bar and watching the "L" trains go by. The Fat Tire and char-dog were just what I needed! Oh and the chuckle from when a kid threw the basketball and it went up and over the netting...More

title: group of 42 school trip
review: Excellent food, great service and staff friendly.  Outdoor terrace is beautiful.  We split the group and we were pleased with everything

title: Get your funk on
review: The roof top bar is one hell of a hang out.  Great, relaxed bar scene with fire pit, pool tables, and mere feet from the "L".  We ventured down stairs to hang out with 40-something year-old metal heads who were just out to have a...More

title: Love the Live Music!
review: We visit Reggies yearly from Indiana for the Live Music. They always host my favorite Midwest band, Wookiefoot, and it's always a great time for a great price.

title: I came here after meeting a couple while in Savannah.....
review: While on a road trip this past summer, I stopped at a bar in Savannah, GA. I met a cool couple who told me they worked/owned this place. Since I was planning on coming in town to see a show at The House of Blues,...More

title: Fantastic music
review: Two alternating acts in two different rooms.  So if you want to chat, you can do so in the room where there isn't music at the time.  We saw the Carl Weathersby Blues Band -- totally amazing! Outstanding music!  The food was just so-so, and...More

title: Great music and food
review: Food is nothing special but good. The music is fantastic, local bands, old bands, heck ratt played there last weekend. The management is great. Looks rough but i felt very safe and is kind of a throw back to the days when bands had to...More

title: Great specials
review: Checked this place out from reviews on Tripadvisor and took advice not to be scared away at first glance haha. It is a little rough looking but in a cool, unique way. They have great specials -Tuesday's were .40 jumbo wings, Wednesday was half priced...More

title: Great Small Live Music Venue
review: Went for the first time to watch a friend's band opening for the evening's main act. There was a cover charge but once inside there was no pressure to order anything and the drinks we ordered were very reasonably priced. There were plenty of servers and relaxed service. The venue includes large TV screens for sports when there isn''t a performance. Don't think there is a bad seat from which to watch performances and the acoustics were very good.Almost all the patrons were adults and at least on the night we were in attendance the acts were classic rock and roll. In all, a funky fun place to enjoy rock and roll and a few drinks.

title: Lots of Character
review: Old wood beams and brick walls, with lots of interesting concert posters. Smaller club, good site lines to stage, acoustics were good enough, wait staff had a lot of personality ("if you expect sangria, then you won't like ours") in a good way. Seems they had a good beer and drink list.

title: Great place, great staff, questionable location
review: We went here to see a concert. There's a bar/restaurant with a record store upstairs, then the concert venue is right next door. The food was really good and reasonably priced and the wait staff was excellent. The booths are ragged looking and the bathrooms are only lit by black light, which is...odd. A local band was playing in the restaurant and they were really good too. The concert venue next door is a decent size. It has great sound, and a cool upstairs with limited seating if you want to get off your feet. We had to park down the street a bit at a meter and the area seemed a little rough. The band we went to see didn't come on til midnight so when we left around 1:30 am, we didn't feel too safe.

title: Ogre at the bar
review: We went to Reggie's for a music event. The bartender was a Shrek ogre, truly. If you didn't tip him with each drink, he literally ignored you, and then tried to school us by flipping around the $1 bills from the tip jar, stating, "See, this is how it works. You want service, you tip." I was appalled. Apparently, he grew up in the woods and doesn't realize that folks get tipped for good service AFTER they provide service. The music was great, the venue is awesome, but the bartender is an ogre. So, be sure to tip him with every drink, whether you think he's worth it or not, or you won't get another drink.

title: You have to trust the reviews
review: I will say that I was immediately skeptical of this place because from the outside it looks iffy at best. Once inside it was awesome. It is a music venue, record store, bar, and restaurant all in one. I was in hipster paradise, and I loved it and I am not a hipster. Only drawback I had is getting fixed soon, and that is the lack of a close train stop. The beers were cheap and the bar staff was quick to get to you. We had drinks in the downstairs bar, the rooftop deck (awesome), and even down in the music venue before the concert started and we were told to clear the area. The rooftop was the coolest spot, but obviously with it being Chicago in early November the weather was a little chilly. I could see this place killing it in the spring and summer. Would definitely recommend to a friend or family member looking for a hole in the wall type place. The shuttle to and from Soldier Field was great too.

title: Cool place
review: Be sure to go there when it's sunny and the rooftop is open. I went there on a Sunday afternoon and watched the match on the roof on a relaxed atmosphere. Beer is great :-)There is also a record shop between the ground floor and the rooftop.

title: Check out the rooftop deck
review: Good bar good, good drinks.Had wings, special price on Tuesdays, recommended mixed sauce (BBQ and Buffalo).Good beer selection, and for non beer drinkers, had a few bottles.Rooftop has large projection TV for sox games, pool table, and basketball hoop!Service not fast, but friendly and tasty experience.

title: Shady looking establishment with some of the best food in town!
review: If you want very good food at a reasonable price, this is the place! My wife and I have visited this place twice before theater engagements. We were able to visit on a Tuesday, which is $.25 wing night. I purchased 16 JUMBO wings for $4.50. They were perfectly seasoned, fried and glazed with a sweet and tangy sauce. I could not finish half of them. My wife and I are hooked on this place and plan to make it a regular spot. It would be nice if they update the place - it's a dark rock type place - but if it affects the quality of food, leave it be! LOL

title: Great appetizers. Would be great after dark for music.
review: Was here for lunch with a bunch of kids. Not really a kids place, but appetizers were great, burgers not so much. Great selection of beers. Went here mainly because of Restaurant.com certificate, flood value for the money with the cert. I bet it's a great fun place after dark!

title: Great Southside Spot
review: Reggie's is a great neighborhood bar with a great outdoor space and a live music venue.  The daily specials are great, including the half off sandwiches with the purchase of a drink on Thursdays.

title: Fantastic
review: I loved my visit here, the atmosphere was great and I thoroughly enjoyed my food. Highly recommended  .

title: A rockin' place with excellent food
review: Where can you see a variety of live music in a slightly rough-around-the-edges rock atmosphere and get delicious food?  Reggies!  We love this place - you never know who you'll find playing there (well, unless you read the website) but you know you'll always get...More

title: Little cafe was a BIG surprise!
review: Small and unobtrusive, this wonderful surprise is our new "cafe benchmark", to which all future cafe's will be compared. We arrived for lunch and the service was friendly, the menu was contemporary with fresh juiced concoctions, delicious loose leaf teas, and strong coffee. The food...was the biggest surprise, and literally looked/tasted like something we would expect at a much more expensive and advertised locale.  My tuna melt was perfect, with a layer of sauted onions that still had a slight crunch, but the heat was replaced by sweet carmelization. My Husband's burger was juicy and tender and I swear there were tears in his eyes with his last bite. This is a place we would go out of our way to eat at again. You will not be disappointed.More

title: The name says “little”.The flavors and service are HUGE!
review: Excellent service at the counter and table. The menu offers any number of choices to rival the biggest breakfasteries. veggie options and smoothies add to the excellent menu. I plan to be back tomorrow.smoothies, eggs

title: Perfect local breakfast
review: A little step from our hotel on Michigan, here is a breakfast drop in that felt local. Good blueberry pancakes, OJ and a coffee made me feel like I had joined the neighbourhoodcoffee made me feel like I had joined the neighbourhood!

title: Go Little (Branch) or Go Home!
review: Great assortment of coffees, smoothies, teas etc.  lots of food choices—salads, sandwiches, entrees.  Good location near museum campus (other side of LSD).  Outdoor and indoor seating.  Southwestern chicken salad, veggie burger, and chicken pecan salad were all flavorful, fresh, and filling.  Friendly staff. Reasonable prices.

title: Nice brunch before the museum
review: We went for a nice brunch before going to the field museum. We walked there after ward. It was a nice walk  the food was tasty. My husband and I shared an omelet and a pastry.

title: Since 2007, a must stop en route to the Museum campus
review: Whether you're in a mood for breakfast or lunch, it's always a good idea to stop at the Little Branch Cafe if you are planning a visit to the Museum Campus or other tourist attractions and historic sites in Chicago's South Loop. Located at 1251...South Prairie Avenue, near Grant Park, the Field Museum, the Shedd Aquarium and the Prairie Avenue Historic District, Little Branch Cafe has been satisfying customers since 2007. It's advertised as a hip American restaurant and coffeehouse with a full bar and patio that serves delicious breakfast and lunch fare and a distinct brand of coffee from 7 to 7 daily. The breakfast menu includes omelettes, pancakes, French toast and waffles. My wife chooses either a cinnamon raisin waffle topped with caramelized nuts or old-fashioned French toast with a chick cut brioche, sweet cream and fresh strawberries. My favorite is oatmeal with cream, brown sugar, cinnamon, nuts and berries with two scrambled eggs, chicken sausage, hash browns and an English muffin. Lunch? Start with the soup of the day. Then flip a coin and select one of six sandwiches--smoked salmon, turkey Reuben, tuna melt, blue cheese burger, Philly steak or fried tilapia. If none of those agrees with your palate, there are several other options that I'm sure will. Whatever you choose, you'll be ready for a full day of visiting some of Chicago's most popular tourist attractions.More

title: Best coffee maker in the neighborhood
review: This is a hidden gem in the neighborhood as it's part of a residential building.  They make great coffee and offers a good selection of sandwiches and brunch menu.   There is outdoor seating; perfect for good summer weather.  This place could get crowded on weekends...near brunch hours.More

title: Best local cafe
review: This is one of those places you would never guess is there.  Great little cafe.  Seek it out.  Menu simple, but very elegant dishes.

title: Well worth the visit if you can find it
review: Little Branch Café is a hidden gem in the South Loop.  Fortunately we live in the area so we frequent it often.  The food is excellent and always well prepared.  They started as a coffee shop and have grown to serve great breakfasts and lunches...as well as smoothies. Try the LBC Burger.  It may be the best cheese burger in the city.  Also check out the breakfast croissant sandwich.  My grandkids love the pancakes and their parents are happy because they also get fresh fruit with the pancakes. My wife says the Veggie Burger is the best she has ever eaten.  During the warm weather Little Branch has outdoor eating available.  Parking can be tough in this area.More

title: Good Food; kinda small and hectic
review: We enjoyed our visit here. It's small and in the bottom of an apartment building. The food was good but the staff seemed a little out of sorts.

title: Thanks to Ina Pinkney for her tip
review: My wife and I never would have known about the Little Branch Cafe at 1251 South Prairie Avenue in Chicago's South Loop if I hadn't read breakfast queen Ina Pinkney's breakfast recommendations in a Chicago Tribune article. She rated this hip American coffeehouse and restaurant...More

title: Nice cozy breakfast on a windy morning
review: Popped in for breakfast in my way to the museum campus for a morning of sciencing. Windy morning outside but hot coffee to be found on the inside, which hit the spot. This cafe seems targeted at the residents of this little corner of the...More

title: Out-of-the-way?
review: Better to say urban camouflage. In the most unlikely of locations to start a restaurant. Yet there it is, for whatever enticed them to start there, and let’s not rule out developer incentive. The place and food is great. They use to have booze, and...More

title: Nice Place
review: My wife and I stopped here for breakfast before going to The Adler Planetarium. The staff was friendly. The service was quick and the food was tasty. I had stuffed French toast with mascarpone and blueberry compote and my wife had strawberry Pancakes. Great place...More

title: Nice find
review: We had the Pecan salad and loved it. Good size and very tasty.  The almond scone was nice  The Mexican hot chocolate was good.  The latte was a bit watery.  The only complaint is that the service is inconsistent.

title: Good quick breakfast
review: This low-key breakfast/brunch was perfect for a quick delicious meal before a big day of sightseeing in downtown Chicago!  The breakfast burrito was good, the lox platter was wonderful and the order up front style allowed for quick efficient service.

title: NOT Recommend
review: Small portions with large prices for the food. The food is not of very good quality, in fact, subway provides better sandwiches! The service is poor and I hope you do not need to use the bathroom.... The walk from the museum is about 1...More

title: Poor food quality but nice place
review: Looking for food near the museum district? You might want to think twice before visiting here.   I rate this place 4 stars for the space, ambiance, and service; but 2 stars for the food so a 3 star average.   My friend and I are vacationing...More

title: My experience
review: This was my first time eating here.  I live in the south loop.  I came because of the great reviews (4.3 stars out of 5.) I ordered stuffed french toast with the blueberries on the side, 2 eggs over medium, and some chicken sausage.  I...More

title: A hidden gem
review: One of the best breakfast's in the city!  The place is tucked away in the South Loop and has a great feel, great service and the food is top notch.

title: Meh Just OK
review: I reeealllly wanted to like this place more than just 3 stars.  I went here for breakfast while visiting friends and saw that they had red velvet waffles.  I'm a red velvet fan so I expect red velvet flavor when you're calling something as such....More

title: Hidden downtown treasure
review: Well technically it is not downtown but it is just two blocks from Museum Campus.   They serve delicious food for people who are looking for healthy ingredients.  With that said the cocktails are the perfect compliment to the brunch.  The decor is charming but you...More

title: Simply Awesome!!!
review: They had a variety of selection.  Loved their daily soup offerings.  Great taste and great ambiance.  Great coffee.  Spent the entire morning without being bothered by anyone.  Was told about their $5 drink specials...Yum...I will be sure to come back to try them out!!

title: Great little find
review: The shrimp salad was out of this world. Very fresh and delightful. Chicken curry soup is very tasty. Not too much curry. Lots of chicken in it, like homemade. Vegetables were very fresh. Crab cake sandwich was one of the best I ever had. Will...More

title: Daily Specialty Cocktails
review: Little Branch has great drink specials wed-sun...I am a huge fan of $5 mojitos on Thursdays and $5 margaritas on Fridays after work.  Plus, the $5 bloody marys and mimosas for weekend brunch are a steal!  Despite being small and off the main road, the...More

title: Unexpected surprise
review: I didn't expect this place to be this nice to be honest, but this place was blew me away!! Yummy brunch menu, very clean and cozy place, and friendly staff. You'll love it!

title: Perfect city get away.
review: I was in Chicago yesterday to visit Field Museum and had little extra time to kill. My search engine showed this cafe hiding in the building forest. Little Branch Cafe - a perfect suiting name for this hidden gem, tucked in the corner of a...More

title: Delightful Breakfast Spot
review: We like to explore various neighborhoods of Chicago when we visit for the weekend, and we first stumbled across Little Branch Cafe a couple of years ago when checking out the South Loop.  There's not much around it -- just some (newish) condo buildings --...More

title: Great hidden breakfast spot
review: Great food and good value. Great spot for breakfast! I really liked everything about this spot except maybe the parking. If I was a local to the south loop, I'd be here every weekend, But it was a pleasant surprise when working on the area....More

title: Ok- so so but good for a drink
review: The Korean lady there unfortunately spoke poor English so got my order wrong big time... And I used to be an English as a second language teacher so I spoke really simply and slowly. Just make sure if a Korean lady there takes your order...More

title: go here for brunch!
review: I lived a few feet away from Little Branch for four years, and it was always a neighborhood favorite.  The weekend brunch is AMAZING!  My two favorites: the marscapone-stuffed brioche french toast and the breakfast burrito.  Both are delicious.  Little Branch also has alcoholic beverages,...More

title: A Southloop Favorite
review: I love Little Branch Cafe. It looks and feels like the cafes back in New York and caters to that same vibe. The do counter service--even during brunch--which makes the line go faster so there's almost never a time you need to wait for a...More

title: THE OWNER HAS NO CLUE ABOUT CUSTOMER SERVICE
review: I have visited this place several times and each time I wonder why I bother to return.  After my experience yesterday I can say with 100% certianly I won't be returning.  We stopped by for a later lunch and found a seat at the empty...More

title: Hidden gem in the South Loop
review: This is one of my favorites in the South Loop. They serve paninis, gelato and some of the best Mac & cheese you've ever tasted. Stop by on the weekend for brunch or grab a drink after work - either way it's a great place...More

title: Beautiful area outside the Shedd Aquarium
review: Beautiful area outside the Shedd Aquarium. If I worked anywhere close to the Shedd Aquarium, I would have my lunch there every single day with nice weather.

title: Nice view!
review: Nice place with very good view. You can relax and have a good time. Perfect place for a good photo of the lake and the city.

title: Great outdoor eating at the Soundings
review: The cafeteria Soundings, at the Shedd Aquarium has a limited but good set of choices for all ages. We ate outdoors and the view of the city was great. Price was a little higher than elsewhere but that is expected at museums.

title: 4th of July
review: wasn't impressed with food or service. Limited seating, Air conditioning on this hot summer day was below par.

title: Beautiful views and walk
review: It’s just peaceful and quiet.  There are a lot of bikes in the area and they do not give way to pedestrians at all so be prepared to wait for them or be hit- yep saw a bike run j to a person.the shops are...ok we did not eat but there are lots of choicesMore

title: Picture Postcard View
review: You're paying for the veiw here...the food is a little expensive for what you're getting, but let's face it, they're in a primo spot ready to catch the hungry crowds coming out of the Shedd Aquarium, so take it for what its worth...rest your weary...bones, eat something and enjoy the view.More

title: Horrendous experience
review: Waited over an hour 15 for food, wife and kids had to leave during wait to go to a show, came back and still didn’t have food. No one to check on us/me sitting at table. Asked to see manager, no one came over. Great...aquarium, but I would never recommend this restaurant while visiting.More

title: Gorgeous scenery and excellent spot for photos and selfies
review: I really couldn't stop taking photos. Chicago really plans out their views well. The boat docks were not seen from Shedd and so all you get is the lovely blue water, the walkway, gardens off to the side, and the gorgeous buildings lining the sky....A lot of people rented bikes and segways which we thought about doing, but decided it would be too much of a hassle to find a drop off location once we were finished. Also, right outside of Shedd, you could purchase tickets for the water taxi and the boat tours.More

title: Gorgeous views. Fresh Food
review: While visiting the Shedd Aquarium, we stopped to eat at the Soundings Cafe. Do not go right after the Aquatic Presentation, because everyone goes there and the lines are long. We went before the crowd and the lines were not long. I had the soup...and salad combo., which was reasonably priced.  The veggie chili was delicious and my salad was very fresh and large. The view of the skyline was awesome. Any food would taste good with these views.More

title: Overly priced, especially for very average food
review: We had 7 of us and this was really pricy, especially since it was mostly snack type food.  It was packed so I attributed the messiness of the place to that, but there wasn't anyone walking around cleaning off tables. To control the line, they...did have someone having you wait in line till it was reasonable to go to the stations to order the food, which I think helped keep the crowd down in those areas. Other than that, I wouldn't recommend unless you absolutely need to eat something.More

title: Quick Lunch
review: Several choices of food on lower level.  Nothing fancy  or inspiring and a bit overpriced but adequate for lunch while we were there

title: Lower level good food
review: The restaurant on the lower level was loud, crowded, and a bit of a turnoff.  Our food, though, was very good.  We ordered soft tacos and a burrito bowl with guacamole.  It was all delicious and more than we could eat. Lunch is probably a...bit more pleasant on a less crowded day than Saturday, but it was so good that we forgot our impatience.More

title: Soundings at Shedd Aquarium
review: Great views of downtown Chicago skyline, Lake Michigan and Lake Shore Drive  Great to walk on the Sounding weather permitting

title: Best Views of Chicago Skyline!
review: It has always been known that the best skyline views of Chicago are from the Shed Aquarium grounds!  Looking at the amazing city from this vantage point is like none others as you get all the best views facing north!  It is great early morning...at sunrise, just as the sun starts to dance on the buildings, or at sunset as the city begins to settle down.  The grounds are very comfortable to sit and have a picnic, or for biking, jogging, walking, or just chilling to enjoy the sites.  Guaranteed to not be disappointed!More

title: Relax, Refresh and Refuel
review: Use your lunch break opportunity to take a break from the hustle and bustle of the aquarium and get something to eat. Menu has many options to choose from. Take the time to go to the bathroom and eat your food in a relaxed atmosphere.

title: Beautiful area outside the Shedd Aquarium
review: Beautiful area outside the Shedd Aquarium. If I worked anywhere close to the Shedd Aquarium, I would have my lunch there every single day with nice weather.

title: Nice view!
review: Nice place with very good view. You can relax and have a good time. Perfect place for a good photo of the lake and the city.

review: The cafeteria Soundings, at the Shedd Aquarium has a limited but good set of choices for all ages. We ate outdoors and the view of the city was great. Price was a little higher than elsewhere but that is expected at museums.
