title: Relax, Refresh and Refuel
review: Use your lunch break opportunity to take a break from the hustle and bustle of the aquarium and get something to eat. Menu has many options to choose from. Take the time to go to the bathroom and eat your food in a relaxed atmosphere.

title: Not what we expected...
review: After waiting in an incredibly long line to get into the aquarium itself, we found that this overpriced restaurant did not meet our expectations.  It was "seat yourself style" after ordering your food, which was difficult as there were no clean tables to sit at....More

title: Decent food, better view.
review: We went, expecting something a little nicer, since it was a "sit down" place.  It wasn't very busy, but there were no tables by the windows.  The food was pretty good and the waiter was very attentive and nice, but it was less than I...More

title: Pleasant staff, great ambiance!
review: The food at this restaurant is well prepared and the decor is elegant. The aquarium makes for an amazing experience. Add this place to your visit to Chicago!

title: Good food with scenic view...
review: After going round the aquarium, we came here to have some lunch.  We had ordered Spinach fita flat bread, Mediterranean vegetarian roll and croissant.  They were very tasty.  The lake view and the  chicago skyline add a charm to this place.  Over all we had...More

title: LOVELY Restaurant...with a FABULOUS View!
review: I think this is one of those "hidden" gems on the lake! This restaurant is located on the upper level of the Shedd Aquarium, and offers up a wonderful selection of food, and if you are lucky enough to get a table by a window,...More

title: A marveloous view and pleasant food.
review: A visit to Shedd Aquarium can easily last all day, so a pleasant lunch might be in order.  The view of Like Michigan and Chicago is wonderful, and the menu is pleasant.  I enjoyed a salad of Gorgonzola, pears, and walnuts.

title: Shedd Aquarium
review: Very nice aquarium. Lovely shows (I saw the 4D movie and the aquatic show) both of which were great. There is so much to do and see. However it is very crowed and the food and gift shop merchandise is very expensive.

title: Grab a quick bite
review: I found the right side of  Soundings to be very similar to Starbucks with about the same prices. The quality of the food was very good.  They had coffee, sandwiches, drinks, muffins, and cute animal cut out sugar cookies.  There is a small  bar area...More

title: better than the foud court downstairs
review: It is preferred over the food court downstairs; however, it is pricier. You can get better food outside the Shedd

title: Excellent!
review: I was surprised to find such a nice place in the aquarium for lunch.  I expected a loud cafeteria with cold food but we found great service with a great view.  The food was excellent and reasonably priced.  I would certainly return upon our next...More

title: A great place to go
review: The Shedd Acquraium is amazing in every way.  If you're in Chicago go--it's terrific for children, teens and adults.

title: Slow service
review: 20+ minutes to wait for a to-go order is unacceptable. The manager and staff appeared aloof and without care or speed when it came to our and others orders. I would not recommend.

title: Overpriced and dull
review: I'll be the first to admit that I had low expectations eating at a museum cafe. However this place was so mediocre, busy and overpriced there's no way I could justify going here. Their menu is limited which would hopefully mean they had some quality...More

title: Beautiful Place
review: The location is really nice. it is right near Lake Michigan. There are lots ofthings inside for the children, and adults. This ia a nice family place. It's worth the money.

title: Good food
review: We got a chicken and avocado sandwich, but the highlight was the Shark Shake - DELICIOUS! Don't miss out on that one.

title: Food is ok; friendliness is rare
review: The food is ok; they serve Starbucks coffee and we had a brownie to go with it. Both were good. We were there at the busiest time:lunch time, but in my opinion, a smile doesn't cost a penny.

title: Not Big Enough, Poorly Staffed.
review: Mentioned this in my Shedd Review. Considering the size of the complex to begin with the food & drink display area was way too small and absolute minimal staffing. Relatively short lines still took time to reach the check out. It was as if the...More

title: Great Place To Eat
review: I thought it looked like the food was too expensive, so only ordered something to drink. My daughter ordered a turkey wrap sandwich that ended up being gigantic so we split it. It came with a pile of homemade potato chips that were excellent.  Free...More

title: Food
review: The food was fine but the organisation of serving it was poor. The price of the differents items were not shown

title: A good "museum" restaurant experience
review: Generally, on location restaurants at museums and attractions leave one with limited selections and / or a less than impressive experience. Soundings was very good, great selections, clean, a bit frenetic but it was a Saturday. All in all, I can comfortable recommend it.

title: convenient, interesting menu
review: Pretty good selection for an 'attraction', interesting choices, something for everyone, relatively quick service at a crowded lunch hour.

title: Food and go
review: thought it was a long tiresome line due to being the massive lunch rush time frame, we were still able to get what we were looking for. when we stopped by in the morning around 10 am it was smooth serving and pleasant staff and...More

title: Food adequate, service rude
review: If you have to have a snack I would recommend finding the vending machines at the aquarium because the food is over priced, although adequate, and the service -- well rude. There were about 5 or 6 people behind the counter and finally one said...More

title: Wonderful place!
review: Obviously its not a "sea world". But its a very nice place to visit in chicago!!! One day is enough! You can get really close to the Belugas!!

title: This is just poor
review: The queuing system initially promised well. The reality was not. The thinking seems to be two servers to a section or none at all. My daughter, the only person at the salad and chicken section, had to wait 10 minutes and eventually shout at people...More

title: expensive, rude and annoying server
review: While it is tempting to avoid and loud and crowded food court at the Shedd, Soundings NOT an option even if the view is great.  The food is expensive, the place is very noisey (the heavy chairs screech across the floor) and our server was...More

title: Surprisingly great food
review: This place had a great selection of fresh and healthy foods.  I expected cafeteria food but this was actually well prepared food.  Note that this is the upstairs eating area.  Downstairs is pizza and hot dogs and the like.  I didn't go there.

title: High Quality Food at an Aquarium?
review: Yes, you can get really good food at the Shedd Aquarium, and it comes with a million-dollar view of Lake Michigan.

title: Surpisingly Good Food and Service
review: Stopped to eat during a trip at the aquarium. Yes, it is definitely overpriced, however it is much better then the options at the lower food court. The food was much better then expected and we received excellent service from the waiters. If you have...More

title: Good Food, Not so good prices...
review: I think it was a bit overpriced, the food however was good but it is what I would expect it to be at that cost. The view while dining is really awesome! I suppose you have to factor that into the cost as well.

title: Food is ok; friendliness is rare
review: The food is ok; they serve Starbucks coffee and we had a brownie to go with it. Both were good. We were there at the busiest time:lunch time, but in my opinion, a smile doesn't cost a penny.

title: Not Big Enough, Poorly Staffed.
review: Mentioned this in my Shedd Review. Considering the size of the complex to begin with the food & drink display area was way too small and absolute minimal staffing. Relatively short lines still took time to reach the check out. It was as if the...More

title: Great Place To Eat
review: I thought it looked like the food was too expensive, so only ordered something to drink. My daughter ordered a turkey wrap sandwich that ended up being gigantic so we split it. It came with a pile of homemade potato chips that were excellent.  Free...More

title: Food
review: The food was fine but the organisation of serving it was poor. The price of the differents items were not shown

title: A good "museum" restaurant experience
review: Generally, on location restaurants at museums and attractions leave one with limited selections and / or a less than impressive experience. Soundings was very good, great selections, clean, a bit frenetic but it was a Saturday. All in all, I can comfortable recommend it.

title: convenient, interesting menu
review: Pretty good selection for an 'attraction', interesting choices, something for everyone, relatively quick service at a crowded lunch hour.

title: Food and go
review: thought it was a long tiresome line due to being the massive lunch rush time frame, we were still able to get what we were looking for. when we stopped by in the morning around 10 am it was smooth serving and pleasant staff and...More

title: Food adequate, service rude
review: If you have to have a snack I would recommend finding the vending machines at the aquarium because the food is over priced, although adequate, and the service -- well rude. There were about 5 or 6 people behind the counter and finally one said...More

title: Wonderful place!
review: Obviously its not a "sea world". But its a very nice place to visit in chicago!!! One day is enough! You can get really close to the Belugas!!

title: This is just poor
review: The queuing system initially promised well. The reality was not. The thinking seems to be two servers to a section or none at all. My daughter, the only person at the salad and chicken section, had to wait 10 minutes and eventually shout at people...More

title: expensive, rude and annoying server
review: While it is tempting to avoid and loud and crowded food court at the Shedd, Soundings NOT an option even if the view is great.  The food is expensive, the place is very noisey (the heavy chairs screech across the floor) and our server was...More

title: Surprisingly great food
review: This place had a great selection of fresh and healthy foods.  I expected cafeteria food but this was actually well prepared food.  Note that this is the upstairs eating area.  Downstairs is pizza and hot dogs and the like.  I didn't go there.

title: High Quality Food at an Aquarium?
review: Yes, you can get really good food at the Shedd Aquarium, and it comes with a million-dollar view of Lake Michigan.

title: Surpisingly Good Food and Service
review: Stopped to eat during a trip at the aquarium. Yes, it is definitely overpriced, however it is much better then the options at the lower food court. The food was much better then expected and we received excellent service from the waiters. If you have...More

title: Good Food, Not so good prices...
review: I think it was a bit overpriced, the food however was good but it is what I would expect it to be at that cost. The view while dining is really awesome! I suppose you have to factor that into the cost as well.

title: Overrated and Priced
review: It's so overpriced, it's ridiculous. However, the views are spectacular. So, if it's a special occasion, go ahead and splurge.

title: Dont go on a free day!
review: We took a cab that costs us 10 dollars to get there. walked up to the place and they told us it would be a hour and 45 min wait to get in. It was way to cold and way to long to wait. We...More

title: Surprising Treat
review: We dined at Soundings at Shedd Aquarium following a morning at The Field Museum.   We were pleasantly surprised by the menu.  I enjoyed the classic Panini while my youngest daughter ordered the roasted vegetable Panini and salad.  My oldest daughter had a cheeseburger and salad....More

title: Ok food, a cut above typical museum fair, good service
review: My wife and I just spent a long weekend in Chicago (late September 2013).  We bought a CitiPass for $89 per person and then chose our 5 places to go from its list of choices. The Shedd was one of these.  After 2.5 hours of...More

title: Close Whenever They Want
review: We were exhausted after a full day of sightseeing and were hungry so we stopped by this cafe to check out the menu and thought it sounded good but thought we'd walk downstairs really quickly and see what they had at the cafeteria. The cafeteria...More

title: Good food, great view
review: For a cafe inside a museum, I thought the prices were entirely reasonable. We ordered the lemongrass chicken wrap and the bbq chicken sandwich. Both were tasty and came with generous fresh salads. Great water view. Two lunches and two bottled waters came to $30...More

title: Not bad for museum food
review: Because we are frequent museum-goers, we have encountered museum food from the very good to the really terrible.  This restaurant rates above the middle in food quality.  Of course the prices are typically high as is generally the case for museum food.  Since we are...More

title: Great view and really good food.
review: This was a great food option for Shedd Aquarium. It was very good food, not even comparable to a typical attractions snack bar quality food. The view was awesome too.

title: Just ok..
review: They need to have a better selection of food, it is not very kid friendly. Quite honestly there was nothing on the menu i even liked myself. The food is extremely overpriced for what you get however the servers were nice.

title: Good food
review: We ate at the aquarium.  It was a nice lunch  for an attraction cafe.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating.

title: Nice views, decent food and quick
review: We stopped for lunch at Soundings immediately after the marine show, it was not very busy at that time since it was only about 11am.  We ordered 2 sandwiches and a kids macaroni and cheese along with 2 adult pops.  The food came very quickly...More

title: Understandably busy
review: They were understandably busy but we stood in line forever outside and In.  It was cold and rainy outside. I felt horrible for the parents with little ones and strollers. Once we got up to the desk to pay to get in I thought it...More

title: Everything was delicious
review: We had an excellent meal--all our selections were fresh and well seasoned, from the paninis to the salmon and rice. Staff was super-friendly. It was full day of sightseeing so a nice lunch break was a welcome treat. Great view of the lake.

title: Wonderful
review: Great for strolling and seeing the lake. You can even take a pricy water taxi to navy pier although a regular cab is cheaper with 2 or more people.

title: very beautiful landscapes
review: This is a great area to take pictures and spend some time, really beautiful, you will love the buildings and gardens. Totally recommended while in Chicago.

title: Comfort Food & Kid Friendly
review: Easy access for all the comfort food any kid could want and be happy! Or so that's how mine said I acted....  Nice stop in between exhibits.   Kid friendly....

title: Good variety, good food
review: Our group of five all were happy with the food choices at the Soundings Cafe, as well as with the speed of service and the quality of the food.

title: Good food; great view
review: Menu is manly salads and sandwiches with fries or fresh fruit.  I had the 3 cheese grilled sandwich, my husband had meatloaf and our grandson had the children's grilled cheese.

title: Terrible hamburger
review: The hamburgers we ordered were so bad, I had a hard time trying it, and my kid who loves hamburgers, ate about a third and almost threw up. The cost is way too high for the fast food this bad.

title: Typical Food court
review: It was your average food court set up. The employees seemed like they really wanted to be somewhere else.

title: What do you expect from an aquarium restaurant?
review: I hadn't originally planned to dine here when I set up my itinerary for Chicago but when I realized that better restaurants were a long walk away I decided to settle for Soundings. I had the Cobb salad which was good but not great, a...More

title: Food better than expected
review: The thing to remember is that this is cafeteria food...and in comparison to other places like this, the food is pretty good.  A great selection of both traditional cafeteria fare (i.e. pizza, hamburgers, hotdogs etc) along with some unexpedted things like chicken & steak kabobs,...More

title: Great place for the little ones!
review: We have 3 kids aged 3.5, 2 and 6 months.  All three were enthralled with this place.  Could not get enough!  We bought the Chicago CityPass, which is great.  The Shedd admission was a part of this pass.    Parking was easy, as we went on...More

title: Convenient and family friendly
review: While the prices were high; that is to be expected at a popular attraction in a major city.  The cashier offered helpful suggestions and encouraged us to move tables together in any way that would fit our needs.  Meal orders were delivered to our table;...More

title: This place is wayyy too...
review: This place is wayyy too expensive for the food. It's something you can make at home.

title: Worth the trip
review: We just had a very late breakfast here and it was great. Food was really good and service was amazing. I had a meat lovers skillet that was one of the best I've ever had.

title: Great spot to start your day
review: Very nice cafe offering wide-ranged delicious menu. The staff is very friendly and fast. Location is very convenient, prices are moderate.

title: Very good but not fancy
review: A nice place to run by for breakfast.  My chorizo burrito was quite good, and hash browns excellent.  My friend liked his meal also.

title: Perfect breakfast spot
review: I've read reviews about the slow service, but from my solo experience with this place, we went on a day where it was 75% packed with a steady stream of people and we got our food in a very reasonable time frame.  Seated quickly, ordered...and served within 15 minutes.  The food was spot on.  My wife had a skillet that was done well and I had french toast that was near perfect (i'd only add confectionary sugar...i thought that was an assumed thing with French Toast) and we shared one of the most amazing plates of biscuits & gravy i've ever had.  AMAZING!  If we stay near here again, i'm definitely going back.  They are definitely under-staffed (looked like maybe a family operation) with only one hostess, one cook and one manager who kinda tried to help everyone.  But be patient, they are friendly and the food is worth it!More

title: Awesome Menu & Downright SWEET staff
review: Had breakfast here twice while in town on business. The menu is vast, the food yummy, and the staff was so kind. When you get the fresh fruit bowl, this ain't no can of fruit cocktail. I ordered it twice: had enough to put on...my fabulous buttermilk pancakes and enough to take away for a lunch snack. The food is fresh, hot, made to order and comes out quick. Every staff member gets a shout out: cooks, wait staff, cleaning crew - all made this location fantastic.More

title: So many choices!
review: We stayed at the Congress and were looking for a quick and cheap place for breakfast.  This hit the spot perfectly!  Way too many choices.  We each had something different and they were all good.  Loads of bacon come with many dishes.

title: Breakfast before Pokemon Gofest
review: Hopping place near Grant Park..Found this place on way to an event and ate a hearty breakfast to provide energy for the day ahead.  Good options...but a little of a wait.  Delicious

title: Delicious!
review: I love this place. They have yummy vegetarian options. And the food is always hot and good. There can be a bit of a wait for food on weekdays so plan accordingly.

title: Breakfast
review: Popped in here as it was recommended by a fellow guest at our hotel. Had a wonderful omelette which was really tasty. Hash browns were shredded which I am not used to but enjoyed. Very reasonable prices, $27 for 2 meals and drinks. Waiting staff...were really friendly and attentive. Cafe was clean, would return again.More

title: Great breakfast find!
review: I stopped in and tried this place for breakfast while visiting Chicago. Very gracious and welcoming staff. The coffee was excellent and so was the service. I had the Deuces Wild. It was well prepared and the price was right. Less expensive than other places...in this area.More

title: Quick and Tasty
review: We stopped here for breakfast. We found a bright clean atmosphere with friendly and helpful waitstaff. I had a western omelet with cheese that was so delicious. My nephew had steak and eggs which were cooked to perfection. He really enjoyed his breakfast. The foos...was prepared very quickly yet was so tasty. The service was great as well. We’ll definitely be back.More

title: Keep walking
review: Thought this would be a good, quick breakfast. Almost all of the tables were full. Once seated, our waitress gave us about 5 min to order. When drinks arrived, I asked for a juice and she said she really had a lot of tables to...get to. ? I said when you get a chance. That never came. Our breakfast took well over 30 min for the basics, scrambled eggs, bacon, waffle and pancakes. Instead of using a tray, all our plates were stacked on top if each other. Average and bland. Not enough staff to cover all restaurant responsiblities. Waiting for bill that never came, went back to pay. They hadn't even tallied it yet. Only reason for the second star is that my son loved the hot chocolate he ordered.More

title: Just keep walking
review: Not a great place to eat, it all literally tasted the same, except the bacon, which tasted like dust. When I asked for sausage instead of the bacon, it took another 10 minutes. I don't typically do that, but it was awful. Food was bland,...service was closer to mediocre, but not even. Thinking about it, I'm not really even sure who our server was, since no one was consistently helping us....I say keep walking.More

title: Classic diner, great prices
review: Had breakfast here and the staff was friendly and attentive. Mexican burrito was delicious. Hash browns could have been cooked more for my taste. Standard diner coffee. Whole grapefruit was a great surprise. Good value for money.

title: Average diner
review: This diner was attached to the hotel we were staying at, so it seemed convenient.  The menu is typical diner-fare.  It seemed busy, but service still felt slow.  It took more time to get a cup of coffee than expected, but food was good.  Nothing...fancy, just satisfying breakfast sandwiches!More

title: Worth the trip
review: We just had a very late breakfast here and it was great. Food was really good and service was amazing. I had a meat lovers skillet that was one of the best I've ever had.

title: Great spot to start your day
review: Very nice cafe offering wide-ranged delicious menu. The staff is very friendly and fast. Location is very convenient, prices are moderate.
