It took more time to get a cup of coffee than expected, but food was good.  Nothing...fancy, just satisfying breakfast sandwiches!More

title: Food was ok
review: Last year for the same event the staff was great and is the reason we came back. Under Staff for an event weekend. Waited over a half hour for an Ice Tea. I lost track of time so can't even tell how long it took...More

title: Let's Do Brunch
review: Spacious, and yet comfortable downtown diner. Warm, friendly staff with speedy service. Menu is pretty classic and all food prepared to order and that adds to the charm. Nice little oasis just off Michigan Ave and Wabash. They have vegetarian options too

title: Could use some improvement
review: This is a diner.  Pretty simple overall and right off the main street of Michigan Ave.  We went in for lunch on a Thursday and it was very busy.  There was a sign to wait to be seated even though it was less that 1/4...More

title: Good hotel, awful food at the restaurant
review: Bad choice to eat. Better go to eat to a local restaurant. We ate at the hotel's restaurant "Third Star". The food was so bland and as if it had been frozen and just heated to be brought to our table, e.g. frozen meat patties,...it all tasted like packaged and frozen foodMore

title: Bar in Hyatt
review: The food is very mediocre and expensive.  There is a minimal selection of beer and liquor, both expensive.  There is no high-end liquor available, unfortunately.

title: Convenient and good
review: We had a 90 min slot to get dinner in between events at the convention centre. The service was quick. The menu had a good range and the food was good.

title: Convenient spot next to McCormick Place, suitable for business meetings
review: This was a nice choice for lunch next to McCormick place if you want something more upscale than the food court in the convention center.  Food is pretty standard American fare, including salads, burgers, Reubens, priced pretty reasonably, about what you would expect in an...upscale hotel ($15-$20 for most choices).  If you had to set up a business meeting while you're at the convention center, this would be a good choice.More

title: Truly Enjoyable Experience
review: I've been in town for almost a week and Third Star / Arc Bar have been a lovely addition to the trip. The service each time has been wonderful and the food was great.  This afternoon for lunch,  I had the opportunity of meeting the...manager,  Mitchell, and he was extremely pleasant and  thanked me for my patronage. I will definitely return on my next trip to Chicago.More

title: It was a breakfast meeting
review: Our party of four all had omlettes. They were good and  service was good. The restaurant place was quiet at 7:30 AM and a Trade show was going on.

title: Frozen and grilled meat patties for a burger?
review: I do not know why we just didn't go to eat to a local restaurant. We ate at the hotel's restaurant "Third Star". The food was so bland and as if it had been taken out of its packages to be heated. For instance two...of our burgers were probably cooked from frozen meat patties and just heated to be brought to our table with bread from a package and not so fresh condiments. The ribs someone ordered seemed fine, but they lacked taste,More

title: Typical major hotel restaurant.
review: Typical major hotel restaurant.   So far we have had dinner and breakfast here. Service is fine. Dinner seemed a bit under staffed. Breakfast was fine due to buffet.    Food and drinks are good. And the prices are on the high side for drinks and breakfast....Glass of wine was$12. Buffet was $23 with coffee and OJ. Coffee on the menu is $4 plain coffee.   Alicya was very nice at breakfastMore

title: Food was good but Service is still Up and Down
review: This was my friends and my 3 trip to Third Star after the Chicago Auto Show in the last 3 years.  It was a weekday and around 5 PM and they were busier than the last trips.  They may have been slightly understaffed as there...was tables available, but a wait to be seated.   Once seated, we ordered and the drinks came out fairly quickly, but the food took long enough to make us think that the food was taking a long time to come out.  Meanwhile, the bread service was pretty good.  Once the food came out, the dinner itself went fine.  I ended up with a burger which was good.  Not anything outstanding, but good.  Everyone was happy with their meals.  Refills were provided by someone other than our regular server and they were will quick.  We even got an ice water pitch for our table.  That was great after walking all day.  Then the wait started.  Our server apparently set our 3 check down at an empty table about 3 tables away and we sat there for 30 minutes tapping our fingers.  I was staring at the checks, thinking that they were ours, but nobody came around to check on us.  The server apparently realized we didn't have our bills yet and scooped them off the table and brought them to us.  It took another 10 minutes to run the cards and bring them back.  It took a grand total of 1 hour and 35 minutes to have our meal.  That's a long time for a burger.  The positive was that we missed some rush hour traffic on our way out of town.  If the fact that something is taking a long time to happen at a restaurant, it's never a very good sign...  They earned their name this day.More

title: Ellyn is a great server!
review: Ellyn at the Third Star restaurant was an outstanding server. She truly cared for special diet request and was very accommodating. It is really nice to see a waiter kneel down, have eye contact and listen to a customer. You rock Ellyn!  Great food! The...atmosphere and decor was great.More

title: Amazing service
review: It was an amazing experience at the Third Star restaurant.  Super friendly and welcoming staff.  Big shout out to Luzmaria for her amazing suggestions and great personality!  Make sure you ask for her when you go to Third Star.  Great job friends!!!

title: Great service
review: Well maintained and well staffed. Luzmaria was awesome in her suggestions and service. Will be coming back during our next convention

title: Extremely unpleasant experience
review: They won't allow you to seat until your full party arrived and reservations are not allowed. They made you to wait forever until people come. The attitude of the waitress and unhelpful and irritating.   Very disappointed with the service and arrangement there.

title: Exceeded Expectations
review: I was at a tradeshow and ate there two days in a row.   They were super busy but still moved me in and out pretty quick. Christina, the hostess handled the stress with ease and was still polite and friendly. I had a tuna BLT...More

title: My daughter and I had a late dinner with Vicente
review: We had 2 meals and both times the food was good and the service was good.  Vicente served us for our first dinner and Jason was the chef.  The food was wonderful.  I HAD THE 7 HOUR POT ROAST.  OMG, it was wonderful.  I have...More

title: Ask fo Kate!
review: Kate is one of the best and most attentive servers I’ve had in a long time. The people in my party and I loved Avery hung we tried. The tofu tacos and coconut pound cake were amazing! Ask for Kate and have the best experience.

title: I will be back!
review: I had the pleasure to be served by Kate during my recent stay at Hyatt Regency McCormick Place. Kate possesses a pleasant and good-tempered personality. She was able to keep herself calm in hectic situations. It was a particularly busy night. She served a dozen...More

title: Bland over-priced food
review: This restaurant serves bland, over priced probably frozen food; in one instance our protein was cool to touch and the waitress refused to replace it until we asked for the manager very unprofessional

title: Surprised by how delightful and delicious dinner was!
review: I often steer away from hotel restaurants but was tired and ready to just settle in when I arrived late at the Hyatt at McCormick Place.  How wonderful to have selected Third Star restaurant! Larry is a fantastic waiter! Attentive without hovering. Good recommendations and...More

title: Surprisingly Good
review: Being in town for a conference we were tired and wanted something more than conference food. We were walking back to our hotel and decided to take a break at Third Star. Expecting typical hotel restaurant food were we glad we stopped. Everyone’s food was...More

title: Fresh food, good service
review: I had lunch alone at the end of a business trip before heading to the airport. Staff were friendly and attentive and the food was really good. Considering a bottle of water around the corner is $4, the prices weren’t as high as I expected...More

title: Great Food and Great Service!!!!
review: Great Hostesses and Staff We attend a big conference and have had the support of Kate, Cynthia, Gachelle and Martha year, after year and they are outstanding. They continue to amaze me and my team with many last minute requests and never cease to amaze...More

title: Great Cobb Salad and great server
review: I ate here for lunch today.  The Cobb Salad looked good, except it was a served with iceberg lettuce as part of the lettuce mixture.  I  asked my server Luis if I could get that salad with every thing but the iceberg lettuce.  Substitute any...More

title: The best choice without leaving the Hyatt
review: This restaurant is the default option for a place to eat without leaving the Hyatt Regency Hotel. It was surprising that a big hotel like this did not have a fine dining restaurant.. The Third Star was OK for breakfast and lunch but would not...More

title: Average, but decent if you're in a bind.
review: This restaurant is located in the hotel. It offers both breakfast, lunch and dinner options, and is the standard hotel type food. The buffet is offered during breakfast, but does not have a lot of vegetarian options.

title: Just Ok
review: My wife and I ate here three times during our stay, while attending a conference. Ate had breakfast two times and dinner one time.  We found the meals to be typical conference hotel fare. Decent, but not outstanding. Slightly over priced. However, if you figure...More

title: Surprisingly Good
review: With few restaurant options at the McCormick Place Hyatt, my wife and I were pleasing surprised by Third Star.  We ate there several times while staying at the Hyatt and enjoyed each meal.

title: C2E2 Breakfast
review: I had breakfast here during C2E2 on Sunday and even though there was a bit of a wait, it wasn't that bad. I had the pancakes with a side of bacon and both were delicious! The waiter had no issues doing separate checks and was...More

title: Good fare but careful with the waiters
review: The restaurant is well appointed and the food is very good. However, some of the waiters are way too slow or simply do not care about the customer. They don't take your order and when they do and get it wrong they literally roll your...More

title: Overpriced, unappetizing food
review: As other reviewers have mentioned, this restaurant has a captive audience and it appears they realize they don't have to be that great.  I went for a late breakfast and was very disappointed.  First, it appeared the wait staff wasn't really organized as two different...More

title: Overpriced and average food
review: The Hyatt Regency has a captive audience with limited food options other than what's on site - especially for those with a short window and lack of good weather to walk anywhere else.  Further not many restaurants are close enough to walk.  Third Star was...More

title: Another breakfast buffet
review: Starbucks over roasted coffee and not crisp bacon, the eggs on the buffet were not hot but they were over done.  As was to be expected at a hotel buffet.  The wait staff was efficient and cordial and offered plenty of the over done coffee....More

title: Good Food But Too Loud
review: Food was excellent, we had 7 Hour Pot Roast, Ribeye, Beet Salad, Caesar Salad, Potato Soup and Minestrone Soup...over several visits. All food was excellent and well prepared. I know this eatery was just updated but, I don't like the ambiance at all. TOO LOUD...More

title: Early Dinner after the Auto Show
review: This was my second visit to Third Star after the Chicago Auto Show over the past few years.  We arrived around 5:30 on a Wednesday (Valentine's Day) and the restaurant was almost empty.  Service was outstanding.  Our server filled drinks and checked on us often....More

title: Just okay
review: Menu looked good, and a quick buffet was in order since we were in a hurry.  Price was excellent.  Food was okay but nothing special, but trying to get the bill was a major event and took forever nearly making us late.  We asked for...More

title: Great Breakfast
review: I had breakfast everyday during my stay. They offered great choices, fresh fruits and delicious omelet.

title: Good food
review: They served up Halal food for a muslim convention I attended. Food was great and reasonably priced. Would definitely recommend

title: Convenient, good food
review: This is the only sit-down restaurant at the Hyatt. If you want a full dinner, the fixed-price, all-you-can-eat buffet is a good deal. The buffet menu changes nightly, but always includes salad bar, two meats, a veggie, a starch, dessert bar, non-alcoholic beverage. The a...More

title: Really Good Food & Excellent Service
review: If you’re near McCormick Place, don’t hesitate to dine at Third Star.  While the quality of the food is really good, the service is most impressive.  My server Larry was quite possibly the best waiter I’ve had in decades.  His customer service could not have...More

title: Skirt steak and shrimp scampi
review: We went here with reservations and got there early.  We went to the Arc Bar across the hall first. The servers were friendly and pleasant. We went across the hall to the restaurant and were greeted pleasantly. The service was okay. The food was very...More

title: Predictable Dinner
review: We stopped here for dinner because of the convenience; not many choices are available in the immediate area of the convention center. At 6PM on a Tuesday we were seated immediately, about half of the tables were occupied. Our waitress, listed as Kate on the...More

title: Great food, fun atmosphere
review: Windy City Ribs is a fun, vibrant bbq joint. They are proudly black-owned. The menu has good choices and a full bar and the prices are reasonable. Staff are friendly and attentive. The atmosphere is vibrant, with sports playing on TV or music in the...backgroundMore

title: Food order is not consistent.
review: I order through a delivery service.  Flavor of food is great. One time I ordered rib tips and got a slab.  Today I ordered hot links and it literally looks like half a hot dog. I never get whatever drink I order.  Frustrating.

title: Nice BBQ in Chi
review: I was recently at McCormick Place for Soxfest and decided to eat here on a lunch time. Server was great, very friendly and talkative. HAd the 1/2 rack St Louis Ribs with Mac N Cheese, the food was very good and the ribs were well...cooked and well seasoned. $24 for the food and a soda, so it is well priced. Would return if and when I were in the area.More

title: Very nice find and walking distance from the hotel
review: Was looking for a quick bite to eat that was walking distance from my hotel Was happy that I chose Windy City Ribs. Had the chicken wings with their spicy BBQ sauce and fries Wings were meaty and minimal breading. Sauce had some kick but...was not too spicy Crinkle cut fries with sea salt that were cooked to perfection Friendly service and asked as I was leaving how I enjoyed the food Would recommend this place if you are in the areaMore

title: Wings!!
review: The wings are awesome!!! Also they are open late.. i think until midnight or 1am. Prices are pretty good as well! I would definitely recommend this spot!

title: OK food
review: Stopped here while staying at the Hyatt McCormick a short walk away. Service was friendly, but slow. Had the slider trio - just OK, a little dry.

title: Hidden gem
review: Fena provides absolutely fabulous service. Visiting from Maine and this was a great welcome to Chicago!

title: Awesome Meats
review: I was referred here by a friend who goes to DePaul games. It is only a couple of blocks from the arena and McCormick Place. The ribs, brisket, links, chili, and green beans are awesome. I loved this place. Not much in to see in...terms of the local. But it more than makes up for it with close proximity to McCormick Place/Arena and great tasting ribs. I will plan a trip to Chicago just to eat here again.More

title: Dive with great ribs!
review: We were hungry after watching a show at the Windy City Playhouse nearby and took a chance since there was not much opened around the area. We were glad we did. The food was delicious and portions were generous. The spicy bbq sauce was the...bomb!More

title: Friggin Brrrrrr!
review: We were in town for the weekend and staying at the Hampton at McCormick place.  This place was just up the block and looked clean and welcoming.  We were greeted by a friendly waitress who seated us in a clean booth.  We decided on the...bbq ribs and bbq brisket respectively.  The food was good but difficult to enjoy.  I've been in some chilly restaurants but I've NEVER ate my entire meal with my coat on.  The thermostat on the wall said 60°.  We asked our waitress if she could turn the heat up, but she said she wasn't allowed to do so.  We'd already ordered our food or we probably would have left.  Not a recipe for success.  I don't care if they have the best ribs I've ever had, not being able to eat in comfort is just stupid.More

title: Generous portions, very good flavor, reasonable prices
review: At this no-frills restaurant/bar, I tried pork, rib and brisket as part of the sampler platter and none of them disappointed. Not fall-off-the-bone ribs, but very good. For the amount of food, the price was very, very good. Restaurant and bathroom were clean. I'd recommend...More

title: Very good food....
review: Due to a front-desk recommendation, and easy walking distance from the hotel; we stopped in for dinner, with visiting conference-attending family members. Overall, we enjoyed the experience.  Though the facility has a somewhat dive-bar ambiance; the food is quite good.  Our server, James, was friendly;...More

title: Great find and highly recommended!!
review: Fantastic! A lucky find for us. We had the pulled pork plate with Mexican corn and cole slaw - all perfectly prepared and very generous servings. My friend had the BBQ Sampler w/potato salad and a dif. side I can’t remember. Service was solid, the...More

title: Fun and friendly
review: Great bar and grill.  We stayed at the Hampton Inn across the street and were recommended this place by the front desk for late night food.  Everyone was really friendly and the food was great.  Definitely will go back!

title: Super Smoked Wings
review: Don’t let the outward appearance of this bar keep you away.  Their smoked wings were served with the meat falling off the bones.  Maybe the best we’ve ever had.  And the mac and cheese was very good, too.

title: Dive place with good BBQ!
review: Stopped in for a quick bite to eat and drink on our way to the train station. We had no expectations but the BBQ was surprisingly delicious! Waitress was friendly and talkative, food was excellent and drinks were good. I can only imagine how much...More

title: Average food, limited selection availability
review: The order process was a little difficult and the waiter kept coming back to our table after the initial order to tell us they were out of one side order or another.  The choices were very small. Waiter did an ok job as he was...More

title: Fun Dive Bar
review: I stopped in for a cold beer and some chicken wings on a recent business trip. It would certainly be considered a dive bar, but the staff was excellent and the food was great. Would recommend this place for chicken and ribs while in Chicago.

title: Great BBQ, in a true "dive" atmosphere.
review: After a long day at C2E2 at McCormick Place all three of us were hungry and wanted to sit down to a hearty meal in a non-chain mom and pop place. That's Windy City Ribs and Whiskey in a nutshell. The "whiskey" part of its...More

title: Food was average at best, but they made up for it with really slow service ...
review: After waiting for 45 minutes for my meal, my combo plate consisted of decent hot links,  dry, over-cooked ribs, and brisket that I literally couldn't eat .....

title: Keep walking
review: A group of four of us happened upon this place while at a convention at McCormick Place. We were looking for somewhere that was a close walk from our hotel. The menu here sounded good, but the food was not. Meat was tough. Server inattentive...More

title: Need a venue close to McCormick Center?
review: I needed a location walking distance to McCormick Center for a 65 person event.  With a limited budget, you can actually rent the entire restaurant out and they provide a casual networking atmosphere with lots of great food.  The networking event had plenty of food...More

title: Best I’ve ever eaten
review: Searched google for the Best Italian restaurant in Chicago. Google definitely got it right. When we got there, my wife and I both said we would not get an appetizer or dessert because we were going to a concert. That was impossible. We had the...meatball appetizer and they were the best I’ve had. My wife had the linguine and white clam sauce and I had gnocchi al forno. I’m Italian and have been eating Italian food for 50 years and I must say, I’ve never had better. Even the dessert was great. The best part was the prices. Bravo IL Culaccino. Cant wait to come back next time I’m in Chicago.More

title: A nice little hidden gem near the Mccormick Place
review: This is my second visit to Culaccino and both times the experience has been worth the visit.. I loved the veal so much I ordered  it twice in two nights. I love how you can get it prepared different ways. The homemade giardiniera was very...flavorful but spicy. The veal parmigiano had just the right amount of cheese and I like the pasta served with it. The portions are large and you end up leaving filling very full.  The bread was nice and hot both nights and my drinks never went dry.  Looking forward to trying the cannoli cake.  The first night I had the Ceasar salad and it was huge and the second night I had the caprese salad.  The dressing on the side was perfect.  I travel quite a bit and was happy to run across this restaurant close to the hotel.More

title: Good not great but walking distance from McCormick Place hotels.
review: Wanted a nice meal while at McCormick Place for gymnastics meet.  IL Culaccino was right across the road and had good reviews.  Service was amazing, was able to reserve a table ahead of time.  Seating we were put right up against the windows by the...door so every time it opened we got cold.  Food was decent but not remarkable...  Honestly Olive Garden is better.  Worth it for proximity.  Would go again, but wouldn't be expecting "wow".  Again, service is what makes this place tic, as I can't complain at all about the staff, they were attentive and helpful and there but not overbearing.More

title: Another Good South Loop Italian Restaurant
review: We had the restaurant to ourselves on a Saturday night at 4:30, but it normally gets busy later. We love Italian so it's nice to see another option come to our part of Chicago. The pros: fast and friendly wait staff, nice romantic atmosphere, some...interesting menu choices, and a good wine list. The cons: pricey for portion size, close to McCormick but far from the loop, specials seemed similar to cheaper menu items. I've got nothing to complain about. Our dinners were great and the warm bread and wine were perfect. The thing is, Italian restaurants are plentiful and I'd prefer the same food for a cheaper price and less atmosphere at Tufanos Vernon Tap. But if you want a nice romantic dinner or you're staying near McCormick and crave some pasta or a steak or even need a classy place to take a client out on business, IL Culaccino will be perfect for you.More

title: Good Italian food in the South Loop
review: Great place for lunch within walking distance of McCormick Place and across the street from Wintrust Arena. We were here for lunch. No wait as there was nothing going on at McCormick Place. The Italian food is good and it is a quiet place- as...opposed to a noisy bar. The South Loop is finally getting a number of restaurants and new hotels as the area has become gentrified. My son bring his kids (4 & 6) with another family for dinner during the week once in a while. Even the kids enjoy it.More

title: Great Pasta & Great Service & a Great Value
review: Our group of six ate there on an early Friday night, mainly based on it's close proximity to the Hyatt McCormick. We were a motley crew of youngsters and oldsters with varying tastes and appetites. My mom was in a wheelchair. The place was fairly...empty when we started dinner (5pm), but was crowded by the time we left. Everyone ordered a different dish so we covered a good sample size. The pastas were all very well prepared. The Eggplant Parmesan was excellent...not bitter or salty. The pumpkin ravioli was superb, as well. The Salmon with a red sauce was can unusual tantalizing  very good surprise and the Hollow speghetti (I can't remember the name) was my son's favorite. The only miss was a pasta special with beets, spinach & chicken. The ingredients were good, but it just did not stand up to the rest. The wine list had reasonable choices and splurges. Dessert was a canoli-inspired  treat. Very good! Our server Shane was fantastic. He had the waiter banter down pat and the team kept our water, wine, and bread filled and table stocked and cleared. Excellent service rivaling many restaurants we have visited at three time the cost....The long booth was a little awkward, but they made it work. Super reasonable for the level of service and food preparation. We will be back.More

title: New option in the South Loop?
review: We have been fans of Franco's for a long time so when this popped up in the search we were excited to try it out.  The service was great, and the wine list and cocktails on point.  Our appetizer, salad and entrees were all wonderful....The menu offers all of the traditional Italian preparations at the entree, but the pasta list included some things I was not expecting and the grilled calamari was great.More

title: Great food, friendly service
review: Made a reservation based on reviews on trip advisor and because it was walking distance from the Hyatt Mcormick Place. Good decision! I had the special Halibut Putanesca ( superb!). One of my coworkers was celebrating a birthday and our amazing server, Kayla, brought the...table a deconstructed Cannoli, which was incredible! Crave worthy in fact. Dinner was delicious, service was excellent and we definitely recommend you try it! A special thanks to Kayla who as she was leaving for the evening saw us on the street looking for the Rooftop Bar and graciously walked us to the spot! Wow.. you can’t teach nice it has to be in you to start with and it absolutely was in Kayla!More

title: Great service and bar but the food was lacking
review: We ate here with a large group the first week of October 2019.  I heard from the bartender that they had only been open 4 months so I understand there is a learning curve and changing staff conditions.  First let me start with the positives....The location is great if you are staying near McCormick.  The specialty drinks are amazing .  The food however is lacking .  Out of the four dishes I tasted from our group only the  gnocchi impressed .  The veal was over cooked and the  tortellini was just ok.  I would probably find a better option for food but the bar is wonderful.More

title: More or less
review: Was here with clients. Although the environment was nice, the food was not that good. We ordered Fettucine Diabolo and Tortelini Carbonara. The Fettucine Diabolo was so spicy that we could not eat it. The Tortelini was more or less....the price was too high for...the quality offered.More

title: decent Italian restaurant
review: we stopped here for a late night meal during the convention in august. we were a group of 4. The waitress was friendly and attentive. Good service. We made our orders before the kitchen closed so we rushed through it. We ordered wine, beer and...More

title: DINE HERE...
review: and enjoy all this restaurant has to offer.   Food was amazing and has an extensive wine list which will please the pickiest.   Dawn, our server was knowledgeable about the menu and flavors and guided us through our selections. There is a nice outdoor area to...More

title: It's a Subway restaurant--what more do you need to know?
review: This particular Subway is identical to all the other ones--no better and no worse. The food is inexpensive, created quickly, and of course there are vegetarian options. Identical to every other Subway in the USA.

title: Average Subway
review: Stopping at Subway seemed like a good idea for a light lunch.  We got the large classic tuna sub.   It tasted good & everything was fresh.  The staff was quick and efficient putting the sandwich together.  The price was more than reasonable.

title: Great Service
review: Service was above average for a Subway, Employees were pleasant, friendly. Yes, I will be back when I am in Chicago. If a business is only as good as it's employees this Subway has nothing to worry about

title: Subway is always great!
review: My family loves Subway. We have visited scores of Subway Restaurants all over the world. Until a few years ago, my children kept a record of all the Subway branches they have visited.   Subway meals are always very tasty, and yet very cheap. This time,...my wife and older son ate Veggie Falafel Sandwich. My younger son ate Veggie Delite Sandwich. I ate Veggie Delite Salad. All of us had requested for guacamole.  I have never tasted salad to be as tasty as that of Subway anywhere in the world.More

title: This is the only Subway I've been to that's retained the honey oat bread!
review: Overall, as nice a Subway as any of them. The staff made nice, full sandwiches, and did not skip. I was pleased, and will go back.

title: soft, sweet and tasteless
review: The sandwiches keep on getting worse - we must have forgotten how lousy they are - but this place succeeded in serving the worst ever sandwich. Come-on - get up in gear and make this worth eating again.

title: Good service, good food
review: Clean facility, very friendly personnel, facility was clean and organized, my food was prepared as order, would return anytime!

title: Clean neat subway with fresh sandwiches
review: Regular run of the mill subway as you would expect staff wear plastic gloves when making subway sand so its hygienic Good selection of toppings and bread types

title: subway breakfast
review: an under  $10 breakfast for two.........a real value in the big city.  two egg, cheese and bacon sandwiches and two coffees for under $10.  no wait time and a clerk happy to make a sell.  everybody is a winner on this one.

title: Clutch
review: They are open late so they really come in handy after a few nights hanging out with my friends. It's Subway so you know how it tastes, and of course it's affordable!

title: Quick dinner service and superior service over neighbor restaurant to the south
review: Good service. With a smile! Food prepared to Subway standards.  Could be cleaned up a bit more, but restrooms were clean.

title: Good quick sammy's
review: The great thing is that they are open late and still functional.  I had a wrap for the first time at this location and it was pretty good!

title: Same as every Subway
review: Just a normal subway....Nothing stood out different from the rest. Ordered Breakfast....Price was average.

title: Average
review: Good location, needs to be cleaner and more organized. Within walking distance of the hotel and train station. Staff was courteous and greeted with a smile.

title: Loved the Spicy Italian Sub
review: This is a pretty big subway, there is enough space for at least 3 people to order their sandwich at the same time, something which is not very usual at a subway. The quality of the bread was very good and the sandwich was served...More

title: "Convenient"
review: This is a smaller Jewel..During the day,this Jewel is extremely busy, but shelves are stocked well enough to handle most purchases.The deli area and produce area are the best areas of the store.The meat area usually looks great and fresh.The dairy items are limited(no matter...which Jewel you go to) Jewel used to have a bigger dairy selection but over the past few years the selection of brands have diminished.This store is busy so during the day the checkout lines can be long..More

title: Going...Going....Gone
review: We have been shopping here for over 30 years and I  don't know what's going on but it has steadily been going down hill for some time. The prices and sales are good but the service! Wow slow, not friendly, try to get something at...the deli for example and you'll see. I would recommend getting adults at the register or train your current employees in how to treat customers. I'm on my way to Strack.... I'm goneMore

title: Good choice of fruit, veggies, snacks in downtown Chicago
review: I picked up fruit and snacks for my Amtrak California Zephyr (2.5 days) trip. It was easier than walking down to Trader Joe's, which would have been my choice otherwise.  Friendly staff. I was impressed with how the cashier served the lady in the wheelchair...in front of me. The lady wanted her groceries packed in a certain way to make it easier for her to carry, and the cashier patiently obliged - no fuss, no drama.More

title: This is a grocery store; not a restaurant
review: This was a typical grocery store with a good looking produce/fruit section.  The drugstore section is small.

title: Place has gone down hill!
review: We used to frequent this Jewel however, we now go to the one on Canal. This location, is always too crowded, never enough cashiers, dirty and the people are rude.

title: This is a grocery store (not a restaurant)
review: This is a full, large grocery store.  We were staying in a hotel nearby that had a small refrigerator in the room.  It was nice to find a complete grocery store (very large), with very reasonable prices to boot!  We got a six-pack of beer,...and a few snacks.  (Oops - don't forget to buy a bottle opener, like we did, and have to go back! :-) )  A nice surprise in the middle of downtown.More

title: Grocery time
review: Jewel is down the street from my apartment and I'm able to walk to get what I need. I like the fresh fruit selection and the frozen aisle.

title: Not a restaurant, but a large grocery store
review: I'm not quite sure how Jewel-Osco gets a rating of #1,151 out of 7,621 Restaurants in Chicago, if only because Jewel-Osco is a grocery store, though it does have a deli counter.  Besides groceries you can get liquor here and there is a pharmacy.  The...grocery store is open 24 hours.More

title: sufficient for grocery needs
review: I went to the Jewel-Osco grocery store  on 550 N State St hoping to find some unique goodies to take back home as souvenirs to share.  I was disappointed that I didn't find what I was looking for. There were some nice looking bakery goods,...but they had a label that they were made in Calif. or elsewhere so not a unique local product.  I did ask a clerk for assistance looking for something else and he was helpful.  The store is crowded but is good to have the option of a real grocery store in the downtown Chicago area close to where my hotel was located. By sharing your experiences, you're helping travelers make better choices and plan their dream trips. Thank you!More

title: Chicago fun
review: Greta prices especially on beer! Great variety big store close to walk from hotel, nice selection all around

title: Good fresh market in the Chicago Loop
review: If you want fresh fruit, vegetables and some amazing meals,.. Here you are!! Jewel-Osco. They have a huge worldwide section of beers and some wines, too. This section is upstairs. It's very well placed in the south loop, Wabash with Roosevelt. You can park in...More

title: Ok
review: I've never been a huge fan of Jewel. I would always prefer Dominick's due to a vast selection. Jewel in my neighborhood is always out of the things I need. When there's a sale I don't understand why the restock is limited. It never fails,...More

title: 24  hours everything you need
review: My favorite grocery store to buy items . Has good selection of fish and meat at a good price(the meat & fish section closes usually @ 9 PM) . The best thing about this place it is 24 hours /7 days a week that what...More

title: Good cheap grocery store
review: We needed supplies and Jewel Osco was suggested to us as they were good and cheap. We found everything we needed and more and the fruit we got was fresh. Good selection.

title: Your typical grocery store
review: Did some baking while on vacation and this store had everything I needed. It is your typical grocery store like the Safeway we have back home. Good selection of liquor and beer upstairs. There was a Jewel-Osco that was close to our S. Michigan ave....More

title: Everything you need.
review: THIS IS A GREAT STORE OFFERING EVERYTHING THAT YOU MAY NEED. We stayed right next door and were able to pick up all sorts of thing that we needed or had forgotten to bring with us on our trip to Chicago. Read someones review that...More

title: Great place to pick up food
review: You can get something to eat after your done shopping. They have a cute little area to sit and eat. I like the atmosphere here.

title: Convenient
review: We stopped by this store on two occasions to get food/drinks for our room. Just a block from embassy suites, Prices were very affordable We picked up. Shrimp. Sushi, coleslaw. Cheese/crackers, fruit tray Snacks. Wine & beer for our room. Lots of fresh made Sandwich's...More

title: Affordable and convenient
review: I love the selection of food in this store - from its pre-prepared meals to basic necessities like milk and bread.  The goods are budget and waistline friendly, and the store's staff is accommodating and helpful.  A little caveat to travelers - The store is...More

title: Great store
review: Jewel-Osco is a fantastic store with great selection. It was a joy to find this store around the corner. The produce department is very fresh and brightly lit. I really wish we had this store back home. Great place to add money to your Illinois...More

title: Great grocery store
review: We always go to this store to buy CTA passes when in town. They have a great selection of fresh fruit and baked goods-things that travelers can keep in their hotel room for snacking. The service counter person was very helpful and friendly while buying...More

title: Excellent & Convenient
review: Staying in Chicago recently, we looked for somewhere to buy some small food items and drinks. We are so glad we found Jewel-Osco. There are many choices for drinks, fresh fruit, a great salad bar, and also a deli with made to order sandwiches, and...More

title: Excellent supermarket!
review: Local supermarket worth finding.  Prices were excellent and the quality of the food and veg on offer was great.  An entire floor dedicated to beers, wines and spirits - at excellent prices.  Not as fancy as Trader Joes nearby, but not as expensive either!

title: Many rude or unhelpful workers
review: They need to hire better at their south loop store as many workers their suck big time. But, there are a few that are actually professional so that's nice. I had one young woman the other day that walk right past me when I asked...More

title: Convenient supermarket
review: We shopped at Jewel-Osco on our first night in Chicago. It was in walking distance to our hotel. We stocked up on all the supplies that we would need for the week.

title: Jewel-Osco Grocers
review: Very clean and well organised.  What I really liked was that if you told them you were visiting they would use a visitors card to give you the same discounts that they gave members. Yeah!!!

title: Southloop Jewel
review: i like this grocery store b/c I know where everything is and I live in the area. However, expansion is needed and the parking lot is tight!!! The best time to go is during the day

title: OK, technically this is...
review: OK, technically this is a grocery store but they have some of the best damn chicken wings around.

title: Adequate
review: As cafeterias go, Galileo’s isn’t bad, but it isn’t very good, either. I had a Supernova pizza that was adequate. The espresso was pretty good. This is a feeding station with a spectacular view over the lake and of the Chicago skyline. And: it’s the...only eatery in the Planetarium.More

title: Fantastic salad
review: Loved the conven a wonderful panini, and I had a fantastic salad; many choices for kids and adults.  Open seating allowed us views of the waterfront and city from a table next to the walls of windows.

title: Great Views, but Expensive Food
review: It is what you would expect for an attraction centered food place, but I hate being gouged $5 for a Gatorade.

title: Friendly staff
review: Stopped by on the way to Adlers for a coffee and a bite. Very hot coffee and a great toasted sub. Friendly staff.

title: Very good paninis!
review: We were at Adler Planetarium with other family members and went this place for lunch. We were pleasantly surprised how much offerings it had, even though it was seemingly just a small food court of one Cafe. We ordered both Cuban and Chicken paninis. They...were both excellent.More

title: The views are better than the food
review: It is a cafe in the Adler planetarium. It doesn't have an extensive menu. The food was average, I gave it an extra star just for the fantastic views. I just had a coffee and a sandwich.

title: Food for thought
review: Great food with fast friendly service! The menu has a surprising amount of choices even for kids. It’s more than a basic museum cafeteria. It also has magnificent views of Lake Michigan and Michigan Ave/Chicago Lakefront!

title: Great View at Museum Cafe
review: We visited the Adler Planetarium, and Cafe Galileo's was connected to it. The planetarium atmosphere did continue into the cafe, as the tables and chairs were decorated with outer space designs. Each of us ordered a hummus and veggie panini, and they were all very...good! The cafe overlooked Lake Michigan, and we were treated to a beautiful view of the city. Altogether, good food was supported by an amazing view of Chicago.More

title: We only came to have some coffee here
review: Great view from the inside of the cafe and fanstatic view when you stroll around outside. We liked that they offered not only hot meals but also cut fruit in eatable portions (prepacked). We enjoyed that the cafe was not too crowded on a weekday...lunch time and would recommend to come here.More

title: Great views
review: Not a cheap place, but the food is fresh and the views are awesome and after walking for a couple of hours learning about interesting facts, it is worth it.....

title: Gret views
review: Food like at any other museum cafeterias, but great views all around.  Also, it has telescopes set up and the friendly volunteers will help you and the kids looks for far-away sights.

title: Great cafe at the planetarium
review: After exploring the planetarium all morning we were all getting hungry. My niece stated she wanted lunch at the planetarium, so that was the original plan. We expected boring over priced food. Yes, it was expensive, but it was very good. We ordered the California...More

title: Best views of the lake and skyline!
review: This restaurant inside the Planetarium will give the kids a few minutes to eat food they enjoy and a view that will take your breath away. Salads are they way to go, they are fresh and delicious! Several are gluten-free, and dressing is on the...More

title: Nice Place to Eat Inside Planetarium
review: Good overall menu with affordable prices. It has huge atrium to sit in and also out door table to get the views of Chicago Skyline and Lake Michigan.

title: Fast bad food
review: The dining area & views are spectacular but the chicken tenders were microwaved & hot but nearly tasteless.

title: Among the planets!!
review: Hungry after a day at the Adler's planetorium, the cafe was the only resort. With a bit of trepidation, asked for a Margarita Pizza. What came out of the kitchen was visually nice & tasty.

title: Save your money and go elsewhere!
review: This restaurant is overrated! The food is horrible. Everything was bland and no seasoning whatsoever! The wait service is trash! The food was nothing like the photos on there Instagram account! I ordered the coconut shrimp as an appetizer and they looked like they were...prepackaged, pre-breaded artificial shrimp! They tasted like garbage and they looked worse! Unfortunately, my battery died and I couldn’t take a pic! My cousin ordered a drink and they never brought the drink but added it to the tab! So we order the burger and fries and the chicken with rice and cabbage. Lord, the fries were Cajun store brought Kroger frozen fries!!! They didn’t even defrost them, just straight out the bag into the fryer!! Disgusting!!!! Ok now let me get to the this darn Jerk chicken….just save ya money and go straight to Jerk 48 or get some  jerk seasoning and put it on a $6 roasted chicken from Walmart or your local grocery store! The rice and beans didn’t have any seasoning just rice and beans from the can! Yep I said CAN! The cabbage was mediocre at its best! As stated before, the waiter never was horrible and never refilled our water glasses, that he clearly saw us drinking, because he kept refilling the tables beside us!! Then to make matters worse, we kept getting attacked by GNATS!! Yep I said GNATS! Oh but it didn’t end there, the waiter added a tip to our receipt and recharged the card!! Save your money!! Just keep your money people and your time!More

title: Mothers day dinner
review: I went to this hyde park location it was delicious we had the curry shrimp cabbage and Caribbean wings.... they  had  great customer service we definitely be back for brunch in the coming weeks

title: That actually moved to a new location in Hyde Park area (Chgo)
review: Darn good food, Feels like you’re in the islands. ABSOLUTELY GREAT FOOD, killer flavors in every bite of food you order.

title: Horrible
review: We got seated an hour AFTER the reservation. The service was bad. The manager or owner never wore a mask nor did he maintain at least 6 feet distance while interacting with customers. The food was okay, but all the dishes were served warm.

title: Jerk Chicken Heaven
review: The area may not be the most fashionable and the interior of the place is no eye catcher, but the service and food do more than just make up for it. Rum punch was just the way we like it and our starter (Hurricane) was...very tasty too. We both picked jerk chicken for main course, and our eyes watered when we saw our plates arriving, Instead of the usual amount of two pieces ioffered in British or German restaurants, we had five succulent, perfectly seasoned chicken pieces on our plates: rice and peas were equally plentiful and extremely tasty. We liked it so much, we came for more two days later. If you like Caribbean food, this is the place to come in Chicago.More

title: Exceptional Food in a Beautiful Restaurant
review: We were at the Hyundai dealership on our way home and found this place.   All I can say is YUM!  I had the Chardonnay Salmon and it was to die for. The rice they served with it was the best rice dish I have ever...eaten.  Wines run around $6 a glass, most entrees are under $20. My husband had the red snapper escoviche.  We were there on a Wednesday night. Food came out quickly. Service is a little sketchy. Our waiter acted like he would rather be anywhere but there. I assume it is a family business and this was their son:).  Will definitely be back food was that good.More

title: Great food slow service
review: Some of the best jerk chicken I have had outside of Jamaica. Service was slow (reminded me of island life), but the food more than made up for it. Coconut conch chowder was excellent as well. Will visit again next time I am in chicago.

title: Good food, awful service
review: We had a business lunch here and the Caribbean style food was outstanding. I had a jerk chicken wrap and it was marvelous. The service was horrible. My glass had a crack in it and I had to wait forever to get it replaced. Forget...about getting napkins, forks, etc. the check took so long, that I elicited one of the other wait staff to assist. But the food was really good......More

title: Jerk Chicken Paradise
review: So I'm at a convention at the McCormick and checked Yelp for suggestions for something good and different.  14 Parish came up and their Jerk Catfish caught my eye.  I walked there from my hotel. The decor was very clean and nice.  It was a...Wednesday evening and there were only 3 tables being used.  Looking over the menu, I was torn between their sampler, the Jerk Catfish and the short ribs. I stuck with what caught my eye in the first place and chose the Jerk Catfish with cabbage, red beans and rice, and I ordered a side of the cream style cornbread. After the first bite of the Jerk chicken I was pitying all of the people with whom I walked past to get here eating overpriced hotel food.  The catfish was fork tender charred perfectly.  The cabbage was so good I would come back just for that.  I mean really? Cabbage?  YES!   The Red beans and rice was also good, but the star of the show was the Jerk Catfish.  Of course I cannot leave out the Cream Style Corn Bread. Had I not seen the dessert menu, I would have been quite satisfied with the Corn bread as being my dessert, it was so good.  On their dessert list they have Rum Raisin Sunday and Fried Beignets.  My server suggested getting the Fried Beignets ala mode in which I did.  I normally don't eat dessert but it was incredible. The beignets were delightfully crunchy on the outside and soft and moist on the inside.  With the thousands upon thousands of people attending conventions at McCormick this place should be packed with a line waiting out the door.  I can't wait to waste time at a convention so that I could eat once again at the 14 Parish.  As much as I loved the Jerk Catfish next time it will be the sampler. (and cabbage and corn bread and then the Rum Raisin Sundae)  You must go visit 14 Parish, you will thank me later.More

title: Mouth Watering Cuisine!
review: We were in Chicago attending a conference and googled great places to eat.  We ended up catching an Uber to 14 Parish. The food is exceptionally good, the service was second to none and the atmosphere was exactly what we needed after a long day...of workshops, walking and taking notes. Every dish on the menu is Fantastic!  You will not be disappointed!More

title: if you want to eat something different
review: I was there with some colleagues, for lunch break during a conference nearby. We were just in time because after us there were many people waiting for a table. We waited a bit for the food, but I guess it was because it was freshly...More

title: Close to McCormick convention centre, but make sure you can wait
review: Neat place near the convention centre (not a lot of choices nearby!). Nice clean modern decor, food is ok for me, but service is slow (even though the staff are pleasant and apologetic) as it takes over 1 hr for lunch.

title: Good food, service was a bit slow
review: I thought the food was very good, great flavor, authentic Caribbean flavors, spicy jerk.  I had the coconut curry shrimp which was great, spicier than I expected (which I liked).  The downside was that we got there at 8:15 and didn't get our food until...More

title: Nice Restaurant with good food, much with a Jerk seasoning
review: Enjoyed our business lunch over tasty, Jamaican food.  The restaurant was relatively empty over lunch but tried it anyway.  Was glad that we did! We thought the food and the service was very good.  The neighborhood is still up and coming, but would go back...More

title: Very good Jamaican restaurant!
review: We went there for lunch. The food was quite good. I can recommend their reggae burger, which was spiced with Jamaican spices and very good. A nice place to visit for a good caribbean meal.The only not so good was that there was only one...More

title: Great Mom & Pop Spot
review: Stopped by from McCormick Place after my daughter's basketball tournament. We were tired and she just wanted some pizza. Very friendly service. We ate comfortably on the patio area. Fun people watching. The pizza toppings were meaty and flavorful. Good! The lemonade was devine! I...had several refills. Being from the south, you drink some devine sweet tea. This lemonade was so perfect. Couldn't stop drinking it.More

title: Friendly
review: Fair prices, huge portions, friendly service, nice toppings but a rather strange crust (at least for me).

title: Amazing definitely worth stopping
review: Want amazing deep dish? Go here! Amazing staff, amazing service and by far the best deep dish I have had! We were just driving through to get back to Ontario and wanted somewhere we didn't have to search for parking! We didn't want to wait...the 40 minutes it would take but they ensured us it was worth it and it was! I will be stopping back everytime I drive through or goto Chicago now!More

title: Good pizza near McCormick Place
review: Stopped in for a pizza while at a conference at McCormick place recently. The food was good, worth the wait - and there was a little wait. I had the Calabrese Pizza, which was sausage, salami, and giardiniera. The service isn't anything fancy, but the...food is good and the staff are friendly.More

title: Poor Service, Unimpressive Food
review: We did not have a good experience here. Despite calling, ordering ahead, and timing our arrival based on what we were told over the phone, we ended up waiting for over an hour for our food.  Upon arriving, we ordered a salad as well and...drinks to eat while we waited.  After a half hour, we asked where our food was.  We were told it was almost ready.  Ten minutes later, we were back at the counter to be told our pizza was almost done - we would be getting our salad (a forty minute salad?) after the pizzas were out.  Ten minutes later, still no food.  No drinks, either.  We had to ask for those.  Our salad finally arrived, sans plates or silverware.  We had to visit the counter to get these.  At long last, an hour and thirty minutes after ordering over the phone, after being told it would be a forty minute wait for the pizza, it arrived.  What had been termed Chicago-style pizza arrived in boxes.  We brought it back to the hotel room to finally eat.  This was not Chicago style pizza.  I'm not sure what style to call it, but Chicago style is not a good descriptor.  This was thick, cheesy, it tasted like pizza.  It didn't taste like good pizza.  What was bizarre was the crispy exterior crust, like pilot crackers.  As someone who routinely eats the discarded crust of my wife, I found this crust to be so lacking in decent texture and flavor I couldn't eat it.  It was a very shallow dished pizza overall, and adequate.  But to wait as long as we had to, it had to be more than adequate.  We ate half of each pie and didn't finish the rest.  We didn't save it for later.  It's the next day, I'm feeling like I could use a snack, and if we'd saved the leftovers, I would skip them.  The second star is solely for Linda who comped us the cost of one pie for our wait.  She seemed to have a great desire to fix things for us and knew what she was doing - sadly, it wasn't enough to overcome the poor pizza, poor overall service, lackluster salad, and disappointing vacation meal.More

title: Very good and very attentive server
review: Came here with my coworkers due to the location we where working  and had the Italian beef with peppers with a side of pasta salad and i was surprised at how delicious the food was mmmmmmmm my coworkers agreed as well and the young girl...working wad so friendly and helpful  and super attentive  cant wait to go back mmmmmmmMore

title: food was late but great
review: we called ahead for our deep-dish pizza around lunch time because we knew these take time to bake. however, it appears the order was just processed about 10 mins after we got there--the staff was very apologetic stating they had several take outs that went...in ahead of our order--we waited for almost an hour despite calling 30 minutes ahead--I had a slice, and had to run off to a meeting, my son ate more leisurely--we were both given our choice of desserts for free because of the delay. All in all turned out well, as the Tiramisu was fantastic!More

title: Delicious Deep Dish!
review: I spoke to Linda a couple times on the phone about accommodating our group as we were there for Younique convention.  This was very close to McCormick Center and just what we wanted, a little local pizza place with deep dish.  I must say, staff...was very friendly, service was great, and pizza was DELICIOUS!!!!!  5 of us got an XL deep dish pepporini and each only needed 1 piece.More

title: Gross
review: Not what I expected. Ordered 2 slices because a deep dish would be a 30 minute wait. Pizza was too thick, greasy, and no flavor. Yuck. Go elsewhere.

title: Get the double dough crust!
review: We were looking for someone who would deliver to our hotel at 11:30pm.  They were able to help us out and had delicious pizza. The double dough crust was not too thick or too thin. The medium was more than enough for 3 of us....The marinara sauce was very good too with the bread sticks.  I woke up the next day wishing we had more pizza for breakfast!  :)More

title: Not a good example of Chicago deep dish
review: Weren't very accomendating.  Only single topping deep dish for personal size was a bit disappointing.  We got a small veggie.  I was a bit regretful when I noticed everyone working was speaking spanish.  Nothing really Itailian about the place outside posters.  When we finally got...the pizza it had enough liquid dripping from it to qualify as a large drink.  Somehow the onion and green peppera remained raw and cold.  My wife's first experience with deep dish was supppsed to be great.  Too bad.  Also plastic cutlery is all they had.  We both ate bits of our forks before we noticed they were broke.  Personally I say avoid the place.  The lady at the register looked like we were bothering her so obviously she wants you to avoid the place too.More

title: Great deep pizza
review: Great deep pizza, wings. Place is small but just be conscious that portions are huge. Large pizza is enough for 5-6 persons. Friendly service.

title: Great Food, Poor Service
review: We ordered a pizza and grilled squid. Both were excellent! We also got treated to a duo that played guitar and mandolin, singing Italian songs. The bummer was that the service was poor and the TV was turned on (very loud) after the musicians left.

title: Nice homey little place
review: Having never tried deep dish pizza before we dropped in here because it was just around the corner from the site of Chess Records.  Have to say that I don't love it, I'm more of a thin crust type,  but the quality of this one...was very nice, and you could not have been served by a sweeter lady.More

title: Chicago style pizza
review: The pizza was excellent. The garlic bread was small, not worth the price. The delivery wait was ridiculous. The driver called when he was on the way & when we didn't answer he went to another delivery instead. When he came back he finally went...inside to have the desk call up to our room. He really should have done that the 1st time.More

title: Great Mom & Pop Spot
review: Stopped by from McCormick Place after my daughter's basketball tournament. We were tired and she just wanted some pizza. Very friendly service. We ate comfortably on the patio area. Fun people watching. The pizza toppings were meaty and flavorful. Good! The lemonade was devine! I...had several refills. Being from the south, you drink some devine sweet tea. This lemonade was so perfect. Couldn't stop drinking it.More

title: Friendly
review: Fair prices, huge portions, friendly service, nice toppings but a rather strange crust (at least for me).

review: Want amazing deep dish? Go here! Amazing staff, amazing service and by far the best deep dish I have had! He really should have done that the 1st time.More

title: Our first time with Deep Dish.
review: While hearing all the "wows" about Chicago Deep Dish from friends we just had to try some.  We weren't disappointed.  This quaint little restaurant is just a few blocks from the Hyatt and offered superb service and a very friendly atmosphere. While it takes a...More

title: Good Chicago Pizza and good price
review: Let's start this review with the fact that it is 92 degrees outside and hotter inside restaurant which had no air conditioning.  I was Immediately disappointed since I was not be able to sit here and enjoy the local atmosphere.  If you gauge good food...More

title: Small pizza-big!
review: The pizza. was worth the money spent . It was huge ! You just order  and sit on the table and they bring it to you .

title: Completely disappointed
review: Waited 20 minutes for burnt pizza. Usually dive pizza joints are the best. This one is just a dive. Service is non-existent.

title: The best pizza shop we stopped at in Chicago!
review: The foccia primavera my partner had was filled with delicious ingredients and was steaming with freshness the minute the sandwich was split in half. You could have photographed the sandwich and put it on a billboard, it was that well prepared.   Their pizza is amazing...More

title: Great.
review: First "Chicago Style" pizza for us. Fries and sausage and cheese and peppers were also great. We were going to Tommy Guns and got there early. It was very cold and it was our first night ever in Chicago. We saw this place and went...More

title: Pizzeria Brandi
review: Great Thin Crust Pizza, we usually order take out, pizza very good we have our timing down to the point where it's piping hot and great for take home.   they also sell pizza by the slice

title: good for quick meal
review: When you have a wonderful museum you just need something quick to keep going. You don't want a great restaurant and waste your time when you have so much to see and learn. The bistro is good.

title: Snacks, beverages, entrees and desserts right next to Maxim, the Titanosaur
review: This cafe has everything you want for lunch, brunch or a snack. We stopped for a quick beverage and snack before spending a full day at the Field Museum. Purchase a soda and get free refills during the day. We returned about 1pm as we...moved between exhibits. I had the garbanzo bean curry which is served over rice. My husband had the beef curry which he reported as very good. I think the rice was jasmine, but I may be mistaken about that. Ample seating at small tables. Maybe it was because we were there early, but I encountered only friendly staff. Maybe we were there on a day when rude staff had the day off. They were very busy at lunch time, trying to serve everyone quickly. It was fun to look at the large exhibits in the main lobby while dining. Look up and see the flying Pteranodons over your head.More

title: On the main floor near the front entrance, good coffee and small bites for a quick lunch.
review: Of course while at the Field Museum one should stop in here at the Bistro. Their coffee is awesome and have a very wide choice of things to eat, from light snacks to sandwiches to great soups and beverages. We entered and just wanted coffee,...but there was a long line. While standing by the cashier (in line) I said to her that we just wanted coffee. She said, "there is no line, I can help you right now". So we did, got our coffee and a table. Then after noticing the huge selection of items, I went to the spot where they had soup. This lady was sort of rude and irritated with me. For example, I said, "Pasta Fagioli please". She replied, "yes that's a soup!" So I said, "yes, I know give me two small bowls of it". She filled the small containers and slapped them on top of the counter without even breaking her stern gaze at me. I suppose she has to deal with a lot of dummies, so I don't fault her. I went to the cashier and paid, no line. Yes, a bit expensive but normal pricing for a museum. Nice seating for people watching as they come and go.More

title: Rude staff terrible food
review: We paid over $50 for my husband myself and our 6 year old to eat. The staff were rude and un helpful and the $10.50 burgers were worse than highschool cafeteria food. Mcdonalds burgers are fresher. I got a cup of broccoli cheese soup that...was good but the lady that was serving was probably the most frigid and angry human being I have ever come in contact with. There was a hot dog stand outside the shedd aquarium that we wished we would have gone to instead. Save your money it isnt worth it.More

title: Tasty Lunch Options
review: The Field Bistro is filled with lots of soup, salad, and sandwich options that fit just about every dietary need.

title: A Quick Snack
review: We had the Chicken Noodle Soup and it was delicious.  It filled the hole and warmed us up to continue exploring the museum.

title: Overpriced and not very good
review: This restaurant is located inside The Field Museum. I paid $10.25 for a cheeseburger. The bun was stale and the meat patty was tiny with a dried out slice of cheese on it. I realize that being inside the museum results in a ridiculous price...increase, but I expected at least a passable burger. McDonald's makes a better cheeseburger for half that price.  The fries were good.  I paid over $3 for a small fountain beverage, but at least there were refills all day. We saved our cups and came back for a refill later in the day so we could sit and rest our legs. No lids or straws available.  The staff, while not exactly rude, were not very helpful. Also, the bistro really needs more seating, especially during lunch. We had to wander around with our hot food until we found somewhere to sit and eat it.More

title: Good lunch
review: This cafe is on the ground floor.  Sunny room, food was fresh and hot, pizza, and sandwiches.  There was a vegetarian selection.

title: Have a Pseudo Sue in the home of Sue
review: We had a quick bite, sandwiches are pre-made, but still fresh and sourced from regional producers.  I would call it, upscale fast food.  We thought it was perfect for what we were looking for.  The best part, is that they carry Toppling Goliath beer.  This...is one of the best beer makers in the States and one of their flagship beers was named after the famous T-rex Sue.  Don't for get to have one while you visit the Field Museum.More

title: Eat beforehand, pricey and not made to order
review: I was invited to the museum and treated to lunch. I ordered a Ruben sandwich and asked for it made to order. The preparation clerk refused and claimed she just made it and that's how it is. I forgot that it has sour kraut and...thousand island dressing. After eating it those two ingredients caused my stomach to rumble. I had a coffee and my host had soup. The tab was about $25 which I felt was high.More

title: Busy, food is OK
review: We wanted to have a lunch break, so we tried the Field Bistro. I had a Reuben, which was basically OK, but had been cooked too long. The Southwestern Salad was interesting. I also had a Tooth and Claw Beer, specially brewed for the Feld....which was excellent. The Field is into recycling, diners are encouraged to dispose of the waste into the appropriate receptacle.More

title: Expensiv
review: Very expensive, and not tasty (fresh) for waht you get (koffie and a bun). I would recommend using outside things.

title: Just ok
review: I tried the Bistro because the cafe area was full of summer camp kids and was a bit loud. :)  I had a Ruben and  fries, at the early end of lunchtime.  They were just ok.  Nothing worth the $15 I just paid.  I'd try...something else if I go back.More

title: Nice place to take a break
review: We stopped here for coffee which was great. The staff was very nice. The menu was limited but had enough variety for everyone. They offered beer and wine. It was a quiet place to stop for a few minutes.

title: High prices marginal quality
review: We use to LOVE eating lunch in this tucked away corner of the museum. But no more--  Very poor service and food quality is marginal at best. I ordered a hamburger, got a very dry turkey burger on a stale bun. My husband's tacos were...not much better. Quality in both the areas of service and food has slipped since it changed to The Field Bistro.More

title: good for quick meal
review: When you have a wonderful museum you just need something quick to keep going. You don't want a great restaurant and waste your time when you have so much to see and learn. The bistro is good.
