Their coffee is awesome and have a very wide choice of things to eat, from light snacks to sandwiches to great soups and beverages. We entered and just wanted coffee,...but there was a long line. While standing by the cashier (in line) I said to her that we just wanted coffee. She said, "there is no line, I can help you right now". So we did, got our coffee and a table. Then after noticing the huge selection of items, I went to the spot where they had soup. This lady was sort of rude and irritated with me. For example, I said, "Pasta Fagioli please". She replied, "yes that's a soup!" So I said, "yes, I know give me two small bowls of it". She filled the small containers and slapped them on top of the counter without even breaking her stern gaze at me. I suppose she has to deal with a lot of dummies, so I don't fault her. I went to the cashier and paid, no line. Yes, a bit expensive but normal pricing for a museum. Nice seating for people watching as they come and go.More

title: Rude staff terrible food
review: We paid over $50 for my husband myself and our 6 year old to eat. The staff were rude and un helpful and the $10.50 burgers were worse than highschool cafeteria food. Mcdonalds burgers are fresher. I got a cup of broccoli cheese soup that...was good but the lady that was serving was probably the most frigid and angry human being I have ever come in contact with. There was a hot dog stand outside the shedd aquarium that we wished we would have gone to instead. Save your money it isnt worth it.More

title: Tasty Lunch Options
review: The Field Bistro is filled with lots of soup, salad, and sandwich options that fit just about every dietary need.

title: A Quick Snack
review: We had the Chicken Noodle Soup and it was delicious.  It filled the hole and warmed us up to continue exploring the museum.

title: Overpriced and not very good
review: This restaurant is located inside The Field Museum. I paid $10.25 for a cheeseburger. The bun was stale and the meat patty was tiny with a dried out slice of cheese on it. I realize that being inside the museum results in a ridiculous price...increase, but I expected at least a passable burger. McDonald's makes a better cheeseburger for half that price.  The fries were good.  I paid over $3 for a small fountain beverage, but at least there were refills all day. We saved our cups and came back for a refill later in the day so we could sit and rest our legs. No lids or straws available.  The staff, while not exactly rude, were not very helpful. Also, the bistro really needs more seating, especially during lunch. We had to wander around with our hot food until we found somewhere to sit and eat it.More

title: Good lunch
review: This cafe is on the ground floor.  Sunny room, food was fresh and hot, pizza, and sandwiches.  There was a vegetarian selection.

title: Have a Pseudo Sue in the home of Sue
review: We had a quick bite, sandwiches are pre-made, but still fresh and sourced from regional producers.  I would call it, upscale fast food.  We thought it was perfect for what we were looking for.  The best part, is that they carry Toppling Goliath beer.  This...is one of the best beer makers in the States and one of their flagship beers was named after the famous T-rex Sue.  Don't for get to have one while you visit the Field Museum.More

title: Eat beforehand, pricey and not made to order
review: I was invited to the museum and treated to lunch. I ordered a Ruben sandwich and asked for it made to order. The preparation clerk refused and claimed she just made it and that's how it is. I forgot that it has sour kraut and...thousand island dressing. After eating it those two ingredients caused my stomach to rumble. I had a coffee and my host had soup. The tab was about $25 which I felt was high.More

title: Busy, food is OK
review: We wanted to have a lunch break, so we tried the Field Bistro. I had a Reuben, which was basically OK, but had been cooked too long. The Southwestern Salad was interesting. I also had a Tooth and Claw Beer, specially brewed for the Feld....which was excellent. The Field is into recycling, diners are encouraged to dispose of the waste into the appropriate receptacle.More

title: Expensiv
review: Very expensive, and not tasty (fresh) for waht you get (koffie and a bun). I would recommend using outside things.

title: Just ok
review: I tried the Bistro because the cafe area was full of summer camp kids and was a bit loud. :)  I had a Ruben and  fries, at the early end of lunchtime.  They were just ok.  Nothing worth the $15 I just paid.  I'd try...something else if I go back.More

title: Nice place to take a break
review: We stopped here for coffee which was great. The staff was very nice. The menu was limited but had enough variety for everyone. They offered beer and wine. It was a quiet place to stop for a few minutes.

title: High prices marginal quality
review: We use to LOVE eating lunch in this tucked away corner of the museum. But no more--  Very poor service and food quality is marginal at best. I ordered a hamburger, got a very dry turkey burger on a stale bun. My husband's tacos were...not much better. Quality in both the areas of service and food has slipped since it changed to The Field Bistro.More

title: Poor Service
review: We purchased regular and decaff coffee along with a few other items.  After payment, we discovered both regular and decaff coffee  self-service urns were empty.  There was a 5 minute delay for the regular coffee to be refilled.  We waited 10 minutes for decaff coffee....More

title: Remember it's just a place to grab a bite
review: Way above average for what it is. I mean these places inside an institution are never as good as an independent restaurant, food was good, service was quick, lines moved at a good pace, pretty pricey.

title: Nice place to stop for a quick bite
review: The mac-n-cheese was delicious!  Was disappointed that a bottle of water cost $4.  There is bar in the back for those wanting a cold beer, etc.  This bistro is located right near Sue so it was cool to sit right near her.

title: Average
review: We found two restaurants at the Field Museum and decided to try this one, located on the main level.  We found about 6 sandwich options including burgers, pulled pork, grilled cheese, a veggie sandwich and a few others.  We tried two of them: decent flavors....More

title: Will never return
review: The Field Museum's restaurant/cafe used to be great - fresh food, wide selection for taste and food restrictions, and relatively inexpensive given the quality of what you got. It is now absolutely terrible- it has the look and feel of a health food store, but...More

title: Limited Selection
review: Food overpriced with a limited selection. The fries were pretty good.  They need more staff manning the areas to pay for food.  By the time you go through the long lines to pay for food, your food is cold.

title: Average museum food
review: Overpriced, fairly mediocre food.  Pretty much what you'd expect in most museum cafes.  Only real advantage is it isn't anywhere near as crowded as the explorer cafe on the lower level, and costs about the same.

title: Differing opinions
review: I am taking my husband's opinion, which would be 1 star, and my own, which would be 5, and averaging them out. I had the tomato caprese panino, which was amazing. Fries were good, hot and crispy. Marbled cheesecake was delicious, very rich so I...More

title: Good food, museum or not: get Caprese sandwich
review: Decent food options, especially for a museum. My partner got a salad (ok). I got a caprese sandwich (grown up grilled cheese with fresh tomato and spinach). That was quite good. And a place that has draft beer in the back. The Pseudo-Sue, brewed for...More

title: High-Quality Museum Cafeteria
review: Food options in museums are either very overpriced or not very healthy, but this grab-a-tray operation inside The Field Museum is surprisingly affordable and has some nice variety in its menu (like vegan sausage and barbecue tempeh, for vegetarians like me). Since the museum itself...More

title: Pricey but Convenient
review: Let's call this what it is... Decent food that's overpriced but very convenient. My husband had a salad he really liked and was filling. I had a good sandwich and our son had a burger that he said was good. It is pricy, but it's...More

title: Beer!!!!
review: Dinosaur themed named craft beer. Food was fine. Just good to see beer after a morning keeping up with kids.

title: Decent food but fairly expensive.
review: My girlfriend ordered a Cesar salad which was large and had a nice dressing. I ordered a grinder which was loaded with meat and flavorful. The prices were a bit steep for what it was.

title: Overpriced
review: Meat was dry and lacked flavor but the bun was soft.  Way way overpriced for what was gotten. Liquor is available. Think hospital cafeteria-which is kind of badmouthing hospitals.

title: Suprisingly good
review: Had a turkey panini sandwich.  I thought the price was a little high but sandwich was fresh and tasty.

title: Much needed break at the Field Bistro
review: After a morning walking around the museum a break and more importantly a sit down was needed. Pleasing to see lovely fresh fruit and vegetables as lunch option.

title: Nice Cafe For A Museum
review: We had been to this cafe previously and noted it had been updated. The food seemed fresh. There's a lot of seating and can become crowded, but the turnover is fast. It was a pleasant lunch. There's an Explorer Cafe in the lower level we...More

title: Reasonable prices, and clean
review: We had the museum fare food, but the pulled pork sandwiches with sauce were great. The prices were very reasonable and staff very friendly and kept the tables cleared. It is a great place to relax and let the others enjoy.

title: Delicious. A bit unfriendly.
review: The food was really good! We expected airport prices and were pleasantly surprised by reasonable prices. The people serving the food seemed annoyed that we interrupted their conversation. This is not a cheap outing! My thought was, "If you work in this amazing place and...More

title: Time to sit for a minute
review: This is a nice place to stop while visiting the Field Museum.  Affordable food and drink and seating.

title: Beer
review: A very nice bistro to have a rest while you do the museum. Was impressed that they have craft beer to sample and drink.

title: Great Place to take Time Out for Lunch
review: Went to the Field Museum to see several exhibits. Checked out places for lunch and the Bistro Cafe was suggested. They do have several options for eating.We went to the Bistro and had lunch. I had a salad and soup and my wife had a...More

title: Great food!
review: Loved the chowder made of corn and bacon.  Fries are good and so are the burgers.  The lines are crazy and I advise you have one person in your party find a table and save it.  Great to be able to eat here as there...More

title: Handy
review: We just stayed with the standard items, burgers and fries.  They were fine.  Does get busy but keep looking and you will find a table and there were 9 of us.

title: Terrific asparagus soup and eco friendly ethos
review: Phenomenal Asparagus soup, all dishes, napkins, etc. eco-friendly (as disposable stuff can be...)! Awesome.

title: Great place to have food at the Field Museum, Chicago
review: A great place to have lunch, while you enjoy the field museum.   The Turkey Burger is very good and a must try. The bistro offers quick service so you don't have to miss out on your shows and exhibitions

title: 2nd time and still good
review: I visited the bistro a second time. Last year I stopped in for an espresso. This year I had an espresso and the asparagus and truffle soup in a bread bowl. I was very impressed with the quality and service.

title: What a great surprise
review: Shredded chicken Caesar Salad in a bowl big enough for sharing. It quite possibly was the best salad I've ever eaten, and fantastic surroundings - gigantic elephants & Sue, the T-Rex.

title: Love the soup in a bread bowl
review: Everytime I visit the Field Museum I have lunch at the Bistro. And my go to order item is the soup in a bread bowl. Although the last time we went the soup choices were rather limited, we still enjoyed our lunch.

title: An unmitigated disaster
review: The layout of the cafeteria is incomprehensible.  People standing around in the way not knowing what they want.  I just wanted to buy a soda but this was not possible because I could not find the cups for the soda fountain and the line to...More

title: Much needed break at the Field Bistro
review: After a morning walking around the museum a break and more importantly a sit down was needed. Pleasing to see lovely fresh fruit and vegetables as lunch option.

title: Nice Cafe For A Museum
review: We had been to this cafe previously and noted it had been updated. The food seemed fresh. There's a lot of seating and can become crowded, but the turnover is fast. It was a pleasant lunch. There's an Explorer Cafe in the lower level we...More

title: Reasonable prices, and clean
review: We had the museum fare food, but the pulled pork sandwiches with sauce were great. The prices were very reasonable and staff very friendly and kept the tables cleared. It is a great place to relax and let the others enjoy.

title: Delicious. A bit unfriendly.
review: The food was really good! We expected airport prices and were pleasantly surprised by reasonable prices. The people serving the food seemed annoyed that we interrupted their conversation. This is not a cheap outing! My thought was, "If you work in this amazing place and...More

title: Time to sit for a minute
review: This is a nice place to stop while visiting the Field Museum.  Affordable food and drink and seating.

title: Beer
review: A very nice bistro to have a rest while you do the museum. Was impressed that they have craft beer to sample and drink.

title: Great Place to take Time Out for Lunch
review: Went to the Field Museum to see several exhibits. Checked out places for lunch and the Bistro Cafe was suggested. They do have several options for eating.We went to the Bistro and had lunch. I had a salad and soup and my wife had a...More

review: Loved the chowder made of corn and bacon.  Fries are good and so are the burgers.  The lines are crazy and I advise you have one person in your party find a table and save it.  Great to be able to eat here as there...More

review: We just stayed with the standard items, burgers and fries.  They were fine.  Does get busy but keep looking and you will find a table and there were 9 of us.

title: Terrific asparagus soup and eco friendly ethos
review: Phenomenal Asparagus soup, all dishes, napkins, etc. eco-friendly (as disposable stuff can be...)! Awesome.

title: Great place to have food at the Field Museum, Chicago
review: A great place to have lunch, while you enjoy the field museum.   The Turkey Burger is very good and a must try. The bistro offers quick service so you don't have to miss out on your shows and exhibitions

title: 2nd time and still good
review: I visited the bistro a second time. Last year I stopped in for an espresso. This year I had an espresso and the asparagus and truffle soup in a bread bowl. I was very impressed with the quality and service.

title: What a great surprise
review: Shredded chicken Caesar Salad in a bowl big enough for sharing. It quite possibly was the best salad I've ever eaten, and fantastic surroundings - gigantic elephants & Sue, the T-Rex.

title: Love the soup in a bread bowl
review: Everytime I visit the Field Museum I have lunch at the Bistro. And my go to order item is the soup in a bread bowl. Although the last time we went the soup choices were rather limited, we still enjoyed our lunch.

title: An unmitigated disaster
review: The layout of the cafeteria is incomprehensible.  People standing around in the way not knowing what they want.  I just wanted to buy a soda but this was not possible because I could not find the cups for the soda fountain and the line to...More

title: fast, good food
review: This cafeteria serves a lot of individuals and families in a fairly short time while they are taking a break from numerous venues in the museum.  And most people are in a hurry to get back to the museum because there is so much to...More

title: Under Cooked!
review: Spent a great day at the museum, wonderful attraction!  Went to the Bistro for lunch and had the Sesame Chicken.  Chicken was coated with a mushy doughy substance and the fried rice was under-cooked, very crunchy.  Tossed it  out.  Ordered the soup which was great!...More

title: I know, you for the exhibits not the food, but....
review: Yuck.   It was clean, tables were comfortable, people were friendly. Food and Price was gross and way to expensive.  Best thing about it was every bowl, plate, fork and cup was recyclable. But we paid $40+ for two people to eat food that was really...More

title: So So
review: Remember, you are here for the exhibits, not for the food.  With that said, I'd like to see some of these kinds of places really up their food service game.  Make the food part of the attraction.

title: Better than most
review: Considering you are stuck in a museum for the day and need a snack break, this bistro was decent.  The food was not bad and the prices were better than I expected.  They do serve wine and beer which was a nice surprise.  I just...More

title: Quick service, but eat early
review: The Field Museum is truly a not to be missed cultural experience in downtown Chicago. However, the dining options are very limited.  I had a hard time rating The Field Bistro because my dining choice was good ( build your own salad) compared to what...More

title: Plan for a full day
review: There is so much to see and explore. We bought the city pass (awesome value!) this was our first stop. Was hoping to do 2-3 stops per day. Don't do that! Field museum needs a full day to itself. We had to leave before completing...More

title: Yum
review: I expected this place to be ridiculously expensive but it wasn't all that bad... the food was good, lots of places to sit (at least for an early lunch), well designed room with a timeline of the museum on the wall and very clearly labelled...More

title: Pretty good food actually...
review: This place has a really good selection for a museum cafe.  We enjoyed our food and the view from the seating area.  It's a little pricey, but not too bad.  I would definitely recommend visiting when you're at the museum.

title: Great place to take a break while visiting the museum
review: Great service, good food selections and very convenient. Try to grab a table by the window for breathtaking views.

title: Not bad for a museum cafe
review: Looking for a place to unwind after a day of museums, I decided to grab a pop, for the caffeine to take the edge off of a headache, and a cookie. The staff here was nice. There was a large selection of local and national...More

title: Real good chow
review: Pleasant area with good variety of food not too outrageously priced. We had an EXCELLENT and unusual white bean and sausage soup.

title: Horrible
review: Did not have a good experience - this Aramark run café has inflated prices and horrible food.  Would not return.

title: Nice selection
review: After a few hours of walking the museum this was a great break with reasonable prices for a restaurant in the museum.  I had a great chicken tortilla soup.

title: Good Food, Fair Price, Great Place
review: The Field Museum is a world class place. To find such a nice eatery inside at fair prices was a true delight..such rare things make one appreciate Chicago for being a wonderful friendly vistor city!

title: good food, pricing a little inflated. Think Airport but tastes better.
review: I had the panini which was delicious but small and two bottled sodas that came up to over 20.00. Nice quiet atmosphere, great way to unwind after spending the day at the museum. Friendly staff that helped me take my tray to the table. Excellent...More

title: All kinds of bistro food....even wine and beer
review: I stopped by for an espresso. Had it made in the back at the bar. Good quality. The back room has a great view of the city.

title: Food court stuff....
review: I did not want to try the pizza, because I did not want to be fattened up, as they say before they bring you to market.... actually the slaughterhouse before they bring you to the market..... so, I had a SALAD and it was just...like they said it would be.... a salad, fresh and crisp.  $12.50.More

title: Really Really Good
review: Wow, very good pizza.  Asked for light sauce nailed it.  Asked for certain ingredients, nailed it.  Delivery nailed it.  Really Really good job!

title: The best place to go if you are at McCormick Place.....
review: McCormick Place can be largely overwhelming.  There is no reason to leave the property...go to Connie's for lunch!  They have great salad selections, soup of the day, chili, sandwiches, and outstanding pizza.  Something for everyone!

title: mediocre at best.
review: The advantage this place has is that it is one of only a few restaurants in the McCormick Place. In the city of Chicago this pizza doesnt begin to measure up.  Friendly staff.  Only would return if really hungry and didnt want to leave the...convention center and didnt want McDs.More

title: Great pizza for a convention center
review: Our company uses Connie's for an employee lunch during a trade show at McCormick Place.  We call the order in ahead of time and then pick it up to take to our booth.  They are friendly and have always been on time.  The deep dish...pizza is very good considering it comes from a convention center.More

title: Lunch after the morning session of the Lions Intl. Convention
review: Busy place because of the Lions gathering.  I had Thick Crust Pizza with sausage and cheese.  My wife had Thin Crust Pepperoni Pizza.  All tasted great, but it is pricey for what you get.

title: Real Chicago Pizza
review: Chicago is known as the place for fine pizza.  A rehearsal dinner at a pizza place sounded a little strange, but this idea quickly changed when we arrived.  There was a wide variety of pizza offered, as well as an excellent salad and several pasta...dishes.  I found the pizza to be among the best I've tasted.  I can't comment on what it might be like in the regular dining room, but in the banquet room the staff was efficient and friendly.More

title: Good pizza, nice casual atmosphere
review: Connie's had a very good pizza, and was a nice environment for the business or family visitor.  Beer and wine list was also good.

title: A Nice Deep Dish
review: Good deep dish. Not the best but pretty YUMMY. Decent service and about as quick as a deep dish can get.

title: A Nice Evening Out
review: I enjoyed an amazing evening at Connies Pizza on Archer in Chicago , the service was great, good was excellent I had the loaded fries for appetizer which were great, and the spinach artichoke dip, which were not so great, I did not care for...the bread they give you, but the pizza was delicious as usually, however the atmosphere was nice and calm, and our waitress was phenomenal . I would visit here again.More

title: Pretty decent sandwiches for "fast food"
review: We ate lunch here because it seemed to look better than some of the other fast food restaurants inside the McCormick Place convention center. It turned out to be OK but not great. The Cuban sandwich was filling, if not spectacular. Service was pretty quick,...More

title: Ok...
review: IMO it was an average pizza, nothing special as others that I tried in the wind city, still if I'd be again in the McCormick place I'd give it another go

title: Must Get!
review: Very very good food, if it wasn't so far away to get to I would have gone there again.  Amazing food.

title: Great Pizza by the slice
review: This was a great place to eat while working at the McCormick Center. Food is great and staff is friendly

title: Great food and ambiance!
review: We always try a Chicago style pizza when in Chicago.  We were a little nervous about Connie's at first because we had never heard of it, but our friends who were with us said it was great.  Well, it was!  The food, the staff, the...More

title: Great Pizza
review: liked everything, always have what we want, always clean and the wait is never very long. I felt the prices were reasonable for the area it was in

title: Pizza nomnomnom
review: The staff at Connie's know how to deal with convention crowds. They have 2 lines -- one for the full menu and an express line for just pizza and salad. An employee stands out front and directs you the appropriate line. Finding seating can be...More

title: Good choice for eating inside McCormick’s Place
review: My wife and I had lunch here while attending a trade show at McCormick Place. She ordered their Italian Beef sandwich, which she really enjoyed.  I had their Italian Sausage sandwich that was quite good. This is a large restaurant with many tables on their...More

title: Great Spot, Location, Atmosphere, Prices, Pool, and Popcorn
review: My daughter and I wanted a spot like this near Union Station to kill two hours before going home. We didn't want trendy and snobby, we wanted Wabash Tap. It's a great location off of Roosevelt and Wabash. They have a great selection, not huge,...but good beer on tap. Popcorn was excellent and free. Pool tables, dart boards and lots of TVs. Owner was very friendly. We will return. Must be a blast on Bears Gameday.More

title: Fun dive bar!
review: We love this place! Nothing fancy for sure. But it's a fun place to have a drink, play darts, pool, watch a game, etc.

title: Great Service and Popcorn
review: The bartender was very nice and made a great Captain and Diet! They have free popcorn which was very fresh. Not gonna lie wasn't expecting that as some free popcorn is usually stale buy 10 at night. As some other reviews state it's a hole...in the wall but it's a very good hole in the wall.More

title: a hole in the wall dive bar
review: this is definitely a hole in the wall dive bar. beware, the homeless like to hang around there late night, most will leave you alone, but just be careful. further down the street, you can find some sport bars and bar and grills. the place...just doesn't seem cleanMore

title: NICE PLACE FOR A HANGOUT
review: Nice place for a chilled beer. Laid back relaxing experience with friendly staff. Reasonably priced for its location.

title: Great atmosphere, Great service!!
review: The staff was friendly and quick, a great mixture of patrons with a laid back feel.Great location near soldiers field.

title: great bar to hang out during events in downtown Chicago
review: Cool bar to hang out while in town for events in grant park and bears games.  Clean bathrooms good food and great TVs. They play cool music with access to touch tunes jukebox.  Great beer selection and generous pour that's moderately priced.  Daytime and evening...bartenders are cool.  Great place to get away from over priced watered down drinks and crowds.  Plenty seats at the bar and they have tables for groups and a pool table.  Great nieghboorhood local chicago vibe.More

title: Best Neighborhood Tavern in the S Loop!
review: If you are looking for a cold beer and a realxed atmosphere with surprising good bar food this is your stop.  Andy and Mary are great bartenders and this place is a favorite spot for locals.

title: bloomin marvellous
review: this was our second stay in Chicago and we were lucky enough to be staying just around the corner again from this great local bar. Lot's of awesome beers on tap, the staff are friendly. The burgers are decent too  The one thing that annoys...me slightly is the music is always a tad too loud for me, but I suppose I can man up next time and wear ear plugs instead!   We all miss the Wabash Tap though, hopefully one day we'll be back.   ''you only get what you give''More

title: Great Pub
review: Really liked it in here.  Not much more to say - nice friendly pub, with good food, good drink and some popcorn for good measure.

title: Local Neighborhood Bar
review: Have had drinks here a couple of times, but never ate here.  Great place to sit and have a drink and watch the game.

title: Nice for a dive
review: They have popcorn, first of all. That's a dive lovers dream. It's a decent sized place with plenty of seating and quite a few tvs. Assuming its a good spot before, during and after a Bears game since its not terribly far from Soldier Field.

title: A Dive-Lovers Dive!
review: Go Before Bears games for a great atmosphere! Cheap, fun, awesome!

title: What a fun place!
review: Wabash Tap looks odd from the outside so I was afraid to go in there for a long time.  Then one of my friends invited me to grab a drink with him there...and it was great!  Great drinks and service.  I've always had a fun...More

title: Beach burrito
review: Good burritos, one steak and the other pork.  Filled with rice, beans, etc.  Flavorful salsas to put on top.  Ample portion, fair price around $11.  Good choice for a picnic near Shedd and the beach.  Tacos look like a good choice also, $4.  Fast and...friendly service.More

title: Good food reasonably priced
review: We were on a Segway tour that stopped here for snacks/bathrooms. We got the Chicago dog for $4 and the carne street taco for $4. Both of these were very good. canned soda is $2. Bottled soda and water is $4. Our friends got the...cheesy fries and pizza puff. They said both were good.More

title: Northerly Island or the 12th st beach!!!
review: We arrived at northerly island for a concert with the intent to walk a bit and take in the sights. We stopped at Del Campo's for a snack and a margarita. Friendly service and very good nachos and tacos.

title: Tasty Tacos; Generous Portions; Friendly Service
review: Our cruise boat was docked at Burnham Harbor for a couple days, and I walked to Del Campo Tacos for "something different" (as opposed to eating on the boat). I didn't notice the "2 Tacos and a soda can" special, but I enjoyed the 2...Asada Tacos and the bottle of orange drink. The tacos were hot (temperature); the amount of meat and fillings were nice; the sauce was very tasty, and the staff (owners) were very friendly. I read and disagree with some of the poor ratings; this is a nice place along the beach for some casual food. You should try it!More

title: Hard to find BUT NOT to be missed
review: It's tough to find a place to eat EAST of LAke Shore Drive and south of Navy pier- in fact- it's impossible unless you call the museums cafeterias a place to eat. THIS PLACE is the exception! Typical Mexican fare but prepared a notch above...what you might expect. We love the tortas but the tacos are pretty tasty as well. Not bad for such a prime piece of real estate! AND..??? There's a beach! A short Divvy ride from anywhere on the museum campus- we like to take our out of town guests on the short ferry ride from Navy Pier to the museum campus- it's a couple-of-block hike but great views along the way- or Divvy it! Just south of the Adler Planetarium along the Lake...More

title: Mediocre overpriced food, violent owner, surly customer service
review: This place used to be great, but is run by the laziest, rudest family you've ever encountered. They kept acting like we were inconveniencing them by eating there even though we were friendly and tipped well, and they've ended table service apparently permanently so in...order to sit in the seating area and eat you have to make a giant detour to walk around to the front and stand in line for each drink or food item. When we left the beach, after having spent about $100 at this taco place, we asked for a little bag to store some sea glass in, and they acted like we were the most annoying people in the world. When I apologized to them for interrupting their picnic to serve us, the owner threatened me with a walking stick. These people are scum. After I posted a Facebook review to this effect, the owner responded claiming my wife, who was served water only at the restaurant and had zero alcohol at all today, was drunk. Classy. He then deleted my responses to his comments. I never even mentioned the expired baked Cheetos we were served and the aggressively oversalted meat. Not only can he not behave with respect towards clients and women, but he can't run a restaurant either.More

title: Hidden Spot along the waterfront
review: Came across this place only because we were looking for a quick snack in between tourist attractions and this place was the closest to where we were. It is just a short walk along the waterfront from the Planetarium.  Food was pretty basic. Similar to...what you could get at a typical carnival. What they advertised as a 'Chicago Dog' was just a weiner with salsa and too much mustard on it.  It's a tiny little stand, but offers great views while you sit alongside the beach.More

title: Fast Food Tacos, Stadium Nachos, Hot Dogs on the Water
review: You can select your tacos, burritos or quesadillas with the array of meats, or vegetarian. You can also get mozzarella sticks, hot dogs, stadium style nachos, sodas and beer. You can bicycle along the lakefront trail right up to the restaurant, or pay $19 to...park in the museum complex. Pedestrian, about 3 bites per taco, great location on the lakefront trail.More

title: Delicious and authentic
review: These are not American tacos with cheese and lettuce.  Delicious al pastor, chicken fajita, or steak with cilantro and onion on a corn tortilla.  Love these tacos.

title: Great food at a walk-up  food shack.
review: Walking the lake shore admiring the view of the boats and the skyline.  We bought the carne asada tacos and they were excellent.  The meat was well-seasoned and delicious but the salsa made the dish!  Went back the next day too, and the food was...just as good.More

title: Delicious carne asada tacos
review: Took a Segway tour that ran out here and stopped for a quick lunch. A few carne asada tacos were quick and delicious and did the trick. Refreshingly uncrowned area, too. Definitely try it!

title: Best Tacos al Pastor I have EVER eaten! Great place to visit in the summer--closed in winter.
review: We found this little restaurant while riding our bikes in Burnham Harbor one day. We had to come back every week because I craved the tacos al pastor (pork tacos) so much that I had to have them. I can honestly say that I haven't...More

title: Hidden Gem!
review: I love this seasonal place for many reasons.   This beachfront, counter service taco shack is great. The tacos are fresh and authentic- make sure to get one of the house made salsas. The helados are also housemade and they have great flavors including unique Mexican...More

title: Worst Elote ever
review: Waited a long time fo my Elote in a cup for $4 and it was not worth it. Very disappointed. Site is very beautiful.

title: Tacos Al Pastor are the BEST!
review: We drove our bikes to get a quick taco and were not disappointed! In fact, I fell in love with the tacos al pastor (marinated pork) and had to return the next day for another! Being able to sit at a picnic table and look...More

title: Good authentic food
review: Went here with some friends during a concert. I ordered some tacos De asada (steak). The employees were all very friendly and it looks like a family business. I got the tacos nice and hot. The meat was cooked very well and it wasn't oily....More

title: Much Needed after a Bears Game!
review: After a Bears game while waiting for the tailgating lots to clear out so that we can leave we were desperately in need of food after several adult beverages at the game.  This place hit the spot and unlike the stadium food was cheap and...More

title: Not Chicago Style
review: My hotel charged $59 to park for one night  Papa John's charged $6 for a small one topping pizza.    Local deep dish Chicago style pizza store closed at 10pm.  Papa John's open till 1am.    Homeless people on the sidewalks pestered me for money and refused...my offer to share pizza.  Young woman working at Pappa John's smiled as she took my order and went right to work making it.  I watched a rat wonder down the sidewalk investigating odd pieces of trash and personal effects of homeless people.  Papa John's was organized and had a clean kitchen area.  My discounted Hilton brand hotel room smells like wet dog.  Papa John's leftovers took the edge off.  Some area pizza house's can take 45 to 60 minutes to back your pie.  Pappa John's had mine out in under 15 minutes.    So this Pappa John's store stands in good contrast to the community at large.  Thank you store owner, GM, shift manager and staff!  You make Chicago a better place to visit.More

title: Worst Customer Service & Pizza Never Delivered
review: We waited over 2 hours for our pizza delivery, and it was never delivered. We called to ask about the status, and the sales associate who answered the phone was rude and unhelpful. We will never be patronizing Papa Johns again.

title: Lip smacking good
review: YES, they know how to make pizza's. We bought "the works" a 16 inch pizza for $21+tax and it was cooked well and was lip smacking good. We found it good value for money and would order from there again

title: Good Food; Fast Delivery
review: While staying at the Hyatt Regency McCormick Place, this pizza place delivers quickly and the food tastes great and arrives warm.

title: Very friendly delivery
review: Just as expected, Papa John's never fails when it comes to good tasting pizza at a great price. The delivery driver was very friendly as well.

title: Easy Order & Expected Quality
review: Fresh pizza with good ETA of when it would be ready for pickup. The only thing I would suggest is the store look less closed by turning the open sign light on.

title: school trip group of 42
review: Excellent pizza, the most delicious of all kind.  Great service, staff is marvelous, wait is not long and food is delicious. Loved it and fast.

title: fun trip
review: Always good pizza and great delivery time.  Driver was friendly and the pizza arrived within time frame given

title: Good Value Food and Fast
review: Ordered pizza delivery (Ceremak location) to they Hyatt Regency hotel.  Very reasonable and pizza came in 30 minutes.  The pizza was good and hot.  Ordered garlic sticks and 2 litter soda.  Pick up at the lobby.

title: One star is a gift; stick with Domino's
review: What a horrible experience!  Ordered at 7:40 pm on a Friday, got an email response saying I'd be eating in 30-40 minutes.  At 8:40 I called the store (80 E. Cermak) and a rude employee insisted that the email I was reading from must say...an hour to an hour-and-a-half.  (Apparently she was a magician of some kind.)  Probably sensing that I wanted to cancel the order, she then told me the pizza "left the store at 8:35."  How convenient!  Just before I called!    In any event the pizza didn't arrive until 9:20.  I've driven from Cermak to the Loop before.  It doesn't take 45 minutes, even if you stop twice along the way.  The pizza itself was a cold, disgusting glob of congealed grease, stuck to the bottom of a pizza box that had been totally discolored by oil seeping through the smiling face of Papa John himself.  The breadsticks were even worse and were promptly thrown down the trash chute.  Whatever hotness and freshness this food once had was destroyed by the passage of time -- 60-70 minutes, I would guess.    At least the delivery man was apologetic, but that's sad in and of itself.  It's not his fault Papa John's doesn't hire enough drivers to serve densely populated areas.  I am routinely blown away by the quality, service, and taste of Domino's.  Domino's beats the pants out of Papa John's in every conceivable metric.  Why we veered off course this time to Papa John's I will never know.  Unfortunately, it seems that for us residents of the Loop, this store (80 E Cermak) is the default option when ordering Papa John's online.  Won't be making that mistake again.More

title: love the papa johns
review: Papa johns is my favorite pizza places in the states. I strongly recomend thin crust spinach alfredo.

title: WORST PAPA JOHNS EVER
review: After being hung up on 3 times and finally 2 hours later my pizza arrived...cold. The delivery guy then asked if I would like to PURCHASE his warm cheese pizza for $10.  NEVER AGAIN ordering delivery. Not to mention, it was 2 blocks away. I...More

title: WORST PAPPA JOHNS EVER
review: Took 2 hours to get a pizza delivered 2 blocks. After being hung up on the third time they finally arrived with cold pizza and had the decency to ask if I would like to PURCHASE an extra pizza for $10.  No, thanks.

title: Jimmy John boycotts
review: Boycott Jimmy John as a protest to his Trophy hunting of animals  He might sell cheap sandwiches but the profits go to Trophy hunting to inflate this guys ego

title: Tasty Sandwiches!!
review: Very fresh and very quick! Great price. Tasty for a lunch to eat in or take out and the appear to deliver too. Had their chips too (crisps) - very nice!

title: Fast lunch stop.
review: Stopped here for lunch. Nice clean place with friendly employees. Food was fresh like the ones back home.

title: Fastest Tuna Sub ever!
review: Got my sub before I had even finished paying! Made to order too! Very tasty, great value for money when you don't need a good stop and go lunch. Kept thinking, I wish I head the recipe for this tuna filling...Staff pleasant, no fuss. Would...eat here again.More

title: Great food, terrible service
review: I live close to this Jimmy Johns and go there because it is convenient.  This is the only reason I go to this location.  The staff is good at getting your food to you in a reasonable time, but in the 50+ times I've eaten...here since they opened, I've never heard any employee (including the manager) say thank you for the business.  Very impersonal.  I'm not looking for people to fall over me when I go into a fast food restaurant, but these folks just seem to have the attitude that I'm kind of an annoyance, rather than a customer.  Even though I like their food, as much as I hate to say it, I may start going to one of the two Subway shops or the Potbelly's, all within a block of Jimmy Johns.  Hey JJ's, it's about the overall experience, not just the food.More

title: PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE OPEN IN THE UK
review: The best  fast food in the US simple, healthy, pure, honest. and good value would seriously hit the competition, sub way ,Mc Donalds etc

title: sandwich takeaways
review: one of the place that i will drop by whenever I'm lazy to cook and just wanna have a good sandwich.  the portion is quite big, so i usually share it with my brother. i really like the freshness of the vegetables and the bread...is very moist .  you can feel the difference between paying the meal for jimmy johns and subway sandwichesMore

title: Not very customer focused and sometimes rude
review: I live in the neighborhood and have eaten here many times.  On average, I would rate this place at a 3 out of 10 for service, appreciation of your business or customer service.  The food is great, but the staff is not very well trained...in working with the public.  Rarely do they thank you for your business, if I say thank you when I get my order it is usually greeted with a "no problem" or "ok"...NEVER a "thank YOU".  It may be nit picky, but I would prefer giving my money to a company who appreciates my business.  Additionally, couple months ago my wife slipped and fell on their wet floor and the manager barely looked up from his work to ask if she was alright.  On a positive note, they have always gotten my order right.  That's about it.    I would think that a sub shop that has 2 Subways, a Potbelly's and a Jersey Mike's within 1 block they would do everything possible to set themselves apart.  But maybe that's just me (sarcasm intended).  Suggestion?  Employees need much better training and this starts with the manager.    I'm going to start walking around the corner to Jersey Mike's or Potbelly's.More

title: Who don't They open up in the UK?
review: Great idea, awesome subs, and if your on the move at lunchtime or want a quick bit to eat with loads of choice then this is in my opinion the place to go.  I have used Jimmy Johns in a load of different cities around...the US and am quite disappointed if I can't find one.   If the CEO of Jimmy Johns reads this, then please open up a franchise in the UK, not London, its so boring try the South West of England Devon for instance.  All the folks visit on vacation its the UK's version of California.More

title: Good but different
review: We ate at Jimmy John's on our first night in Chicago.  I had the tuna on wheat sub.  The sandwich had cucumbers on it giving it a unique flavor.  The restaurant was clean and the staff friendly.    I would recommend this restaurant instead of Subway...for a change of pace.More

title: Always consistent
review: We live a two blocks down the street from the South Michigan Avenue Jimmy Johns.  We stop in about twice a month for a sandwich for there or to go.  The quality of food here is always excellent, and the staff is always friendly and...More

title: mouse
review: pour service order never right this store is new and the bathroom was not clean no  paper towel to dry hands and the employees had to chase a mouse out of the diner room table was never clean  this is in orlando fl. right by...disney worldMore

title: Customer
review: On today I came into the store on 35& King Dr. Firstly the cashier approach was totally unprofessional. She say" what you gone have"? No hello good afternoon nothing. Then I was gonna be old fries and when I said something about that the young...man supposedly cooking fries wants to reply the fries were not old but I saw them sitting there when I came in. Then because I spoke up I ended up waiting longer for my second order which they forgot the fries and that seem to irritate the cashier. They all need to be retrained on their customer service skills.More

title: Ally
review: I went to the one on Dixie hwy in Louisville.  Very dissatisfied, first anyone who has to wait in line should get hot hash browns.  I set there long enough to make them hot.  I won't come back

title: Excellent Value for the Price Paid
review: This fast food restaurant has good food that is hot & fresh. Servers were accommodating & friendly!!

title: Love them!
review: Ever since moving to Wisconsin we crave the sliders, so have them whenever we visit Illinois.  They haven't changed ever since I've been a kid. The service was quick and our food was hot.

title: White Castle burgers
review: So much hype for such a little burger (slider)  with a thin patty that is steamed, a sliver of cheese.  Got about 10 of them and it took about that many to get a flavor of the burger.  Really not bad.  Located right next to...a subway stop so it gets lots of business and people just hanging around.  Service was fine, price was decent for the large sack of them (something like $28 for 30 sliders.  There is a drive through and some parking at this location.More

title: Cheap dinner, slow service
review: Needed a quick, cheap dinner, and this seemed to be the only fast food around. The sliders were average, which was to be expected. However, I was rather disappointed with the slow service. It took over 15 minutes for my very simple order to be...ready.More

title: Evil Goodness
review: If you have never had a White Castle burger then you need to go and buy a "Sack" of burgers.  White Castle has been serving these addictive little square burgers for a century....it's hard to eat just one.

title: Everything you expect from a White Castle
review: They have an awesome location for us. It's right next to the train station we used to get to McCormick place each day. I talked the guys into going twice. The place was clean, they made our sliders fresh, and the service was fine.  It...was one of my friend's first visit to a White Castle. He isn't keen on onions or cheese, and we should have warned him that onions comes standard. He enjoyed the meal. The first trip was for sliders, and the second trip was for breakfast, but I got sliders anyway. Three doubles with cheese and all is right with the world. Loved it, but I should have been adventurous and gone for the sausage breakfast sliders. The coffee was great, as it always is.   We had a few beggars after loose change hounding us, but hey, that's downtown for you.More

title: how do you rate White Castle?
review: It's White Castle and this one was recently rebuilt. You get what you expect at White Castle. Sometimes the clientele is a bit "urban" for the non-city dweller.

title: Fun lunch spot
review: As the location was very close to the entrance/exit of the Green Line at Cermack-McCormack station, it was an easy choice to stop in for a bag of sliders to go.  One gets what they order - and must expect to get exactly what they...More

title: Fun lunch
review: We don't have White Castle at home in Canada, and had only tried the frozen variety so we went out of our way on our weekend Chicago trip to try this!  Sack of 10 (mix of plain, cheese and bacon) was about $12USD and was...More

title: Not what I expected
review: Being from Florida and not having white castles I was excited to try them, the White Castle I went to right out of midway airport had very slow service, not very friendly, had to ask for a lid for my drink. The hamburgers where ok,...More

title: They Are Greasy, They Are Tiny, They Are Not Healthy, They Are Great.
review: California does not have a White Castle. Whenever we are in Chicago, we look for one. We love them. This is the ultimate junk food. They are little tiny, super thin meat patties on a small bun. Some people buy them by the bag. I...More

title: Terrible
review: Disgusting burgers... if I would even call that a burger. Meat patty is so thin Definately one of the worst things I've ever had.. fed the rest of my meal to the birds. You get what you pay for. Not worth it at all. Had...More

title: wanted a 95 yr glass n some sliders
review: service was good burgers good they were out the advertised 7.99 sack of sliders with 3 kinds of cheese so had to get regular cheesewhich is fine  i got 2 95 yr glasses  just ran in  to get it to go

title: Good Eats!
review: Yep.  White Castle burgers.  We ordered 100 and shared them with a large group of teen girls (and parents) for a volleyball tournament we were at.  Took a long time, but the folks ordering just 1 or 2 things were served quickly, so I imagine...More

title: now they have shrimp on the menu.
review: Now they have fried shrimp on the menu and it was good and hot. The sliders are always a good change of pace. I like the cheese sticks and the french fries too.

title: Downright scary
review: At night the neighborhood is pretty rough and even the staff that works there has an attitude as if they're gonna jump on you (specially the young man at the cashier who I didn't even understand a word out of his mouth)  The food was...More

title: Sliders
review: So good. Hot, fresh and tasty cheeseburgers. Liked the doubles. Jalapeño cheese sliders not so much.

title: Some for the road!
review: We stopped at the Castle on our way out of town.  Best call ever!  You don't eat them for your health you eat them for the taste!  I grew up in New York and I love the tiny burgers! 20 for the road makes it...More

title: The little burger that gets your ready for the next morning
review: White Castle is a Chicago Icon.  It has been around a very long time.  The food there is not designed to be gourmet, but is a good snack and extremely taste.  The burgers also offer a great side effect for those late night drinkers.  It...More

title: A personal choice
review: The "sliders" are a personal choice. You either like them or don't...I have grown up with them and still enjoy them on occasion. They are worth a try at least one time...then the choice becomes yours

title: White Castle - must stop!
review: My favorite is the Bacon Cheese Slider. The juicy burger with melted cheese, caramelized onions, and smoked bacon atop a soft bun is just heavenly. White Castle is always a must-stop when I am in Chicago!

title: Love it
review: I walked from McCormick to white castle and being a Texan we don't have these so anytime I find one I have to get the 6 pack and stuff the face.

title: It is cheap but you get what you pay for.
review: The burgers are close to being the worst I have had.  They are very thin with low quality meat. I thought the chicken sandwiches were a little better.  I tried the chicken sandwich bbq sauce and an onion ring on top. The fries were good...More

title: Affordable, Quick, Friendly
review: With so much overpriced food and service in the immediate area it was nice to go somewhere where the whole family could eat a good snack without breaking the bank. It was clean on the inside and the staff was friendly and courteous.

title: Bad business practices
review: Just left and not at all please with their business practices. If your going to charge for lemon pepper(.50) and mild sauce on the side(.75)  POST IT along with everything else.  With hidden charges your getting over on the customers.👎At least inform the customers, if...they place this kind of order.   I was also disappointed that the chicken didn't taste like "Harold's Chicken". 👎 I won't be going back.More

title: Doesn't exist
review: Tried really hard to find this location. It doesn't exist. Stopped in at a nearby CTA Station and they weren't aware of a Harold's ever being at the location listed. We found an open green space by a school, with well established grass. So, no...building had been at this location for well over a year.More

title: Great Chicken
review: I've eaten here several times during my last two trips to Chicago. This is, IMHO, VERY good fried chicken. The pieces are of a decent size and, if you order the dinner, you get a good amount of fries. I don't order their sauce so,...I can't comment on that. I can, however, say that my coworkers speak highly of it. I've also ordered the liver and gizzards, both excellent. The food is cooked to order and therefore takes a while. It's a good idea to call in your order ahead of time. They have two small tables inside and it's sometimes crowded with people waiting for their food. The staff has always been very friendly to me and my coworkers.More

title: Got it to go
review: Was on the way to a concert at soldier field so dropped in on the way for quick meal. Definitely cheaper than eating there and was good chicken. They had some kind of deal with 10 wings that day for about $6. Only took maybe...5 minutes to get food and nice container to take it in. Not a fancy place at all! I liked the hot sauce on my wings as well.More

title: Perfectly cooked fried chicken
review: I was instructed to visit Harold's Chicken Shack when I made my trip to Chicago.  This was actually our first meal when we arrived there.  We were pleasantly surprised.  We had missed the lunch rush so there was no waiting in line.  The chicken was...fried and seasoned very well.  5+ stars to this establishment.More

title: Far better than their Chicken Shop cousins.
review: I was expecting somewhere more fancy, as it is pretty well known and has a great rep, but is obviously known for its food and not the ambience or decor.   When it comes to the food... it gets 5+ stars. You have to wait while...the food gets cooked, and it seems like ages... but it's worth it. I don't remember the lat time I had such a well cooked, tender and tasty piece of Chicken. And the Catfish was great too. I recommend you ditch the fancy restaurants for a night and take-out some Harold's Chicken.More

title: Classic Chicago Fried Chicken
review: Love the MILD SAUCE - its is THE BEST.  Chicken is good - they will fry it to your liking (hard, salt and pepper etc)  Fries and mild sauce - gotta have it!

title: Yummy
review: Want to go back to the Chi just for some more chicken!!!  Not fancy but definitely good eats.  Quick service.

title: Not cooked to order
review: They are known to cook the chicken raw from the beginning, but I must have caught them on a bad day becuase my chicken was recooked, like KFC, or other franchises. Very dissappointed. The seafood was so sad, don't know why they even bother.

title: The BEST Harolds
review: Everytime my hubby or I drive into the city this Harolds is a must!! Love the chicken and they have the best sauce.  Not all Harolds are good but this is one of THE BEST!

title: best chicken in America
review: good chicken and very good staff.....alawys ask for the mild sauce on the chicken

title: 4 wings, mild with salt...
review: 4 wings, mild with salt and pepper

title: Chicken and hot sauce
review: Chicken and hot sauce

title: harold's will forever be...
review: harold's will forever be the boss of wings!! and that damn mild sauce is the business.

title: Lots of these around the...
review: Lots of these around the city, delicious chicken, don't touch the bread...

title: Way over priced for meh quality - pretty much what we expected
review: Bland, overpriced cafeteria food. We had one of the nephews with us, and figured (correctly) he'd be all over the opportunity. He was excited to walk through all the options and pick a place. He also noted his food was just 'meh'. He had cheese...pizza and a bland, mealy apple. My husband and I both had burgers. They were sitting in oily water (ah, high school cafeteria memories. But the high school wasn't charging ^$6 for that level of quality. The buns were also stale.  Screaming children and exasperated parents everywhere. So if that's your jam, rock on. If we didn't have a kid with us, we'd have skipped it entirely.More

title: Slow, bad food
review: Ick. This needs serious updating--and a queue just for coffee! It's not laid out well nor fast, even nowhere near a meal time.

title: Disappointing
review: After finally getting through the crowds, I made my way to the food court with my two grandchildren, 5 and 7. The food choices for them were awful, high fat and sugar, and so expensive. Then we had to sit a a dirty table. It...was a miserable and pricey experience. Avoid this place. Pack a lunch.More

title: Variety of choices for lunch
review: There's a good variety of options for lunch here. Great options for kids' meals but also several choices for grown-ups too.  If you'll be at Shedd all day, this is a good place to rest up and have a bite.

title: Tasty, but expensive food
review: We appreciated the variety offered at the Bubble Net Food Court.  We ordered pizza for the kids which was tasty, but a little overdone.  The adults ate burritos which were very good.  Drinks were very overpriced.

title: Lots of Food Choices - Something for Everyone
review: Bubble Net has like mini cafeteria order windows.  you stand in line with your tray in what ever line you want to order food at.  Our gang normally splits up and goes to their favorite spot, be it pizza, tacos, salad, chicken tenders, hamburgers, etc....Don't be afraid to split an order also.  Order the big size and split it between and adult and a child or 2 children.  You get more for your buck that way.  You used to get fries as a side with your order, and now you have to order them as well.  We all meet up at the checkout/pay station and each run goes through the station so the attendant gets to charge what is on each tray and the last one (adult) pays.  If you are a Shedd Member you get a discount.  If you only want water, ask for a paper cup.  You can bring in granola bars, fruit etc. and share that to make your meal more complete or healthy. It isn't fast food like McD or BK, so you do pay more for it, someone has to do the dishes and clear the trays. The bathrooms are just a short distance away.  A tip is to head to the far side of the room and find the right size table for your needs.  Don't be afraid to share a table with someone on the other end also.More

title: Way overpriced and staff is cold
review: We paid $62 for hamburgers & fries for 5 people. We got up to counter and cook yells, "have your order before you get in line!" I would never recommend it unless your kids are absolutely starving.

title: Ho-Hum and Overpriced
review: Unfortunately, you're stuck with eating lunch or snacks here if you visit the Shedd. You are, however, allowed to take food in, but you can only eat it in designated areas. The food is mediocre and the prices are very high. If you have small...children, I would advise taking food in and storing it in one of the coin-operated lockers until you are ready to eat.More

title: Pricey Average Food / Great Views
review: Super pricey average food.  Variety of food options.  Great outdoor views.  Suggest eat elsewhere before visiting aquarium.

title: Fast Food for People on the Move
review: If you are looking for fast food this is the place for you.  They serve sandwhiches hot and cold, pizza, tacos, fruit, chips, coffee, drinks...  Average taste but fast.

title: Lunch for the Bunch
review: After seeing the Dolphin Show, hunger set in. After a bit of a wait, our party of 9 ordered a smorgasbord of different menu ideas. My daughter and I had the burrito, which was a very large portion. The 3 grands had of course, pizza....More

title: Great lake and shoreline views but middling food
review: Closes at 4pm, before the Shedd.   Views out on the Lake and the shoreline are great.   Lots of boats on the water.   The cafeteria style food is not cheap but it's not as pricey as other reviews think (other than $4.95 for a slice of...More

title: Pricey, but set up like a cafeteria
review: This food court is set up like a lunch cafeteria, so you have a salad area, a grill area, a speciality station, and grab and go items. For 2 adults and 2 kids, we spent over $50 for lunch. Very expensive. I guess that's what...More

title: Pretty Pricey
review: We ate here recently while visiting the Shedd  with our grandchildren.  We felt we had to pay way too much for hot dogs, hamburgers and drinks.  The Dippin Dots were ridiculously priced.  I suggest visitors could bring a few granola bars and enjoy  a meal...More

title: Food is good on location, and a place to take a break
review: Lots of different food to chose from.  Prices have gone up in recent years, so ask questions as to what you are getting.  The basket used to include fries, now they are extra.  Drinks are available out on the floor after going through the cashier,...More

title: the worst lunch I ate in Chicago
review: The food left me feeling indigestion the rest of the day.  It did not taste good at all, and it did not settle well.  Definitely not worth the price we paid.

title: Not good!
review: This is not the place to eat. All the food tastes the same. I would get a big breakfast to avoid this place.

title: Nice view of skyline and good food.
review: This food court restaurant is located inside the Shedd Aquarium.  It has quite a few choices to pick from.  The food is good.  The view of the lake/skyline is beautiful!  The only downside is the price.  Spent $40 for lunch for three people.

title: Loved the Vegetarian Chili
review: This is your typical food venue at an attraction.  If you are expecting something exceptional you won't find it here.  Definitely enjoyed the vegetarian chili which we both had.  Good size serving and very tasty.  Normal fare for the kids, grilled cheese, chicken tenders, mac...More

title: Chicago Dogs
review: Like any other food court- a bit pricey. The lay out was cafeteria style. The views were nice- over looking the lake and could see Navy Pier. It was ok

title: Cute and expensive.
review: Very crowded and expensive. There was the usual fare of pizza, hamburgers, chicken/veggie sandwiches, fries, soda. Service was very slow for being so busy. We packed snacks & mini-lunches and split a few sodas for our group. Lots of table & accessible seating. Outdoor patio...More

title: No. Just, no.
review: I'd already spent a mega ton of money on this place, so I wanted a sort of budget meal to carry me over. I really wanted sea food, but they don't seem to think that's appropriate for an aquarium.  I passed on the pizza, looked...More

title: Good food
review: The prices were a lot better then I thought for food. For 2 people to eat we spent $22. When you walk in a lady hands you a menu. That way you can figure that out before getting into 3 different lines for the food...More

title: Good Food, Typical Museum Prices
review: Friendly staff, variety of healthy options for the family (including fresh cut fruit, grilled chicken).  Paid $40 for lunch for a family of 4.

title: Good place to refuel while touring the aquarium
review: A great place to grab a quick bite while enjoying the aquarium.  We especially like the gluten-free pizza!  It is quite large, and can easily feed two people if you also get a side.

title: Great food and first rate view of the lake.
review: Had lunch at the Bubble Net Food Court on our visit to the Shedd Aquarium.  Had the Nachos which were delicious.  Looked at other patrons choices and everything looked very good.  Sat outside on the deck with a great view of the lake and downtown...More

title: Cheap eats with a great view
review: Just had coffee....but it was good. Likes. The best part was the view! Good large area to rest and recharge.

title: Disgusting
review: You have been warned. Go to Soundings or bring in your own and eat by underwater viewing for belugas. Burger worse than your worst government subsidized school lunch.

title: Alright
review: The food is alright here and the place can be pretty dirty. The only very cool thing was the view of Lake Michigan. The food court contains normal stuff such as hamburgers, Mexican food,and sandwiches. I kinda expected them to have fish there (Does that...More

title: Just your average touristy food court
review: Areas for Mexican, a hamburger grill, and a pizza choice, along with some pre-made salads, desserts and sandwiches.  Great view of Lake Michigan/downtown from the dining area!

title: Ok for cafeteria food
review: I had a cheeseburger, which was ok. It didn't taste frozen, but it probably was. My husband had the Italian Sausage sandwich, which was decent. I was pricy, if we were locate, we would have packed a lunch and had a picnic near Lake Michigan.
